Before Jesus' Public Ministry
– +
The Word Became Human
Lk 1:1-4 Jn 1:1-18
Default Lk 1:1-4 Jn 1:1-18
JN
1:1
In the beginning there was the Word.(a) The Word was with God, and the Word was God.
JN
1:2
He was with God in the beginning.
JN
1:3
All things were made by him, and nothing was made without him.
JN
1:4
In him there was life, and that life was the light of all people.
JN
1:5
The Light shines in the darkness, and the darkness has not overpowered(b) it.
JN
1:6
There was a man named John(c) who was sent by God.
JN
1:7
He came to tell people the truth about the Light so that through him all people could hear about the Light and believe.
JN
1:8
John was not the Light, but he came to tell people the truth about the Light.
JN
1:9
The true Light that gives light to all was coming into the world!
JN
1:10
The Word was in the world, and the world was made by him, but the world did not know him.
JN
1:11
He came to the world that was his own, but his own people did not accept him.
JN
1:12
But to all who did accept him and believe in him he gave the right to become children of God.
JN
1:13
They did not become his children in any human way-by any human parents or human desire. They were born of God.
JN
1:14
The Word became a human and lived among us. We saw his glory-the glory that belongs to the only Son of the Father-and he was full of grace and truth.
JN
1:15
John tells the truth about him and cries out, saying, “This is the One I told you about: ‘The One who comes after me is greater than I am, because he was living before me.’”
JN
1:16
Because he was full of grace and truth, from him we all received one gift after another.
JN
1:17
The law was given through Moses, but grace and truth came through Jesus Christ.
JN
1:18
No one has ever seen God. But God the only Son is very close to the Father,(d) and he has shown us what God is like.
Default Lk 1:1-4 Jn 1:1-18
LK
1:1
Many have tried to report on the things that happened among us.
LK
1:2
They have written the same things that we learned from others-the people who saw those things from the beginning and served God by telling people his message.
LK
1:3
Since I myself have studied everything carefully from the beginning, most excellent(a) Theophilus, it seemed good for me to write it out for you. I arranged it in order,
LK
1:4
to help you know that what you have been taught is true.
Default Lk 1:1-4 Jn 1:1-18
JN
1:1
In the beginning there was the Word.(a) The Word was with God, and the Word was God.
JN
1:2
He was with God in the beginning.
JN
1:3
All things were made by him, and nothing was made without him.
JN
1:4
In him there was life, and that life was the light of all people.
JN
1:5
The Light shines in the darkness, and the darkness has not overpowered(b) it.
JN
1:6
There was a man named John(c) who was sent by God.
JN
1:7
He came to tell people the truth about the Light so that through him all people could hear about the Light and believe.
JN
1:8
John was not the Light, but he came to tell people the truth about the Light.
JN
1:9
The true Light that gives light to all was coming into the world!
JN
1:10
The Word was in the world, and the world was made by him, but the world did not know him.
JN
1:11
He came to the world that was his own, but his own people did not accept him.
JN
1:12
But to all who did accept him and believe in him he gave the right to become children of God.
JN
1:13
They did not become his children in any human way-by any human parents or human desire. They were born of God.
JN
1:14
The Word became a human and lived among us. We saw his glory-the glory that belongs to the only Son of the Father-and he was full of grace and truth.
JN
1:15
John tells the truth about him and cries out, saying, “This is the One I told you about: ‘The One who comes after me is greater than I am, because he was living before me.’”
JN
1:16
Because he was full of grace and truth, from him we all received one gift after another.
JN
1:17
The law was given through Moses, but grace and truth came through Jesus Christ.
JN
1:18
No one has ever seen God. But God the only Son is very close to the Father,(d) and he has shown us what God is like.
Angel Gabriel Appear To Zechariah, The Father Of John The Baptist
Lk 1:5-25
Lk 1:5-25
LK
1:5
During the time Herod ruled Judea, there was a priest named Zechariah who belonged to Abijah’s group.(b) Zechariah’s wife, Elizabeth, came from the family of Aaron.
LK
1:6
Zechariah and Elizabeth truly did what God said was good. They did everything the Lord commanded and were without fault in keeping his law.
LK
1:7
But they had no children, because Elizabeth could not have a baby, and both of them were very old.
LK
1:8
One day Zechariah was serving as a priest before God, because his group was on duty.
LK
1:9
According to the custom of the priests, he was chosen by lot to go into the Temple of the Lord and burn incense.
LK
1:10
There were a great many people outside praying at the time the incense was offered.
LK
1:11
Then an angel of the Lord appeared to Zechariah, standing on the right side of the incense table.
LK
1:12
When he saw the angel, Zechariah was startled and frightened.
LK
1:13
But the angel said to him, “Zechariah, don’t be afraid. God has heard your prayer. Your wife, Elizabeth, will give birth to a son, and you will name him John.
LK
1:14
He will bring you joy and gladness, and many people will be happy because of his birth.
LK
1:15
John will be a great man for the Lord. He will never drink wine or beer, and even from birth, he will be filled with the Holy Spirit.
LK
1:16
He will help many people of Israel return to the Lord their God.
LK
1:17
He will go before the Lord in spirit and power like Elijah. He will make peace between parents and their children and will bring those who are not obeying God back to the right way of thinking, to make a people ready for the coming of the Lord.”
LK
1:18
Zechariah said to the angel, “How can I know that what you say is true? I am an old man, and my wife is old, too.”
LK
1:19
The angel answered him, “I am Gabriel. I stand before God, who sent me to talk to you and to tell you this good news.
LK
1:20
Now, listen! You will not be able to speak until the day these things happen, because you did not believe what I told you. But they will really happen.”
LK
1:21
Outside, the people were still waiting for Zechariah and were surprised that he was staying so long in the Temple.
LK
1:22
When Zechariah came outside, he could not speak to them, and they knew he had seen a vision in the Temple. He could only make signs to them and remained unable to speak.
LK
1:23
When his time of service at the Temple was finished, he went home.
LK
1:24
Later, Zechariah’s wife, Elizabeth, became pregnant and did not go out of her house for five months. Elizabeth said,
LK
1:25
“Look what the Lord has done for me! My people were ashamed(c) of me, but now the Lord has taken away that shame.”
Angel Gabriel Appear To Jesus' Mother, Mary
Lk 1:26-38
Lk 1:26-38
LK
1:26
During Elizabeth’s sixth month of pregnancy, God sent the angel Gabriel to Nazareth, a town in Galilee,
LK
1:27
to a virgin. She was engaged to marry a man named Joseph from the family of David. Her name was Mary.
LK
1:28
The angel came to her and said, “Greetings! The Lord has blessed you and is with you.”
LK
1:29
But Mary was very startled by what the angel said and wondered what this greeting might mean.
LK
1:30
The angel said to her, “Don’t be afraid, Mary; God has shown you his grace.
LK
1:31
Listen! You will become pregnant and give birth to a son, and you will name him Jesus.
LK
1:32
He will be great and will be called the Son of the Most High. The Lord God will give him the throne of King David, his ancestor.
LK
1:33
He will rule over the people of Jacob forever, and his kingdom will never end.”
LK
1:34
Mary said to the angel, “How will this happen since I am a virgin?”
LK
1:35
The angel said to Mary, “The Holy Spirit will come upon you, and the power of the Most High will cover you. For this reason the baby will be holy and will be called the Son of God.
LK
1:36
Now Elizabeth, your relative, is also pregnant with a son though she is very old. Everyone thought she could not have a baby, but she has been pregnant for six months.
LK
1:37
God can do anything!”
LK
1:38
Mary said, “I am the servant of the Lord. Let this happen to me as you say!” Then the angel went away.
Mary Visits Elizabeth, The Mother Of John The Baptist
Lk 1:39-56
Lk 1:39-56
LK
1:39
Mary got up and went quickly to a town in the hills of Judea.
LK
1:40
She came to Zechariah’s house and greeted Elizabeth.
LK
1:41
When Elizabeth heard Mary’s greeting, the unborn baby inside her jumped, and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit.
LK
1:42
She cried out in a loud voice, “God has blessed you more than any other woman, and he has blessed the baby to which you will give birth.
LK
1:43
Why has this good thing happened to me, that the mother of my Lord comes to me?
LK
1:44
When I heard your voice, the baby inside me jumped with joy.
LK
1:45
You are blessed because you believed that what the Lord said to you would really happen.”
LK
1:46
Then Mary said, “My soul praises the Lord;
LK
1:47
my heart rejoices in God my Savior,
LK
1:48
because he has shown his concern for his humble servant girl. From now on, all people will say that I am blessed,
LK
1:49
because the Powerful One has done great things for me. His name is holy.
LK
1:50
God will show his mercy forever and ever to those who worship and serve him.
LK
1:51
He has done mighty deeds by his power. He has scattered the people who are proud and think great things about themselves.
LK
1:52
He has brought down rulers from their thrones and raised up the humble.
LK
1:53
He has filled the hungry with good things and sent the rich away with nothing.
LK
1:54
He has helped his servant, the people of Israel, remembering to show them mercy
LK
1:55
as he promised to our ancestors, to Abraham and to his children forever.”
LK
1:56
Mary stayed with Elizabeth for about three months and then returned home.
Birth Of John The Baptist
Lk 1:57-80
Lk 1:57-80
LK
1:57
When it was time for Elizabeth to give birth, she had a boy.
LK
1:58
Her neighbors and relatives heard how good the Lord was to her, and they rejoiced with her.
LK
1:59
When the baby was eight days old, they came to circumcise him. They wanted to name him Zechariah because this was his father’s name,
LK
1:60
but his mother said, “No! He will be named John.”
LK
1:61
The people said to Elizabeth, “But no one in your family has this name.”
LK
1:62
Then they made signs to his father to find out what he would like to name him.
LK
1:63
Zechariah asked for a writing tablet and wrote, “His name is John,” and everyone was surprised.
LK
1:64
Immediately Zechariah could talk again, and he began praising God.
LK
1:65
All their neighbors became alarmed, and in all the mountains of Judea people continued talking about all these things.
LK
1:66
The people who heard about them wondered, saying, “What will this child be?” because the Lord was with him.
LK
1:67
Then Zechariah, John’s father, was filled with the Holy Spirit and prophesied:
LK
1:68
“Let us praise the Lord, the God of Israel, because he has come to help his people and has given them freedom.
LK
1:69
He has given us a powerful Savior from the family of God’s servant David.
LK
1:70
He said that he would do this through his holy prophets who lived long ago:
LK
1:71
He promised he would save us from our enemies and from the power of all those who hate us.
LK
1:72
He said he would give mercy to our ancestors and that he would remember his holy promise.
LK
1:73
God promised Abraham, our father,
LK
1:74
that he would save us from the power of our enemies so we could serve him without fear,
LK
1:75
being holy and good before God as long as we live.
LK
1:76
“Now you, child, will be called a prophet of the Most High God. You will go before the Lord to prepare his way.
LK
1:77
You will make his people know that they will be saved by having their sins forgiven.
LK
1:78
With the loving mercy of our God, a new day from heaven will dawn upon us.
LK
1:79
It will shine on those who live in darkness, in the shadow of death. It will guide us into the path of peace.”
LK
1:80
And so the child grew up and became strong in spirit. John lived in the desert until the time when he came out to preach to Israel.
An Angel Appear To Jesus' Foster Father Joseph
Mt 1:18-25
Mt 1:18-25
MT
1:18
This is how the birth of Jesus Christ came about. His mother Mary was engaged(d) to marry Joseph, but before they married, she learned she was pregnant by the power of the Holy Spirit.
MT
1:19
Because Mary’s husband, Joseph, was a good man, he did not want to disgrace her in public, so he planned to divorce her secretly.
MT
1:20
While Joseph thought about these things, an angel of the Lord came to him in a dream. The angel said, “Joseph, descendant of David, don’t be afraid to take Mary as your wife, because the baby in her is from the Holy Spirit.
MT
1:21
She will give birth to a son, and you will name him Jesus,(e) because he will save his people from their sins.”
MT
1:22
All this happened to bring about what the Lord had said through the prophet:
MT
1:23
“The virgin will be pregnant. She will have a son, and they will name him Immanuel,”(f) which means “God is with us.”
MT
1:24
When Joseph woke up, he did what the Lord’s angel had told him to do. Joseph took Mary as his wife,
MT
1:25
but he did not have sexual relations with her until she gave birth to the son. And Joseph named him Jesus.
The Birth Of Jesus
Lk 2:1-7
Lk 2:1-7
LK
2:1
At that time, Augustus Caesar sent an order that all people in the countries under Roman rule must list their names in a register.
LK
2:2
This was the first registration;(d) it was taken while Quirinius was governor of Syria.
LK
2:3
And all went to their own towns to be registered.
LK
2:4
So Joseph left Nazareth, a town in Galilee, and went to the town of Bethlehem in Judea, known as the town of David. Joseph went there because he was from the family of David.
LK
2:5
Joseph registered with Mary, to whom he was engaged(e) and who was now pregnant.
LK
2:6
While they were in Bethlehem, the time came for Mary to have the baby,
LK
2:7
and she gave birth to her first son. Because there were no rooms left in the inn, she wrapped the baby with pieces of cloth and laid him in a feeding trough.
Visitors From The East At The Begining Of Jesus' Life
Mt 2:1-12 Lk 2:8-20
Default Mt 2:1-12 Lk 2:8-20
LK
2:8
That night, some shepherds were in the fields nearby watching their sheep.
LK
2:9
Then an angel of the Lord stood before them. The glory of the Lord was shining around them, and they became very frightened.
LK
2:10
The angel said to them, “Do not be afraid. I am bringing you good news that will be a great joy to all the people.
LK
2:11
Today your Savior was born in the town of David. He is Christ, the Lord.
LK
2:12
This is how you will know him: You will find a baby wrapped in pieces of cloth and lying in a feeding box.”
LK
2:13
Then a very large group of angels from heaven joined the first angel, praising God and saying:
LK
2:14
“Give glory to God in heaven, and on earth let there be peace among the people who please God.”(f)
LK
2:15
When the angels left them and went back to heaven, the shepherds said to each other, “Let’s go to Bethlehem. Let’s see this thing that has happened which the Lord has told us about.”
MT
2:1
Jesus was born in the town of Bethlehem in Judea during the time when Herod was king. When Jesus was born, some wise men from the east came to Jerusalem.
MT
2:2
They asked, “Where is the baby who was born to be the king of the Jews? We saw his star in the east and have come to worship him.”
MT
2:3
When King Herod heard this, he was troubled, as were all the people in Jerusalem.
MT
2:4
Herod called a meeting of all the leading priests and teachers of the law and asked them where the Christ would be born.
MT
2:5
They answered, “In the town of Bethlehem in Judea. The prophet wrote about this in the Scriptures:
MT
2:6
‘But you, Bethlehem, in the land of Judah, are not just an insignificant village in Judah. A ruler will come from you who will be like a shepherd for my people Israel.’” (Micah 5:2)
MT
2:7
Then Herod had a secret meeting with the wise men and learned from them the exact time they first saw the star.
MT
2:8
He sent the wise men to Bethlehem, saying, “Look carefully for the child. When you find him, come tell me so I can worship him too.”
MT
2:9
After the wise men heard the king, they left. The star that they had seen in the east went before them until it stopped above the place where the child was.
MT
2:10
When the wise men saw the star, they were filled with joy.
MT
2:11
They came to the house where the child was and saw him with his mother, Mary, and they bowed down and worshiped him. They opened their gifts and gave him treasures of gold, frankincense, and myrrh.
LK
2:17
When they had seen him, they told what the angels had said about this child.
LK
2:18
Everyone was amazed at what the shepherds said to them.
LK
2:19
But Mary treasured these things and continued to think about them.
MT
2:12
But God warned the wise men in a dream not to go back to Herod, so they returned to their own country by a different way.
LK
2:20
Then the shepherds went back to their sheep, praising God and thanking him for everything they had seen and heard. It had been just as the angel had told them.
Default Mt 2:1-12 Lk 2:8-20
MT
2:1
Jesus was born in the town of Bethlehem in Judea during the time when Herod was king. When Jesus was born, some wise men from the east came to Jerusalem.
MT
2:2
They asked, “Where is the baby who was born to be the king of the Jews? We saw his star in the east and have come to worship him.”
MT
2:3
When King Herod heard this, he was troubled, as were all the people in Jerusalem.
MT
2:4
Herod called a meeting of all the leading priests and teachers of the law and asked them where the Christ would be born.
MT
2:5
They answered, “In the town of Bethlehem in Judea. The prophet wrote about this in the Scriptures:
MT
2:6
‘But you, Bethlehem, in the land of Judah, are not just an insignificant village in Judah. A ruler will come from you who will be like a shepherd for my people Israel.’” (Micah 5:2)
MT
2:7
Then Herod had a secret meeting with the wise men and learned from them the exact time they first saw the star.
MT
2:8
He sent the wise men to Bethlehem, saying, “Look carefully for the child. When you find him, come tell me so I can worship him too.”
MT
2:9
After the wise men heard the king, they left. The star that they had seen in the east went before them until it stopped above the place where the child was.
MT
2:10
When the wise men saw the star, they were filled with joy.
MT
2:11
They came to the house where the child was and saw him with his mother, Mary, and they bowed down and worshiped him. They opened their gifts and gave him treasures of gold, frankincense, and myrrh.
MT
2:12
But God warned the wise men in a dream not to go back to Herod, so they returned to their own country by a different way.
Default Mt 2:1-12 Lk 2:8-20
LK
2:8
That night, some shepherds were in the fields nearby watching their sheep.
LK
2:9
Then an angel of the Lord stood before them. The glory of the Lord was shining around them, and they became very frightened.
LK
2:10
The angel said to them, “Do not be afraid. I am bringing you good news that will be a great joy to all the people.
LK
2:11
Today your Savior was born in the town of David. He is Christ, the Lord.
LK
2:12
This is how you will know him: You will find a baby wrapped in pieces of cloth and lying in a feeding box.”
LK
2:13
Then a very large group of angels from heaven joined the first angel, praising God and saying:
LK
2:14
“Give glory to God in heaven, and on earth let there be peace among the people who please God.”(f)
LK
2:15
When the angels left them and went back to heaven, the shepherds said to each other, “Let’s go to Bethlehem. Let’s see this thing that has happened which the Lord has told us about.”
LK
2:16
So the shepherds went quickly and found Mary and Joseph and the baby, who was lying in a feeding trough.
LK
2:17
When they had seen him, they told what the angels had said about this child.
LK
2:18
Everyone was amazed at what the shepherds said to them.
LK
2:19
But Mary treasured these things and continued to think about them.
LK
2:20
Then the shepherds went back to their sheep, praising God and thanking him for everything they had seen and heard. It had been just as the angel had told them.
Jesus Is Circumcised
Lk 2:21-21
Lk 2:21-21
LK
2:21
When the baby was eight days old, he was circumcised and was named Jesus, the name given by the angel before the baby began to grow inside Mary.
The Family History Of Jesus
Mt 1:1-17 Lk 3:23-38
Default Mt 1:1-17 Lk 3:23-38
MT
1:1
Jesus Christ came from the family of King David and also from the family of Abraham. And this is a list of his ancestors. From Abraham to King David, his ancestors were:
MT
1:2
Abraham, Isaac, Jacob,
MT
1:3
Judah and his brothers (Judah’s sons were Perez and Zerah, and their mother was Tamar), Hezron;
MT
1:4
Ram, Amminadab, Nahshon,
MT
1:5
Salmon, Boaz (his mother was Rahab), Obed (his mother was Ruth),
MT
1:6
Jesse, and King David. From David to the time of the exile in Babylonia, the ancestors of Jesus were: David,
MT
1:7
Solomon (his mother had been Uriah’s wife), Rehoboam, Abijah,
MT
1:8
Asa, Jehoshaphat, Jehoram;
MT
1:9
Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz,
MT
1:10
Hezekiah, Manasseh, Amon,
MT
1:11
Josiah, and Jehoiachin and his brothers.
MT
1:12
From the exile to the birth of Jesus, his ancestors were: Jehoiachin, Shealtiel,
MT
1:13
Zerubbabel, Abiud, Eliakim,
MT
1:14
Azor, Zadok, Achim;
MT
1:15
Eliud, Eleazar, Matthan,
MT
1:16
Jacob, and Joseph, the husband [father] of Mary, the mother of Jesus, who is called the Messiah.
MT
1:17
There were fourteen generations from Abraham to David. There were also fourteen from David to the exile in Babylonia and fourteen more to the birth of the Messiah.

Mt 1:16 Should read "father" not "husband" of Mary
• To reason the different ancestors comparing to Lk 3:23-38,
• And to give the full 14 generations

Default Mt 1:1-17 Lk 3:23-38
MT
1:1
Jesus Christ came from the family of King David and also from the family of Abraham. And this is a list of his ancestors. From Abraham to King David, his ancestors were:
MT
1:2
Abraham, Isaac, Jacob,
MT
1:3
Judah and his brothers (Judah’s sons were Perez and Zerah, and their mother was Tamar), Hezron;
MT
1:4
Ram, Amminadab, Nahshon,
MT
1:5
Salmon, Boaz (his mother was Rahab), Obed (his mother was Ruth),
MT
1:6
Jesse, and King David. From David to the time of the exile in Babylonia, the ancestors of Jesus were: David,
MT
1:7
Solomon (his mother had been Uriah’s wife), Rehoboam, Abijah,
MT
1:8
Asa, Jehoshaphat, Jehoram;
MT
1:9
Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz,
MT
1:10
Hezekiah, Manasseh, Amon,
MT
1:11
Josiah, and Jehoiachin and his brothers.
MT
1:12
From the exile to the birth of Jesus, his ancestors were: Jehoiachin, Shealtiel,
MT
1:13
Zerubbabel, Abiud, Eliakim,
MT
1:14
Azor, Zadok, Achim;
MT
1:15
Eliud, Eleazar, Matthan,
MT
1:16
Jacob, and Joseph, the husband [father] of Mary, the mother of Jesus, who is called the Messiah.
MT
1:17
There were fourteen generations from Abraham to David. There were also fourteen from David to the exile in Babylonia and fourteen more to the birth of the Messiah.

Mt 1:16 Should read "father" not "husband" of Mary
• To reason the different ancestors comparing to Lk 3:23-38,
• And to give the full 14 generations

Default Mt 1:1-17 Lk 3:23-38
LK
3:23
When Jesus began to preach, he was about thirty years old. Everyone thought he was the son(l) of Joseph. But his [Joseph's] family went back through Heli,
LK
3:24
Matthat, Levi, Melchi, Jannai, Joseph,
LK
3:25
Mattathias, Amos, Nahum, Esli, Naggai,
LK
3:26
Maath, Mattathias, Semein, Josech, Joda;
LK
3:27
Joanan, Rhesa, Zerubbabel, Shealtiel, Neri,
LK
3:28
Melchi, Addi, Cosam, Elmadam, Er,
LK
3:29
Joshua, Eliezer, Jorim, Matthat, Levi;
LK
3:30
Simeon, Judah, Joseph, Jonam, Eliakim,
LK
3:31
Melea, Menna, Mattatha, Nathan, David,
LK
3:32
Jesse, Obed, Boaz, Salmon(m), Nahshon;
LK
3:33
Amminadab, Admin, Arni, Hezron, Perez, Judah,
LK
3:34
Jacob, Isaac, Abraham, Terah, Nahor,
LK
3:35
Serug, Reu, Peleg, Eber, Shelah;
LK
3:36
Cainan, Arphaxad, Shem, Noah, Lamech,
LK
3:37
Methuselah, Enoch, Jared, Mahalaleel, Kenan,
LK
3:38
Enosh, and Seth. The family of Jesus went all the way back to Adam and then to God.
Jesus Is Being Made Pure By Presented In The Temple
Lk 2:22-38
Lk 2:22-38
LK
2:22
When the time came for Mary and Joseph to do what the law of Moses taught about being made pure,(g) they took Jesus to Jerusalem to present him to the Lord.
LK
2:23
(It is written in the law of the Lord: “Every firstborn male shall be given to the Lord.”)(h)
LK
2:24
Mary and Joseph also went to offer a sacrifice, as the law of the Lord says: “You must sacrifice two doves or two young pigeons.”(i)
LK
2:25
In Jerusalem lived a man named Simeon who was a good man and godly. He was waiting for the time when God would take away Israel’s sorrow, and the Holy Spirit was in him.
LK
2:26
Simeon had been told by the Holy Spirit that he would not die before he saw the Christ promised by the Lord.
LK
2:27
The Spirit led Simeon to the Temple. When Mary and Joseph brought the baby Jesus to the Temple to do what the law said they must do,
LK
2:28
Simeon took the baby in his arms and thanked God:
LK
2:29
“Now, Lord, you can let me, your servant, die in peace as you said.
LK
2:30
With my own eyes I have seen your salvation,
LK
2:31
which you prepared before all people.
LK
2:32
It is a light for the non-Jewish people to see and an honor for your people, the Israelites.”
LK
2:33
Jesus’ father and mother were amazed at what Simeon had said about him.
LK
2:34
Then Simeon blessed them and said to Mary, “God has chosen this child to cause the fall and rise of many in Israel. He will be a sign from God that many people will not accept
LK
2:35
so that the thoughts of many will be made known. And the things that will happen will make your heart sad, too.”
LK
2:36
There was a prophetess, Anna, from the family of Phanuel in the tribe of Asher. Anna was very old. She had once been married for seven years.
LK
2:37
Then her husband died, and she was a widow for eighty-four years. Anna never left the Temple but worshiped God, going without food and praying day and night.
LK
2:38
Standing there at that time, she thanked God and spoke about Jesus to all who were waiting for God to free Jerusalem.
Escape To Egypt From King Herod
Mt 2:13-18
Mt 2:13-18
MT
2:13
After they left, an angel of the Lord came to Joseph in a dream and said, “Get up! Take the child and his mother and escape to Egypt, because Herod is starting to look for the child so he can kill him. Stay in Egypt until I tell you to return.”
MT
2:14
So Joseph got up and left for Egypt during the night with the child and his mother.
MT
2:15
And Joseph stayed in Egypt until Herod died. This happened to bring about what the Lord had said through the prophet: “I called my son out of Egypt.”(g)
MT
2:16
When Herod saw that the wise men had tricked him, he was furious. So he gave an order to kill all the baby boys in Bethlehem and in the surrounding area who were two years old or younger. This was in keeping with the time he learned from the wise men.
MT
2:17
So what God had said through the prophet Jeremiah came true:
MT
2:18
“A voice was heard in Ramah of painful crying and deep sadness: Rachel crying for her children. She refused to be comforted, because her children are dead.” (Jeremiah 31:15)
Return To Nazareth
Mt 2:19-23 Lk 2:39-40
Default Mt 2:19-23 Lk 2:39-40
MT
2:19
After Herod died, an angel of the Lord spoke to Joseph in a dream while he was in Egypt.
MT
2:20
The angel said, “Get up! Take the child and his mother and go to the land of Israel, because the people who were trying to kill the child are now dead.”
MT
2:21
So Joseph took the child and his mother and went to Israel.
MT
2:22
But he heard that Archelaus was now king in Judea since his father Herod had died. So Joseph was afraid to go there. After being warned in a dream, he went to the area of Galilee,
MT
2:23
to a town called Nazareth, and lived there. And so what God had said through the prophets came true: “He will be called a Nazarene.”(h)
Default Mt 2:19-23 Lk 2:39-40
MT
2:19
After Herod died, an angel of the Lord spoke to Joseph in a dream while he was in Egypt.
MT
2:20
The angel said, “Get up! Take the child and his mother and go to the land of Israel, because the people who were trying to kill the child are now dead.”
MT
2:21
So Joseph took the child and his mother and went to Israel.
MT
2:22
But he heard that Archelaus was now king in Judea since his father Herod had died. So Joseph was afraid to go there. After being warned in a dream, he went to the area of Galilee,
MT
2:23
to a town called Nazareth, and lived there. And so what God had said through the prophets came true: “He will be called a Nazarene.”(h)
Default Mt 2:19-23 Lk 2:39-40
LK
2:39
When Joseph and Mary had done everything the law of the Lord commanded, they went home to Nazareth, their own town in Galilee.
LK
2:40
The little child grew and became strong. He was filled with wisdom, and God’s goodness was upon him.
The Twelve Year Old Jesus On The Passover Feast
Lk 2:41-50
Lk 2:41-50
LK
2:41
Every year Jesus’ parents went to Jerusalem for the Passover Feast.
LK
2:42
When he was twelve years old, they went to the feast as they always did.
LK
2:43
After the feast days were over, they started home. The boy Jesus stayed behind in Jerusalem, but his parents did not know it.
LK
2:44
Thinking that Jesus was with them in the group, they traveled for a whole day. Then they began to look for him among their family and friends.
LK
2:45
When they did not find him, they went back to Jerusalem to look for him there.
LK
2:46
After three days they found Jesus sitting in the Temple with the teachers, listening to them and asking them questions.
LK
2:47
All who heard him were amazed at his understanding and answers.
LK
2:48
When Jesus’ parents saw him, they were astonished. His mother said to him, “Son, why did you do this to us? Your father and I were very worried about you and have been looking for you.”
LK
2:49
Jesus said to them, “Why were you looking for me? Didn’t you know that I must be in my Father’s house?”
LK
2:50
But they did not understand the meaning of what he said.
Jesus Grows Up
Lk 2:51-52
Lk 2:51-52
LK
2:51
Jesus went with them to Nazareth and was obedient to them. But his mother kept in her mind all that had happened.
LK
2:52
Jesus became wiser and grew physically. People liked him, and he pleased God.
Week 1-6 | Baptism By Water And First Followers In Judea
– +
Week 1 | The Baptism
Mt 3:13-17 Mk 1:9-11 Lk 3:21-22
Default Mt 3:13-17 Mk 1:9-11 Lk 3:21-22
MT
3:13
At that time Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan River and wanted John to baptize him.
MT
3:14
But John tried to stop him, saying, “Why do you come to me to be baptized? I need to be baptized by you!”
MT
3:15
Jesus answered, “Let it be this way for now. We should do all things that are God’s will.” So John agreed to baptize Jesus.
MT
3:16
As soon as Jesus was baptized, he came up out of the water. Then heaven opened, and he saw God’s Spirit coming down on him like a dove.
MT
3:17
And a voice from heaven said, “This is my Son, whom I love, and I am very pleased with him.”
Default Mt 3:13-17 Mk 1:9-11 Lk 3:21-22
MT
3:13
At that time Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan River and wanted John to baptize him.
MT
3:14
But John tried to stop him, saying, “Why do you come to me to be baptized? I need to be baptized by you!”
MT
3:15
Jesus answered, “Let it be this way for now. We should do all things that are God’s will.” So John agreed to baptize Jesus.
MT
3:16
As soon as Jesus was baptized, he came up out of the water. Then heaven opened, and he saw God’s Spirit coming down on him like a dove.
MT
3:17
And a voice from heaven said, “This is my Son, whom I love, and I am very pleased with him.”
Default Mt 3:13-17 Mk 1:9-11 Lk 3:21-22
MK
1:9
At that time Jesus came from the town of Nazareth in Galilee and was baptized by John in the Jordan River.
MK
1:10
Immediately, as Jesus was coming up out of the water, he saw heaven open. The Holy Spirit came down on him like a dove,
MK
1:11
and a voice came from heaven: “You are my Son, whom I love, and I am very pleased with you.”
Default Mt 3:13-17 Mk 1:9-11 Lk 3:21-22
LK
3:21
When all the people were being baptized by John, Jesus also was baptized. While Jesus was praying, heaven opened
LK
3:22
and the Holy Spirit came down on him in the form of a dove. Then a voice came from heaven, saying, “You are my Son, whom I love, and I am very pleased with you.”
Week 1-6 | The Temptation
Mt 4:1-11 Mk 1:12-13 Lk 4:1-13
Default Mt 4:1-11 Mk 1:12-13 Lk 4:1-13
MT
4:1
Then the Spirit led Jesus into the desert to be tempted by the devil.
MT
4:2
Jesus fasted for forty days and nights. After this, he was very hungry.
MT
4:3
The devil came to Jesus to tempt him, saying, “If you are the Son of God, tell these rocks to become bread.”
MT
4:4
Jesus answered, “It is written in the Scriptures, ‘A person lives not on bread alone, but by everything God says.’”(k)
MT
4:5
Then the devil led Jesus to the holy city of Jerusalem and put him on a high place of the Temple.
MT
4:6
The devil said, “If you are the Son of God, jump down, because it is written in the Scriptures: ‘He has put his angels in charge of you. They will catch you in their hands so that you will not hit your foot on a rock.’” (Psalm 91:11-12)
MT
4:7
Jesus answered him, “It also says in the Scriptures, ‘Do not test the Lord your God.’”(l)
MT
4:8
Then the devil led Jesus to the top of a very high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and all their splendor.
MT
4:9
The devil said, “If you will bow down and worship me, I will give you all these things.”
MT
4:10
Jesus said to the devil, “Go away from me, Satan! It is written in the Scriptures, ‘You must worship the Lord your God and serve only him.’”(m)
MT
4:11
So the devil left Jesus, and angels came and took care of him.
Default Mt 4:1-11 Mk 1:12-13 Lk 4:1-13
MT
4:1
Then the Spirit led Jesus into the desert to be tempted by the devil.
MT
4:2
Jesus fasted for forty days and nights. After this, he was very hungry.
MT
4:3
The devil came to Jesus to tempt him, saying, “If you are the Son of God, tell these rocks to become bread.”
MT
4:4
Jesus answered, “It is written in the Scriptures, ‘A person lives not on bread alone, but by everything God says.’”(k)
MT
4:5
Then the devil led Jesus to the holy city of Jerusalem and put him on a high place of the Temple.
MT
4:6
The devil said, “If you are the Son of God, jump down, because it is written in the Scriptures: ‘He has put his angels in charge of you. They will catch you in their hands so that you will not hit your foot on a rock.’” (Psalm 91:11-12)
MT
4:7
Jesus answered him, “It also says in the Scriptures, ‘Do not test the Lord your God.’”(l)
MT
4:8
Then the devil led Jesus to the top of a very high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and all their splendor.
MT
4:9
The devil said, “If you will bow down and worship me, I will give you all these things.”
MT
4:10
Jesus said to the devil, “Go away from me, Satan! It is written in the Scriptures, ‘You must worship the Lord your God and serve only him.’”(m)
MT
4:11
So the devil left Jesus, and angels came and took care of him.
Default Mt 4:1-11 Mk 1:12-13 Lk 4:1-13
MK
1:12
Then the Spirit sent Jesus into the desert.
MK
1:13
He was in the desert forty days and was tempted by Satan. He was with the wild animals, and the angels came and took care of him.
Default Mt 4:1-11 Mk 1:12-13 Lk 4:1-13
LK
4:1
Jesus, filled with the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan River. The Spirit led Jesus into the desert
LK
4:2
where the devil tempted Jesus for forty days. Jesus ate nothing during that time, and when those days were ended, he was very hungry.
LK
4:3
The devil said to Jesus, “If you are the Son of God, tell this rock to become bread.”
LK
4:4
Jesus answered, “It is written in the Scriptures: ‘A person does not live on bread alone.’”(n)
LK
4:5
Then the devil took Jesus and showed him all the kingdoms of the world in an instant.
LK
4:6
The devil said to Jesus, “I will give you all these kingdoms and all their power and glory. It has all been given to me, and I can give it to anyone I wish.
LK
4:7
If you worship me, then it will all be yours.”
LK
4:8
Jesus answered, “It is written in the Scriptures: ‘You must worship the Lord your God and serve only him.’”(o)
LK
4:9
Then the devil led Jesus to Jerusalem and put him on a high place of the Temple. He said to Jesus, “If you are the Son of God, jump down.
LK
4:10
It is written in the Scriptures: ‘He has put his angels in charge of you to watch over you.’ (Psalm 91:11)
LK
4:11
It is also written: ‘They will catch you in their hands so that you will not hit your foot on a rock.’” (Psalm 91:12)
LK
4:12
Jesus answered, “But it also says in the Scriptures: ‘Do not test the Lord your God.’”(p)
LK
4:13
After the devil had tempted Jesus in every way, he left him to wait until a better time.
Week 1-6 | John The Baptist Prepares for Jesus
Mt 3:1-12 Mk 1:1-8 Lk 3:1-18 Jn 1:19-28
Default Mt 3:1-12 Mk 1:1-8 Lk 3:1-18 Jn 1:19-28
LK
3:1
It was the fifteenth year of the rule of Tiberius Caesar. These men were under Caesar: Pontius Pilate, the ruler of Judea; Herod, the ruler of Galilee; Philip, Herod’s brother, the ruler of Iturea and Traconitis; and Lysanias, the ruler of Abilene.
LK
3:2
Annas and Caiaphas were the high priests. At this time, the word of God came to John son of Zechariah in the desert.
LK
3:3
He went all over the area around the Jordan River preaching a baptism of changed hearts and lives for the forgiveness of sins.
MT
3:2
John said, “Change your hearts and lives because the kingdom of heaven is near.”
MK
1:6
John wore clothes made from camel’s hair, had a leather belt around his waist, and ate locusts and wild honey.
JN
1:19
Here is the truth John(e) told when the leaders in Jerusalem sent priests and Levites to ask him, “Who are you?”
JN
1:20
John spoke freely and did not refuse to answer. He said, “I am not the Christ.”
JN
1:21
So they asked him, “Then who are you? Are you Elijah?”(f) He answered, “No, I am not.” “Are you the Prophet?”(g) they asked. He answered, “No.”
JN
1:22
Then they said, “Who are you? Give us an answer to tell those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?”
LK
3:4
As it is written in the book of Isaiah the prophet: “This is a voice of one who calls out in the desert: ‘Prepare the way for the Lord. Make the road straight for him.
LK
3:5
Every valley should be filled in, and every mountain and hill should be made flat. Roads with turns should be made straight, and rough roads should be made smooth.
LK
3:6
And all people will know about the salvation of God!’” (Isaiah 40:3-5)
MT
3:7
Many of the Pharisees and Sadducees came to the place where John was baptizing people. When John saw them, he said, “You are snakes! Who warned you to run away from God’s coming punishment?
MT
3:8
Do the things that show you really have changed your hearts and lives.
MT
3:9
And don’t think you can say to yourselves, ‘Abraham is our father.’ I tell you that God could make children for Abraham from these rocks.
MT
3:10
The ax is now ready to cut down the trees, and every tree that does not produce good fruit will be cut down and thrown into the fire.(i)
LK
3:10
The people asked John, “Then what should we do?”
LK
3:11
John answered, “If you have two shirts, share with the person who does not have one. If you have food, share that also.”
LK
3:12
Even tax collectors came to John to be baptized. They said to him, “Teacher, what should we do?”
LK
3:13
John said to them, “Don’t take more taxes from people than you have been ordered to take.”
LK
3:14
The soldiers asked John, “What about us? What should we do?” John said to them, “Don’t force people to give you money, and don’t lie about them. Be satisfied with the pay you get.”
LK
3:15
Since the people were hoping for the Christ to come, they wondered if John might be the one.
LK
3:16
John answered everyone, “I baptize you with water, but there is one coming who is greater than I am. I am not good enough to untie his sandals. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
LK
3:17
He will come ready to clean the grain, separating the good grain from the chaff. He will put the good part of the grain into his barn, but he will burn the chaff with a fire that cannot be put out.”(k)
LK
3:18
And John continued to preach the Good News, saying many other things to encourage the people.
JN
1:28
This all happened at Bethany on the other side of the Jordan River, where John was baptizing people.
Default Mt 3:1-12 Mk 1:1-8 Lk 3:1-18 Jn 1:19-28
MT
3:1
About that time John the Baptist began preaching in the desert area of Judea.
MT
3:2
John said, “Change your hearts and lives because the kingdom of heaven is near.”
MT
3:3
John the Baptist is the one Isaiah the prophet was talking about when he said: “This is a voice of one who calls out in the desert: ‘Prepare the way for the Lord. Make the road straight for him.’” (Isaiah 40:3)
MT
3:4
John’s clothes were made from camel’s hair, and he wore a leather belt around his waist. For food, he ate locusts and wild honey.
MT
3:5
Many people came from Jerusalem and Judea and all the area around the Jordan River to hear John.
MT
3:6
They confessed their sins, and he baptized them in the Jordan River.
MT
3:7
Many of the Pharisees and Sadducees came to the place where John was baptizing people. When John saw them, he said, “You are snakes! Who warned you to run away from God’s coming punishment?
MT
3:8
Do the things that show you really have changed your hearts and lives.
MT
3:9
And don’t think you can say to yourselves, ‘Abraham is our father.’ I tell you that God could make children for Abraham from these rocks.
MT
3:10
The ax is now ready to cut down the trees, and every tree that does not produce good fruit will be cut down and thrown into the fire.(i)
MT
3:11
“I baptize you with water to show that your hearts and lives have changed. But there is one coming after me who is greater than I am, whose sandals I am not good enough to carry. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
MT
3:12
He will come ready to clean the grain, separating the good grain from the chaff. He will put the good part of the grain into his barn, but he will burn the chaff with a fire that cannot be put out.”(j)
Default Mt 3:1-12 Mk 1:1-8 Lk 3:1-18 Jn 1:19-28
MK
1:1
This is the beginning of the Good News about Jesus Christ, the Son of God,(a)
MK
1:2
as the prophet Isaiah wrote: “I will send my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare your way.” (Malachi 3:1)
MK
1:3
“This is a voice of one who calls out in the desert: ‘Prepare the way for the Lord. Make the road straight for him.’” (Isaiah 40:3)
MK
1:4
John was baptizing people in the desert and preaching a baptism of changed hearts and lives for the forgiveness of sins.
MK
1:5
All the people from Judea and Jerusalem were going out to him. They confessed their sins and were baptized by him in the Jordan River.
MK
1:6
John wore clothes made from camel’s hair, had a leather belt around his waist, and ate locusts and wild honey.
MK
1:7
This is what John preached to the people: “There is one coming after me who is greater than I; I am not good enough even to kneel down and untie his sandals.
MK
1:8
I baptize you with water, but he will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.”
Default Mt 3:1-12 Mk 1:1-8 Lk 3:1-18 Jn 1:19-28
LK
3:1
It was the fifteenth year of the rule of Tiberius Caesar. These men were under Caesar: Pontius Pilate, the ruler of Judea; Herod, the ruler of Galilee; Philip, Herod’s brother, the ruler of Iturea and Traconitis; and Lysanias, the ruler of Abilene.
LK
3:2
Annas and Caiaphas were the high priests. At this time, the word of God came to John son of Zechariah in the desert.
LK
3:3
He went all over the area around the Jordan River preaching a baptism of changed hearts and lives for the forgiveness of sins.
LK
3:4
As it is written in the book of Isaiah the prophet: “This is a voice of one who calls out in the desert: ‘Prepare the way for the Lord. Make the road straight for him.
LK
3:5
Every valley should be filled in, and every mountain and hill should be made flat. Roads with turns should be made straight, and rough roads should be made smooth.
LK
3:6
And all people will know about the salvation of God!’” (Isaiah 40:3-5)
LK
3:7
To the crowds of people who came to be baptized by John, he said, “You are all snakes! Who warned you to run away from God’s coming punishment?
LK
3:8
Do the things that show you really have changed your hearts and lives. Don’t begin to say to yourselves, ‘Abraham is our father.’ I tell you that God could make children for Abraham from these rocks.
LK
3:9
The ax is now ready to cut down the trees, and every tree that does not produce good fruit will be cut down and thrown into the fire.”(j)
LK
3:10
The people asked John, “Then what should we do?”
LK
3:11
John answered, “If you have two shirts, share with the person who does not have one. If you have food, share that also.”
LK
3:12
Even tax collectors came to John to be baptized. They said to him, “Teacher, what should we do?”
LK
3:13
John said to them, “Don’t take more taxes from people than you have been ordered to take.”
LK
3:14
The soldiers asked John, “What about us? What should we do?” John said to them, “Don’t force people to give you money, and don’t lie about them. Be satisfied with the pay you get.”
LK
3:15
Since the people were hoping for the Christ to come, they wondered if John might be the one.
LK
3:16
John answered everyone, “I baptize you with water, but there is one coming who is greater than I am. I am not good enough to untie his sandals. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
LK
3:17
He will come ready to clean the grain, separating the good grain from the chaff. He will put the good part of the grain into his barn, but he will burn the chaff with a fire that cannot be put out.”(k)
LK
3:18
And John continued to preach the Good News, saying many other things to encourage the people.
Default Mt 3:1-12 Mk 1:1-8 Lk 3:1-18 Jn 1:19-28
JN
1:19
Here is the truth John(e) told when the leaders in Jerusalem sent priests and Levites to ask him, “Who are you?”
JN
1:20
John spoke freely and did not refuse to answer. He said, “I am not the Christ.”
JN
1:21
So they asked him, “Then who are you? Are you Elijah?”(f) He answered, “No, I am not.” “Are you the Prophet?”(g) they asked. He answered, “No.”
JN
1:22
Then they said, “Who are you? Give us an answer to tell those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?”
JN
1:23
John told them in the words of the prophet Isaiah: “I am the voice of one calling out in the desert: ‘Make the road straight for the Lord.’” (Isaiah 40:3)
JN
1:24
Some Pharisees who had been sent asked John:
JN
1:25
“If you are not the Christ or Elijah or the Prophet, why do you baptize people?”
JN
1:26
John answered, “I baptize with water, but there is one here with you that you don’t know about.
JN
1:27
He is the One who comes after me. I am not good enough to untie the strings of his sandals.”
JN
1:28
This all happened at Bethany on the other side of the Jordan River, where John was baptizing people.
Week 6 | John Declares: "The Lamb Of God"
Jn 1:29-34
Jn 1:29-34
JN
1:29
The next day John saw Jesus coming toward him. John said, “Look, the Lamb of God,(h) who takes away the sin of the world!
JN
1:30
This is the One I was talking about when I said, ‘A man will come after me, but he is greater than I am, because he was living before me.’
JN
1:31
Even I did not know who he was, although I came baptizing with water so that the people of Israel would know who he is.”
JN
1:32
Then John said, “I saw the Spirit come down from heaven in the form of a dove and rest on him.
JN
1:33
Until then I did not know who the Christ was. But the God who sent me to baptize with water told me, ‘You will see the Spirit come down and rest on a man; he is the One who will baptize with the Holy Spirit.’
JN
1:34
I have seen this happen, and I tell you the truth: This man is the Son of God.”(i)
Week 6 | Jesus' First Followers: Andrew, Simon Peter,...
Jn 1:35-42
Jn 1:35-42
JN
1:35
The next day John(j) was there again with two of his followers.
JN
1:36
When he saw Jesus walking by, he said, “Look, the Lamb of God!”(k)
JN
1:37
The two followers heard John say this, so they followed Jesus.
JN
1:38
When Jesus turned and saw them following him, he asked, “What are you looking for?”
JN
1:39
They said, “Rabbi, where are you staying?” (“Rabbi” means “Teacher”). He answered, “Come and see.” So the two men went with Jesus and saw where he was staying and stayed there with him that day. It was about four o’clock in the afternoon.
JN
1:40
One of the two men who followed Jesus after they heard John speak about him was Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother.
JN
1:41
The first thing Andrew did was to find his brother Simon and say to him, “We have found the Messiah.” (“Messiah” means “Christ.”)
JN
1:42
Then Andrew took Simon to Jesus. Jesus looked at him and said, “You are Simon son of John. You will be called Cephas.” (“Cephas” means “Peter.”(l))
Week 6 | More Followers: Philip And Nathanael
Jn 1:43-51
Jn 1:43-51
JN
1:43
The next day Jesus decided to go to Galilee. He found Philip and said to him, “Follow me.”
JN
1:44
Philip was from the town of Bethsaida, where Andrew and Peter lived.
JN
1:45
Philip found Nathanael and told him, “We have found the man that Moses wrote about in the law, and the prophets also wrote about him. He is Jesus, the son of Joseph, from Nazareth.”
JN
1:46
But Nathanael said to Philip, “Can anything good come from Nazareth?” Philip answered, “Come and see.”
JN
1:47
As Jesus saw Nathanael coming toward him, he said, “Here is truly an Israelite. There is nothing false in him.”
JN
1:48
Nathanael asked, “How do you know me?” Jesus answered, “I saw you when you were under the fig tree, before Philip told you about me.”
JN
1:49
Then Nathanael said to Jesus, “Teacher, you are the Son of God; you are the King of Israel.”
JN
1:50
Jesus said to Nathanael, “Do you believe simply because I told you I saw you under the fig tree? You will see greater things than that.”
JN
1:51
And Jesus said to them, “I tell you the truth, you will all see heaven open and ‘angels of God going up and coming down’(m) on the Son of Man.”
Week 7 | Jesus Visits His Family Of Origin In Galilee
– +
Week 7 | The Wedding At Cana
Jn 2:1-11
Jn 2:1-11
JN
2:1
Two days later there was a wedding in the town of Cana in Galilee. Jesus’ mother was there,
JN
2:2
and Jesus and his followers were also invited to the wedding.
JN
2:3
When all the wine was gone, Jesus’ mother said to him, “They have no more wine.”
JN
2:4
Jesus answered, “Dear woman, why come to me? My time has not yet come.”
JN
2:5
His mother said to the servants, “Do whatever he tells you to do.”
JN
2:6
In that place there were six stone water jars that the Jews used in their washing ceremony.(n) Each jar held about twenty or thirty gallons.
JN
2:7
Jesus said to the servants, “Fill the jars with water.” So they filled the jars to the top.
JN
2:8
Then he said to them, “Now take some out and give it to the master of the feast.” So they took the water to the master.
JN
2:9
When he tasted it, the water had become wine. He did not know where the wine came from, but the servants who had brought the water knew. The master of the wedding called the bridegroom
JN
2:10
and said to him, “People always serve the best wine first. Later, after the guests have been drinking awhile, they serve the cheaper wine. But you have saved the best wine till now.”
JN
2:11
So in Cana of Galilee Jesus did his first miracle. There he showed his glory, and his followers believed in him.
Week 7 | Jesus' Family Of Faith And Family Of Origin Together In Capernaum
Jn 2:12-12
Jn 2:12-12
JN
2:12
After this, Jesus went to the town of Capernaum with his mother, brothers, and followers. They stayed there for just a few days.
Week 8 | First Passover In Jerusalem, Ministry In Judea
– +
Week 8 | First Cleansing Of Temple For Passover
Jn 2:13-17
Jn 2:13-17
JN
2:13
When it was almost time for the Jewish Passover Feast, Jesus went to Jerusalem.
JN
2:14
In the Temple he found people selling cattle, sheep, and doves. He saw others sitting at tables, exchanging different kinds of money.
JN
2:15
Jesus made a whip out of cords and forced all of them, both the sheep and cattle, to leave the Temple. He turned over the tables and scattered the money of those who were exchanging it.
JN
2:16
Then he said to those who were selling pigeons, “Take these things out of here! Don’t make my Father’s house a place for buying and selling!”
JN
2:17
When this happened, the followers remembered what was written in the Scriptures: “My strong love for your Temple completely controls me.”(o)
Week 8 | Destroy This Temple And I Will Build It Again In Three Days
Jn 2:18-25
Jn 2:18-25
JN
2:18
Some of his people said to Jesus, “Show us a miracle to prove you have the right to do these things.”
JN
2:19
Jesus answered them, “Destroy this temple, and I will build it again in three days.”
JN
2:20
They answered, “It took forty-six years to build this Temple! Do you really believe you can build it again in three days?”
JN
2:21
(But the temple Jesus meant was his own body.
JN
2:22
After Jesus was raised from the dead, his followers remembered that Jesus had said this. Then they believed the Scripture and the words Jesus had said.)
JN
2:23
When Jesus was in Jerusalem for the Passover Feast, many people believed in him because they saw the miracles he did.
JN
2:24
But Jesus did not believe in them because he knew them all.
JN
2:25
He did not need anyone to tell him about people, because he knew what was in people’s minds.
Week 9 | Nicodemus Goes to Jesus To Talk
Jn 3:1-21
Jn 3:1-21
JN
3:1
There was a man named Nicodemus who was one of the Pharisees and an important Jewish leader.
JN
3:2
One night Nicodemus came to Jesus and said, “Teacher, we know you are a teacher sent from God, because no one can do the miracles you do unless God is with him.”
JN
3:3
Jesus answered, “I tell you the truth, unless you are born again, you cannot be in God’s kingdom.”
JN
3:4
Nicodemus said, “But if a person is already old, how can he be born again? He cannot enter his mother’s womb again. So how can a person be born a second time?”
JN
3:5
But Jesus answered, “I tell you the truth, unless you are born from water and the Spirit, you cannot enter God’s kingdom.
JN
3:6
Human life comes from human parents, but spiritual life comes from the Spirit.
JN
3:7
Don’t be surprised when I tell you, ‘You must all be born again.’
JN
3:8
The wind blows where it wants to and you hear the sound of it, but you don’t know where the wind comes from or where it is going. It is the same with every person who is born from the Spirit.”
JN
3:9
Nicodemus asked, “How can this happen?”
JN
3:10
Jesus said, “You are an important teacher in Israel, and you don’t understand these things?
JN
3:11
I tell you the truth, we talk about what we know, and we tell about what we have seen, but you don’t accept what we tell you.
JN
3:12
I have told you about things here on earth, and you do not believe me. So you will not believe me if I tell you about things of heaven.
JN
3:13
The only one who has ever gone up to heaven is the One who came down from heaven-the Son of Man.(p)
JN
3:14
“Just as Moses lifted up the snake in the desert,(q) the Son of Man must also be lifted up.
JN
3:15
So that everyone who believes can have eternal life in him.
JN
3:16
“God loved the world so much that he gave his one and only Son so that whoever believes in him may not be lost, but have eternal life.
JN
3:17
God did not send his Son into the world to judge the world guilty, but to save the world through him.
JN
3:18
People who believe in God’s Son are not judged guilty. Those who do not believe have already been judged guilty, because they have not believed in God’s one and only Son.
JN
3:19
They are judged by this fact: The Light has come into the world, but they did not want light. They wanted darkness, because they were doing evil things.
JN
3:20
All who do evil hate the light and will not come to the light, because it will show all the evil things they do.
JN
3:21
But those who follow the true way come to the light, and it shows that the things they do were done through God.”
Week 9-15 | The Ministry Is Being Taken Over From John To Jesus
Jn 3:22-36
Jn 3:22-36
JN
3:22
After this, Jesus and his followers went into the area of Judea, where he stayed with his followers and baptized people.
JN
3:23
John was also baptizing in Aenon, near Salim, because there was plenty of water there. People were going there to be baptized.
JN
3:24
(This was before John was put into prison.)
JN
3:25
Some of John’s followers had an argument with a Jew about religious washing.(r)
JN
3:26
So they came to John and said, “Teacher, remember the man who was with you on the other side of the Jordan River, the one you spoke about so much? He is baptizing, and everyone is going to him.”
JN
3:27
John answered, “A man can get only what God gives him.
JN
3:28
You yourselves heard me say, ‘I am not the Christ, but I am the one sent to prepare the way for him.’
JN
3:29
The bride belongs only to the bridegroom. But the friend who helps the bridegroom stands by and listens to him. He is thrilled that he gets to hear the bridegroom’s voice. In the same way, I am really happy.
JN
3:30
He must become greater, and I must become less important.
JN
3:31
“The One who comes from above is greater than all. The one who is from the earth belongs to the earth and talks about things on the earth. But the One who comes from heaven is greater than all.
JN
3:32
He tells what he has seen and heard, but no one accepts what he says.
JN
3:33
Whoever accepts what he says has proven that God is true.
JN
3:34
The One whom God sent speaks the words of God, because God gives him the Spirit fully.
JN
3:35
The Father loves the Son and has given him power over everything.
JN
3:36
Those who believe in the Son have eternal life, but those who do not obey the Son will never have life. God’s anger stays on them.”
Week 9-15 | Back To Galilee
– +
Week 9-15 | The Samaritan Woman
Jn 4:1-42
Jn 4:1-42
JN
4:1
The Pharisees heard that Jesus was making and baptizing more followers than John,
JN
4:2
although Jesus himself did not baptize people, but his followers did.
JN
4:3
Jesus knew that the Pharisees had heard about him, so he left Judea and went back to Galilee.
JN
4:4
But on the way he had to go through the country of Samaria.
JN
4:5
In Samaria Jesus came to the town called Sychar, which is near the field Jacob gave to his son Joseph.
JN
4:6
Jacob’s well was there. Jesus was tired from his long trip, so he sat down beside the well. It was about twelve o’clock noon.
JN
4:7
When a Samaritan woman came to the well to get some water, Jesus said to her, “Please give me a drink.”
JN
4:8
(This happened while Jesus’ followers were in town buying some food.)
JN
4:9
The woman said, “I am surprised that you ask me for a drink, since you are a Jewish man and I am a Samaritan woman.” (Jewish people are not friends with Samaritans.(s))
JN
4:10
Jesus said, “If you only knew the free gift of God and who it is that is asking you for water, you would have asked him, and he would have given you living water.”
JN
4:11
The woman said, “Sir, where will you get this living water? The well is very deep, and you have nothing to get water with.
JN
4:12
Are you greater than Jacob, our father, who gave us this well and drank from it himself along with his sons and flocks?”
JN
4:13
Jesus answered, “Everyone who drinks this water will be thirsty again,
JN
4:14
but whoever drinks the water I give will never be thirsty. The water I give will become a spring of water gushing up inside that person, giving eternal life.”
JN
4:15
The woman said to him, “Sir, give me this water so I will never be thirsty again and will not have to come back here to get more water.”
JN
4:16
Jesus told her, “Go get your husband and come back here.”
JN
4:17
The woman answered, “I have no husband.” Jesus said to her, “You are right to say you have no husband.
JN
4:18
Really you have had five husbands, and the man you live with now is not your husband. You told the truth.”
JN
4:19
The woman said, “Sir, I can see that you are a prophet.
JN
4:20
Our ancestors worshiped on this mountain, but you say that Jerusalem is the place where people must worship.”
JN
4:21
Jesus said, “Believe me, woman. The time is coming when neither in Jerusalem nor on this mountain will you actually worship the Father.
JN
4:22
You Samaritans worship something you don’t understand. We understand what we worship, because salvation comes from the Jews.
JN
4:23
The time is coming when the true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth, and that time is here already. You see, the Father too is actively seeking such people to worship him.
JN
4:24
God is spirit, and those who worship him must worship in spirit and truth.”
JN
4:25
The woman said, “I know that the Messiah is coming.” (Messiah is the One called Christ.) “When the Messiah comes, he will explain everything to us.”
JN
4:26
Then Jesus said, “I am he-I, the one talking to you.”
JN
4:27
Just then his followers came back from town and were surprised to see him talking with a woman. But none of them asked, “What do you want?” or “Why are you talking with her?”
JN
4:28
Then the woman left her water jar and went back to town. She said to the people,
JN
4:29
“Come and see a man who told me everything I ever did. Do you think he might be the Christ?”
JN
4:30
So the people left the town and went to see Jesus.
JN
4:31
Meanwhile, his followers were begging him, “Teacher, eat something.”
JN
4:32
But Jesus answered, “I have food to eat that you know nothing about.”
JN
4:33
So the followers asked themselves, “Did somebody already bring him food?”
JN
4:34
Jesus said, “My food is to do what the One who sent me wants me to do and to finish his work.
JN
4:35
You have a saying, ‘Four more months till harvest.’ But I tell you, open your eyes and look at the fields ready for harvest now.
JN
4:36
Already, the one who harvests is being paid and is gathering crops for eternal life. So the one who plants and the one who harvests celebrate at the same time.
JN
4:37
Here the saying is true, ‘One person plants, and another harvests.’
JN
4:38
I sent you to harvest a crop that you did not work on. Others did the work, and you get to finish up their work.”(t)
JN
4:39
Many of the Samaritans in that town believed in Jesus because of what the woman said: “He told me everything I ever did.”
JN
4:40
When the Samaritans came to Jesus, they begged him to stay with them, so he stayed there two more days.
JN
4:41
And many more believed because of the things he said.
JN
4:42
They said to the woman, “First we believed in Jesus because of what you said, but now we believe because we heard him ourselves. We know that this man really is the Savior of the world.”
Week 9-15 | Jesus Heals An Officer’s Son
Jn 4:43-54
Jn 4:43-54
JN
4:43
Two days later, Jesus left and went to Galilee.
JN
4:44
(Jesus had said before that a prophet is not respected in his own country.)
JN
4:45
When Jesus arrived in Galilee, the people there welcomed him. They had seen all the things he did at the Passover Feast in Jerusalem, because they had been there, too.
JN
4:46
Jesus went again to visit Cana in Galilee where he had changed the water into wine. One of the king’s important officers lived in the city of Capernaum, and his son was sick.
JN
4:47
When he heard that Jesus had come from Judea to Galilee, he went to Jesus and begged him to come to Capernaum and heal his son, because his son was almost dead.
JN
4:48
Jesus said to him, “You people must see signs and miracles before you will believe in me.”
JN
4:49
The officer said, “Sir, come before my child dies.”
JN
4:50
Jesus answered, “Go. Your son will live.” The man believed what Jesus told him and went home.
JN
4:51
On the way the man’s servants came and met him and told him, “Your son is alive.”
JN
4:52
The man asked, “What time did my son begin to get well?” They answered, “Yesterday at one o’clock the fever left him.”
JN
4:53
The father knew that one o’clock was the exact time that Jesus had said, “Your son will live.” So the man and all the people who lived in his house believed in Jesus.
JN
4:54
That was the second miracle Jesus did after coming from Judea to Galilee.
Week 9-15 | Herod Puts John In Prison
Mt 14:3-5 Mk 6:17-20 Lk 3:19-20
Default Mt 14:3-5 Mk 6:17-20 Lk 3:19-20
LK
3:19
But John spoke against Herod, the governor, because of his sin with Herodias, the wife of Herod’s brother, and because of the many other evil things Herod did.
MK
6:19
So Herodias hated John and wanted to kill him. But she couldn’t,
MK
6:20
because Herod was afraid of John and protected him. He knew John was a good and holy man. Also, though John’s preaching always bothered him, he enjoyed listening to John.
LK
3:20
So Herod did something even worse: He put John in prison.
Default Mt 14:3-5 Mk 6:17-20 Lk 3:19-20
MT
14:3
Sometime before this, Herod had arrested John, tied him up, and put him into prison. Herod did this because of Herodias, who had been the wife of Philip, Herod’s brother.
MT
14:4
John had been telling Herod, “It is not lawful for you to be married to Herodias.”
MT
14:5
Herod wanted to kill John, but he was afraid of the people, because they believed John was a prophet.
Default Mt 14:3-5 Mk 6:17-20 Lk 3:19-20
MK
6:17
Herod himself had ordered his soldiers to arrest John and put him in prison in order to please his wife, Herodias. She had been the wife of Philip, Herod’s brother, but then Herod had married her.
MK
6:18
John had been telling Herod, “It is not lawful for you to be married to your brother’s wife.”
MK
6:19
So Herodias hated John and wanted to kill him. But she couldn’t,
MK
6:20
because Herod was afraid of John and protected him. He knew John was a good and holy man. Also, though John’s preaching always bothered him, he enjoyed listening to John.
Default Mt 14:3-5 Mk 6:17-20 Lk 3:19-20
LK
3:19
But John spoke against Herod, the governor, because of his sin with Herodias, the wife of Herod’s brother, and because of the many other evil things Herod did.
LK
3:20
So Herod did something even worse: He put John in prison.
Week 15 | Pentecost In Jerusalem
– +
Week 15 | Healing At Bethesda On Sabbath
Jn 5:1-15
Jn 5:1-15
JN
5:1
Later Jesus went to Jerusalem for a special feast.
JN
5:2
In Jerusalem there is a pool with five covered porches, which is called Bethesda(u) in the Hebrew language.(v) This pool is near the Sheep Gate.
JN
5:3
Many sick people were lying on the porches beside the pool. Some were blind, some were crippled, and some were paralyzed [, and they waited for the water to move.
JN
5:4
Sometimes an angel of the Lord came down to the pool and stirred up the water. After the angel did this, the first person to go into the pool was healed from any sickness he had].(w)
JN
5:5
A man was lying there who had been sick for thirty-eight years.
JN
5:6
When Jesus saw the man and knew that he had been sick for such a long time, Jesus asked him, “Do you want to be well?”
JN
5:7
The sick man answered, “Sir, there is no one to help me get into the pool when the water starts moving. While I am coming to the water, someone else always gets in before me.”
JN
5:8
Then Jesus said, “Stand up. Pick up your mat and walk.”
JN
5:9
And immediately the man was well; he picked up his mat and began to walk. The day this happened was a Sabbath day.
JN
5:10
So the Jews said to the man who had been healed, “Today is the Sabbath. It is against our law for you to carry your mat on the Sabbath day.”
JN
5:11
But he answered, “The man who made me well told me, ‘Pick up your mat and walk.’ ”
JN
5:12
Then they asked him, “Who is the man who told you to pick up your mat and walk?”
JN
5:13
But the man who had been healed did not know who it was, because there were many people in that place, and Jesus had left.
JN
5:14
Later, Jesus found the man at the Temple and said to him, “See, you are well now. Stop sinning so that something worse does not happen to you.”
JN
5:15
Then the man left and told his people that Jesus was the one who had made him well.
Week 15 | Jesus Is The Son Of God
Jn 5:16-47
Jn 5:16-47
JN
5:16
Because Jesus was doing this on the Sabbath day, some evil people began to persecute him.
JN
5:17
But Jesus said to them, “My Father never stops working, and so I keep working, too.”
JN
5:18
This made them try still harder to kill him. They said, “First Jesus was breaking the law about the Sabbath day. Now he says that God is his own Father, making himself equal with God!”
JN
5:19
But Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, the Son can do nothing alone. The Son does only what he sees the Father doing, because the Son does whatever the Father does.
JN
5:20
The Father loves the Son and shows the Son all the things he himself does. But the Father will show the Son even greater things than this so that you can all be amazed.
JN
5:21
Just as the Father raises the dead and gives them life, so also the Son gives life to those he wants to.
JN
5:22
In fact, the Father judges no one, but he has given the Son power to do all the judging
JN
5:23
so that all people will honor the Son as much as they honor the Father. Anyone who does not honor the Son does not honor the Father who sent him.
JN
5:24
“I tell you the truth, whoever hears what I say and believes in the One who sent me has eternal life. That person will not be judged guilty but has already left death and entered life.
JN
5:25
I tell you the truth, the time is coming and is already here when the dead will hear the voice of the Son of God, and those who hear will have life.
JN
5:26
Life comes from the Father himself, and he has allowed the Son to have life in himself as well.
JN
5:27
And the Father has given the Son the approval to judge, because he is the Son of Man.
JN
5:28
Don’t be surprised at this: A time is coming when all who are dead and in their graves will hear his voice.
JN
5:29
Then they will come out of their graves. Those who did good will rise and have life forever, but those who did evil will rise to be judged guilty.
JN
5:30
“I can do nothing alone. I judge only the way I am told, so my judgment is fair. I don’t try to please myself, but I try to please the One who sent me.
JN
5:31
“If only I tell people about myself, what I say is not true.
JN
5:32
But there is another who tells about me, and I know that the things he says about me are true.
JN
5:33
“You have sent people to John, and he has told you the truth.
JN
5:34
It is not that I need what humans say; I tell you this so you can be saved.
JN
5:35
John was like a burning and shining lamp, and you were happy to enjoy his light for a while.
JN
5:36
“But I have a proof about myself that is greater than that of John. The things I do, which are the things my Father gave me to do, prove that the Father sent me.
JN
5:37
And the Father himself who sent me has given proof about me. You have never heard his voice or seen what he looks like.
JN
5:38
His teaching does not live in you, because you don’t believe in the One the Father sent.
JN
5:39
You carefully study the Scriptures because you think they give you eternal life. They do in fact tell about me,
JN
5:40
but you refuse to come to me to have that life.
JN
5:41
“I don’t need praise from people.
JN
5:42
But I know you-I know that you don’t have God’s love in you.
JN
5:43
I have come from my Father and speak for him, but you don’t accept me. But when another person comes, speaking only for himself, you will accept him.
JN
5:44
You try to get praise from each other, but you do not try to get the praise that comes from the only God. So how can you believe?
JN
5:45
Don’t think that I will stand before the Father and say you are wrong. The one who says you are wrong is Moses, the one you hoped would save you.
JN
5:46
If you really believed Moses, you would believe me, because Moses wrote about me.
JN
5:47
But if you don’t believe what Moses wrote, how can you believe what I say?”
Week 18-31 | Opening Of The Galilean Ministry
– +
Week 16 | Opening Of The Galilean Ministry
Mt 4:12-12 Mk 1:14-15 Lk 4:14-15
Default Mt 4:12-12 Mk 1:14-15 Lk 4:14-15
MK
1:14
After John was put in prison, Jesus went into Galilee, preaching the Good News from God.
MK
1:15
He said, “The right time has come. The kingdom of God is near. Change your hearts and lives and believe the Good News!”
Default Mt 4:12-12 Mk 1:14-15 Lk 4:14-15
MT
4:12
When Jesus heard that John had been put in prison, he went back to Galilee.
Default Mt 4:12-12 Mk 1:14-15 Lk 4:14-15
MK
1:14
After John was put in prison, Jesus went into Galilee, preaching the Good News from God.
MK
1:15
He said, “The right time has come. The kingdom of God is near. Change your hearts and lives and believe the Good News!”
Default Mt 4:12-12 Mk 1:14-15 Lk 4:14-15
LK
4:14
Jesus returned to Galilee in the power of the Holy Spirit, and stories about him spread all through the area.
LK
4:15
He began to teach in their synagogues, and everyone praised him.
Week 16 | Isaiah's Words Are Coming True
Lk 4:16-30
Lk 4:16-30
LK
4:16
Jesus traveled to Nazareth, where he had grown up. On the Sabbath day he went to the synagogue, as he always did, and stood up to read.
LK
4:17
The book of Isaiah the prophet was given to him. He opened the book and found the place where this is written:
LK
4:18
“The Lord has put his Spirit in me, because he appointed me to tell the Good News to the poor. He has sent me to tell the captives they are free and to tell the blind that they can see again. (Isaiah 61:1) God sent me to free those who have been treated unfairly (Isaiah 58:6)
LK
4:19
and to announce the time when the Lord will show his kindness.” (Isaiah 61:2)
LK
4:20
Jesus closed the book, gave it back to the assistant, and sat down. Everyone in the synagogue was watching Jesus closely.
LK
4:21
He began to say to them, “While you heard these words just now, they were coming true!”
LK
4:22
All the people spoke well of Jesus and were amazed at the words of grace he spoke. They asked, “Isn’t this Joseph’s son?”
LK
4:23
Jesus said to them, “I know that you will tell me the old saying: ‘Doctor, heal yourself.’ You want to say, ‘We heard about the things you did in Capernaum. Do those things here in your own town!’”
LK
4:24
Then Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, a prophet is not accepted in his hometown.
LK
4:25
But I tell you the truth, there were many widows in Israel during the time of Elijah. It did not rain in Israel for three and one-half years, and there was no food anywhere in the whole country.
LK
4:26
But Elijah was sent to none of those widows, only to a widow in Zarephath, a town in Sidon.
LK
4:27
And there were many with skin diseases living in Israel during the time of the prophet Elisha. But none of them were healed, only Naaman, who was from the country of Syria.”
LK
4:28
When all the people in the synagogue heard these things, they became very angry.
LK
4:29
They got up, forced Jesus out of town, and took him to the edge of the cliff on which the town was built. They planned to throw him off the edge,
LK
4:30
but Jesus walked through the crowd and went on his way.
Week 17 | Jesus Teaches In Capernaum
Mt 4:13-17
Mt 4:13-17
MT
4:13
He left Nazareth and went to live in Capernaum, a town near Lake Galilee, in the area near Zebulun and Naphtali.
MT
4:14
Jesus did this to bring about what the prophet Isaiah had said:
MT
4:15
“Land of Zebulun and land of Naphtali along the sea, beyond the Jordan River. This is Galilee where the non-Jewish people live.
MT
4:16
These people who live in darkness will see a great light. They live in a place covered with the shadows of death, but a light will shine on them.” (Isaiah 9:1-2)
MT
4:17
From that time Jesus began to preach, saying, “Change your hearts and lives, because the kingdom of heaven is near.”
Week 17 | The Call By The Sea: Simon Peter, Andrew, James And John Join Full Time
Mt 4:18-22 Mk 1:16-20 Lk 5:1-11
Default Mt 4:18-22 Mk 1:16-20 Lk 5:1-11
MK
1:16
When Jesus was walking by Lake Galilee, he saw Simon(b) and his brother Andrew throwing a net into the lake because they were fishermen.
MK
1:19
Going a little farther, Jesus saw two more brothers, James and John, the sons of Zebedee. They were in a boat, mending their nets.
LK
5:1
One day while Jesus was standing beside Lake Galilee, many people were pressing all around him to hear the word of God.
LK
5:3
Jesus got into one of the boats, the one that belonged to Simon,(s) and asked him to push off a little from the land. Then Jesus sat down and continued to teach the people from the boat.
LK
5:4
When Jesus had finished speaking, he said to Simon, “Take the boat into deep water, and put your nets in the water to catch some fish.”
LK
5:5
Simon answered, “Master, we worked hard all night trying to catch fish, and we caught nothing. But you say to put the nets in the water, so I will.”
LK
5:6
When the fishermen did as Jesus told them, they caught so many fish that the nets began to break.
LK
5:7
They called to their partners in the other boat to come and help them. They came and filled both boats so full that they were almost sinking.
LK
5:8
When Simon Peter saw what had happened, he bowed down before Jesus and said, “Go away from me, Lord. I am a sinful man!”
LK
5:9
He and the other fishermen were amazed at the many fish they caught, as were
MK
1:17
Jesus said to them, “Come follow me, and I will make you fish for people.”
LK
5:11
When the men brought their boats to the shore, they left everything and followed Jesus.
Default Mt 4:18-22 Mk 1:16-20 Lk 5:1-11
MT
4:18
As Jesus was walking by Lake Galilee, he saw two brothers, Simon (called Peter) and his brother Andrew. They were throwing a net into the lake because they were fishermen.
MT
4:19
Jesus said, “Come follow me, and I will make you fish for people.”
MT
4:20
So Simon and Andrew immediately left their nets and followed him.
MT
4:21
As Jesus continued walking by Lake Galilee, he saw two other brothers, James and John, the sons of Zebedee. They were in a boat with their father Zebedee, mending their nets. Jesus told them to come with him.
MT
4:22
Immediately they left the boat and their father, and they followed Jesus.
Default Mt 4:18-22 Mk 1:16-20 Lk 5:1-11
MK
1:16
When Jesus was walking by Lake Galilee, he saw Simon(b) and his brother Andrew throwing a net into the lake because they were fishermen.
MK
1:17
Jesus said to them, “Come follow me, and I will make you fish for people.”
MK
1:18
So Simon and Andrew immediately left their nets and followed him.
MK
1:19
Going a little farther, Jesus saw two more brothers, James and John, the sons of Zebedee. They were in a boat, mending their nets.
MK
1:20
Jesus immediately called them, and they left their father in the boat with the hired workers and followed Jesus.
Default Mt 4:18-22 Mk 1:16-20 Lk 5:1-11
LK
5:1
One day while Jesus was standing beside Lake Galilee, many people were pressing all around him to hear the word of God.
LK
5:2
Jesus saw two boats at the shore of the lake. The fishermen had left them and were washing their nets.
LK
5:3
Jesus got into one of the boats, the one that belonged to Simon,(s) and asked him to push off a little from the land. Then Jesus sat down and continued to teach the people from the boat.
LK
5:4
