When Jesus had finished speaking, he said to Simon, “Take the boat into deep water, and put your nets in the water to catch some fish.”
LK
5:5
Simon answered, “Master, we worked hard all night trying to catch fish, and we caught nothing. But you say to put the nets in the water, so I will.”
LK
5:6
When the fishermen did as Jesus told them, they caught so many fish that the nets began to break.
LK
5:7
They called to their partners in the other boat to come and help them. They came and filled both boats so full that they were almost sinking.
LK
5:8
When Simon Peter saw what had happened, he bowed down before Jesus and said, “Go away from me, Lord. I am a sinful man!”
LK
5:9
He and the other fishermen were amazed at the many fish they caught, as were
LK
5:10
James and John, the sons of Zebedee, Simon’s partners. Jesus said to Simon, “Don’t be afraid. From now on you will fish for people.”
LK
5:11
When the men brought their boats to the shore, they left everything and followed Jesus.
Week 17 | Forces Out An Evil Spirit In The Synagoge
Mk 1:21-28 Lk 4:31-37
Default Mk 1:21-28 Lk 4:31-37
MK
1:21
Jesus and his followers went to Capernaum. On the Sabbath day He went to the synagogue and began to teach.
MK
1:22
The people were amazed at his teaching, because he taught like a person who had authority, not like their teachers of the law.
MK
1:23
Just then, a man was there in the synagogue who had an evil spirit in him. He shouted,
MK
1:24
“Jesus of Nazareth! What do you want with us? Did you come to destroy us? I know who you are-God’s Holy One!”
MK
1:25
Jesus commanded the evil spirit, “Be quiet! Come out of the man!”
MK
1:26
The evil spirit shook the man violently, gave a loud cry, and then came out of him.
MK
1:27
The people were so amazed they asked each other, “What is happening here? This man is teaching something new, and with authority. He even gives commands to evil spirits, and they obey him.”
MK
1:28
And the news about Jesus spread quickly everywhere in the area of Galilee.
Default Mk 1:21-28 Lk 4:31-37
MK
1:21
Jesus and his followers went to Capernaum. On the Sabbath day He went to the synagogue and began to teach.
MK
1:22
The people were amazed at his teaching, because he taught like a person who had authority, not like their teachers of the law.
MK
1:23
Just then, a man was there in the synagogue who had an evil spirit in him. He shouted,
MK
1:24
“Jesus of Nazareth! What do you want with us? Did you come to destroy us? I know who you are-God’s Holy One!”
MK
1:25
Jesus commanded the evil spirit, “Be quiet! Come out of the man!”
MK
1:26
The evil spirit shook the man violently, gave a loud cry, and then came out of him.
MK
1:27
The people were so amazed they asked each other, “What is happening here? This man is teaching something new, and with authority. He even gives commands to evil spirits, and they obey him.”
MK
1:28
And the news about Jesus spread quickly everywhere in the area of Galilee.
Default Mk 1:21-28 Lk 4:31-37
LK
4:31
Jesus went to Capernaum, a city in Galilee, and on the Sabbath day, he taught the people.
LK
4:32
They were amazed at his teaching, because he spoke with authority.
LK
4:33
In the synagogue a man who had within him an evil spirit shouted in a loud voice,
LK
4:34
“Jesus of Nazareth! What do you want with us? Did you come to destroy us? I know who you are-God’s Holy One!”
LK
4:35
Jesus commanded the evil spirit, “Be quiet! Come out of the man!” The evil spirit threw the man down to the ground before all the people and then left the man without hurting him.
LK
4:36
The people were amazed and said to each other, “What does this mean? With authority and power he commands evil spirits, and they come out.”
LK
4:37
And so the news about Jesus spread to every place in the whole area.
Week 17 | Jesus Heals Many People At Peter's Home
Mt 8:14-17 Mk 1:29-34 Lk 4:38-41
Default Mt 8:14-17 Mk 1:29-34 Lk 4:38-41
MK
1:29
As soon as Jesus and his followers left the synagogue, they went with James and John to the home of Simon(c) and Andrew.
MK
1:30
Simon’s mother-in-law was sick in bed with a fever, and the people told Jesus about her.
MK
1:31
So Jesus went to her bed, took her hand, and helped her up. The fever left her, and she began serving them.
MK
1:32
That evening, after the sun went down, the people brought to Jesus all who were sick and had demons in them.
MK
1:33
The whole town gathered at the door.
MK
1:34
Jesus healed many who had different kinds of sicknesses, and he forced many demons to leave people. But he would not allow the demons to speak, because they knew who he was.
MT
8:17
He did these things to bring about what Isaiah the prophet had said: “He took our suffering on him and carried our diseases.” (Isaiah 53:4)
Default Mt 8:14-17 Mk 1:29-34 Lk 4:38-41
MT
8:14
When Jesus went to Peter’s house, he saw that Peter’s mother-in-law was sick in bed with a fever.
MT
8:15
Jesus touched her hand, and the fever left her. Then she stood up and began to serve Jesus.
MT
8:16
That evening people brought to Jesus many who had demons. Jesus spoke and the demons left them, and he healed all the sick.
MT
8:17
He did these things to bring about what Isaiah the prophet had said: “He took our suffering on him and carried our diseases.” (Isaiah 53:4)
Default Mt 8:14-17 Mk 1:29-34 Lk 4:38-41
MK
1:29
As soon as Jesus and his followers left the synagogue, they went with James and John to the home of Simon(c) and Andrew.
MK
1:30
Simon’s mother-in-law was sick in bed with a fever, and the people told Jesus about her.
MK
1:31
So Jesus went to her bed, took her hand, and helped her up. The fever left her, and she began serving them.
MK
1:32
That evening, after the sun went down, the people brought to Jesus all who were sick and had demons in them.
MK
1:33
The whole town gathered at the door.
MK
1:34
Jesus healed many who had different kinds of sicknesses, and he forced many demons to leave people. But he would not allow the demons to speak, because they knew who he was.
Default Mt 8:14-17 Mk 1:29-34 Lk 4:38-41
LK
4:38
Jesus left the synagogue and went to the home of Simon.(q) Simon’s mother-in-law was sick with a high fever, and they asked Jesus to help her.
LK
4:39
He came to her side and commanded the fever to leave. It left her, and immediately she got up and began serving them.
LK
4:40
When the sun went down, the people brought those who were sick to Jesus. Putting his hands on each sick person, he healed every one of them.
LK
4:41
Demons came out of many people, shouting, “You are the Son of God.” But Jesus commanded the demons and would not allow them to speak, because they knew Jesus was the Christ.
Week 18 | Jesus Must Preach In Other Towns Too
Mk 1:35-38 Lk 4:42-43
Default Mk 1:35-38 Lk 4:42-43
MK
1:35
Early the next morning, while it was still dark, Jesus woke and left the house. He went to a lonely place, where he prayed.
MK
1:36
Simon and his friends went to look for Jesus.
MK
1:37
When they found him, they said, “Everyone is looking for you!”
MK
1:38
Jesus answered, “We should go to other towns around here so I can preach there too. That is the reason I came.”
Default Mk 1:35-38 Lk 4:42-43
MK
1:35
Early the next morning, while it was still dark, Jesus woke and left the house. He went to a lonely place, where he prayed.
MK
1:36
Simon and his friends went to look for Jesus.
MK
1:37
When they found him, they said, “Everyone is looking for you!”
MK
1:38
Jesus answered, “We should go to other towns around here so I can preach there too. That is the reason I came.”
Default Mk 1:35-38 Lk 4:42-43
LK
4:42
At daybreak, Jesus went to a lonely place, but the people looked for him. When they found him, they tried to keep him from leaving.
LK
4:43
But Jesus said to them, “I must preach about God’s kingdom to other towns, too. This is why I was sent.”
Week 18-31 | First Galilean Tour
Mt 4:23-25 Mk 1:39-39 Lk 4:44-44
Default Mt 4:23-25 Mk 1:39-39 Lk 4:44-44
MT
4:23
Jesus went everywhere in Galilee, teaching in the synagogues, preaching the Good News about the kingdom of heaven, and healing all the people’s diseases and sicknesses.
MT
4:24
The news about Jesus spread all over Syria, and people brought all the sick to him. They were suffering from different kinds of diseases. Some were in great pain, some had demons, some were epileptics,(n) and some were paralyzed. Jesus healed all of them.
MT
4:25
Many people from Galilee, the Ten Towns,(o) Jerusalem, Judea, and the land across the Jordan River followed him.
Default Mt 4:23-25 Mk 1:39-39 Lk 4:44-44

4:23
Jesus went everywhere in Galilee, teaching in the synagogues, preaching the Good News about the kingdom of heaven, and healing all the people’s diseases and sicknesses.
MT
4:24
The news about Jesus spread all over Syria, and people brought all the sick to him. They were suffering from different kinds of diseases. Some were in great pain, some had demons, some were epileptics,(n) and some were paralyzed. Jesus healed all of them.
MT
4:25
Many people from Galilee, the Ten Towns,(o) Jerusalem, Judea, and the land across the Jordan River followed him.

1:39
So he went everywhere in Galilee, preaching in the synagogues and forcing out demons.

4:44

Week 18-31 | Heals A Leper
Mt 8:2-4 Mk 1:40-45 Lk 5:12-16
Default Mt 8:2-4 Mk 1:40-45 Lk 5:12-16
MK
1:40
A man with a skin disease came to Jesus. He fell to his knees and begged Jesus, “You can heal me if you will.”
MK
1:41
Jesus felt sorry for the man, so he reached out his hand and touched him and said, “I will. Be healed!”
MK
1:42
Immediately the disease left the man, and he was healed.
MK
1:43
Jesus told the man to go away at once, but he warned him strongly,
MK
1:44
“Don’t tell anyone about this. But go and show yourself to the priest. And offer the gift Moses commanded for people who are made well.(d) This will show the people what I have done.”
MK
1:45
The man left there, but he began to tell everyone that Jesus had healed him, and so he spread the news about Jesus. As a result, Jesus could not enter a town if people saw him. He stayed in places where nobody lived, but people came to him from everywhere.
Default Mt 8:2-4 Mk 1:40-45 Lk 5:12-16
MT
8:2
Then a man with a skin disease came to Jesus. The man bowed down before him and said, “Lord, you can heal me if you will.”
MT
8:3
Jesus reached out his hand and touched the man and said, “I will. Be healed!” And immediately the man was healed from his disease.
MT
8:4
Then Jesus said to him, “Don’t tell anyone about this. But go and show yourself to the priest(z) and offer the gift Moses commanded(aa) for people who are made well. This will show the people what I have done.”
Default Mt 8:2-4 Mk 1:40-45 Lk 5:12-16
MK
1:40
A man with a skin disease came to Jesus. He fell to his knees and begged Jesus, “You can heal me if you will.”
MK
1:41
Jesus felt sorry for the man, so he reached out his hand and touched him and said, “I will. Be healed!”
MK
1:42
Immediately the disease left the man, and he was healed.
MK
1:43
Jesus told the man to go away at once, but he warned him strongly,
MK
1:44
“Don’t tell anyone about this. But go and show yourself to the priest. And offer the gift Moses commanded for people who are made well.(d) This will show the people what I have done.”
MK
1:45
The man left there, but he began to tell everyone that Jesus had healed him, and so he spread the news about Jesus. As a result, Jesus could not enter a town if people saw him. He stayed in places where nobody lived, but people came to him from everywhere.
Default Mt 8:2-4 Mk 1:40-45 Lk 5:12-16
LK
5:12
When Jesus was in one of the towns, there was a man covered with a skin disease. When he saw Jesus, he bowed before him and begged him, “Lord, you can heal me if you will.”
LK
5:13
Jesus reached out his hand and touched the man and said, “I will. Be healed!” Immediately the disease disappeared.
LK
5:14
Then Jesus said, “Don’t tell anyone about this, but go and show yourself to the priest(t) and offer a gift for your healing, as Moses commanded.(u) This will show the people what I have done.”
LK
5:15
But the news about Jesus spread even more. Many people came to hear Jesus and to be healed of their sicknesses,
LK
5:16
but Jesus often slipped away to be alone so he could pray.
Week 18-31 | The Paralytic Lowered Through The Roof
Mt 9:1-8 Mk 2:1-12 Lk 5:17-26
Default Mt 9:1-8 Mk 2:1-12 Lk 5:17-26
MK
2:1
A few days later, when Jesus came back to Capernaum, the news spread that he was at home.
MK
2:2
Many people gathered together so that there was no room in the house, not even outside the door. And Jesus was teaching them God’s message.
MK
2:3
Four people came, carrying a paralyzed man.
MK
2:4
Since they could not get to Jesus because of the crowd, they dug a hole in the roof right above where he was speaking. When they got through, they lowered the mat with the paralyzed man on it.
MK
2:5
When Jesus saw the faith of these people, he said to the paralyzed man, “Young man, your sins are forgiven.”
MK
2:6
Some of the teachers of the law were sitting there, thinking to themselves,
MK
2:7
“Why does this man say things like that? He is speaking as if he were God. Only God can forgive sins.”
MK
2:8
Jesus knew immediately what these teachers of the law were thinking. So he said to them, “Why are you thinking these things?
MK
2:9
Which is easier: to tell this paralyzed man, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to tell him, ‘Stand up. Take your mat and walk’?
MK
2:10
But I will prove to you that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins.” So Jesus said to the paralyzed man,
MK
2:11
“I tell you, stand up, take your mat, and go home.”
MK
2:12
Immediately the paralyzed man stood up, took his mat, and walked out while everyone was watching him. The people were amazed and praised God. They said, “We have never seen anything like this!”
Default Mt 9:1-8 Mk 2:1-12 Lk 5:17-26
MT
9:1
Jesus got into a boat and went back across the lake to his own town.
MT
9:2
Some people brought to Jesus a man who was paralyzed and lying on a mat. When Jesus saw the faith of these people, he said to the paralyzed man, “Be encouraged, young man. Your sins are forgiven.”
MT
9:3
Some of the teachers of the law said to themselves, “This man speaks as if he were God. That is blasphemy!”(ac)
MT
9:4
Knowing their thoughts, Jesus said, “Why are you thinking evil thoughts?
MT
9:5
Which is easier: to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to tell him, ‘Stand up and walk’?
MT
9:6
But I will prove to you that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins.” Then Jesus said to the paralyzed man, “Stand up, take your mat, and go home.”
MT
9:7
And the man stood up and went home.
MT
9:8
When the people saw this, they were amazed and praised God for giving power like this to human beings.
Default Mt 9:1-8 Mk 2:1-12 Lk 5:17-26
MK
2:1
A few days later, when Jesus came back to Capernaum, the news spread that he was at home.
MK
2:2
Many people gathered together so that there was no room in the house, not even outside the door. And Jesus was teaching them God’s message.
MK
2:3
Four people came, carrying a paralyzed man.
MK
2:4
Since they could not get to Jesus because of the crowd, they dug a hole in the roof right above where he was speaking. When they got through, they lowered the mat with the paralyzed man on it.
MK
2:5
When Jesus saw the faith of these people, he said to the paralyzed man, “Young man, your sins are forgiven.”
MK
2:6
Some of the teachers of the law were sitting there, thinking to themselves,
MK
2:7
“Why does this man say things like that? He is speaking as if he were God. Only God can forgive sins.”
MK
2:8
Jesus knew immediately what these teachers of the law were thinking. So he said to them, “Why are you thinking these things?
MK
2:9
Which is easier: to tell this paralyzed man, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to tell him, ‘Stand up. Take your mat and walk’?
MK
2:10
But I will prove to you that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins.” So Jesus said to the paralyzed man,
MK
2:11
“I tell you, stand up, take your mat, and go home.”
MK
2:12
Immediately the paralyzed man stood up, took his mat, and walked out while everyone was watching him. The people were amazed and praised God. They said, “We have never seen anything like this!”
Default Mt 9:1-8 Mk 2:1-12 Lk 5:17-26
LK
5:17
One day as Jesus was teaching the people, the Pharisees and teachers of the law from every town in Galilee and Judea and from Jerusalem were there. The Lord was giving Jesus the power to heal people.
LK
5:18
Just then, some men were carrying on a mat a man who was paralyzed. They tried to bring him in and put him down before Jesus.
LK
5:19
But because there were so many people there, they could not find a way in. So they went up on the roof and lowered the man on his mat through the ceiling into the middle of the crowd right before Jesus.
LK
5:20
Seeing their faith, Jesus said, “Friend, your sins are forgiven.”
LK
5:21
The Jewish teachers of the law and the Pharisees thought to themselves, “Who is this man who is speaking as if he were God? Only God can forgive sins.”
LK
5:22
But Jesus knew what they were thinking and said, “Why are you thinking these things?
LK
5:23
Which is easier: to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Stand up and walk’?
LK
5:24
But I will prove to you that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins.” So Jesus said to the paralyzed man, “I tell you, stand up, take your mat, and go home.”
LK
5:25
At once the man stood up before them, picked up his mat, and went home, praising God.
LK
5:26
All the people were fully amazed and began to praise God. They were filled with much respect and said, “Today we have seen amazing things!”
Week 18-31 | Call Of Levi Matthew
Mt 9:9-9 Mk 2:13-14 Lk 5:27-28
Default Mt 9:9-9 Mk 2:13-14 Lk 5:27-28

2:13
Jesus went to the lake again. The whole crowd followed him there, and he taught them.
MK
2:14
While he was walking along, he saw a man named Levi son of Alphaeus, sitting in the tax collector’s booth. Jesus said to him, “Follow me,” and he stood up and followed Jesus.

MT
9:9
When Jesus was leaving, he saw a man named Matthew sitting in the tax collector’s booth. Jesus said to him, “Follow me,” and he stood up and followed Jesus.

MK
2:13
Jesus went to the lake again. The whole crowd followed him there, and he taught them.
MK
2:14
While he was walking along, he saw a man named Levi son of Alphaeus, sitting in the tax collector’s booth. Jesus said to him, “Follow me,” and he stood up and followed Jesus.

5:27

LK
5:28

Week 18-31 | Matthew's Feast
Mt 9:10-13 Mk 2:15-17 Lk 5:29-32
Default Mt 9:10-13 Mk 2:15-17 Lk 5:29-32
MK
2:15
Later, as Jesus was having dinner at Levi’s house, many tax collectors and “sinners” were eating there with Jesus and his followers. Many people like this followed Jesus.
MK
2:16
When the teachers of the law who were Pharisees saw Jesus eating with the tax collectors and “sinners,” they asked his followers, “Why does he eat with tax collectors and sinners?”
LK
5:31
Jesus answered them, “It is not the healthy people who need a doctor, but the sick.
MT
9:13
Go and learn what this means: ‘I want kindness more than I want animal sacrifices.’(ad) I did not come to invite good people but to invite sinners.”
Default Mt 9:10-13 Mk 2:15-17 Lk 5:29-32
MT
9:10
As Jesus was having dinner at Matthew’s house, many tax collectors and “sinners” came and ate with Jesus and his followers.
MT
9:11
When the Pharisees saw this, they asked Jesus’ followers, “Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?”
MT
9:12
When Jesus heard them, he said, “It is not the healthy people who need a doctor, but the sick.
MT
9:13
Go and learn what this means: ‘I want kindness more than I want animal sacrifices.’(ad) I did not come to invite good people but to invite sinners.”
Default Mt 9:10-13 Mk 2:15-17 Lk 5:29-32
MK
2:15
Later, as Jesus was having dinner at Levi’s house, many tax collectors and “sinners” were eating there with Jesus and his followers. Many people like this followed Jesus.
MK
2:16
When the teachers of the law who were Pharisees saw Jesus eating with the tax collectors and “sinners,” they asked his followers, “Why does he eat with tax collectors and sinners?”
MK
2:17
Jesus heard this and said to them, “It is not the healthy people who need a doctor, but the sick. I did not come to invite good people but to invite sinners.”
Default Mt 9:10-13 Mk 2:15-17 Lk 5:29-32
LK
5:29
Then Levi gave a big dinner for Jesus at his house. Many tax collectors and other people were eating there, too.
LK
5:30
But the Pharisees and the men who taught the law for the Pharisees began to complain to Jesus’ followers, “Why do you eat and drink with tax collectors and sinners?”
LK
5:31
Jesus answered them, “It is not the healthy people who need a doctor, but the sick.
LK
5:32
I have not come to invite good people but sinners to change their hearts and lives.”
Week 18-31 | The Pharisees Question Jesus About Fasting
Mt 9:14-17 Mk 2:18-22 Lk 5:33-39
Default Mt 9:14-17 Mk 2:18-22 Lk 5:33-39
LK
5:33
They said to Jesus, “John’s followers often fast(v) for a certain time and pray, just as the Pharisees do. But your followers eat and drink all the time.”
LK
5:34
Jesus said to them, “You cannot make the friends of the bridegroom fast while he is still with them.
LK
5:35
But the time will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast.”
LK
5:36
Jesus told them this story: “No one takes cloth off a new coat to cover a hole in an old coat. Otherwise, he ruins the new coat, and the cloth from the new coat will not be the same as the old cloth.
LK
5:37
Also, no one ever pours new wine into old leather bags. Otherwise, the new wine will break the bags, the wine will spill out, and the leather bags will be ruined.
LK
5:38
New wine must be put into new leather bags.
LK
5:39
No one after drinking old wine wants new wine, because he says, ‘The old wine is better.’”
Default Mt 9:14-17 Mk 2:18-22 Lk 5:33-39
MT
9:14
Then the followers of John(ae) came to Jesus and said, “Why do we and the Pharisees often fast(af) for a certain time, but your followers don’t?”
MT
9:15
Jesus answered, “The friends of the bridegroom are not sad while he is with them. But the time will come when the bridegroom will be taken from them, and then they will fast.
MT
9:16
“No one sews a patch of unshrunk cloth over a hole in an old coat. If he does, the patch will shrink and pull away from the coat, making the hole worse.
MT
9:17
Also, people never pour new wine into old leather bags. Otherwise, the bags will break, the wine will spill, and the wine bags will be ruined. But people always pour new wine into new wine bags. Then both will continue to be good.”
Default Mt 9:14-17 Mk 2:18-22 Lk 5:33-39
MK
2:18
Now the followers of John(e) and the Pharisees often fasted(f) for a certain time. Some people came to Jesus and said, “Why do John’s followers and the followers of the Pharisees often fast, but your followers don’t?”
MK
2:19
Jesus answered, “The friends of the bridegroom do not fast while the bridegroom is still with them. As long as the bridegroom is with them, they cannot fast.
MK
2:20
But the time will come when the bridegroom will be taken from them, and then they will fast.
MK
2:21
“No one sews a patch of unshrunk cloth over a hole in an old coat. Otherwise, the patch will shrink and pull away-the new patch will pull away from the old coat. Then the hole will be worse.
MK
2:22
Also, no one ever pours new wine into old leather bags. Otherwise, the new wine will break the bags, and the wine will be ruined along with the bags. But new wine should be put into new leather bags.”
Default Mt 9:14-17 Mk 2:18-22 Lk 5:33-39
LK
5:33
They said to Jesus, “John’s followers often fast(v) for a certain time and pray, just as the Pharisees do. But your followers eat and drink all the time.”
LK
5:34
Jesus said to them, “You cannot make the friends of the bridegroom fast while he is still with them.
LK
5:35
But the time will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast.”
LK
5:36
Jesus told them this story: “No one takes cloth off a new coat to cover a hole in an old coat. Otherwise, he ruins the new coat, and the cloth from the new coat will not be the same as the old cloth.
LK
5:37
Also, no one ever pours new wine into old leather bags. Otherwise, the new wine will break the bags, the wine will spill out, and the leather bags will be ruined.
LK
5:38
New wine must be put into new leather bags.
LK
5:39
No one after drinking old wine wants new wine, because he says, ‘The old wine is better.’”
Week 18-31 | The Son Of Man Is Lord Even Of The Sabbath Day
Mt 12:1-8 Mk 2:23-28 Lk 6:1-5
Default Mt 12:1-8 Mk 2:23-28 Lk 6:1-5
MT
12:1
At that time Jesus was walking through some fields of grain on a Sabbath day. His followers were hungry, so they began to pick the grain and eat it.
MT
12:2
When the Pharisees saw this, they said to Jesus, “Look! Your followers are doing what is unlawful to do on the Sabbath day.”
MT
12:3
Jesus answered, “Have you not read what David did when he and the people with him were hungry?
MT
12:4
He went into God’s house, and he and those with him ate the holy bread, which was lawful only for priests to eat.
MT
12:5
And have you not read in the law of Moses that on every Sabbath day the priests in the Temple break this law about the Sabbath day? But the priests are not wrong for doing that.
MT
12:6
I tell you that there is something here that is greater than the Temple.
MT
12:7
The Scripture says, ‘I want kindness more than I want animal sacrifices.’(an) You don’t really know what those words mean. If you understood them, you would not judge those who have done nothing wrong.
MK
2:27
Then Jesus said to the Pharisees, “The Sabbath day was made to help people; they were not made to be ruled by the Sabbath day.
MK
2:28
So then, the Son of Man is Lord even of the Sabbath day.”
Default Mt 12:1-8 Mk 2:23-28 Lk 6:1-5
MT
12:1
At that time Jesus was walking through some fields of grain on a Sabbath day. His followers were hungry, so they began to pick the grain and eat it.
MT
12:2
When the Pharisees saw this, they said to Jesus, “Look! Your followers are doing what is unlawful to do on the Sabbath day.”
MT
12:3
Jesus answered, “Have you not read what David did when he and the people with him were hungry?
MT
12:4
He went into God’s house, and he and those with him ate the holy bread, which was lawful only for priests to eat.
MT
12:5
And have you not read in the law of Moses that on every Sabbath day the priests in the Temple break this law about the Sabbath day? But the priests are not wrong for doing that.
MT
12:6
I tell you that there is something here that is greater than the Temple.
MT
12:7
The Scripture says, ‘I want kindness more than I want animal sacrifices.’(an) You don’t really know what those words mean. If you understood them, you would not judge those who have done nothing wrong.
MT
12:8
“So the Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath day.”
Default Mt 12:1-8 Mk 2:23-28 Lk 6:1-5
MK
2:23
One Sabbath day, as Jesus was walking through some fields of grain, his followers began to pick some grain to eat.
MK
2:24
The Pharisees said to Jesus, “Why are your followers doing what is not lawful on the Sabbath day?”
MK
2:25
Jesus answered, “Have you never read what David did when he and those with him were hungry and needed food?
MK
2:26
During the time of Abiathar the high priest, David went into God’s house and ate the holy bread, which is lawful only for priests to eat. And David also gave some of the bread to those who were with him.”
MK
2:27
Then Jesus said to the Pharisees, “The Sabbath day was made to help people; they were not made to be ruled by the Sabbath day.
MK
2:28
So then, the Son of Man is Lord even of the Sabbath day.”
Default Mt 12:1-8 Mk 2:23-28 Lk 6:1-5
LK
6:1
One Sabbath day Jesus was walking through some fields of grain. His followers picked the heads of grain, rubbed them in their hands, and ate them.
LK
6:2
Some Pharisees said, “Why do you do what is not lawful on the Sabbath day?”
LK
6:3
Jesus answered, “Have you not read what David did when he and those with him were hungry?
LK
6:4
He went into God’s house and took and ate the holy bread, which is lawful only for priests to eat. And he gave some to the people who were with him.”
LK
6:5
Then Jesus said to the Pharisees, “The Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath day.”
Week 18-31 | Healing The Crippled Hand Man On The Sabbath
Mt 12:9-14 Mk 3:1-6 Lk 6:6-11
Default Mt 12:9-14 Mk 3:1-6 Lk 6:6-11
MT
12:9
Jesus left there and went into their synagogue,
LK
6:7
The teachers of the law and the Pharisees were watching closely to see if Jesus would heal on the Sabbath day so they could accuse him.
LK
6:8
But he knew what they were thinking, and he said to the man with the crippled hand, “Stand up here in the middle of everyone.” The man got up and stood there.
LK
6:9
Then Jesus said to them, “I ask you, which is lawful on the Sabbath day: to do good or to do evil, to save a life or to destroy it?”
LK
6:10
Jesus looked around at all of them and said to the man, “Hold out your hand.” The man held out his hand, and it was healed.
LK
6:11
But the Pharisees and the teachers of the law were very angry and discussed with each other what they could do to Jesus.
MK
3:6
Then the Pharisees left and began making plans with the Herodians(g) about a way to kill Jesus.
Default Mt 12:9-14 Mk 3:1-6 Lk 6:6-11
MT
12:9
Jesus left there and went into their synagogue,
MT
12:10
where there was a man with a crippled hand. They were looking for a reason to accuse Jesus, so they asked him, “Is it right to heal on the Sabbath day?”(ao)
MT
12:11
Jesus answered, “If any of you has a sheep, and it falls into a ditch on the Sabbath day, you will help it out of the ditch.
MT
12:12
Surely a human being is more important than a sheep. So it is lawful to do good things on the Sabbath day.”
MT
12:13
Then Jesus said to the man with the crippled hand, “Hold out your hand.” The man held out his hand, and it became well again, like the other hand.
MT
12:14
But the Pharisees left and made plans to kill Jesus.
Default Mt 12:9-14 Mk 3:1-6 Lk 6:6-11
MK
3:1
Another time when Jesus went into a synagogue, a man with a crippled hand was there.
MK
3:2
Some people watched Jesus closely to see if he would heal the man on the Sabbath day so they could accuse him.
MK
3:3
Jesus said to the man with the crippled hand, “Stand up here in the middle of everyone.”
MK
3:4
Then Jesus asked the people, “Which is lawful on the Sabbath day: to do good or to do evil, to save a life or to kill?” But they said nothing to answer him.
MK
3:5
Jesus was angry as he looked at the people, and he felt very sad because they were stubborn. Then he said to the man, “Hold out your hand.” The man held out his hand and it was healed.
MK
3:6
Then the Pharisees left and began making plans with the Herodians(g) about a way to kill Jesus.
Default Mt 12:9-14 Mk 3:1-6 Lk 6:6-11
LK
6:6
On another Sabbath day Jesus went into the synagogue and was teaching, and a man with a crippled right hand was there.
LK
6:7
The teachers of the law and the Pharisees were watching closely to see if Jesus would heal on the Sabbath day so they could accuse him.
LK
6:8
But he knew what they were thinking, and he said to the man with the crippled hand, “Stand up here in the middle of everyone.” The man got up and stood there.
LK
6:9
Then Jesus said to them, “I ask you, which is lawful on the Sabbath day: to do good or to do evil, to save a life or to destroy it?”
LK
6:10
Jesus looked around at all of them and said to the man, “Hold out your hand.” The man held out his hand, and it was healed.
LK
6:11
But the Pharisees and the teachers of the law were very angry and discussed with each other what they could do to Jesus.
Week 18-31 | Here Is My Servant Whom I Have Chosen
Mt 12:15-21
Mt 12:15-21
MT
12:15
Jesus knew what the Pharisees were doing, so he left that place. Many people followed him, and he healed all who were sick.
MT
12:16
But Jesus warned the people not to tell who he was.
MT
12:17
He did these things to bring about what Isaiah the prophet had said:
MT
12:18
“Here is my servant whom I have chosen. I love him, and I am pleased with him. I will put my Spirit upon him, and he will tell of my justice to all people.
MT
12:19
He will not argue or cry out; no one will hear his voice in the streets.
MT
12:20
He will not break a crushed blade of grass or put out even a weak flame until he makes justice win the victory.
MT
12:21
In him will the non-Jewish people find hope.” (Isaiah 42:1-4)
Week 18-31 | The Sermon On The Mount In Galilee
– +
Week 18-31 | Choosing The Twelve Apostles
Mt 10:1-4 Mk 3:13-19 Lk 6:12-16
Default Mt 10:1-4 Mk 3:13-19 Lk 6:12-16
LK
6:12
At that time Jesus went off to a mountain to pray, and he spent the night praying to God.
LK
6:13
The next morning, Jesus called his followers to him and chose twelve of them, whom he named apostles:
LK
6:14
Simon (Jesus named him Peter), his brother Andrew, James, John, Philip, Bartholomew,
LK
6:15
Matthew, Thomas, James son of Alphaeus, Simon (called the Zealot),

6:16
Judas son of James, and Judas Iscariot who later turned Jesus over to his enemies.

MT
10:1

MT
10:2
These are the names of the twelve apostles: Simon (also called Peter), and his brother Andrew, James son of Zebedee, and his brother John,
MT
10:3
Philip, and Bartholomew, Thomas, and Matthew the tax collector, James son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus,
MT
10:4

3:14

MK
3:15
and to have the authority to force demons out of people.
MK
3:16

MK
3:17

MK
3:18

MK
3:19
and Judas Iscariot who later turned against Jesus.

Week 18-31 | Sending Out The Twelve Apostles
Mt 10:5-16
Mt 10:5-16
MT
10:5
Jesus sent out these twelve men with the following order: “Don’t go to the non-Jewish people or to any town where the Samaritans live.
MT
10:6
But go to the people of Israel, who are like lost sheep.
MT
10:7
When you go, preach this: ‘The kingdom of heaven is near.’
MT
10:8
Heal the sick, raise the dead to life again, heal those who have skin diseases, and force demons out of people. I give you these powers freely, so help other people freely.
MT
10:9
Don’t carry any money with you-gold or silver or copper.
MT
10:10
Don’t carry a bag or extra clothes or sandals or a walking stick. Workers should be given what they need.
MT
10:11
“When you enter a city or town, find some worthy person there and stay in that home until you leave.
MT
10:12
When you enter that home, say, ‘Peace be with you.’
MT
10:13
If the people there welcome you, let your peace stay there. But if they don’t welcome you, take back the peace you wished for them.
MT
10:14
And if a home or town refuses to welcome you or listen to you, leave that place and shake its dust off your feet.(ah)
MT
10:15
I tell you the truth, on the Judgment Day it will be better for the towns of Sodom and Gomorrah(ai) than for the people of that town.
MT
10:16
“Listen, I am sending you out like sheep among wolves. So be as clever as snakes and as innocent as doves.
Week 18-31 | When People Mistreat You In One Town, Hurry To Another One
Mt 10:23-23
Mt 10:23-23
MT
10:23
When you are treated badly in one city, run to another city. I tell you the truth, you will not finish going through all the cities of Israel before the Son of Man comes.
Week 18-31 | Healing Before Sermon On The Mount
Mk 3:7-12 Lk 6:17-19
Default Mk 3:7-12 Lk 6:17-19
LK
6:17
Jesus and the apostles came down from the mountain, and he stood on level ground. A large group of his followers was there, as well as many people from all around Judea, Jerusalem, and the seacoast cities of Tyre and Sidon.
LK
6:18
They all came to hear Jesus teach and to be healed of their sicknesses, and he healed those who were troubled by evil spirits.
LK
6:19
All the people were trying to touch Jesus, because power was coming from him and healing them all.
Default Mk 3:7-12 Lk 6:17-19
MK
3:7
Jesus left with his followers for the lake, and a large crowd from Galilee followed him.
MK
3:8
Also many people came from Judea, from Jerusalem, from Idumea, from the lands across the Jordan River, and from the area of Tyre and Sidon. When they heard what Jesus was doing, many people came to him.
MK
3:9
When Jesus saw the crowds, he told his followers to get a boat ready for him to keep people from crowding against him.
MK
3:10
He had healed many people, so all the sick were pushing toward him to touch him.
MK
3:11
When evil spirits saw Jesus, they fell down before him and shouted, “You are the Son of God!”
MK
3:12
But Jesus strongly warned them not to tell who he was.

LK
6:18
They all came to hear Jesus teach and to be healed of their sicknesses, and he healed those who were troubled by evil spirits.
LK

Week 18-31 | Sitting Down For The Sermon On The Mount
Mt 5:1-1
Mt 5:1-1
MT
5:1
When Jesus saw the crowds, he went up on a hill and sat down. His followers came to him,
Week 18-31 | Blessed Statements
Mt 5:2-12 Lk 6:20-26
Default Mt 5:2-12 Lk 6:20-26
MT
5:2
and he began to teach them, saying:
MT
5:3
“They are blessed who realize their spiritual poverty, for the kingdom of heaven belongs to them.
MT
5:4
They are blessed who grieve, for God will comfort them.
MT
5:5
They are blessed who are humble, for the whole earth will be theirs.
MT
5:6
They are blessed who hunger and thirst after justice, for they will be satisfied.
MT
5:7
They are blessed who show mercy to others, for God will show mercy to them.
MT
5:8
They are blessed whose thoughts are pure, for they will see God.
MT
5:9
They are blessed who work for peace, for they will be called God’s children.
MT
5:10
They are blessed who are persecuted for doing good, for the kingdom of heaven belongs to them.
MT
5:11
“People will insult you and hurt you. They will lie and say all kinds of evil things about you because you follow me. But when they do, you will be blessed.
MT
5:12
Rejoice and be glad, because you have a great reward waiting for you in heaven. People did the same evil things to the prophets who lived before you.
Default Mt 5:2-12 Lk 6:20-26
MT
5:2
and he began to teach them, saying:
MT
5:3
“They are blessed who realize their spiritual poverty, for the kingdom of heaven belongs to them.
MT
5:4
They are blessed who grieve, for God will comfort them.
MT
5:5
They are blessed who are humble, for the whole earth will be theirs.
MT
5:6
They are blessed who hunger and thirst after justice, for they will be satisfied.
MT
5:7
They are blessed who show mercy to others, for God will show mercy to them.
MT
5:8
They are blessed whose thoughts are pure, for they will see God.
MT
5:9
They are blessed who work for peace, for they will be called God’s children.
MT
5:10
They are blessed who are persecuted for doing good, for the kingdom of heaven belongs to them.
MT
5:11
“People will insult you and hurt you. They will lie and say all kinds of evil things about you because you follow me. But when they do, you will be blessed.
MT
5:12
Rejoice and be glad, because you have a great reward waiting for you in heaven. People did the same evil things to the prophets who lived before you.
Default Mt 5:2-12 Lk 6:20-26
LK
6:20
Jesus looked at his followers and said, “You people who are poor are blessed, because the kingdom of God belongs to you.
LK
6:21
You people who are now hungry are blessed, because you will be satisfied. You people who are now crying are blessed, because you will laugh with joy.
LK
6:22
“People will hate you, shut you out, insult you, and say you are evil because you follow the Son of Man. But when they do, you will be blessed.
LK
6:23
Be full of joy at that time, because you have a great reward in heaven. Their ancestors did the same things to the prophets.
LK
6:24
“But how terrible it will be for you who are rich, because you have had your easy life.
LK
6:25
How terrible it will be for you who are full now, because you will be hungry. How terrible it will be for you who are laughing now, because you will be sad and cry.
LK
6:26
“How terrible when everyone says only good things about you, because their ancestors said the same things about the false prophets.
Week 18-31 | The Importance Of The Law
Mt 5:17-20 Lk 16:17-17
Default Mt 5:17-20 Lk 16:17-17
MT
5:17
“Don’t think that I have come to destroy the law of Moses or the teaching of the prophets. I have not come to destroy them but to bring about what they said.
MT
5:18
I tell you the truth, nothing will disappear from the law until heaven and earth are gone. Not even the smallest letter or the smallest part of a letter will be lost until everything has happened.
MT
5:19
Whoever refuses to obey any command and teaches other people not to obey that command will be the least important in the kingdom of heaven. But whoever obeys the commands and teaches other people to obey them will be great in the kingdom of heaven.
MT
5:20
I tell you that if you are no more obedient than the teachers of the law and the Pharisees, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven.
Default Mt 5:17-20 Lk 16:17-17
MT
5:17
“Don’t think that I have come to destroy the law of Moses or the teaching of the prophets. I have not come to destroy them but to bring about what they said.
MT
5:18
I tell you the truth, nothing will disappear from the law until heaven and earth are gone. Not even the smallest letter or the smallest part of a letter will be lost until everything has happened.
MT
5:19
Whoever refuses to obey any command and teaches other people not to obey that command will be the least important in the kingdom of heaven. But whoever obeys the commands and teaches other people to obey them will be great in the kingdom of heaven.
MT
5:20
I tell you that if you are no more obedient than the teachers of the law and the Pharisees, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven.
Default Mt 5:17-20 Lk 16:17-17
LK
16:17
It would be easier for heaven and earth to pass away than for the smallest part of a letter in the law to be changed.
Week 18-31 | Being Angry Is Like Killing
Mt 5:21-26 Lk 12:57-59
Default Mt 5:21-26 Lk 12:57-59
MT
5:21
“You have heard that it was said to our people long ago, ‘You must not murder anyone.(p) Anyone who murders another will be judged.’
MT
5:22
But I tell you, if you are angry with a brother or sister,(q) you will be judged. If you say bad things to a brother or sister, you will be judged by the council. And if you call someone a fool, you will be in danger of the fire of hell.
MT
5:23
“So when you offer your gift to God at the altar, and you remember that your brother or sister has something against you,
MT
5:24
leave your gift there at the altar. Go and make peace with that person, and then come and offer your gift.
MT
5:25
“If your enemy is taking you to court, become friends quickly, before you go to court. Otherwise, your enemy might turn you over to the judge, and the judge might give you to a guard to put you in jail.
MT
5:26
I tell you the truth, you will not leave there until you have paid everything you owe.
Default Mt 5:21-26 Lk 12:57-59
MT
5:21
“You have heard that it was said to our people long ago, ‘You must not murder anyone.(p) Anyone who murders another will be judged.’
MT
5:22
But I tell you, if you are angry with a brother or sister,(q) you will be judged. If you say bad things to a brother or sister, you will be judged by the council. And if you call someone a fool, you will be in danger of the fire of hell.
MT
5:23
“So when you offer your gift to God at the altar, and you remember that your brother or sister has something against you,
MT
5:24
leave your gift there at the altar. Go and make peace with that person, and then come and offer your gift.
MT
5:25
“If your enemy is taking you to court, become friends quickly, before you go to court. Otherwise, your enemy might turn you over to the judge, and the judge might give you to a guard to put you in jail.
MT
5:26
I tell you the truth, you will not leave there until you have paid everything you owe.
Default Mt 5:21-26 Lk 12:57-59
LK
12:57
“Why can’t you decide for yourselves what is right?
LK
12:58
If your enemy is taking you to court, try hard to settle it on the way. If you don’t, your enemy might take you to the judge, and the judge might turn you over to the officer, and the officer might throw you into jail.
LK
12:59
I tell you, you will not get out of there until you have paid everything you owe.”
Week 18-31 | Allowing Sexual Thoughts Is Sin
Mt 5:27-30
Default Mt 5:27-30
MT
5:27
“You have heard that it was said, ‘You must not be guilty of adultery.’(r)
MT
5:28
But I tell you that if anyone looks at a woman and wants to sin sexually with her, in his mind he has already done that sin with the woman.
Default Mt 5:27-30
MT
5:27
“You have heard that it was said, ‘You must not be guilty of adultery.’(r)
MT
5:28
But I tell you that if anyone looks at a woman and wants to sin sexually with her, in his mind he has already done that sin with the woman.
MT
5:29
If your right eye causes you to sin, take it out and throw it away. It is better to lose one part of your body than to have your whole body thrown into hell.
MT
5:30
If your right hand causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away. It is better to lose one part of your body than for your whole body to go into hell.
Week 18-31 | Divorce And Remarriage
Mt 5:31-32 Lk 16:18-18
Default Mt 5:31-32 Lk 16:18-18
MT
5:31
“It was also said, ‘Anyone who divorces his wife must give her a written divorce paper.’(s)
MT
5:32
But I tell you that anyone who divorces his wife forces her to be guilty of adultery. The only reason for a man to divorce his wife is if she has sexual relations with another man. And anyone who marries that divorced woman is guilty of adultery.
Default Mt 5:31-32 Lk 16:18-18
MT
5:31
“It was also said, ‘Anyone who divorces his wife must give her a written divorce paper.’(s)
MT
5:32
But I tell you that anyone who divorces his wife forces her to be guilty of adultery. The only reason for a man to divorce his wife is if she has sexual relations with another man. And anyone who marries that divorced woman is guilty of adultery.
Default Mt 5:31-32 Lk 16:18-18
LK
16:18
“If a man divorces his wife and marries another woman, he is guilty of adultery, and the man who marries a divorced woman is also guilty of adultery.”
Week 18-31 | Keep Promises, Never Swear
Mt 5:33-37
Mt 5:33-37
MT
5:33
“You have heard that it was said to our people long ago, ‘Don’t break your promises, but keep the promises you make to the Lord.’(t)
MT
5:34
But I tell you, never swear an oath. Don’t swear an oath using the name of heaven, because heaven is God’s throne.
MT
5:35
Don’t swear an oath using the name of the earth, because the earth belongs to God. Don’t swear an oath using the name of Jerusalem, because that is the city of the great King.
MT
5:36
Don’t even swear by your own head, because you cannot make one hair on your head become white or black.
MT
5:37
Say only yes if you mean yes, and no if you mean no. If you say more than yes or no, it is from the Evil One.
Week 18-31 | Love Your Enemies
Mt 5:38-48 Lk 6:27-36
Default Mt 5:38-48 Lk 6:27-36
MT
5:38
“You have heard that it was said, ‘An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth.’(u)
MT
5:39
But I tell you, don’t stand up against an evil person. If someone slaps you on the right cheek, turn to him the other cheek also.
MT
5:40
If someone wants to sue you in court and take your shirt, let him have your coat also.
MT
5:41
If someone forces you to go with him one mile, go with him two miles.
MT
5:42
If a person asks you for something, give it to him. Don’t refuse to give to someone who wants to borrow from you.
MT
5:43
“You have heard that it was said, ‘Love your neighbor(v) and hate your enemies.’
MT
5:44
But I say to you, love your enemies. Pray for those who hurt you.(w)
MT
5:45
If you do this, you will be true children of your Father in heaven. He causes the sun to rise on good people and on evil people, and he sends rain to those who do right and to those who do wrong.
MT
5:46
If you love only the people who love you, you will get no reward. Even the tax collectors do that.
MT
5:47
And if you are nice only to your friends, you are no better than other people. Even those who don’t know God are nice to their friends.
MT
5:48
So you must be perfect, just as your Father in heaven is perfect.
Default Mt 5:38-48 Lk 6:27-36
MT
5:38
“You have heard that it was said, ‘An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth.’(u)
MT
5:39
But I tell you, don’t stand up against an evil person. If someone slaps you on the right cheek, turn to him the other cheek also.
MT
5:40
If someone wants to sue you in court and take your shirt, let him have your coat also.
MT
5:41
If someone forces you to go with him one mile, go with him two miles.
MT
5:42
If a person asks you for something, give it to him. Don’t refuse to give to someone who wants to borrow from you.
MT
5:43
“You have heard that it was said, ‘Love your neighbor(v) and hate your enemies.’
MT
5:44
But I say to you, love your enemies. Pray for those who hurt you.(w)
MT
5:45
If you do this, you will be true children of your Father in heaven. He causes the sun to rise on good people and on evil people, and he sends rain to those who do right and to those who do wrong.
MT
5:46
If you love only the people who love you, you will get no reward. Even the tax collectors do that.
MT
5:47
And if you are nice only to your friends, you are no better than other people. Even those who don’t know God are nice to their friends.
MT
5:48
So you must be perfect, just as your Father in heaven is perfect.
Default Mt 5:38-48 Lk 6:27-36
LK
6:27
“But I say to you who are listening, love your enemies. Do good to those who hate you,
LK
6:28
bless those who curse you, pray for those who are cruel to you.
LK
6:29
If anyone slaps you on one cheek, offer him the other cheek, too. If someone takes your coat, do not stop him from taking your shirt.
LK
6:30
Give to everyone who asks you, and when someone takes something that is yours, don’t ask for it back.
LK
6:31
Do to others what you would want them to do to you.
LK
6:32
If you love only the people who love you, what praise should you get? Even sinners love the people who love them.
LK
6:33
If you do good only to those who do good to you, what praise should you get? Even sinners do that!
LK
6:34
If you lend things to people, always hoping to get something back, what praise should you get? Even sinners lend to other sinners so that they can get back the same amount!
LK
6:35
But love your enemies, do good to them, and lend to them without hoping to get anything back. Then you will have a great reward, and you will be children of the Most High God, because he is kind even to people who are ungrateful and full of sin.
LK
6:36
Show mercy, just as your Father shows mercy.
Week 18-31 | Giving
Mt 6:1-4
Mt 6:1-4
MT
6:1
“Be careful! When you do good things, don’t do them in front of people to be seen by them. If you do that, you will have no reward from your Father in heaven.
MT
6:2
“When you give to the poor, don’t be like the hypocrites. They blow trumpets in the synagogues and on the streets so that people will see them and honor them. I tell you the truth, those hypocrites already have their full reward.
MT
6:3
So when you give to the poor, don’t let anyone know what you are doing.
MT
6:4
Your giving should be done in secret. Your Father can see what is done in secret, and he will reward you.
Week 18-31 | Prayer, Our Father In Heaven
Mt 6:5-15 Lk 11:1-4
Default Mt 6:5-15 Lk 11:1-4
MT
6:5
“When you pray, don’t be like the hypocrites. They love to stand in the synagogues and on the street corners and pray so people will see them. I tell you the truth, they already have their full reward.
MT
6:6
When you pray, you should go into your room and close the door and pray to your Father who cannot be seen. Your Father can see what is done in secret, and he will reward you.
MT
6:7
“And when you pray, don’t be like those people who don’t know God. They continue saying things that mean nothing, thinking that God will hear them because of their many words.
MT
6:8
Don’t be like them, because your Father knows the things you need before you ask him.
MT
6:9
So when you pray, you should pray like this: ‘Our Father in heaven, may your name always be kept holy.
MT
6:10
May your kingdom come and what you want be done, here on earth as it is in heaven.
MT
6:11
Give us the food we need for each day.
MT
6:12
Forgive us for our sins, just as we have forgiven those who sinned against us.
MT
6:13
And do not cause us to be tempted, but save us from the Evil One.’ [The kingdom, the power, and the glory are yours forever. Amen.](x)
MT
6:14
Yes, if you forgive others for their sins, your Father in heaven will also forgive you for your sins.
MT
6:15
But if you don’t forgive others, your Father in heaven will not forgive your sins.
Default Mt 6:5-15 Lk 11:1-4
MT
6:5
“When you pray, don’t be like the hypocrites. They love to stand in the synagogues and on the street corners and pray so people will see them. I tell you the truth, they already have their full reward.

6:6

LK
11:1

LK
11:2
Jesus said to them, “When you pray, say: ‘Father, may your name always be kept holy. May your kingdom come.
LK
11:3
Give us the food we need for each day.
LK
11:4
Forgive us for our sins, because we forgive everyone who has done wrong to us. And do not cause us to be tempted.’”(at)
Week 18-31 | Fasting / Worship
Mt 6:16-18
Mt 6:16-18
MT
6:16
“When you fast,(y) don’t put on a sad face like the hypocrites. They make their faces look sad to show people they are fasting. I tell you the truth, those hypocrites already have their full reward.
MT
6:17
So when you fast, comb your hair and wash your face.
MT
6:18
Then people will not know that you are fasting, but your Father, whom you cannot see, will see you. Your Father sees what is done in secret, and he will reward you.
Week 18-31 | Don’t Judge
Mt 7:1-5 Lk 6:37-42
Default Mt 7:1-5 Lk 6:37-42
MT
7:1
“Don’t judge others, or you will be judged.
MT
7:2
You will be judged in the same way that you judge others, and the amount you give to others will be given to you.
LK
6:39
Jesus told them this story: “Can a blind person lead another blind person? No! Both of them will fall into a ditch.
MT
7:3
“Why do you notice the little piece of dust in your friend’s eye, but you don’t notice the big piece of wood in your own eye?
MT
7:4
How can you say to your friend, ‘Let me take that little piece of dust out of your eye’? Look at yourself! You still have that big piece of wood in your own eye.
MT
7:5
You hypocrite! First, take the wood out of your own eye. Then you will see clearly to take the dust out of your friend’s eye.
Default Mt 7:1-5 Lk 6:37-42
MT
7:1
“Don’t judge others, or you will be judged.
MT
7:2
You will be judged in the same way that you judge others, and the amount you give to others will be given to you.
MT
7:3
“Why do you notice the little piece of dust in your friend’s eye, but you don’t notice the big piece of wood in your own eye?
MT
7:4
How can you say to your friend, ‘Let me take that little piece of dust out of your eye’? Look at yourself! You still have that big piece of wood in your own eye.
MT
7:5
You hypocrite! First, take the wood out of your own eye. Then you will see clearly to take the dust out of your friend’s eye.
Default Mt 7:1-5 Lk 6:37-42
LK
6:37
“Don’t judge others, and you will not be judged. Don’t accuse others of being guilty, and you will not be accused of being guilty. Forgive, and you will be forgiven.
LK
6:38
Give, and you will receive. You will be given much. Pressed down, shaken together, and running over, it will spill into your lap. The way you give to others is the way God will give to you.”
LK
6:39
Jesus told them this story: “Can a blind person lead another blind person? No! Both of them will fall into a ditch.
LK
6:40
A student is not better than the teacher, but the student who has been fully trained will be like the teacher.
LK
6:41
“Why do you notice the little piece of dust in your friend’s eye, but you don’t notice the big piece of wood in your own eye?
LK
6:42
How can you say to your friend, ‘Friend, let me take that little piece of dust out of your eye’ when you cannot see that big piece of wood in your own eye! You hypocrite! First, take the wood out of your own eye. Then you will see clearly to take the dust out of your friend’s eye.

MT
7:6
“Don’t give holy things to dogs, and don’t throw your pearls before pigs. Pigs will only trample on them, and dogs will turn to attack you.

7:12
“Do to others what you want them to do to you. This is the meaning of the law of Moses and the teaching of the prophets.
Week 18-31 | You Know False Prophets By Their Acts
Mt 7:15-20 Lk 6:43-45
Default Mt 7:15-20 Lk 6:43-45
MT
7:15
“Be careful of false prophets. They come to you looking gentle like sheep, but they are really dangerous like wolves.
MT
7:16
You will know these people by what they do. Grapes don’t come from thornbushes, and figs don’t come from thorny weeds.
MT
7:17
In the same way, every good tree produces good fruit, but a bad tree produces bad fruit.
MT
7:18
A good tree cannot produce bad fruit, and a bad tree cannot produce good fruit.
MT
7:19
Every tree that does not produce good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
MT
7:20
In the same way, you will know these false prophets by what they do.
Default Mt 7:15-20 Lk 6:43-45
MT
7:15
“Be careful of false prophets. They come to you looking gentle like sheep, but they are really dangerous like wolves.
MT
7:16
You will know these people by what they do. Grapes don’t come from thornbushes, and figs don’t come from thorny weeds.
MT
7:17
In the same way, every good tree produces good fruit, but a bad tree produces bad fruit.
MT
7:18
A good tree cannot produce bad fruit, and a bad tree cannot produce good fruit.
MT
7:19
Every tree that does not produce good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
MT
7:20
In the same way, you will know these false prophets by what they do.
Default Mt 7:15-20 Lk 6:43-45
LK
6:43
“A good tree does not produce bad fruit, nor does a bad tree produce good fruit.
LK
6:44
Each tree is known by its own fruit. People don’t gather figs from thornbushes, and they don’t get grapes from bushes.
LK
6:45
Good people bring good things out of the good they stored in their hearts. But evil people bring evil things out of the evil they stored in their hearts. People speak the things that are in their hearts.
Week 18-31 | The Foundation You Build On
Mt 7:24-27 Lk 6:46-49
Default Mt 7:24-27 Lk 6:46-49
LK
6:46
“Why do you call me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ but do not do what I say?
LK
6:47
I will show you what everyone is like who comes to me and hears my words and obeys.
LK
6:48
That person is like a man building a house who dug deep and laid the foundation on rock. When the floods came, the water tried to wash the house away, but it could not shake it, because the house was built well.
LK
6:49
But the one who hears my words and does not obey is like a man who built his house on the ground without a foundation. When the floods came, the house quickly fell and was completely destroyed.”
Default Mt 7:24-27 Lk 6:46-49
MT
7:24
“Everyone who hears my words and obeys them is like a wise man who built his house on rock.
MT
7:25
It rained hard, the floods came, and the winds blew and hit that house. But it did not fall, because it was built on rock.
MT
7:26
Everyone who hears my words and does not obey them is like a foolish man who built his house on sand.
MT
7:27
It rained hard, the floods came, and the winds blew and hit that house, and it fell with a big crash.”
Default Mt 7:24-27 Lk 6:46-49
LK
6:46
“Why do you call me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ but do not do what I say?
LK
6:47
I will show you what everyone is like who comes to me and hears my words and obeys.
LK
6:48
That person is like a man building a house who dug deep and laid the foundation on rock. When the floods came, the water tried to wash the house away, but it could not shake it, because the house was built well.
LK
6:49
But the one who hears my words and does not obey is like a man who built his house on the ground without a foundation. When the floods came, the house quickly fell and was completely destroyed.”

Mt 7:28-29

7:28

7:29
because he did not teach like their teachers of the law. He taught like a person who had authority.

Week 18-31 | The Galilean Ministry Continues

Week 18-31 | An Army Officer’s Faith
Mt 8:5-13 Lk 7:2-10
Default Mt 8:5-13 Lk 7:2-10
MT
8:5
When Jesus entered the city of Capernaum, an army officer came to him, begging for help.
MT
8:6
The officer said, “Lord, my servant is at home in bed. He can’t move his body and is in much pain.”
MT
8:7
Jesus said to the officer, “I will go and heal him.”
MT
8:8
The officer answered, “Lord, I am not worthy for you to come into my house. You only need to command it, and my servant will be healed.
MT
8:9
I, too, am a man under the authority of others, and I have soldiers under my command. I tell one soldier, ‘Go,’ and he goes. I tell another soldier, ‘Come,’ and he comes. I say to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and my servant does it.
MT
8:10
When Jesus heard this, he was amazed. He said to those who were following him, “I tell you the truth, this is the greatest faith I have found, even in Israel.
MT
8:11
Many people will come from the east and from the west and will sit and eat with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven.
MT
8:12
But those people who should be in the kingdom will be thrown outside into the darkness, where people will cry and grind their teeth with pain.”
MT
8:13
Then Jesus said to the officer, “Go home. Your servant will be healed just as you believed he would.” And his servant was healed that same hour.
Default Mt 8:5-13 Lk 7:2-10
MT
8:5
When Jesus entered the city of Capernaum, an army officer came to him, begging for help.
MT
8:6
The officer said, “Lord, my servant is at home in bed. He can’t move his body and is in much pain.”
MT
8:7
Jesus said to the officer, “I will go and heal him.”
MT
8:8
The officer answered, “Lord, I am not worthy for you to come into my house. You only need to command it, and my servant will be healed.
MT
8:9
I, too, am a man under the authority of others, and I have soldiers under my command. I tell one soldier, ‘Go,’ and he goes. I tell another soldier, ‘Come,’ and he comes. I say to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and my servant does it.
MT
8:10
When Jesus heard this, he was amazed. He said to those who were following him, “I tell you the truth, this is the greatest faith I have found, even in Israel.
MT
8:11
Many people will come from the east and from the west and will sit and eat with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven.
MT
8:12
But those people who should be in the kingdom will be thrown outside into the darkness, where people will cry and grind their teeth with pain.”
MT
8:13
Then Jesus said to the officer, “Go home. Your servant will be healed just as you believed he would.” And his servant was healed that same hour.
Default Mt 8:5-13 Lk 7:2-10
LK
7:2
There was an army officer who had a servant who was very important to him. The servant was so sick he was nearly dead.
LK
7:3
When the officer heard about Jesus, he sent some Jewish elders to him to ask Jesus to come and heal his servant.
LK
7:4
The men went to Jesus and begged him, saying, “This officer is worthy of your help.
LK
7:5
He loves our people, and he built us a synagogue.”
LK
7:6
So Jesus went with the men. He was getting near the officer’s house when the officer sent friends to say, “Lord, don’t trouble yourself, because I am not worthy to have you come into my house.
LK
7:7
That is why I did not come to you myself. But you only need to command it, and my servant will be healed.
LK
7:8
I, too, am a man under the authority of others, and I have soldiers under my command. I tell one soldier, ‘Go,’ and he goes. I tell another soldier, ‘Come,’ and he comes. I say to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and my servant does it.”
LK
7:9
When Jesus heard this, he was amazed. Turning to the crowd that was following him, he said, “I tell you, this is the greatest faith I have found anywhere, even in Israel.”
LK
7:10
Those who had been sent to Jesus went back to the house where they found the servant in good health.
Week 18-31 | Two Blind Men's Faith
Mt 9:27-31
Mt 9:27-31
MT
9:27
When Jesus was leaving there, two blind men followed him. They cried out, “Have mercy on us, Son of David!”
MT
9:28
After Jesus went inside, the blind men went with him. He asked the men, “Do you believe that I can make you see again?” They answered, “Yes, Lord.”
MT
9:29
Then Jesus touched their eyes and said, “Because you believe I can make you see again, it will happen.”
MT
9:30
Then the men were able to see. But Jesus warned them strongly, saying, “Don’t tell anyone about this.”
MT
9:31
But the blind men left and spread the news about Jesus all around that area.
Week 18-31 | A Dumb Demoniac
Mt 9:32-34
Mt 9:32-34
MT
9:32
When the two men were leaving, some people brought another man to Jesus. This man could not talk because he had a demon in him.
MT
9:33
After Jesus forced the demon to leave the man, he was able to speak. The crowd was amazed and said, “We have never seen anything like this in Israel.”
MT
9:34
But the Pharisees said, “The prince of demons is the one that gives him power to force demons out.”
Week 18-31 | Second Galilean Tour
Mt 9:35-35 Lk 8:1-3
Default Mt 9:35-35 Lk 8:1-3
LK
8:1
After this, while Jesus was traveling through some cities and small towns, he preached and told the Good News about God’s kingdom. The twelve apostles were with him,
LK
8:2
and also some women who had been healed of sicknesses and evil spirits: Mary, called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out;
LK
8:3
Joanna, the wife of Cuza (the manager of Herod’s house); Susanna; and many others. These women used their own money to help Jesus and his apostles.
Default Mt 9:35-35 Lk 8:1-3
MT
9:35
Jesus traveled through all the towns and villages, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the Good News about the kingdom, and healing all kinds of diseases and sicknesses.
Default Mt 9:35-35 Lk 8:1-3
LK
8:1
After this, while Jesus was traveling through some cities and small towns, he preached and told the Good News about God’s kingdom. The twelve apostles were with him,
LK
8:2
and also some women who had been healed of sicknesses and evil spirits: Mary, called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out;
LK
8:3
Joanna, the wife of Cuza (the manager of Herod’s house); Susanna; and many others. These women used their own money to help Jesus and his apostles.
Week 18-31 | Raises The Son Of A Widow In Nain
Lk 7:11-17
Lk 7:11-17
LK
7:11
Soon afterwards Jesus went to a town called Nain, and his followers and a large crowd traveled with him.
LK
7:12
When he came near the town gate, he saw a funeral. A mother, who was a widow, had lost her only son. A large crowd from the town was with the mother while her son was being carried out.
LK
7:13
When the Lord saw her, he felt very sorry for her and said, “Don’t cry.”
LK
7:14
He went up and touched the coffin, and the people who were carrying it stopped. Jesus said, “Young man, I tell you, get up!”
LK
7:15
And the son sat up and began to talk. Then Jesus gave him back to his mother.
LK
7:16
All the people were amazed and began praising God, saying, “A great prophet has come to us! God has come to help his people.”
LK
7:17
This news about Jesus spread through all Judea and into all the places around there.
Week 18-31 | Questioning The Source Of Jesus' Power
Mt 12:22-30 Mk 3:20-27 Lk 11:14-23
Default Mt 12:22-30 Mk 3:20-27 Lk 11:14-23
LK
11:14
One time Jesus was sending out a demon who could not talk. When the demon came out, the man who had been unable to speak, then spoke. The people were amazed.
LK
11:15
But some of them said, “Jesus uses the power of Beelzebul, the ruler of demons, to force demons out of people.”
LK
11:16
Other people, wanting to test Jesus, asked him to give them a sign from heaven.
LK
11:17
But knowing their thoughts, he said to them, “Every kingdom that is divided against itself will be destroyed. And a family that is divided against itself will not continue.
LK
11:18
So if Satan is divided against himself, his kingdom will not continue. You say that I use the power of Beelzebul to force out demons.
LK
11:19
But if I use the power of Beelzebul to force out demons, what power do your people use to force demons out? So they will be your judges.
LK
11:20
But if I use the power of God to force out demons, then the kingdom of God has come to you.
LK
11:21
“When a strong person with many weapons guards his own house, his possessions are safe.
LK
11:22
But when someone stronger comes and defeats him, the stronger one will take away the weapons the first man trusted and will give away the possessions.
LK
11:23
“Anyone who is not with me is against me, and anyone who does not work with me is working against me.
Default Mt 12:22-30 Mk 3:20-27 Lk 11:14-23
MT
12:22
Then some people brought to Jesus a man who was blind and could not talk, because he had a demon. Jesus healed the man so that he could talk and see.
MT
12:23
All the people were amazed and said, “Perhaps this man is the Son of David!”
MT
12:24
When the Pharisees heard this, they said, “Jesus uses the power of Beelzebul, the ruler of demons, to force demons out of people.”
MT
12:25
Jesus knew what the Pharisees were thinking, so he said to them, “Every kingdom that is divided against itself will be destroyed. And any city or family that is divided against itself will not continue.
MT
12:26
And if Satan forces out himself, then Satan is divided against himself, and his kingdom will not continue.
MT
12:27
You say that I use the power of Beelzebul to force out demons. If that is true, then what power do your people use to force out demons? So they will be your judges.
MT
12:28
But if I use the power of God’s Spirit to force out demons, then the kingdom of God has come to you.
MT
12:29
“If anyone wants to enter a strong person’s house and steal his things, he must first tie up the strong person. Then he can steal the things from the house.
MT
12:30
“Whoever is not with me is against me. Whoever does not work with me is working against me.
Default Mt 12:22-30 Mk 3:20-27 Lk 11:14-23
MK
3:20
Then Jesus went home, but again a crowd gathered. There were so many people that Jesus and his followers could not eat.
MK
3:21
When his family heard this, they went to get him because they thought he was out of his mind.
MK
3:22
But the teachers of the law from Jerusalem were saying, “Beelzebul is living inside him! He uses power from the ruler of demons to force demons out of people.”
MK
3:23
So Jesus called the people together and taught them with stories. He said, “Satan will not force himself out of people.
MK
3:24
A kingdom that is divided cannot continue,
MK
3:25
and a family that is divided cannot continue.
MK
3:26
And if Satan is against himself and fights against his own people, he cannot continue; that is the end of Satan.
MK
3:27
No one can enter a strong person’s house and steal his things unless he first ties up the strong person. Then he can steal things from the house.

LK

LK

Week 18-31 | The Unpardonable Sin
Mt 12:31-37 Mk 3:28-30 Lk 12:10-10
Default Mt 12:31-37 Mk 3:28-30 Lk 12:10-10
MK
3:28
I tell you the truth, all sins that people do and all the things people say against God can be forgiven.
MK
3:29
But anyone who speaks against the Holy Spirit will never be forgiven; he is guilty of a sin that continues forever.”
MK
3:30
Jesus said this because the teachers of the law said that he had an evil spirit inside him.
MT
12:34
You snakes! You are evil people, so how can you say anything good? The mouth speaks the things that are in the heart.
MT
12:35
Good people have good things in their hearts, and so they say good things. But evil people have evil in their hearts, so they say evil things.
MT
12:36
And I tell you that on the Judgment Day people will be responsible for every careless thing they have said.
MT
12:37
The words you have said will be used to judge you. Some of your words will prove you right, but some of your words will prove you guilty.”
Default Mt 12:31-37 Mk 3:28-30 Lk 12:10-10
MT
12:31
So I tell you, people can be forgiven for every sin and everything they say against God. But whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.
MT
12:32
Anyone who speaks against the Son of Man can be forgiven, but anyone who speaks against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven, now or in the future.
MT
12:33
“If you want good fruit, you must make the tree good. If your tree is not good, it will have bad fruit. A tree is known by the kind of fruit it produces.
MT
12:34
You snakes! You are evil people, so how can you say anything good? The mouth speaks the things that are in the heart.
MT
12:35
Good people have good things in their hearts, and so they say good things. But evil people have evil in their hearts, so they say evil things.
MT
12:36
And I tell you that on the Judgment Day people will be responsible for every careless thing they have said.
MT
12:37
The words you have said will be used to judge you. Some of your words will prove you right, but some of your words will prove you guilty.”

3:28
I tell you the truth, all sins that people do and all the things people say against God can be forgiven.
MK
3:29

MK
3:30

Week 18-31 | Sign Of Jonah: Three Days And Three Nights
Mt 12:38-42 Lk 11:29-32
Default Mt 12:38-42 Lk 11:29-32
MT
12:38
Then some of the Pharisees and teachers of the law answered Jesus, saying, “Teacher, we want to see you work a miracle as a sign.”
MT
12:39
Jesus answered, “Evil and sinful people are the ones who want to see a miracle for a sign. But no sign will be given to them, except the sign of the prophet Jonah.
MT
12:40
Jonah was in the stomach of the big fish for three days and three nights. In the same way, the Son of Man will be in the grave three days and three nights.
MT
12:41
On the Judgment Day the people from Nineveh(ap) will stand up with you people who live now, and they will show that you are guilty. When Jonah preached to them, they were sorry and changed their lives. And I tell you that someone greater than Jonah is here.
MT
12:42
On the Judgment Day, the Queen of the South(aq) will stand up with you people who live today. She will show that you are guilty, because she came from far away to listen to Solomon’s wise teaching. And I tell you that someone greater than Solomon is here.
Default Mt 12:38-42 Lk 11:29-32
MT
12:38
Then some of the Pharisees and teachers of the law answered Jesus, saying, “Teacher, we want to see you work a miracle as a sign.”
MT
12:39
Jesus answered, “Evil and sinful people are the ones who want to see a miracle for a sign. But no sign will be given to them, except the sign of the prophet Jonah.
MT
12:40
Jonah was in the stomach of the big fish for three days and three nights. In the same way, the Son of Man will be in the grave three days and three nights.
MT
12:41
On the Judgment Day the people from Nineveh(ap) will stand up with you people who live now, and they will show that you are guilty. When Jonah preached to them, they were sorry and changed their lives. And I tell you that someone greater than Jonah is here.
MT
12:42
On the Judgment Day, the Queen of the South(aq) will stand up with you people who live today. She will show that you are guilty, because she came from far away to listen to Solomon’s wise teaching. And I tell you that someone greater than Solomon is here.
Default Mt 12:38-42 Lk 11:29-32
LK
11:29
As the crowd grew larger, Jesus said, “The people who live today are evil. They want to see a miracle for a sign, but no sign will be given them, except the sign of Jonah.(av)
LK
11:30
As Jonah was a sign for those people who lived in Nineveh, the Son of Man will be a sign for the people of this time.
LK
11:31
On the Judgment Day the Queen of the South(aw) will stand up with the people who live now. She will show they are guilty, because she came from far away to listen to Solomon’s wise teaching. And I tell you that someone greater than Solomon is here.
LK
11:32
On the Judgment Day the people of Nineveh will stand up with the people who live now, and they will show that you are guilty. When Jonah preached to them, they were sorry and changed their lives. And I tell you that someone greater than Jonah is here.
Week 18-31 | Returning Evil Spirits
Mt 12:43-45 Lk 11:24-26
Default Mt 12:43-45 Lk 11:24-26
MT
12:43
“When an evil spirit comes out of a person, it travels through dry places, looking for a place to rest, but it doesn’t find it.
MT
12:44
So the spirit says, ‘I will go back to the house I left.’ When the spirit comes back, it finds the house still empty, swept clean, and made neat.
MT
12:45
Then the evil spirit goes out and brings seven other spirits even more evil than it is, and they go in and live there. So the person has even more trouble than before. It is the same way with the evil people who live today.”
Default Mt 12:43-45 Lk 11:24-26
MT
12:43
“When an evil spirit comes out of a person, it travels through dry places, looking for a place to rest, but it doesn’t find it.
MT
12:44
So the spirit says, ‘I will go back to the house I left.’ When the spirit comes back, it finds the house still empty, swept clean, and made neat.
MT
12:45
Then the evil spirit goes out and brings seven other spirits even more evil than it is, and they go in and live there. So the person has even more trouble than before. It is the same way with the evil people who live today.”
Default Mt 12:43-45 Lk 11:24-26
LK
11:24

LK
11:25
And when it comes back, it finds that house swept clean and made neat.
LK
11:26
Then the evil spirit goes out and brings seven other spirits more evil than it is, and they go in and live there. So the person has even more trouble than before.”

11:28

Week 18-31 | Jesus' True Family

12:47

MT
12:48
He answered, “Who is my mother? Who are my brothers?”
MT
12:49
Then he pointed to his followers and said, “Here are my mother and my brothers.
MT
12:50
My true brother and sister and mother are those who do what my Father in heaven wants.”

3:31

MK
3:32

3:33

8:21

Week 18-31 | The Sermon By The Sea (Gathering)

13:1

MT
13:2
Large crowds gathered around him, so he got into a boat and sat down, while the people stood on the shore.

13:2
Large crowds gathered around him, so he got into a boat and sat down, while the people stood on the shore.

4:1
Again Jesus began teaching by the lake. A great crowd gathered around him, so he sat down in a boat near the shore. All the people stayed on the shore close to the water.
