LK
8:4
When a great crowd was gathered, and people were coming to Jesus from every town, he told them this story:
Week 18-31 | A Story About Planting Seed
Mt 13:3-23 Mk 4:2-20 Lk 8:5-15
Default Mt 13:3-23 Mk 4:2-20 Lk 8:5-15
MK
4:2
Jesus taught them many things, using stories. He said,
MK
4:3
“Listen! A farmer went out to plant his seed.
MK
4:4
While he was planting, some seed fell by the road, and the birds came and ate it up.
MK
4:5
Some seed fell on rocky ground where there wasn’t much dirt. That seed grew very fast, because the ground was not deep.
MK
4:6
But when the sun rose, the plants dried up because they did not have deep roots.
MK
4:7
Some other seed fell among thorny weeds, which grew and choked the good plants. So those plants did not produce a crop.
MK
4:8
Some other seed fell on good ground and began to grow. It got taller and produced a crop. Some plants made thirty times more, some made sixty times more, and some made a hundred times more.”
MK
4:9
Then Jesus said, “Let those with ears use them and listen!”
MK
4:10
Later, when Jesus was alone, the twelve apostles and others around him asked him about the stories.
MT
13:11
Jesus answered, “You have been chosen to know the secrets about the kingdom of heaven, but others cannot know these secrets.
MT
13:12
Those who have understanding will be given more, and they will have all they need. But those who do not have understanding, even what they have will be taken away from them.
MT
13:13
This is why I use stories to teach the people: They see, but they don’t really see. They hear, but they don’t really hear or understand.
MT
13:14
So they show that the things Isaiah said about them are true: ‘You will listen and listen, but you will not understand. You will look and look, but you will not learn.
MT
13:15
For the minds of these people have become stubborn. They do not hear with their ears, and they have closed their eyes. Otherwise they might really understand what they see with their eyes and hear with their ears. They might really understand in their minds and come back to me and be healed.’ (Isaiah 6:9-10)
MT
13:16
But you are blessed, because you see with your eyes and hear with your ears.
MT
13:17
I tell you the truth, many prophets and good people wanted to see the things that you now see, but they did not see them. And they wanted to hear the things that you now hear, but they did not hear them.
MT
13:18
“So listen to the meaning of that story about the farmer.
LK
8:11
“This is what the story means: The seed is God’s message.
LK
8:12
The seed that fell beside the road is like the people who hear God’s teaching, but the devil comes and takes it away from them so they cannot believe it and be saved.
LK
8:13
The seed that fell on rock is like those who hear God’s teaching and accept it gladly, but they don’t allow the teaching to go deep into their lives. They believe for a while, but when trouble comes, they give up.
LK
8:14
The seed that fell among the thorny weeds is like those who hear God’s teaching, but they let the worries, riches, and pleasures of this life keep them from growing and producing good fruit.
LK
8:15
And the seed that fell on the good ground is like those who hear God’s teaching with good, honest hearts and obey it and patiently produce good fruit.
Default Mt 13:3-23 Mk 4:2-20 Lk 8:5-15
MT
13:3
Then Jesus used stories to teach them many things. He said: “A farmer went out to plant his seed.
MT
13:4
While he was planting, some seed fell by the road, and the birds came and ate it all up.
MT
13:5
Some seed fell on rocky ground, where there wasn’t much dirt. That seed grew very fast, because the ground was not deep.
MT
13:6
But when the sun rose, the plants dried up, because they did not have deep roots.
MT
13:7
Some other seed fell among thorny weeds, which grew and choked the good plants.
MT
13:8
Some other seed fell on good ground where it grew and produced a crop. Some plants made a hundred times more, some made sixty times more, and some made thirty times more.
MT
13:9
Let those with ears use them and listen.”
MT
13:10
The followers came to Jesus and asked, “Why do you use stories to teach the people?”
MT
13:11
Jesus answered, “You have been chosen to know the secrets about the kingdom of heaven, but others cannot know these secrets.
MT
13:12
Those who have understanding will be given more, and they will have all they need. But those who do not have understanding, even what they have will be taken away from them.
MT
13:13
This is why I use stories to teach the people: They see, but they don’t really see. They hear, but they don’t really hear or understand.
MT
13:14
So they show that the things Isaiah said about them are true: ‘You will listen and listen, but you will not understand. You will look and look, but you will not learn.
MT
13:15
For the minds of these people have become stubborn. They do not hear with their ears, and they have closed their eyes. Otherwise they might really understand what they see with their eyes and hear with their ears. They might really understand in their minds and come back to me and be healed.’ (Isaiah 6:9-10)
MT
13:16
But you are blessed, because you see with your eyes and hear with your ears.
MT
13:17
I tell you the truth, many prophets and good people wanted to see the things that you now see, but they did not see them. And they wanted to hear the things that you now hear, but they did not hear them.
MT
13:18
“So listen to the meaning of that story about the farmer.
MT
13:19
What is the seed that fell by the road? That seed is like the person who hears the message about the kingdom but does not understand it. The Evil One comes and takes away what was planted in that person’s heart.
MT
13:20
And what is the seed that fell on rocky ground? That seed is like the person who hears the teaching and quickly accepts it with joy.
MT
13:21
But he does not let the teaching go deep into his life, so he keeps it only a short time. When trouble or persecution comes because of the teaching he accepted, he quickly gives up.
MT
13:22
And what is the seed that fell among the thorny weeds? That seed is like the person who hears the teaching but lets worries about this life and the temptation of wealth stop that teaching from growing. So the teaching does not produce fruit(as) in that person’s life.
MT
13:23
But what is the seed that fell on the good ground? That seed is like the person who hears the teaching and understands it. That person grows and produces fruit, sometimes a hundred times more, sometimes sixty times more, and sometimes thirty times more.”
Default Mt 13:3-23 Mk 4:2-20 Lk 8:5-15
MK
4:2
Jesus taught them many things, using stories. He said,
MK
4:3
“Listen! A farmer went out to plant his seed.
MK
4:4
While he was planting, some seed fell by the road, and the birds came and ate it up.
MK
4:5
Some seed fell on rocky ground where there wasn’t much dirt. That seed grew very fast, because the ground was not deep.
MK
4:6
But when the sun rose, the plants dried up because they did not have deep roots.
MK
4:7
Some other seed fell among thorny weeds, which grew and choked the good plants. So those plants did not produce a crop.
MK
4:8
Some other seed fell on good ground and began to grow. It got taller and produced a crop. Some plants made thirty times more, some made sixty times more, and some made a hundred times more.”
MK
4:9
Then Jesus said, “Let those with ears use them and listen!”
MK
4:10
Later, when Jesus was alone, the twelve apostles and others around him asked him about the stories.
MK
4:11
Jesus said, “You can know the secret about the kingdom of God. But to other people I tell everything by using stories
MK
4:12
so that: ‘They will look and look, but they will not learn. They will listen and listen, but they will not understand. If they did learn and understand, they would come back to me and be forgiven.’” (Isaiah 6:9-10)
MK
4:13
Then Jesus said to his followers, “Don’t you understand this story? If you don’t, how will you understand any story?
MK
4:14
The farmer is like a person who plants God’s message in people.
MK
4:15
Sometimes the teaching falls on the road. This is like the people who hear the teaching of God, but Satan quickly comes and takes away the teaching that was planted in them.
MK
4:16
Others are like the seed planted on rocky ground. They hear the teaching and quickly accept it with joy.
MK
4:17
But since they don’t allow the teaching to go deep into their lives, they keep it only a short time. When trouble or persecution comes because of the teaching they accepted, they quickly give up.
MK
4:18
Others are like the seed planted among the thorny weeds. They hear the teaching,
MK
4:19
but the worries of this life, the temptation of wealth, and many other evil desires keep the teaching from growing and producing fruit(j) in their lives.
MK
4:20
Others are like the seed planted in the good ground. They hear the teaching and accept it. Then they grow and produce fruit-sometimes thirty times more, sometimes sixty times more, and sometimes a hundred times more.”
Default Mt 13:3-23 Mk 4:2-20 Lk 8:5-15
LK
8:5
“A farmer went out to plant his seed. While he was planting, some seed fell by the road. People walked on the seed, and the birds ate it up.
LK
8:6
Some seed fell on rock, and when it began to grow, it died because it had no water.
LK
8:7
Some seed fell among thorny weeds, but the weeds grew up with it and choked the good plants.
LK
8:8
And some seed fell on good ground and grew and made a hundred times more.” As Jesus finished the story, he called out, “Let those with ears use them and listen!”
LK
8:9
Jesus’ followers asked him what this story meant.
LK
8:10
Jesus said, “You have been chosen to know the secrets about the kingdom of God. But I use stories to speak to other people so that: ‘They will look, but they may not see. They will listen, but they may not understand.’ (Isaiah 6:9)
LK
8:11
“This is what the story means: The seed is God’s message.
LK
8:12
The seed that fell beside the road is like the people who hear God’s teaching, but the devil comes and takes it away from them so they cannot believe it and be saved.
LK
8:13
The seed that fell on rock is like those who hear God’s teaching and accept it gladly, but they don’t allow the teaching to go deep into their lives. They believe for a while, but when trouble comes, they give up.
LK
8:14
The seed that fell among the thorny weeds is like those who hear God’s teaching, but they let the worries, riches, and pleasures of this life keep them from growing and producing good fruit.
LK
8:15
And the seed that fell on the good ground is like those who hear God’s teaching with good, honest hearts and obey it and patiently produce good fruit.
Week 18-31 | Be The Light For Others
Mt 5:14-16 Mk 4:21-25 Lk 8:16-18
Default Mt 5:14-16 Mk 4:21-25 Lk 8:16-18
MT
5:14
“You are the light that gives light to the world. A city that is built on a hill cannot be hidden.
MT
5:15
And people don’t hide a light under a bowl. They put it on a lampstand so the light shines for all the people in the house.
MT
5:16
In the same way, you should be a light for other people. Live so that they will see the good things you do and will praise your Father in heaven.
MK
4:22
Everything that is hidden will be made clear and every secret thing will be made known.
MK
4:23
Let those with ears use them and listen!
MK
4:24
“Think carefully about what you hear. The way you give to others is the way God will give to you, but God will give you even more.
LK
8:18
So be careful how you listen. Those who have understanding will be given more. But those who do not have understanding, even what they think they have will be taken away from them.”
Default Mt 5:14-16 Mk 4:21-25 Lk 8:16-18
MT
5:14
“You are the light that gives light to the world. A city that is built on a hill cannot be hidden.
MT
5:15
And people don’t hide a light under a bowl. They put it on a lampstand so the light shines for all the people in the house.
MT
5:16
In the same way, you should be a light for other people. Live so that they will see the good things you do and will praise your Father in heaven.
Default Mt 5:14-16 Mk 4:21-25 Lk 8:16-18
MK
4:21
Then Jesus said to them, “Do you hide a lamp under a bowl or under a bed? No! You put the lamp on a lampstand.
MK
4:22
Everything that is hidden will be made clear and every secret thing will be made known.
MK
4:23
Let those with ears use them and listen!
MK
4:24
“Think carefully about what you hear. The way you give to others is the way God will give to you, but God will give you even more.
MK
4:25
Those who have understanding will be given more. But those who do not have understanding, even what they have will be taken away from them.”
Default Mt 5:14-16 Mk 4:21-25 Lk 8:16-18
LK
8:16
“No one after lighting a lamp covers it with a bowl or hides it under a bed. Instead, the person puts it on a lampstand so those who come in will see the light.
LK
8:17
Everything that is hidden will become clear, and every secret thing will be made known.
LK
8:18
So be careful how you listen. Those who have understanding will be given more. But those who do not have understanding, even what they think they have will be taken away from them.”
Week 18-31 | By Itself The Earth Produces Grain
Mk 4:26-29
Mk 4:26-29
MK
4:26
Then Jesus said, “The kingdom of God is like someone who plants seed in the ground.
MK
4:27
Night and day, whether the person is asleep or awake, the seed still grows, but the person does not know how it grows.
MK
4:28
By itself the earth produces grain. First the plant grows, then the head, and then all the grain in the head.
MK
4:29
When the grain is ready, the farmer cuts it, because this is the harvest time.”
Week 18-31 | Wheat And Weeds
Mt 13:24-30
Mt 13:24-30
MT
13:24
Then Jesus told them another story: “The kingdom of heaven is like a man who planted good seed in his field.
MT
13:25
That night, when everyone was asleep, his enemy came and planted weeds among the wheat and then left.
MT
13:26
Later, the wheat sprouted and the heads of grain grew, but the weeds also grew.
MT
13:27
Then the man’s servants came to him and said, ‘You planted good seed in your field. Where did the weeds come from?’
MT
13:28
The man answered, ‘An enemy planted weeds.’ The servants asked, ‘Do you want us to pull up the weeds?’
MT
13:29
The man answered, ‘No, because when you pull up the weeds, you might also pull up the wheat.
MT
13:30
Let the weeds and the wheat grow together until the harvest time. At harvest time I will tell the workers, “First gather the weeds and tie them together to be burned. Then gather the wheat and bring it to my barn.”’”
Week 18-31 | Mustard Seed
Mt 13:31-32 Mk 4:30-32 Lk 13:18-19
Default Mt 13:31-32 Mk 4:30-32 Lk 13:18-19
MT
13:31
Then Jesus told another story: “The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed that a man planted in his field.
MT
13:32
That seed is the smallest of all seeds, but when it grows, it is one of the largest garden plants. It becomes big enough for the wild birds to come and build nests in its branches.”
Default Mt 13:31-32 Mk 4:30-32 Lk 13:18-19
MT
13:31
Then Jesus told another story: “The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed that a man planted in his field.
MT
13:32
That seed is the smallest of all seeds, but when it grows, it is one of the largest garden plants. It becomes big enough for the wild birds to come and build nests in its branches.”
Default Mt 13:31-32 Mk 4:30-32 Lk 13:18-19
MK
4:30
Then Jesus said, “How can I show you what the kingdom of God is like? What story can I use to explain it?
MK
4:31
The kingdom of God is like a mustard seed, the smallest seed you plant in the ground.
MK
4:32
But when planted, this seed grows and becomes the largest of all garden plants. It produces large branches, and the wild birds can make nests in its shade.”
Default Mt 13:31-32 Mk 4:30-32 Lk 13:18-19
LK
13:18
Then Jesus said, “What is God’s kingdom like? What can I compare it with?
LK
13:19
It is like a mustard seed that a man plants in his garden. The seed grows and becomes a tree, and the wild birds build nests in its branches.”

Mt 13:33-33 Lk 13:20-21
Default Mt 13:33-33 Lk 13:20-21
MT
13:33
Then Jesus told another story: “The kingdom of heaven is like yeast that a woman took and hid in a large tub of flour until it made all the dough rise.”
Default Mt 13:33-33 Lk 13:20-21

13:33
Then Jesus told another story: “The kingdom of heaven is like yeast that a woman took and hid in a large tub of flour until it made all the dough rise.”

13:20
Jesus said again, “What can I compare God’s kingdom with?
LK
13:21
It is like yeast that a woman took and hid in a large tub of flour until it made all the dough rise.”
Week 18-31 | Teaching By Stories
Mt 13:34-35 Mk 4:33-34
Default Mt 13:34-35 Mk 4:33-34
MK
4:33
Jesus used many stories like these to teach the crowd God’s message-as much as they could understand.
MK
4:34
He always used stories to teach them. But when he and his followers were alone, Jesus explained everything to them.
MT
13:35
This is as the prophet said: “I will speak using stories; I will tell things that have been secret since the world was made.” (Psalm 78:2)
Default Mt 13:34-35 Mk 4:33-34
MT
13:34
Jesus used stories to tell all these things to the people; he always used stories to teach them.
MT
13:35
This is as the prophet said: “I will speak using stories; I will tell things that have been secret since the world was made.” (Psalm 78:2)
Default Mt 13:34-35 Mk 4:33-34
MK
4:33
Jesus used many stories like these to teach the crowd God’s message-as much as they could understand.
MK
4:34
He always used stories to teach them. But when he and his followers were alone, Jesus explained everything to them.
Week 18-31 | The Treasure And The Pearl
Mt 13:44-46
Mt 13:44-46
MT
13:44
“The kingdom of heaven is like a treasure hidden in a field. One day a man found the treasure, and then he hid it in the field again. He was so happy that he went and sold everything he owned to buy that field.
MT
13:45
“Also, the kingdom of heaven is like a man looking for fine pearls.
MT
13:46
When he found a very valuable pearl, he went and sold everything he had and bought it.
Week 18-31 | Fishing Net
Mt 13:47-50
Mt 13:47-50
MT
13:47
“Also, the kingdom of heaven is like a net that was put into the lake and caught many different kinds of fish.
MT
13:48
When it was full, the fishermen pulled the net to the shore. They sat down and put all the good fish in baskets and threw away the bad fish.
MT
13:49
It will be this way at the end of the age. The angels will come and separate the evil people from the good people.
MT
13:50
The angels will throw the evil people into the blazing furnace, where people will cry and grind their teeth with pain.”
Week 18-31 | Teacher Of Law Who Became Followers
Mt 13:51-52
Mt 13:51-52
MT
13:51
Jesus asked his followers, “Do you understand all these things?” They answered, “Yes, we understand.”
MT
13:52
Then Jesus said to them, “So every teacher of the law who has been taught about the kingdom of heaven is like the owner of a house. He brings out both new things and old things he has saved.”

8:18

Week 18-31 | Cost Of Following Jesus
Mt 8:19-22 Lk 9:57-62
Default Mt 8:19-22 Lk 9:57-62
MT
8:19
Then a teacher of the law came to Jesus and said, “Teacher, I will follow you any place you go.”
MT
8:20
Jesus said to him, “The foxes have holes to live in, and the birds have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to rest his head.”
MT
8:21
Another man, one of Jesus’ followers, said to him, “Lord, first let me go and bury my father.”
LK
9:60
But Jesus said to him, “Let the people who are dead bury their own dead. You must go and tell about the kingdom of God.”
LK
9:61
Another man said, “I will follow you, Lord, but first let me go and say good-bye to my family.”
LK
9:62
Jesus said, “Anyone who begins to plow a field but keeps looking back is of no use in the kingdom of God.”
Default Mt 8:19-22 Lk 9:57-62
MT
8:19
Then a teacher of the law came to Jesus and said, “Teacher, I will follow you any place you go.”
MT
8:20
Jesus said to him, “The foxes have holes to live in, and the birds have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to rest his head.”
MT
8:21
Another man, one of Jesus’ followers, said to him, “Lord, first let me go and bury my father.”
MT
8:22
But Jesus told him, “Follow me, and let the people who are dead bury their own dead.”
Default Mt 8:19-22 Lk 9:57-62
LK
9:57
As they were going along the road, someone said to Jesus, “I will follow you any place you go.”
LK
9:58
Jesus said to them, “The foxes have holes to live in, and the birds have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to rest his head.”
LK
9:59
Jesus said to another man, “Follow me!” But he said, “Lord, first let me go and bury my father.”
LK
9:60
But Jesus said to him, “Let the people who are dead bury their own dead. You must go and tell about the kingdom of God.”
LK
9:61
Another man said, “I will follow you, Lord, but first let me go and say good-bye to my family.”
LK
9:62
Jesus said, “Anyone who begins to plow a field but keeps looking back is of no use in the kingdom of God.”

Leaving the crowd behind, they took him in the boat just as he was. There were also other boats with them.

8:23
Jesus got into a boat, and his followers went with him.

Week 18-31 | Wheat And Weeds Explanation
Mt 13:36-43
Mt 13:36-43
MT
13:36
Then Jesus left the crowd and went into the house. His followers came to him and said, “Explain to us the meaning of the story about the weeds in the field.”
MT
13:37
Jesus answered, “The man who planted the good seed in the field is the Son of Man.
MT
13:38
The field is the world, and the good seed are all of God’s children who belong to the kingdom. The weeds are those people who belong to the Evil One.
MT
13:39
And the enemy who planted the bad seed is the devil. The harvest time is the end of the age, and the workers who gather are God’s angels.
MT
13:40
“Just as the weeds are pulled up and burned in the fire, so it will be at the end of the age.
MT
13:41
The Son of Man will send out his angels, and they will gather out of his kingdom all who cause sin and all who do evil.
MT
13:42
The angels will throw them into the blazing furnace, where the people will cry and grind their teeth with pain.
MT
13:43
Then the good people will shine like the sun in the kingdom of their Father. Let those with ears use them and listen.
Week 18-31 | The Galilean Ministry Goes On
– +
Week 18-31 | Jesus Calms A Storm
Mt 8:24-27 Mk 4:37-41 Lk 8:23-25
Default Mt 8:24-27 Mk 4:37-41 Lk 8:23-25
LK
8:23
While they were sailing, Jesus fell asleep. A very strong wind blew up on the lake, causing the boat to fill with water, and they were in danger.
LK
8:24
The followers went to Jesus and woke him, saying, “Master! Master! We will drown!” Jesus got up and gave a command to the wind and the waves. They stopped, and it became calm.
LK
8:25
Jesus said to his followers, “Where is your faith?” The followers were afraid and amazed and said to each other, “Who is this that commands even the wind and the water, and they obey him?”
Default Mt 8:24-27 Mk 4:37-41 Lk 8:23-25
MT
8:24
A great storm arose on the lake so that waves covered the boat, but Jesus was sleeping.
MT
8:25
His followers went to him and woke him, saying, “Lord, save us! We will drown!”
MT
8:26
Jesus answered, “Why are you afraid? You don’t have enough faith.” Then Jesus got up and gave a command to the wind and the waves, and it became completely calm.
MT
8:27
The men were amazed and said, “What kind of man is this? Even the wind and the waves obey him!”
Default Mt 8:24-27 Mk 4:37-41 Lk 8:23-25
MK
4:37
A very strong wind came up on the lake. The waves came over the sides and into the boat so that it was already full of water.
MK
4:38
Jesus was at the back of the boat, sleeping with his head on a cushion. His followers woke him and said, “Teacher, don’t you care that we are drowning!”
MK
4:39
Jesus stood up and commanded the wind and said to the waves, “Quiet! Be still!” Then the wind stopped, and it became completely calm.
MK
4:40
Jesus said to his followers, “Why are you afraid? Do you still have no faith?”
MK
4:41
The followers were very afraid and asked each other, “Who is this? Even the wind and the waves obey him!”
Default Mt 8:24-27 Mk 4:37-41 Lk 8:23-25
LK
8:23
While they were sailing, Jesus fell asleep. A very strong wind blew up on the lake, causing the boat to fill with water, and they were in danger.
LK
8:24
The followers went to Jesus and woke him, saying, “Master! Master! We will drown!” Jesus got up and gave a command to the wind and the waves. They stopped, and it became calm.
LK
8:25
Jesus said to his followers, “Where is your faith?” The followers were afraid and amazed and said to each other, “Who is this that commands even the wind and the water, and they obey him?”
Week 18-31 | The Demoniacs Of Gadara
Mt 8:28-34 Mk 5:1-20 Lk 8:26-39
Default Mt 8:28-34 Mk 5:1-20 Lk 8:26-39
MK
5:1
Jesus and his followers went to the other side of the lake to the area of the Gerasene(k) people.
MK
5:2
When Jesus got out of the boat, instantly a man with an evil spirit came to him from the burial caves.
MK
5:3
This man lived in the caves, and no one could tie him up, not even with a chain.
MK
5:4
Many times people had used chains to tie the man’s hands and feet, but he always broke them off. No one was strong enough to control him.
MK
5:5
Day and night he would wander around the burial caves and on the hills, screaming and cutting himself with stones.
MK
5:6
While Jesus was still far away, the man saw him, ran to him, and fell down before him.
MK
5:7
The man shouted in a loud voice, “What do you want with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I command you in God’s name not to torture me!”
MK
5:8
He said this because Jesus was saying to him, “You evil spirit, come out of the man.”
MK
5:9
Then Jesus asked him, “What is your name?” He answered, “My name is Legion,(l) because we are many spirits.”
MK
5:10
He begged Jesus again and again not to send them out of that area.
MK
5:11
A large herd of pigs was feeding on a hill near there.
MK
5:12
The demons begged Jesus, “Send us into the pigs; let us go into them.”
MK
5:13
So Jesus allowed them to do this. The evil spirits left the man and went into the pigs. Then the herd of pigs-about two thousand of them-rushed down the hill into the lake and were drowned.
MK
5:14
The herdsmen ran away and went to the town and to the countryside, telling everyone about this. So people went out to see what had happened.
MK
5:15
They came to Jesus and saw the man who used to have the many evil spirits, sitting, clothed, and in his right mind. And they were frightened.
MK
5:16
The people who saw this told the others what had happened to the man who had the demons living in him, and they told about the pigs.
MK
5:17
Then the people began to beg Jesus to leave their area.
MK
5:18
As Jesus was getting back into the boat, the man who was freed from the demons begged to go with him.
MK
5:19
But Jesus would not let him. He said, “Go home to your family and tell them how much the Lord has done for you and how he has had mercy on you.”
MK
5:20
So the man left and began to tell the people in the Ten Towns(m) about what Jesus had done for him. And everyone was amazed.
Default Mt 8:28-34 Mk 5:1-20 Lk 8:26-39
MT
8:28
When Jesus arrived at the other side of the lake in the area of the Gadarene(ab) people, two men who had demons in them met him. These men lived in the burial caves and were so dangerous that people could not use the road by those caves.
MT
8:29
They shouted, “What do you want with us, Son of God? Did you come here to torture us before the right time?”
MT
8:30
Near that place there was a large herd of pigs feeding.
MT
8:31
The demons begged Jesus, “If you make us leave these men, please send us into that herd of pigs.”
MT
8:32
Jesus said to them, “Go!” So the demons left the men and went into the pigs. Then the whole herd rushed down the hill into the lake and were drowned.
MT
8:33
The herdsmen ran away and went into town, where they told about all of this and what had happened to the men who had demons.
MT
8:34
Then the whole town went out to see Jesus. When they saw him, they begged him to leave their area.
Default Mt 8:28-34 Mk 5:1-20 Lk 8:26-39
MK
5:1
Jesus and his followers went to the other side of the lake to the area of the Gerasene(k) people.
MK
5:2
When Jesus got out of the boat, instantly a man with an evil spirit came to him from the burial caves.
MK
5:3
This man lived in the caves, and no one could tie him up, not even with a chain.
MK
5:4
Many times people had used chains to tie the man’s hands and feet, but he always broke them off. No one was strong enough to control him.
MK
5:5
Day and night he would wander around the burial caves and on the hills, screaming and cutting himself with stones.
MK
5:6
While Jesus was still far away, the man saw him, ran to him, and fell down before him.
MK
5:7
The man shouted in a loud voice, “What do you want with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I command you in God’s name not to torture me!”
MK
5:8
He said this because Jesus was saying to him, “You evil spirit, come out of the man.”
MK
5:9
Then Jesus asked him, “What is your name?” He answered, “My name is Legion,(l) because we are many spirits.”
MK
5:10
He begged Jesus again and again not to send them out of that area.
MK
5:11
A large herd of pigs was feeding on a hill near there.
MK
5:12
The demons begged Jesus, “Send us into the pigs; let us go into them.”
MK
5:13
So Jesus allowed them to do this. The evil spirits left the man and went into the pigs. Then the herd of pigs-about two thousand of them-rushed down the hill into the lake and were drowned.
MK
5:14
The herdsmen ran away and went to the town and to the countryside, telling everyone about this. So people went out to see what had happened.
MK
5:15
They came to Jesus and saw the man who used to have the many evil spirits, sitting, clothed, and in his right mind. And they were frightened.
MK
5:16
The people who saw this told the others what had happened to the man who had the demons living in him, and they told about the pigs.
MK
5:17
Then the people began to beg Jesus to leave their area.
MK
5:18
As Jesus was getting back into the boat, the man who was freed from the demons begged to go with him.
MK
5:19
But Jesus would not let him. He said, “Go home to your family and tell them how much the Lord has done for you and how he has had mercy on you.”
MK
5:20
So the man left and began to tell the people in the Ten Towns(m) about what Jesus had done for him. And everyone was amazed.
Default Mt 8:28-34 Mk 5:1-20 Lk 8:26-39
LK
8:26
Jesus and his followers sailed across the lake from Galilee to the area of the Gerasene(y) people.
LK
8:27
When Jesus got out on the land, a man from the town who had demons inside him came to Jesus. For a long time he had worn no clothes and had lived in the burial caves, not in a house.
LK
8:28
When he saw Jesus, he cried out and fell down before him. He said with a loud voice, “What do you want with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I beg you, don’t torture me!”
LK
8:29
He said this because Jesus was commanding the evil spirit to come out of the man. Many times it had taken hold of him. Though he had been kept under guard and chained hand and foot, he had broken his chains and had been forced by the demon out into a lonely place.
LK
8:30
Jesus asked him, “What is your name?” He answered, “Legion,”(z) because many demons were in him.
LK
8:31
The demons begged Jesus not to send them into eternal darkness.(aa)
LK
8:32
A large herd of pigs was feeding on a hill, and the demons begged Jesus to allow them to go into the pigs. So Jesus allowed them to do this.
LK
8:33
When the demons came out of the man, they went into the pigs, and the herd ran down the hill into the lake and was drowned.
LK
8:34
When the herdsmen saw what had happened, they ran away and told about this in the town and the countryside.
LK
8:35
And people went to see what had happened. When they came to Jesus, they found the man sitting at Jesus’ feet, clothed and in his right mind, because the demons were gone. But the people were frightened.
LK
8:36
The people who saw this happen told the others how Jesus had made the man well.
LK
8:37
All the people of the Gerasene country asked Jesus to leave, because they were all very afraid. So Jesus got into the boat and went back to Galilee.
LK
8:38
The man whom Jesus had healed begged to go with him, but Jesus sent him away, saying,
LK
8:39
“Go back home and tell people how much God has done for you.” So the man went all over town telling how much Jesus had done for him.
Week 18-31 | Back To The Galilee Side Of The Lake
Mt 9:1-1 Mk 5:21-21 Lk 8:40-40
Default Mt 9:1-1 Mk 5:21-21 Lk 8:40-40
LK
8:40
When Jesus got back to Galilee, a crowd welcomed him, because everyone was waiting for him.
Default Mt 9:1-1 Mk 5:21-21 Lk 8:40-40
MT
9:1
Jesus got into a boat and went back across the lake to his own town.
Default Mt 9:1-1 Mk 5:21-21 Lk 8:40-40
MK
5:21
When Jesus went in the boat back to the other side of the lake, a large crowd gathered around him there.
Default Mt 9:1-1 Mk 5:21-21 Lk 8:40-40
LK
8:40
When Jesus got back to Galilee, a crowd welcomed him, because everyone was waiting for him.
Week 18-31 | Raises Jairus' Daughter
Mt 9:18-26 Mk 5:22-43 Lk 8:41-56
Default Mt 9:18-26 Mk 5:22-43 Lk 8:41-56
MK
5:22
A leader of the synagogue, named Jairus, came there, saw Jesus, and fell at his feet.
MK
5:23
He begged Jesus, saying again and again, “My daughter is dying. Please come and put your hands on her so she will be healed and will live.”
MK
5:24
So Jesus went with him. A large crowd followed Jesus and pushed very close around him.
LK
8:43
A woman was in the crowd who had been bleeding for twelve years,(ab) but no one was able to heal her.
LK
8:44
She came up behind Jesus and touched the edge of his coat, and instantly her bleeding stopped.
LK
8:45
Then Jesus said, “Who touched me?” When all the people said they had not touched him, Peter said, “Master, the people are all around you and are pushing against you.”
LK
8:46
But Jesus said, “Someone did touch me, because I felt power go out from me.”
LK
8:47
When the woman saw she could not hide, she came forward, shaking, and fell down before Jesus. While all the people listened, she told why she had touched him and how she had been instantly healed.
LK
8:48
Jesus said to her, “Dear woman, you are made well because you believed. Go in peace.”
LK
8:49
While Jesus was still speaking, someone came from the house of the synagogue leader and said to him, “Your daughter is dead. Don’t bother the teacher anymore.”
LK
8:50
When Jesus heard this, he said to Jairus, “Don’t be afraid. Just believe, and your daughter will be well.”
LK
8:51
When Jesus went to the house, he let only Peter, John, James, and the girl’s father and mother go inside with him.
LK
8:52
All the people were crying and feeling sad because the girl was dead, but Jesus said, “Stop crying. She is not dead, only asleep.”
LK
8:53
The people laughed at Jesus because they knew the girl was dead.
LK
8:54
But Jesus took hold of her hand and called to her, “My child, stand up!”
LK
8:55
Her spirit came back into her, and she stood up at once. Then Jesus ordered that she be given something to eat.
LK
8:56
The girl’s parents were amazed, but Jesus told them not to tell anyone what had happened.
Default Mt 9:18-26 Mk 5:22-43 Lk 8:41-56
MT
9:18
While Jesus was saying these things, a leader of the synagogue came to him. He bowed down before Jesus and said, “My daughter has just died. But if you come and lay your hand on her, she will live again.”
MT
9:19
So Jesus and his followers stood up and went with the leader.
MT
9:20
Then a woman who had been bleeding for twelve years came behind Jesus and touched the edge of his coat.
MT
9:21
She was thinking, “If I can just touch his clothes, I will be healed.”
MT
9:22
Jesus turned and saw the woman and said, “Be encouraged, dear woman. You are made well because you believed.” And the woman was healed from that moment on.
MT
9:23
Jesus continued along with the leader and went into his house. There he saw the funeral musicians and many people crying.
MT
9:24
Jesus said, “Go away. The girl is not dead, only asleep.” But the people laughed at him.
MT
9:25
After the crowd had been thrown out of the house, Jesus went into the girl’s room and took hold of her hand, and she stood up.
MT
9:26
The news about this spread all around the area.
Default Mt 9:18-26 Mk 5:22-43 Lk 8:41-56
MK
5:22
A leader of the synagogue, named Jairus, came there, saw Jesus, and fell at his feet.
MK
5:23
He begged Jesus, saying again and again, “My daughter is dying. Please come and put your hands on her so she will be healed and will live.”
MK
5:24
So Jesus went with him. A large crowd followed Jesus and pushed very close around him.
MK
5:25
Among them was a woman who had been bleeding for twelve years.
MK
5:26
She had suffered very much from many doctors and had spent all the money she had, but instead of improving, she was getting worse.
MK
5:27
When the woman heard about Jesus, she came up behind him in the crowd and touched his coat.
MK
5:28
She thought, “If I can just touch his clothes, I will be healed.”
MK
5:29
Instantly her bleeding stopped, and she felt in her body that she was healed from her disease.
MK
5:30
At once Jesus felt power go out from him. So he turned around in the crowd and asked, “Who touched my clothes?”
MK
5:31
His followers said, “Look at how many people are pushing against you! And you ask, ‘Who touched me?’ ”
MK
5:32
But Jesus continued looking around to see who had touched him.
MK
5:33
The woman, knowing that she was healed, came and fell at Jesus’ feet. Shaking with fear, she told him the whole truth.
MK
5:34
Jesus said to her, “Dear woman, you are made well because you believed. Go in peace; be healed of your disease.”
MK
5:35
While Jesus was still speaking, some people came from the house of the synagogue leader. They said, “Your daughter is dead. There is no need to bother the teacher anymore.”
MK
5:36
But Jesus paid no attention to what they said. He told the synagogue leader, “Don’t be afraid; just believe.”
MK
5:37
Jesus let only Peter, James, and John the brother of James go with him.
MK
5:38
When they came to the house of the synagogue leader, Jesus found many people there making lots of noise and crying loudly.
MK
5:39
Jesus entered the house and said to them, “Why are you crying and making so much noise? The child is not dead, only asleep.”
MK
5:40
But they laughed at him. So, after throwing them out of the house, Jesus took the child’s father and mother and his three followers into the room where the child was.
MK
5:41
Taking hold of the girl’s hand, he said to her, “Talitha, koum!” (This means, “Young girl, I tell you to stand up!”)
MK
5:42
At once the girl stood right up and began walking. (She was twelve years old.) Everyone was completely amazed.
MK
5:43
Jesus gave them strict orders not to tell people about this. Then he told them to give the girl something to eat.
Default Mt 9:18-26 Mk 5:22-43 Lk 8:41-56
LK
8:41
A man named Jairus, a leader of the synagogue, came to Jesus and fell at his feet, begging him to come to his house.
LK
8:42
Jairus’ only daughter, about twelve years old, was dying. While Jesus was on his way to Jairus’ house, the people were crowding all around him.
LK
8:43
A woman was in the crowd who had been bleeding for twelve years,(ab) but no one was able to heal her.
LK
8:44
She came up behind Jesus and touched the edge of his coat, and instantly her bleeding stopped.
LK
8:45
Then Jesus said, “Who touched me?” When all the people said they had not touched him, Peter said, “Master, the people are all around you and are pushing against you.”
LK
8:46
But Jesus said, “Someone did touch me, because I felt power go out from me.”
LK
8:47
When the woman saw she could not hide, she came forward, shaking, and fell down before Jesus. While all the people listened, she told why she had touched him and how she had been instantly healed.
LK
8:48
Jesus said to her, “Dear woman, you are made well because you believed. Go in peace.”
LK
8:49
While Jesus was still speaking, someone came from the house of the synagogue leader and said to him, “Your daughter is dead. Don’t bother the teacher anymore.”
LK
8:50
When Jesus heard this, he said to Jairus, “Don’t be afraid. Just believe, and your daughter will be well.”
LK
8:51
When Jesus went to the house, he let only Peter, John, James, and the girl’s father and mother go inside with him.
LK
8:52
All the people were crying and feeling sad because the girl was dead, but Jesus said, “Stop crying. She is not dead, only asleep.”
LK
8:53
The people laughed at Jesus because they knew the girl was dead.
LK
8:54
But Jesus took hold of her hand and called to her, “My child, stand up!”
LK
8:55
Her spirit came back into her, and she stood up at once. Then Jesus ordered that she be given something to eat.
LK
8:56
The girl’s parents were amazed, but Jesus told them not to tell anyone what had happened.
Week 18-31 | John Asks For Affirmation From Jesus
Mt 11:2-6 Lk 7:18-23
Default Mt 11:2-6 Lk 7:18-23
MT
11:2
John the Baptist was in prison, but he heard about what the Christ was doing. So John sent some of his followers to Jesus.
MT
11:3
They asked him, “Are you the One who is to come, or should we wait for someone else?”
MT
11:4
Jesus answered them, “Go tell John what you hear and see:
MT
11:5
The blind can see, the crippled can walk, and people with skin diseases are healed. The deaf can hear, the dead are raised to life, and the Good News is preached to the poor.
MT
11:6
Those who do not stumble in their faith because of me are blessed.”
Default Mt 11:2-6 Lk 7:18-23
MT
11:2
John the Baptist was in prison, but he heard about what the Christ was doing. So John sent some of his followers to Jesus.
MT
11:3
They asked him, “Are you the One who is to come, or should we wait for someone else?”
MT
11:4
Jesus answered them, “Go tell John what you hear and see:
MT
11:5
The blind can see, the crippled can walk, and people with skin diseases are healed. The deaf can hear, the dead are raised to life, and the Good News is preached to the poor.
MT
11:6
Those who do not stumble in their faith because of me are blessed.”
Default Mt 11:2-6 Lk 7:18-23
LK
7:18
John’s followers told him about all these things. He called for two of his followers
LK
7:19
and sent them to the Lord to ask, “Are you the One who is to come, or should we wait for someone else?”
LK
7:20
When the men came to Jesus, they said, “John the Baptist sent us to you with this question: ‘Are you the One who is to come, or should we wait for someone else?’”
LK
7:21
At that time, Jesus healed many people of their sicknesses, diseases, and evil spirits, and he gave sight to many blind people.
LK
7:22
Then Jesus answered John’s followers, “Go tell John what you saw and heard here. The blind can see, the crippled can walk, and people with skin diseases are healed. The deaf can hear, the dead are raised to life, and the Good News is preached to the poor.
LK
7:23
Those who do not stumble in their faith because of me are blessed!”
Week 18-31 | Jesus' Testimony About John
Mt 11:7-19 Lk 7:24-35
Default Mt 11:7-19 Lk 7:24-35
LK
7:24
When John’s followers left, Jesus began talking to the people about John: “What did you go out into the desert to see? A reed(w) blown by the wind?
LK
7:25
What did you go out to see? A man dressed in fine clothes? No, people who have fine clothes and much wealth live in kings’ palaces.
LK
7:26
But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, and I tell you, John is more than a prophet.
LK
7:27
This was written about him: ‘I will send my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare the way for you.’ (Malachi 3:1)
LK
7:28
I tell you, John is greater than any other person ever born, but even the least important person in the kingdom of God is greater than John.”
LK
16:16
“The law of Moses and the writings of the prophets were preached until John(bg) came. Since then the Good News about the kingdom of God is being told, and everyone tries to enter it by force.
LK
7:29
(When the people, including the tax collectors, heard this, they all agreed that God’s teaching was good, because they had been baptized by John.
LK
7:30
But the Pharisees and experts on the law refused to accept God’s plan for themselves; they did not let John baptize them.)
MT
11:14
And if you will believe what they said, you will believe that John is Elijah, whom they said would come.
MT
11:15
Let those with ears use them and listen!
LK
7:31
Then Jesus said, “What shall I say about the people of this time? What are they like?
LK
7:32
They are like children sitting in the marketplace, calling to one another and saying, ‘We played music for you, but you did not dance; we sang a sad song, but you did not cry.’
LK
7:33
John the Baptist came and did not eat bread or drink wine, and you say, ‘He has a demon in him.’
LK
7:34
The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and you say, ‘Look at him! He eats too much and drinks too much wine, and he is a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’
LK
7:35
But wisdom is proved to be right by what it does.”
Default Mt 11:7-19 Lk 7:24-35
MT
11:7
As John’s followers were leaving, Jesus began talking to the people about John. Jesus said, “What did you go out into the desert to see? A reed(aj) blown by the wind?
MT
11:8
What did you go out to see? A man dressed in fine clothes? No, those who wear fine clothes live in kings’ palaces.
MT
11:9
So why did you go out? To see a prophet? Yes, and I tell you, John is more than a prophet.
MT
11:10
This was written about him: ‘I will send my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare the way for you.’ (Malachi 3:1)
MT
11:11
I tell you the truth, John the Baptist is greater than any other person ever born, but even the least important person in the kingdom of heaven is greater than John.
MT
11:12
Since the time John the Baptist came until now, the kingdom of heaven has been going forward in strength, and people have been trying to take it by force.
MT
11:13
All the prophets and the law of Moses told about what would happen until the time John came.
MT
11:14
And if you will believe what they said, you will believe that John is Elijah, whom they said would come.
MT
11:15
Let those with ears use them and listen!
MT
11:16
“What can I say about the people of this time? What are they like? They are like children sitting in the marketplace, who call out to each other,
MT
11:17
‘We played music for you, but you did not dance; we sang a sad song, but you did not cry.’
MT
11:18
John came and did not eat or drink like other people. So people say, ‘He has a demon.’
MT
11:19
The Son of Man came, eating and drinking, and people say, ‘Look at him! He eats too much and drinks too much wine, and he is a friend of tax collectors and sinners.’ But wisdom is proved to be right by what she does.”

LK
7:25

Week 18-31 | Jesus Warns Unbelievers
Mt 11:20-24 Lk 10:12-15
Default Mt 11:20-24 Lk 10:12-15
MT
11:20
Then Jesus criticized the cities where he did most of his miracles, because the people did not change their lives and stop sinning.
MT
11:21
He said, “How terrible for you, Korazin! How terrible for you, Bethsaida! If the same miracles I did in you had happened in Tyre and Sidon,(ak) those people would have changed their lives a long time ago. They would have worn rough cloth and put ashes on themselves to show they had changed.
MT
11:22
But I tell you, on the Judgment Day it will be better for Tyre and Sidon than for you.
MT
11:23
And you, Capernaum,(al) will you be lifted up to heaven? No, you will be thrown down to the depths. If the miracles I did in you had happened in Sodom,(am) its people would have stopped sinning, and it would still be a city today.
MT
11:24
But I tell you, on the Judgment Day it will be better for Sodom than for you.”
Default Mt 11:20-24 Lk 10:12-15
MT
11:20
Then Jesus criticized the cities where he did most of his miracles, because the people did not change their lives and stop sinning.
MT
11:21
He said, “How terrible for you, Korazin! How terrible for you, Bethsaida! If the same miracles I did in you had happened in Tyre and Sidon,(ak) those people would have changed their lives a long time ago. They would have worn rough cloth and put ashes on themselves to show they had changed.
MT
11:22
But I tell you, on the Judgment Day it will be better for Tyre and Sidon than for you.
MT
11:23
And you, Capernaum,(al) will you be lifted up to heaven? No, you will be thrown down to the depths. If the miracles I did in you had happened in Sodom,(am) its people would have stopped sinning, and it would still be a city today.
MT
11:24
But I tell you, on the Judgment Day it will be better for Sodom than for you.”
Default Mt 11:20-24 Lk 10:12-15
LK
10:12
I tell you, on the Judgment Day it will be better for the people of Sodom(aj) than for the people of that town.
LK
10:13
“How terrible for you, Korazin! How terrible for you, Bethsaida! If the miracles I did in you had happened in Tyre and Sidon,(ak) those people would have changed their lives long ago. They would have worn rough cloth and put ashes on themselves to show they had changed.
LK
10:14
But on the Judgment Day it will be better for Tyre and Sidon than for you.
LK
10:15
And you, Capernaum,(al) will you be lifted up to heaven? No! You will be thrown down to the depths!
Week 18-31 | Jesus Praises The Father
Mt 11:25-27 Lk 10:21-24
Default Mt 11:25-27 Lk 10:21-24
LK
10:21
Then Jesus rejoiced in the Holy Spirit and said, “I praise you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have hidden these things from the people who are wise and smart. But you have shown them to those who are like little children. Yes, Father, this is what you really wanted.
LK
10:22
“My Father has given me all things. No one knows who the Son is, except the Father. And no one knows who the Father is, except the Son and those whom the Son chooses to tell.”
LK
10:23
Then Jesus turned to his followers and said privately, “You are blessed to see what you now see.
LK
10:24
I tell you, many prophets and kings wanted to see what you now see, but they did not, and they wanted to hear what you now hear, but they did not.”

MT
11:26
Yes, Father, this is what you really wanted.
MT
11:27

10:21
Then Jesus rejoiced in the Holy Spirit and said, “I praise you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have hidden these things from the people who are wise and smart. But you have shown them to those who are like little children. Yes, Father, this is what you really wanted.
LK
10:22

10:24

Week 18-31 | Jesus Offers Easier Burden
Mt 11:28-30
Mt 11:28-30
MT
11:28
“Come to me, all of you who are tired and have heavy loads, and I will give you rest.
MT
11:29
Accept my teachings and learn from me, because I am gentle and humble in spirit, and you will find rest for your lives.
MT
11:30
The burden that I ask you to accept is easy; the load I give you to carry is light.”
Week 18-31 | A Prophet Is Not Honored In His Hometown
Mt 13:53-58 Mk 6:1-6
Default Mt 13:53-58 Mk 6:1-6
MK
6:1
Jesus left there and went to his hometown, and his followers went with him.
MK
6:2
On the Sabbath day he taught in the synagogue. Many people heard him and were amazed, saying, “Where did this man get these teachings? What is this wisdom that has been given to him? And where did he get the power to do miracles?
MK
6:3
He is just the carpenter, the son of Mary and the brother of James, Joseph, Judas, and Simon. And his sisters are here with us.” So the people were upset with Jesus.
MK
6:4
Jesus said to them, “A prophet is honored everywhere except in his hometown and with his own people and in his own home.”
MK
6:5
So Jesus was not able to work any miracles there except to heal a few sick people by putting his hands on them.
MK
6:6
He was amazed at how many people had no faith. Then Jesus went to other villages in that area and taught.
Default Mt 13:53-58 Mk 6:1-6
MT
13:53
When Jesus finished teaching with these stories, he left there.
MT
13:54
He went to his hometown and taught the people in the synagogue, and they were amazed. They said, “Where did this man get this wisdom and this power to do miracles?
MT
13:55
He is just the son of a carpenter. His mother is Mary, and his brothers are James, Joseph, Simon, and Judas.
MT
13:56
And all his sisters are here with us. Where then does this man get all these things?”
MT
13:57
So the people were upset with Jesus. But Jesus said to them, “A prophet is honored everywhere except in his hometown and in his own home.”
MT
13:58
So he did not do many miracles there because they had no faith.
Default Mt 13:53-58 Mk 6:1-6
MK
6:1
Jesus left there and went to his hometown, and his followers went with him.
MK
6:2
On the Sabbath day he taught in the synagogue. Many people heard him and were amazed, saying, “Where did this man get these teachings? What is this wisdom that has been given to him? And where did he get the power to do miracles?
MK
6:3
He is just the carpenter, the son of Mary and the brother of James, Joseph, Judas, and Simon. And his sisters are here with us.” So the people were upset with Jesus.
MK
6:4
Jesus said to them, “A prophet is honored everywhere except in his hometown and with his own people and in his own home.”
MK
6:5
So Jesus was not able to work any miracles there except to heal a few sick people by putting his hands on them.
MK
6:6
He was amazed at how many people had no faith. Then Jesus went to other villages in that area and taught.
Week 18-31 | Jesus Helps A Non-Jewish Woman
Mt 15:21-28 Mk 7:24-30
Default Mt 15:21-28 Mk 7:24-30
MK
7:24
Jesus left that place and went to the area around Tyre.(x) When he went into a house, he did not want anyone to know he was there, but he could not stay hidden.
MT
15:22
A Canaanite woman from that area came to Jesus and cried out, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on me! My daughter has a demon, and she is suffering very much.”
MT
15:23
But Jesus did not answer the woman. So his followers came to Jesus and begged him, “Tell the woman to go away. She is following us and shouting.”
MT
15:24
Jesus answered, “God sent me only to the lost sheep, the people of Israel.”
MT
15:25
Then the woman came to Jesus again and bowed before him and said, “Lord, help me!”
MK
7:27
Jesus told the woman, “It is not right to take the children’s bread and give it to the dogs. First let the children eat all they want.”
MT
15:27
The woman said, “Yes, Lord, but even the dogs eat the crumbs that fall from their masters’ table.”
MT
15:28
Then Jesus answered, “Woman, you have great faith! I will do what you asked.” And at that moment the woman’s daughter was healed.
Default Mt 15:21-28 Mk 7:24-30
MT
15:21
Jesus left that place and went to the area of Tyre and Sidon.
MT
15:22
A Canaanite woman from that area came to Jesus and cried out, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on me! My daughter has a demon, and she is suffering very much.”
MT
15:23
But Jesus did not answer the woman. So his followers came to Jesus and begged him, “Tell the woman to go away. She is following us and shouting.”
MT
15:24
Jesus answered, “God sent me only to the lost sheep, the people of Israel.”
MT
15:25
Then the woman came to Jesus again and bowed before him and said, “Lord, help me!”
MT
15:26
Jesus answered, “It is not right to take the children’s bread and give it to the dogs.”
MT
15:27
The woman said, “Yes, Lord, but even the dogs eat the crumbs that fall from their masters’ table.”
MT
15:28
Then Jesus answered, “Woman, you have great faith! I will do what you asked.” And at that moment the woman’s daughter was healed.
Default Mt 15:21-28 Mk 7:24-30
MK
7:24
Jesus left that place and went to the area around Tyre.(x) When he went into a house, he did not want anyone to know he was there, but he could not stay hidden.
MK
7:25
A woman whose daughter had an evil spirit in her heard that he was there. So she quickly came to Jesus and fell at his feet.
MK
7:26
She was Greek, born in Phoenicia, in Syria. She begged Jesus to force the demon out of her daughter.
MK
7:27
Jesus told the woman, “It is not right to take the children’s bread and give it to the dogs. First let the children eat all they want.”
MK
7:28
But she answered, “Yes, Lord, but even the dogs under the table can eat the children’s crumbs.”
MK
7:29
Then Jesus said, “Because of your answer, you may go. The demon has left your daughter.”
MK
7:30
The woman went home and found her daughter lying in bed; the demon was gone.
Week 18-31 | A Deafmute Healed
Mt 15:29-31 Mk 7:31-37
Default Mt 15:29-31 Mk 7:31-37
MK
7:31
Then Jesus left the area around Tyre and went through Sidon to Lake Galilee, to the area of the Ten Towns.(y)
MK
7:32
While he was there, some people brought a man to him who was deaf and could not talk plainly. The people begged Jesus to put his hand on the man to heal him.
MK
7:33
Jesus led the man away from the crowd, by himself. He put his fingers in the man’s ears and then spit and touched the man’s tongue.
MK
7:34
Looking up to heaven, he sighed and said to the man, “Ephphatha!” (This means, “Be opened.”)
MK
7:35
Instantly the man was able to hear and to use his tongue so that he spoke clearly.
MK
7:36
Jesus commanded the people not to tell anyone about what happened. But the more he commanded them, the more they told about it.
MK
7:37
They were completely amazed and said, “Jesus does everything well. He makes the deaf hear! And those who can’t talk he makes able to speak.”
MT
15:30
Great crowds came to Jesus, bringing with them the lame, the blind, the crippled, those who could not speak, and many others. They put them at Jesus’ feet, and he healed them.
MT
15:31
The crowd was amazed when they saw that people who could not speak before were now able to speak. The crippled were made strong. The lame could walk, and the blind could see. And they praised the God of Israel for this.
Default Mt 15:29-31 Mk 7:31-37
MT
15:29
After leaving there, Jesus went along the shore of Lake Galilee. He went up on a hill and sat there.
MT
15:30
Great crowds came to Jesus, bringing with them the lame, the blind, the crippled, those who could not speak, and many others. They put them at Jesus’ feet, and he healed them.
MT
15:31
The crowd was amazed when they saw that people who could not speak before were now able to speak. The crippled were made strong. The lame could walk, and the blind could see. And they praised the God of Israel for this.
Default Mt 15:29-31 Mk 7:31-37
MK
7:31
Then Jesus left the area around Tyre and went through Sidon to Lake Galilee, to the area of the Ten Towns.(y)
MK
7:32
While he was there, some people brought a man to him who was deaf and could not talk plainly. The people begged Jesus to put his hand on the man to heal him.
MK
7:33
Jesus led the man away from the crowd, by himself. He put his fingers in the man’s ears and then spit and touched the man’s tongue.
MK
7:34
Looking up to heaven, he sighed and said to the man, “Ephphatha!” (This means, “Be opened.”)
MK
7:35
Instantly the man was able to hear and to use his tongue so that he spoke clearly.
MK
7:36
Jesus commanded the people not to tell anyone about what happened. But the more he commanded them, the more they told about it.
MK
7:37
They were completely amazed and said, “Jesus does everything well. He makes the deaf hear! And those who can’t talk he makes able to speak.”
Week 18-31 | Third Galilean Tour
Mt 9:36-38
Mt 9:36-38
MT
9:36
When he saw the crowds, he felt sorry for them because they were hurting and helpless, like sheep without a shepherd.
MT
9:37
Jesus said to his followers, “There are many people to harvest but only a few workers to help harvest them.
MT
9:38
Pray to the Lord, who owns the harvest, that he will send more workers to gather his harvest.”(ag)
Week 18-31 | Sending Out The Twelve Apostles
Mk 6:7-13 Lk 9:1-6
Default Mk 6:7-13 Lk 9:1-6
LK
9:1
Jesus called the twelve apostles together and gave them power and authority over all demons and the ability to heal sicknesses.
LK
9:2
He sent the apostles out to tell about God’s kingdom and to heal the sick.
LK
9:3
He said to them, “Take nothing for your trip, neither a walking stick, bag, bread, money, or extra clothes.
LK
9:4
When you enter a house, stay there until it is time to leave.
LK
9:5
If people do not welcome you, shake the dust off of your feet(ac) as you leave the town, as a warning to them.”
LK
9:6
So the apostles went out and traveled through all the towns, preaching the Good News and healing people everywhere.
Default Mk 6:7-13 Lk 9:1-6
MK
6:7
He called his twelve followers together and got ready to send them out two by two and gave them authority over evil spirits.
MK
6:8
This is what Jesus commanded them: “Take nothing for your trip except a walking stick. Take no bread, no bag, and no money in your pockets.
MK
6:9
Wear sandals, but take only the clothes you are wearing.
MK
6:10
When you enter a house, stay there until you leave that town.
MK
6:11
If the people in a certain place refuse to welcome you or listen to you, leave that place. Shake its dust off your feet(n) as a warning to them.”(o)
MK
6:12
So the followers went out and preached that people should change their hearts and lives.
MK
6:13
They forced many demons out and put olive oil on many sick people and healed them.
Default Mk 6:7-13 Lk 9:1-6
LK
9:1
Jesus called the twelve apostles together and gave them power and authority over all demons and the ability to heal sicknesses.
LK
9:2
He sent the apostles out to tell about God’s kingdom and to heal the sick.
LK
9:3
He said to them, “Take nothing for your trip, neither a walking stick, bag, bread, money, or extra clothes.
LK
9:4
When you enter a house, stay there until it is time to leave.
LK
9:5
If people do not welcome you, shake the dust off of your feet(ac) as you leave the town, as a warning to them.”
LK
9:6
So the apostles went out and traveled through all the towns, preaching the Good News and healing people everywhere.
Week 18-31 | Continue The Galilean Tour
Mt 11:1-1
Mt 11:1-1
MT
11:1
After Jesus finished telling these things to his twelve followers, he left there and went to the towns in Galilee to teach and preach.
Week 31 | Herod Is Tricked To Get John Killed
Mt 14:6-11 Mk 6:21-28
Default Mt 14:6-11 Mk 6:21-28
MK
6:21
Then the perfect time came for Herodias to cause John’s death. On Herod’s birthday, he gave a dinner party for the most important government leaders, the commanders of his army, and the most important people in Galilee.
MK
6:22
When the daughter of Herodias(r) came in and danced, she pleased Herod and the people eating with him. So King Herod said to the girl, “Ask me for anything you want, and I will give it to you.”
MK
6:23
He promised her, “Anything you ask for I will give to you-up to half of my kingdom.”
MK
6:24
The girl went to her mother and asked, “What should I ask for?” Her mother answered, “Ask for the head of John the Baptist.”
MK
6:25
At once the girl went back to the king and said to him, “I want the head of John the Baptist right now on a platter.”
MK
6:26
Although the king was very sad, he had made a promise, and his dinner guests had heard it. So he did not want to refuse what she asked.
MK
6:27
Immediately the king sent a soldier to bring John’s head. The soldier went and cut off John’s head in the prison
MK
6:28
and brought it back on a platter. He gave it to the girl, and the girl gave it to her mother.
Default Mt 14:6-11 Mk 6:21-28
MT
14:6
On Herod’s birthday, the daughter of Herodias danced for Herod and his guests, and she pleased him.
MT
14:7
So he promised with an oath to give her anything she wanted.
MT
14:8
Herodias told her daughter what to ask for, so she said to Herod, “Give me the head of John the Baptist here on a platter.”
MT
14:9
Although King Herod was very sad, he had made a promise, and his dinner guests had heard him. So Herod ordered that what she asked for be done.
MT
14:10
He sent soldiers to the prison to cut off John’s head.
MT
14:11
And they brought it on a platter and gave it to the girl, and she took it to her mother.
Default Mt 14:6-11 Mk 6:21-28

6:21

MK
6:22
When the daughter of Herodias(r) came in and danced, she pleased Herod and the people eating with him. So King Herod said to the girl, “Ask me for anything you want, and I will give it to you.”
MK
6:23

MK
6:24

MK
6:25

MK
6:26

Week 31 | Feast Of Trumpets In Galilee

Week 31 | Jesus Hears About John's Death, The Apostles Return

Default Mt 14:12-13 Mk 6:29-32 Lk 9:10-10 Jn 6:1-1
MT
14:12
John’s followers came and got his body and buried it. Then they went and told Jesus.
LK
9:10
When the apostles returned, they told Jesus everything they had done. Then Jesus took them with him to a town called Bethsaida where they could be alone together.
Default Mt 14:12-13 Mk 6:29-32 Lk 9:10-10 Jn 6:1-1
MT
14:12
John’s followers came and got his body and buried it. Then they went and told Jesus.
MT
14:13
When Jesus heard what had happened to John, he left in a boat and went to a lonely place by himself. But the crowds heard about it and followed him on foot from the towns.
Default Mt 14:12-13 Mk 6:29-32 Lk 9:10-10 Jn 6:1-1

MK
6:30
The apostles gathered around Jesus and told him about all the things they had done and taught.
MK
6:31
Crowds of people were coming and going so that Jesus and his followers did not even have time to eat. He said to them, “Come away by yourselves, and we will go to a lonely place to get some rest.”
MK
6:32
So they went in a boat by themselves to a lonely place.
