5:13
“You are the salt of the earth. But if the salt loses its salty taste, it cannot be made salty again. It is good for nothing, except to be thrown out and walked on.
Default Mt 5:13-13 Mk 9:50-50 Lk 14:34-35
MT
5:13
“You are the salt of the earth. But if the salt loses its salty taste, it cannot be made salty again. It is good for nothing, except to be thrown out and walked on.
Default Mt 5:13-13 Mk 9:50-50 Lk 14:34-35
MK
9:50
“Salt is good, but if the salt loses its salty taste, you cannot make it salty again. So, be full of salt, and have peace with each other.”
Default Mt 5:13-13 Mk 9:50-50 Lk 14:34-35
LK
14:34
“Salt is good, but if it loses its salty taste, you cannot make it salty again.
LK
14:35
It is no good for the soil or for manure; it is thrown away. “Let those with ears use them and listen.”
Week 33 | The Lost Sheep
Mt 18:10-14 Lk 15:1-7
Default Mt 18:10-14 Lk 15:1-7
LK
15:1
The tax collectors and sinners all came to listen to Jesus.
LK
15:2
But the Pharisees and the teachers of the law began to complain: “Look, this man welcomes sinners and even eats with them.”
LK
15:3
Then Jesus told them this story:
LK
15:4
“Suppose one of you has a hundred sheep but loses one of them. Then he will leave the other ninety-nine sheep in the open field and go out and look for the lost sheep until he finds it.
LK
15:5
And when he finds it, he happily puts it on his shoulders
LK
15:6
and goes home. He calls to his friends and neighbors and says, ‘Be happy with me because I found my lost sheep.’
LK
15:7
In the same way, I tell you there is more joy in heaven over one sinner who changes his heart and life, than over ninety-nine good people who don’t need to change.
MT
18:14
In the same way, your Father in heaven does not want any of these little children to be lost.
Default Mt 18:10-14 Lk 15:1-7
MT
18:10
“Be careful. Don’t think these little children are worth nothing. I tell you that they have angels in heaven who are always with my Father in heaven. [
MT
18:11
The Son of Man came to save lost people.](bd)
MT
18:12
“If a man has a hundred sheep but one of the sheep gets lost, he will leave the other ninety-nine on the hill and go to look for the lost sheep.
MT
18:13
I tell you the truth, if he finds it he is happier about that one sheep than about the ninety-nine that were never lost.
MT
18:14
In the same way, your Father in heaven does not want any of these little children to be lost.
Default Mt 18:10-14 Lk 15:1-7
LK
15:1
The tax collectors and sinners all came to listen to Jesus.
LK
15:2
But the Pharisees and the teachers of the law began to complain: “Look, this man welcomes sinners and even eats with them.”
LK
15:3
Then Jesus told them this story:
LK
15:4
“Suppose one of you has a hundred sheep but loses one of them. Then he will leave the other ninety-nine sheep in the open field and go out and look for the lost sheep until he finds it.
LK
15:5
And when he finds it, he happily puts it on his shoulders
LK
15:6
and goes home. He calls to his friends and neighbors and says, ‘Be happy with me because I found my lost sheep.’
LK
15:7
In the same way, I tell you there is more joy in heaven over one sinner who changes his heart and life, than over ninety-nine good people who don’t need to change.
Week 33 | The Lost Coin
Lk 15:8-10
Lk 15:8-10
LK
15:8
“Suppose a woman has ten silver coins,(be) but loses one. She will light a lamp, sweep the house, and look carefully for the coin until she finds it.
LK
15:9
And when she finds it, she will call her friends and neighbors and say, ‘Be happy with me because I have found the coin that I lost.’
LK
15:10
In the same way, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God when one sinner changes his heart and life.”
Week 33 | The Wasteful Son
Lk 15:11-32
Lk 15:11-32
LK
15:11
Then Jesus said, “A man had two sons.
LK
15:12
The younger son said to his father, ‘Give me my share of the property.’ So the father divided the property between his two sons.
LK
15:13
Then the younger son gathered up all that was his and traveled far away to another country. There he wasted his money in foolish living.
LK
15:14
After he had spent everything, a time came when there was no food anywhere in the country, and the son was poor and hungry.
LK
15:15
So he got a job with one of the citizens there who sent the son into the fields to feed pigs.
LK
15:16
The son was so hungry that he wanted to eat the pods the pigs were eating, but no one gave him anything.
LK
15:17
When he realized what he was doing, he thought, ‘All of my father’s servants have plenty of food. But I am here, almost dying with hunger.
LK
15:18
I will leave and return to my father and say to him, “Father, I have sinned against God and against you.
LK
15:19
I am no longer worthy to be called your son, but let me be like one of your servants.”’
LK
15:20
So the son left and went to his father. “While the son was still a long way off, his father saw him and felt sorry for his son. So the father ran to him and hugged and kissed him.
LK
15:21
The son said, ‘Father, I have sinned against God and against you. I am no longer worthy to be called your son.’(bf)
LK
15:22
But the father said to his servants, ‘Hurry! Bring the best clothes and put them on him. Also, put a ring on his finger and sandals on his feet.
LK
15:23
And get our fat calf and kill it so we can have a feast and celebrate.
LK
15:24
My son was dead, but now he is alive again! He was lost, but now he is found!’ So they began to celebrate.
LK
15:25
“The older son was in the field, and as he came closer to the house, he heard the sound of music and dancing.
LK
15:26
So he called to one of the servants and asked what all this meant.
LK
15:27
The servant said, ‘Your brother has come back, and your father killed the fat calf, because your brother came home safely.’
LK
15:28
The older son was angry and would not go in to the feast. So his father went out and begged him to come in.
LK
15:29
But the older son said to his father, ‘I have served you like a slave for many years and have always obeyed your commands. But you never gave me even a young goat to have at a feast with my friends.
LK
15:30
But your other son, who wasted all your money on prostitutes, comes home, and you kill the fat calf for him!’
LK
15:31
The father said to him, ‘Son, you are always with me, and all that I have is yours.
LK
15:32
We had to celebrate and be happy because your brother was dead, but now he is alive. He was lost, but now he is found.’”
Week 33 | Warn Others If They Are Wrong
Mt 18:15-18 Lk 17:3-3
Default Mt 18:15-18 Lk 17:3-3
MT
18:15
“If your fellow believer sins against you,(be) go and tell him in private what he did wrong. If he listens to you, you have helped that person to be your brother or sister again.
MT
18:16
But if he refuses to listen, go to him again and take one or two other people with you. ‘Every case may be proved by two or three witnesses.’(bf)
MT
18:17
If he refuses to listen to them, tell the church. If he refuses to listen to the church, then treat him like a person who does not believe in God or like a tax collector.
MT
18:18
“I tell you the truth, the things you don’t allow on earth will be the things God does not allow. And the things you allow on earth will be the things that God allows.
Default Mt 18:15-18 Lk 17:3-3
MT
18:15
“If your fellow believer sins against you,(be) go and tell him in private what he did wrong. If he listens to you, you have helped that person to be your brother or sister again.
MT
18:16
But if he refuses to listen, go to him again and take one or two other people with you. ‘Every case may be proved by two or three witnesses.’(bf)
MT
18:17
If he refuses to listen to them, tell the church. If he refuses to listen to the church, then treat him like a person who does not believe in God or like a tax collector.
MT
18:18
“I tell you the truth, the things you don’t allow on earth will be the things God does not allow. And the things you allow on earth will be the things that God allows.
Default Mt 18:15-18 Lk 17:3-3
LK
17:3
So be careful! “If another follower sins, warn him, and if he is sorry and stops sinning, forgive him.
Week 33 | Accepting Apology
Mt 18:21-22 Lk 17:4-4
Default Mt 18:21-22 Lk 17:4-4
MT
18:21
Then Peter came to Jesus and asked, “Lord, when my fellow believer sins against me, how many times must I forgive him? Should I forgive him as many as seven times?”
MT
18:22
Jesus answered, “I tell you, you must forgive him more than seven times. You must forgive him even if he wrongs you seventy times seven.
Default Mt 18:21-22 Lk 17:4-4
MT
18:21
Then Peter came to Jesus and asked, “Lord, when my fellow believer sins against me, how many times must I forgive him? Should I forgive him as many as seven times?”
MT
18:22
Jesus answered, “I tell you, you must forgive him more than seven times. You must forgive him even if he wrongs you seventy times seven.
Default Mt 18:21-22 Lk 17:4-4
LK
17:4
If he sins against you seven times in one day and says that he is sorry each time, forgive him.”
Week 33 | If You Come Together In My Name, I Am There With You
Mt 18:19-20
Mt 18:19-20
MT
18:19
“Also, I tell you that if two of you on earth agree about something and pray for it, it will be done for you by my Father in heaven.
MT
18:20
This is true because if two or three people come together in my name, I am there with them.”
Week 33 | An Unforgiving Servant
Mt 18:23-35
Mt 18:23-35
MT
18:23
“The kingdom of heaven is like a king who decided to collect the money his servants owed him.
MT
18:24
When the king began to collect his money, a servant who owed him several million dollars was brought to him.
MT
18:25
But the servant did not have enough money to pay his master, the king. So the master ordered that everything the servant owned should be sold, even the servant’s wife and children. Then the money would be used to pay the king what the servant owed.
MT
18:26
“But the servant fell on his knees and begged, ‘Be patient with me, and I will pay you everything I owe.’
MT
18:27
The master felt sorry for his servant and told him he did not have to pay it back. Then he let the servant go free.
MT
18:28
“Later, that same servant found another servant who owed him a few dollars. The servant grabbed him around the neck and said, ‘Pay me the money you owe me!’
MT
18:29
“The other servant fell on his knees and begged him, ‘Be patient with me, and I will pay you everything I owe.’
MT
18:30
“But the first servant refused to be patient. He threw the other servant into prison until he could pay everything he owed.
MT
18:31
When the other servants saw what had happened, they were very sorry. So they went and told their master all that had happened.
MT
18:32
“Then the master called his servant in and said, ‘You evil servant! Because you begged me to forget what you owed, I told you that you did not have to pay anything.
MT
18:33
You should have showed mercy to that other servant, just as I showed mercy to you.’
MT
18:34
The master was very angry and put the servant in prison to be punished until he could pay everything he owed.
MT
18:35
“This king did what my heavenly Father will do to you if you do not forgive your brother or sister from your heart.”
Week 33-34 | Feast Of Tabernacles In Jerusalem
– +
Week 33 | Jesus Goes To Jerusalem At The Feast Of Tabernacles
Lk 9:51-56 Jn 7:10-13
Default Lk 9:51-56 Jn 7:10-13
LK
9:51
When the time was coming near for Jesus to depart, he was determined to go to Jerusalem.
LK
9:52
He sent some messengers ahead of him, who went into a town in Samaria to make everything ready for him.
LK
9:53
But the people there would not welcome him, because he was set on going to Jerusalem.
LK
9:54
When James and John, followers of Jesus, saw this, they said, “Lord, do you want us to call fire down from heaven and destroy those people?”(af)
LK
9:55
But Jesus turned and scolded them. [And Jesus said, “You don’t know what kind of spirit you belong to.
LK
9:56
The Son of Man did not come to destroy the souls of people but to save them.”](ag) Then they went to another town.
JN
7:11
At the feast some people were looking for him and saying, “Where is that man?”
JN
7:12
Within the large crowd there, many people were whispering to each other about Jesus. Some said, “He is a good man.” Others said, “No, he fools the people.”
JN
7:13
But no one was brave enough to talk about Jesus openly, because they were afraid of the elders.
Default Lk 9:51-56 Jn 7:10-13
LK
9:51
When the time was coming near for Jesus to depart, he was determined to go to Jerusalem.
LK
9:52
He sent some messengers ahead of him, who went into a town in Samaria to make everything ready for him.
LK
9:53
But the people there would not welcome him, because he was set on going to Jerusalem.
LK
9:54
When James and John, followers of Jesus, saw this, they said, “Lord, do you want us to call fire down from heaven and destroy those people?”(af)
LK
9:55
But Jesus turned and scolded them. [And Jesus said, “You don’t know what kind of spirit you belong to.
LK
9:56
The Son of Man did not come to destroy the souls of people but to save them.”](ag) Then they went to another town.
Default Lk 9:51-56 Jn 7:10-13
JN
7:10
But after Jesus’ brothers had gone to the feast, Jesus went also. But he did not let people see him.
JN
7:11
At the feast some people were looking for him and saying, “Where is that man?”
JN
7:12
Within the large crowd there, many people were whispering to each other about Jesus. Some said, “He is a good man.” Others said, “No, he fools the people.”
JN
7:13
But no one was brave enough to talk about Jesus openly, because they were afraid of the elders.
Week 33 | The Ten Lepers
Lk 17:11-19
Lk 17:11-19
LK
17:11
While Jesus was on his way to Jerusalem, he was going through the area between Samaria and Galilee.
LK
17:12
As he came into a small town, ten men who had a skin disease met him there. They did not come close to Jesus
LK
17:13
but called to him, “Jesus! Master! Have mercy on us!”
LK
17:14
When Jesus saw the men, he said, “Go and show yourselves to the priests.”(bh) As the ten men were going, they were healed.
LK
17:15
When one of them saw that he was healed, he went back to Jesus, praising God in a loud voice.
LK
17:16
Then he bowed down at Jesus’ feet and thanked him. (And this man was a Samaritan.)
LK
17:17
Jesus said, “Weren’t ten men healed? Where are the other nine?
LK
17:18
Is this Samaritan the only one who came back to thank God?”
LK
17:19
Then Jesus said to him, “Stand up and go on your way. You were healed because you believed.”
Week 33 | Arrival To Judea To The Other Side Of The Jordan
Mt 19:1-2 Mk 10:1-1
Default Mt 19:1-2 Mk 10:1-1
MT
19:1
After Jesus said all these things, he left Galilee and went into the area of Judea on the other side of the Jordan River.
MT
19:2
Large crowds followed him, and he healed them there.
Default Mt 19:1-2 Mk 10:1-1
MT
19:1
After Jesus said all these things, he left Galilee and went into the area of Judea on the other side of the Jordan River.
MT
19:2
Large crowds followed him, and he healed them there.
Default Mt 19:1-2 Mk 10:1-1
MK
10:1
Then Jesus left that place and went into the area of Judea and across the Jordan River. Again, crowds came to him, and he taught them as he usually did.
Week 34 | Teaching In The Temple At Feast Of Tabernacles
Jn 7:14-36
Jn 7:14-36
JN
7:14
When the feast was about half over, Jesus went to the Temple and began to teach.
JN
7:15
The people were amazed and said, “This man has never studied in school. How did he learn so much?”
JN
7:16
Jesus answered, “The things I teach are not my own, but they come from him who sent me.
JN
7:17
If people choose to do what God wants, they will know that my teaching comes from God and not from me.
JN
7:18
Those who teach their own ideas are trying to get honor for themselves. But those who try to bring honor to the one who sent them speak the truth, and there is nothing false in them.
JN
7:19
Moses gave you the law,(ab) but none of you obeys that law. Why are you trying to kill me?”
JN
7:20
The people answered, “A demon has come into you. We are not trying to kill you.”
JN
7:21
Jesus said to them, “I did one miracle, and you are all amazed.
JN
7:22
Moses gave you the law about circumcision. (But really Moses did not give you circumcision; it came from our ancestors.) And yet you circumcise a baby boy on a Sabbath day.
JN
7:23
If a baby boy can be circumcised on a Sabbath day to obey the law of Moses, why are you angry at me for healing a person’s whole body on the Sabbath day?
JN
7:24
Stop judging by the way things look, but judge by what is really right.” Is Jesus the Christ?
JN
7:25
Then some of the people who lived in Jerusalem said, “This is the man they are trying to kill.
JN
7:26
But he is teaching where everyone can see and hear him, and no one is trying to stop him. Maybe the leaders have decided he really is the Christ.
JN
7:27
But we know where this man is from. Yet when the real Christ comes, no one will know where he comes from.”
JN
7:28
Jesus, teaching in the Temple, cried out, “Yes, you know me, and you know where I am from. But I have not come by my own authority. I was sent by the One who is true, whom you don’t know.
JN
7:29
But I know him, because I am from him, and he sent me.”
JN
7:30
When Jesus said this, they tried to seize him. But no one was able to touch him, because it was not yet the right time.
JN
7:31
But many of the people believed in Jesus. They said, “When the Christ comes, will he do more miracles than this man has done?”
JN
7:32
The Pharisees heard the crowd whispering these things about Jesus. So the leading priests and the Pharisees sent some Temple guards to arrest him.
JN
7:33
Jesus said, “I will be with you a little while longer. Then I will go back to the One who sent me.
JN
7:34
You will look for me, but you will not find me. And you cannot come where I am.”
JN
7:35
Some people said to each other, “Where will this man go so we cannot find him? Will he go to the Greek cities where our people live and teach the Greek people there?
JN
7:36
What did he mean when he said, ‘You will look for me, but you will not find me,’ and ‘You cannot come where I am’?”
Week 34 | Last Great Day Of Tabernacles
Jn 7:37-53
Jn 7:37-53
JN
7:37
On the last and most important day of the feast Jesus stood up and said in a loud voice, “Let anyone who is thirsty come to me and drink.
JN
7:38
If anyone believes in me, rivers of living water will flow out from that person’s heart, as the Scripture says.”
JN
7:39
Jesus was talking about the Holy Spirit. The Spirit had not yet been given, because Jesus had not yet been raised to glory. But later, those who believed in Jesus would receive the Spirit.
JN
7:40
When the people heard Jesus’ words, some of them said, “This man really is the Prophet.”(ac)
JN
7:41
Others said, “He is the Christ.” Still others said, “The Christ will not come from Galilee.
JN
7:42
The Scripture says that the Christ will come from David’s family and from Bethlehem, the town where David lived.”
JN
7:43
So the people did not agree with each other about Jesus.
JN
7:44
Some of them wanted to arrest him, but no one was able to touch him.
JN
7:45
The Temple guards went back to the leading priests and the Pharisees, who asked, “Why didn’t you bring Jesus?”
JN
7:46
The guards answered, “The words he says are greater than the words of any other person who has ever spoken!”
JN
7:47
The Pharisees answered, “So Jesus has fooled you also!
JN
7:48
Have any of the leaders or the Pharisees believed in him? No!
JN
7:49
But these people, who know nothing about the law, are under God’s curse.”
JN
7:50
Nicodemus, who had gone to see Jesus before, was in that group.(ad) He said,
JN
7:51
“Our law does not judge a person without hearing him and knowing what he has done.”
JN
7:52
They answered, “Are you from Galilee, too? Study the Scriptures, and you will learn that no prophet comes from Galilee.”
JN
7:53
And everyone left and went home.
Week 34 | The Woman Caught In Adultery
Jn 8:1-11
Jn 8:1-11
JN
8:1
Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.
JN
8:2
But early in the morning he went back to the Temple, and all the people came to him, and he sat and taught them.
JN
8:3
The teachers of the law and the Pharisees brought a woman who had been caught in adultery. They forced her to stand before the people.
JN
8:4
They said to Jesus, “Teacher, this woman was caught having sexual relations with a man who is not her husband.
JN
8:5
The law of Moses commands that we stone to death every woman who does this. What do you say we should do?”
JN
8:6
They were asking this to trick Jesus so that they could have some charge against him. But Jesus bent over and started writing on the ground with his finger.
JN
8:7
When they continued to ask Jesus their question, he raised up and said, “Anyone here who has never sinned can throw the first stone at her.”
JN
8:8
Then Jesus bent over again and wrote on the ground.
JN
8:9
Those who heard Jesus began to leave one by one, first the older men and then the others. Jesus was left there alone with the woman standing before him.
JN
8:10
Jesus raised up again and asked her, “Woman, where are they? Has no one judged you guilty?”
JN
8:11
She answered, “No one, sir.” Then Jesus said, “I also don’t judge you guilty. You may go now, but don’t sin anymore.”]
Week 34 | Jesus Declares: I Am The Light Of The World
Jn 8:12-30
Jn 8:12-30
JN
8:12
Later, Jesus talked to the people again, saying, “I am the light of the world. The person who follows me will never live in darkness but will have the light that gives life.”
JN
8:13
The Pharisees said to Jesus, “When you talk about yourself, you are the only one to say these things are true. We cannot accept what you say.”
JN
8:14
Jesus answered, “Yes, I am saying these things about myself, but they are true. I know where I came from and where I am going. But you don’t know where I came from or where I am going.
JN
8:15
You judge by human standards. I am not judging anyone.
JN
8:16
But when I do judge, I judge truthfully, because I am not alone. The Father who sent me is with me.
JN
8:17
Your own law says that when two witnesses say the same thing, you must accept what they say.
JN
8:18
I am one of the witnesses who speaks about myself, and the Father who sent me is the other witness.”
JN
8:19
They asked, “Where is your father?” Jesus answered, “You don’t know me or my Father. If you knew me, you would know my Father, too.”
JN
8:20
Jesus said these things while he was teaching in the Temple, near where the money is kept. But no one arrested him, because the right time for him had not yet come.
JN
8:21
Again, Jesus said to the people, “I will leave you, and you will look for me, but you will die in your sins. You cannot come where I am going.”
JN
8:22
So the Jews asked, “Will he kill himself? Is that why he said, ‘You cannot come where I am going’?”
JN
8:23
Jesus said, “You people are from here below, but I am from above. You belong to this world, but I don’t belong to this world.
JN
8:24
So I told you that you would die in your sins. Yes, you will die in your sins if you don’t believe that I am he.”
JN
8:25
They asked, “Then who are you?” Jesus answered, “I am what I have told you from the beginning.
JN
8:26
I have many things to say and decide about you. But I tell people only the things I have heard from the One who sent me, and he speaks the truth.”
JN
8:27
The people did not understand that he was talking to them about the Father.
JN
8:28
So Jesus said to them, “When you lift up the Son of Man, you will know that I am he. You will know that these things I do are not by my own authority but that I say only what the Father has taught me.
JN
8:29
The One who sent me is with me. I always do what is pleasing to him, so he has not left me alone.”
JN
8:30
While Jesus was saying these things, many people believed in him.
Week 34 | The True Sons Of The Heavenly Father
Jn 8:31-59
Jn 8:31-59
JN
8:31
So Jesus said to the Jews who believed in him, “If you continue to obey my teaching, you are truly my followers.
JN
8:32
Then you will know the truth, and the truth will make you free.”
JN
8:33
They answered, “We are Abraham’s children, and we have never been anyone’s slaves. So why do you say we will be free?”
JN
8:34
Jesus answered, “I tell you the truth, everyone who lives in sin is a slave to sin.
JN
8:35
A slave does not stay with a family forever, but a son belongs to the family forever.
JN
8:36
So if the Son makes you free, you will be truly free.
JN
8:37
I know you are Abraham’s children, but you want to kill me because you don’t accept my teaching.
JN
8:38
I am telling you what my Father has shown me, but you do what your father has told you.”
JN
8:39
They answered, “Our father is Abraham.” Jesus said, “If you were really Abraham’s children, you would do(ae) the things Abraham did.
JN
8:40
I am a man who has told you the truth which I heard from God, but you are trying to kill me. Abraham did nothing like that.
JN
8:41
So you are doing the things your own father did.” But they said, “We are not like children who never knew who their father was. God is our Father; he is the only Father we have.”
JN
8:42
Jesus said to them, “If God were really your Father, you would love me, because I came from God and now I am here. I did not come by my own authority; God sent me.
JN
8:43
You don’t understand what I say, because you cannot accept my teaching.
JN
8:44
You belong to your father the devil, and you want to do what he wants. He was a murderer from the beginning and was against the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he tells a lie, he shows what he is really like, because he is a liar and the father of lies.
JN
8:45
But because I speak the truth, you don’t believe me.
JN
8:46
Can any of you prove that I am guilty of sin? If I am telling the truth, why don’t you believe me?
JN
8:47
The person who belongs to God accepts what God says. But you don’t accept what God says, because you don’t belong to God.”
JN
8:48
They answered, “We say you are a Samaritan and have a demon in you. Are we not right?”
JN
8:49
Jesus answered, “I have no demon in me. I give honor to my Father, but you dishonor me.
JN
8:50
I am not trying to get honor for myself. There is One who wants this honor for me, and he is the judge.
JN
8:51
I tell you the truth, whoever obeys my teaching will never die.”
JN
8:52
They said to Jesus, “Now we know that you have a demon in you! Even Abraham and the prophets died. But you say, ‘Whoever obeys my teaching will never die.’
JN
8:53
Do you think you are greater than our father Abraham, who died? And the prophets died, too. Who do you think you are?”
JN
8:54
Jesus answered, “If I give honor to myself, that honor is worth nothing. The One who gives me honor is my Father, and you say he is your God.
JN
8:55
You don’t really know him, but I know him. If I said I did not know him, I would be a liar like you. But I do know him, and I obey what he says.
JN
8:56
Your father Abraham was very happy that he would see my day. He saw that day and was glad.”
JN
8:57
They said to him, “You have never seen Abraham! You are not even fifty years old.”
JN
8:58
Jesus answered, “I tell you the truth, before Abraham was even born, I am!”
JN
8:59
When Jesus said this, the people picked up stones to throw at him. But Jesus hid himself, and then he left the Temple.
Week 35 | The Man Born Blind
Jn 9:1-41
Jn 9:1-41
JN
9:1
As Jesus was walking along, he saw a man who had been born blind.
JN
9:2
His followers asked him, “Teacher, whose sin caused this man to be born blind-his own sin or his parents’ sin?”
JN
9:3
Jesus answered, “It is not this man’s sin or his parents’ sin that made him blind. This man was born blind so that God’s power could be shown in him.
JN
9:4
While it is daytime, we must continue doing the work of the One who sent me. Night is coming, when no one can work.
JN
9:5
While I am in the world, I am the light of the world.”
JN
9:6
After Jesus said this, he spit on the ground and made some mud with it and put the mud on the man’s eyes.
JN
9:7
Then he told the man, “Go and wash in the Pool of Siloam.” (Siloam means Sent.) So the man went, washed, and came back seeing.
JN
9:8
The neighbors and some people who had earlier seen this man begging said, “Isn’t this the same man who used to sit and beg?”
JN
9:9
Some said, “He is the one,” but others said, “No, he only looks like him.” The man himself said, “I am the man.”
JN
9:10
They asked, “How did you get your sight?”
JN
9:11
He answered, “The man named Jesus made some mud and put it on my eyes. Then he told me to go to Siloam and wash. So I went and washed, and then I could see.”
JN
9:12
They asked him, “Where is this man?” “I don’t know,” he answered.
JN
9:13
Then the people took to the Pharisees the man who had been blind.
JN
9:14
The day Jesus had made mud and healed his eyes was a Sabbath day.
JN
9:15
So now the Pharisees asked the man, “How did you get your sight?” He answered, “He put mud on my eyes, I washed, and now I see.”
JN
9:16
So some of the Pharisees were saying, “This man does not keep the Sabbath day, so he is not from God.” But others said, “A man who is a sinner can’t do miracles like these.” So they could not agree with each other.
JN
9:17
They asked the man again, “What do you say about him since it was your eyes he opened?” The man answered, “He is a prophet.”
JN
9:18
These leaders did not believe that he had been blind and could now see again. So they sent for the man’s parents
JN
9:19
and asked them, “Is this your son who you say was born blind? Then how does he now see?”
JN
9:20
His parents answered, “We know that this is our son and that he was born blind.
JN
9:21
But we don’t know how he can now see. We don’t know who opened his eyes. Ask him. He is old enough to speak for himself.”
JN
9:22
His parents said this because they were afraid of the elders, who had already decided that anyone who said Jesus was the Christ would be avoided.
JN
9:23
That is why his parents said, “He is old enough. Ask him.”
JN
9:24
So for the second time, they called the man who had been blind. They said, “You should give God the glory by telling the truth. We know that this man is a sinner.”
JN
9:25
He answered, “I don’t know if he is a sinner. One thing I do know: I was blind, and now I see.”
JN
9:26
They asked, “What did he do to you? How did he make you see again?”
JN
9:27
He answered, “I already told you, and you didn’t listen. Why do you want to hear it again? Do you want to become his followers, too?”
JN
9:28
Then they insulted him and said, “You are his follower, but we are followers of Moses.
JN
9:29
We know that God spoke to Moses, but we don’t even know where this man comes from.”
JN
9:30
The man answered, “This is a very strange thing. You don’t know where he comes from, and yet he opened my eyes.
JN
9:31
We all know that God does not listen to sinners, but he listens to anyone who worships and obeys him.
JN
9:32
Nobody has ever heard of anyone giving sight to a man born blind.
JN
9:33
If this man were not from God, he could do nothing.”
JN
9:34
They answered, “You were born full of sin! Are you trying to teach us?” And they threw him out.
JN
9:35
When Jesus heard that they had thrown him out, Jesus found him and said, “Do you believe in the Son of Man?”
JN
9:36
He asked, “Who is the Son of Man, sir, so that I can believe in him?”
JN
9:37
Jesus said to him, “You have seen him. The Son of Man is the one talking with you.”
JN
9:38
He said, “Lord, I believe!” Then the man worshiped Jesus.
JN
9:39
Jesus said, “I came into this world so that the world could be judged. I came so that the blind(af) would see and so that those who see will become blind.”
JN
9:40
Some of the Pharisees who were nearby heard Jesus say this and asked, “Are you saying we are blind, too?”
JN
9:41
Jesus said, “If you were blind, you would not be guilty of sin. But since you keep saying you see, your guilt remains.”
Week 35-43 | Ministry In Judea
– +
Week 35-36 | The Good Shepherd Gives His Life For The Sheep
Jn 10:1-21
Jn 10:1-21
JN
10:1
Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, the person who does not enter the sheepfold by the door, but climbs in some other way, is a thief and a robber.
JN
10:2
The one who enters by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.
JN
10:3
The one who guards the door opens it for him. And the sheep listen to the voice of the shepherd. He calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.
JN
10:4
When he brings all his sheep out, he goes ahead of them, and they follow him because they know his voice.
JN
10:5
But they will never follow a stranger. They will run away from him because they don’t know his voice.”
JN
10:6
Jesus told the people this story, but they did not understand what it meant.
JN
10:7
So Jesus said again, “I tell you the truth, I am the door for the sheep.
JN
10:8
All the people who came before me were thieves and robbers. The sheep did not listen to them.
JN
10:9
I am the door, and the person who enters through me will be saved and will be able to come in and go out and find pasture.
JN
10:10
A thief comes to steal and kill and destroy, but I came to give life-life in all its fullness.
JN
10:11
“I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd gives his life for the sheep.
JN
10:12
The worker who is paid to keep the sheep is different from the shepherd who owns them. When the worker sees a wolf coming, he runs away and leaves the sheep alone. Then the wolf attacks the sheep and scatters them.
JN
10:13
The man runs away because he is only a paid worker and does not really care about the sheep.
JN
10:14
“I am the good shepherd. I know my sheep, and my sheep know me,
JN
10:15
just as the Father knows me, and I know the Father. I give my life for the sheep.
JN
10:16
I have other sheep that are not in this flock, and I must bring them also. They will listen to my voice, and there will be one flock and one shepherd.
JN
10:17
The Father loves me because I give my life so that I can take it back again.
JN
10:18
No one takes it away from me; I give my own life freely. I have the right to give my life, and I have the right to take it back. This is what my Father commanded me to do.”
JN
10:19
Again the leaders did not agree with each other because of these words of Jesus.
JN
10:20
Many of them said, “A demon has come into him and made him crazy. Why listen to him?”
JN
10:21
But others said, “A man who is crazy with a demon does not say things like this. Can a demon open the eyes of the blind?”
Week 35-36 | Sending Out Seventy-Two Followers
Lk 10:1-11
Lk 10:1-11
LK
10:1
After this, the Lord chose seventy-two(ah) others and sent them out in pairs ahead of him into every town and place where he planned to go.
LK
10:2
He said to them, “There are a great many people to harvest, but there are only a few workers. So pray to God, who owns the harvest, that he will send more workers to help gather his harvest.
LK
10:3
Go now, but listen! I am sending you out like sheep among wolves.
LK
10:4
Don’t carry a purse, a bag, or sandals, and don’t waste time talking with people on the road.
LK
10:5
Before you go into a house, say, ‘Peace be with this house.’
LK
10:6
If peace-loving people live there, your blessing of peace will stay with them, but if not, then your blessing will come back to you.
LK
10:7
Stay in the same house, eating and drinking what the people there give you. A worker should be given his pay. Don’t move from house to house.
LK
10:8
If you go into a town and the people welcome you, eat what they give you.
LK
10:9
Heal the sick who live there, and tell them, ‘The kingdom of God is near you.’
LK
10:10
But if you go into a town, and the people don’t welcome you, then go into the streets and say,
LK
10:11
‘Even the dirt from your town that sticks to our feet we wipe off against you.(ai) But remember that the kingdom of God is near.’
Week 36-43 | Who Is My Neighbor?
Lk 10:25-37
Lk 10:25-37
LK
10:25
Then an expert on the law stood up to test Jesus, saying, “Teacher, what must I do to get life forever?”
LK
10:26
Jesus said, “What is written in the law? What do you read there?”
LK
10:27
The man answered, “Love the Lord your God with all your heart, all your soul, all your strength, and all your mind.”(an) Also, “Love your neighbor as you love yourself.”(ao)
LK
10:28
Jesus said to him, “Your answer is right. Do this and you will live.”
LK
10:29
But the man, wanting to show the importance of his question, said to Jesus, “And who is my neighbor?”
LK
10:30
Jesus answered, “As a man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho, some robbers attacked him. They tore off his clothes, beat him, and left him lying there, almost dead.
LK
10:31
It happened that a priest was going down that road. When he saw the man, he walked by on the other side.
LK
10:32
Next, a Levite(ap) came there, and after he went over and looked at the man, he walked by on the other side of the road.
LK
10:33
Then a Samaritan(aq) traveling down the road came to where the hurt man was. When he saw the man, he felt very sorry for him.
LK
10:34
The Samaritan went to him, poured olive oil and wine(ar) on his wounds, and bandaged them. Then he put the hurt man on his own donkey and took him to an inn where he cared for him.
LK
10:35
The next day, the Samaritan brought out two coins,(as) gave them to the innkeeper, and said, ‘Take care of this man. If you spend more money on him, I will pay it back to you when I come again.’”
LK
10:36
Then Jesus said, “Which one of these three men do you think was a neighbor to the man who was attacked by the robbers?”
LK
10:37
The expert on the law answered, “The one who showed him mercy.” Jesus said to him, “Then go and do what he did.”
Week 36-43 | Mary And Martha
Lk 10:38-42
Lk 10:38-42
LK
10:38
While Jesus and his followers were traveling, Jesus went into a town. A woman named Martha let Jesus stay at her house.
LK
10:39
Martha had a sister named Mary, who was sitting at Jesus’ feet and listening to him teach.
LK
10:40
But Martha was busy with all the work to be done. She went in and said, “Lord, don’t you care that my sister has left me alone to do all the work? Tell her to help me.”
LK
10:41
But the Lord answered her, “Martha, Martha, you are worried and upset about many things.
LK
10:42
Only one thing is important. Mary has chosen the better thing, and it will never be taken away from her.”
Week 36-43 | Urgent Need
Lk 11:5-8
Lk 11:5-8
LK
11:5
Then Jesus said to them, “Suppose one of you went to your friend’s house at midnight and said to him, ‘Friend, loan me three loaves of bread.
LK
11:6
A friend of mine has come into town to visit me, but I have nothing for him to eat.’
LK
11:7
Your friend inside the house answers, ‘Don’t bother me! The door is already locked, and my children and I are in bed. I cannot get up and give you anything.’
LK
11:8
I tell you, if friendship is not enough to make him get up to give you the bread, your boldness will make him get up and give you whatever you need.
Week 36-43 | Ask, And God Will Give To You
Mt 7:7-11 Lk 11:9-13
Default Mt 7:7-11 Lk 11:9-13
LK
11:9
So I tell you, ask, and God will give to you. Search, and you will find. Knock, and the door will open for you.
LK
11:10
Yes, everyone who asks will receive. The one who searches will find. And everyone who knocks will have the door opened.
LK
11:11
If your children ask for(au) a fish, which of you would give them a snake instead?
LK
11:12
Or, if your children ask for an egg, would you give them a scorpion?
LK
11:13
Even though you are bad, you know how to give good things to your children. How much more your heavenly Father will give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him!”
Default Mt 7:7-11 Lk 11:9-13
MT
7:7
“Ask, and God will give to you. Search, and you will find. Knock, and the door will open for you.
MT
7:8
Yes, everyone who asks will receive. Everyone who searches will find. And everyone who knocks will have the door opened.
MT
7:9
“If your children ask for bread, which of you would give them a stone?
MT
7:10
Or if your children ask for a fish, would you give them a snake?
MT
7:11
Even though you are bad, you know how to give good gifts to your children. How much more your heavenly Father will give good things to those who ask him!
Default Mt 7:7-11 Lk 11:9-13
LK
11:9
So I tell you, ask, and God will give to you. Search, and you will find. Knock, and the door will open for you.
LK
11:10
Yes, everyone who asks will receive. The one who searches will find. And everyone who knocks will have the door opened.
LK
11:11
If your children ask for(au) a fish, which of you would give them a snake instead?
LK
11:12
Or, if your children ask for an egg, would you give them a scorpion?
LK
11:13
Even though you are bad, you know how to give good things to your children. How much more your heavenly Father will give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him!”
Week 36-43 | Eye Is A Light For The Body
Mt 6:22-23 Lk 11:33-36
Default Mt 6:22-23 Lk 11:33-36
LK
11:33
“No one lights a lamp and puts it in a secret place or under a bowl, but on a lampstand so the people who come in can see.
MT
6:22
“The eye is a light for the body. If your eyes are good, your whole body will be full of light.
MT
6:23
But if your eyes are evil, your whole body will be full of darkness. And if the only light you have is really darkness, then you have the worst darkness.
LK
11:35
So be careful not to let the light in you become darkness.
LK
11:36
If your whole body is full of light, and none of it is dark, then you will shine bright, as when a lamp shines on you.”
Default Mt 6:22-23 Lk 11:33-36
MT
6:22
“The eye is a light for the body. If your eyes are good, your whole body will be full of light.
MT
6:23
But if your eyes are evil, your whole body will be full of darkness. And if the only light you have is really darkness, then you have the worst darkness.
Default Mt 6:22-23 Lk 11:33-36
LK
11:33
“No one lights a lamp and puts it in a secret place or under a bowl, but on a lampstand so the people who come in can see.
LK
11:34
Your eye is a light for the body. When your eyes are good, your whole body will be full of light. But when your eyes are evil, your whole body will be full of darkness.
LK
11:35
So be careful not to let the light in you become darkness.
LK
11:36
If your whole body is full of light, and none of it is dark, then you will shine bright, as when a lamp shines on you.”
Week 36-43 | Return Of The Seventy-Two
Lk 10:17-20
Lk 10:17-20
LK
10:17
When the seventy-two(am) came back, they were very happy and said, “Lord, even the demons obeyed us when we used your name!”
LK
10:18
Jesus said, “I saw Satan fall like lightning from heaven.
LK
10:19
Listen, I have given you power to walk on snakes and scorpions, power that is greater than the enemy has. So nothing will hurt you.
LK
10:20
But you should not be happy because the spirits obey you but because your names are written in heaven.”
Week 36-43 | Fear God, Not People
Mt 10:26-31 Lk 12:1-7
Default Mt 10:26-31 Lk 12:1-7
LK
12:1
So many thousands of people had gathered that they were stepping on each other. Jesus spoke first to his followers, saying, “Beware of the yeast of the Pharisees, because they are hypocrites.
LK
12:2
Everything that is hidden will be shown, and everything that is secret will be made known.
LK
12:3
What you have said in the dark will be heard in the light, and what you have whispered in an inner room will be shouted from the housetops.
LK
12:4
“I tell you, my friends, don’t be afraid of people who can kill the body but after that can do nothing more to hurt you.
LK
12:5
I will show you the one to fear. Fear the one who has the power to kill you and also to throw you into hell. Yes, this is the one you should fear.
LK
12:6
“Five sparrows are sold for only two pennies, and God does not forget any of them.
LK
12:7
But God even knows how many hairs you have on your head. Don’t be afraid. You are worth much more than many sparrows.
Default Mt 10:26-31 Lk 12:1-7
MT
10:26
“So don’t be afraid of those people, because everything that is hidden will be shown. Everything that is secret will be made known.
MT
10:27
I tell you these things in the dark, but I want you to tell them in the light. What you hear whispered in your ear you should shout from the housetops.
MT
10:28
Don’t be afraid of people, who can kill the body but cannot kill the soul. The only one you should fear is the one who can destroy the soul and the body in hell.
MT
10:29
Two sparrows cost only a penny, but not even one of them can die without your Father’s knowing it.
MT
10:30
God even knows how many hairs are on your head.
MT
10:31
So don’t be afraid. You are worth much more than many sparrows.
Default Mt 10:26-31 Lk 12:1-7
LK
12:1
So many thousands of people had gathered that they were stepping on each other. Jesus spoke first to his followers, saying, “Beware of the yeast of the Pharisees, because they are hypocrites.
LK
12:2
Everything that is hidden will be shown, and everything that is secret will be made known.
LK
12:3
What you have said in the dark will be heard in the light, and what you have whispered in an inner room will be shouted from the housetops.
LK
12:4
“I tell you, my friends, don’t be afraid of people who can kill the body but after that can do nothing more to hurt you.
LK
12:5
I will show you the one to fear. Fear the one who has the power to kill you and also to throw you into hell. Yes, this is the one you should fear.
LK
12:6
“Five sparrows are sold for only two pennies, and God does not forget any of them.
LK
12:7
But God even knows how many hairs you have on your head. Don’t be afraid. You are worth much more than many sparrows.
Week 36-43 | Tell People About Your Faith
Mt 10:32-33 Lk 12:8-9
Default Mt 10:32-33 Lk 12:8-9
MT
10:32
“All those who stand before others and say they believe in me, I will say before my Father in heaven that they belong to me.
MT
10:33
But all who stand before others and say they do not believe in me, I will say before my Father in heaven that they do not belong to me.
Default Mt 10:32-33 Lk 12:8-9
MT
10:32
“All those who stand before others and say they believe in me, I will say before my Father in heaven that they belong to me.
MT
10:33
But all who stand before others and say they do not believe in me, I will say before my Father in heaven that they do not belong to me.
Default Mt 10:32-33 Lk 12:8-9
LK
12:8
“I tell you, all those who stand before others and say they believe in me, I, the Son of Man, will say before the angels of God that they belong to me.
LK
12:9
But all who stand before others and say they do not believe in me, I will say before the angels of God that they do not belong to me.
Week 36-43 | Greed
Lk 12:13-21
Lk 12:13-21
LK
12:13
Someone in the crowd said to Jesus, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide with me the property our father left us.”
LK
12:14
But Jesus said to him, “Who said I should judge or decide between you?”
LK
12:15
Then Jesus said to them, “Be careful and guard against all kinds of greed. Life is not measured by how much one owns.”
LK
12:16
Then Jesus told this story: “There was a rich man who had some land, which grew a good crop.
LK
12:17
He thought to himself, ‘What will I do? I have no place to keep all my crops.’
LK
12:18
Then he said, ‘This is what I will do: I will tear down my barns and build bigger ones, and there I will store all my grain and other goods.
LK
12:19
Then I can say to myself, “I have enough good things stored to last for many years. Rest, eat, drink, and enjoy life!”’
LK
12:20
“But God said to him, ‘Foolish man! Tonight your life will be taken from you. So who will get those things you have prepared for yourself?’
LK
12:21
“This is how it will be for those who store up things for themselves and are not rich toward God.”
Week 36-43 | Seek God And God Takes Care Of You
Mt 6:25-34 Lk 12:22-32
Default Mt 6:25-34 Lk 12:22-32
MT
6:25
“So I tell you, don’t worry about the food or drink you need to live, or about the clothes you need for your body. Life is more than food, and the body is more than clothes.
MT
6:26
Look at the birds in the air. They don’t plant or harvest or store food in barns, but your heavenly Father feeds them. And you know that you are worth much more than the birds.
MT
6:27
You cannot add any time to your life by worrying about it.
LK
12:26
If you cannot do even the little things, then why worry about the big things?
MT
6:28
“And why do you worry about clothes? Look at how the lilies in the field grow. They don’t work or make clothes for themselves.
MT
6:29
But I tell you that even Solomon with his riches was not dressed as beautifully as one of these flowers.
MT
6:30
God clothes the grass in the field, which is alive today but tomorrow is thrown into the fire. So you can be even more sure that God will clothe you. Don’t have so little faith!
MT
6:31
Don’t worry and say, ‘What will we eat?’ or ‘What will we drink?’ or ‘What will we wear?’
MT
6:32
The people who don’t know God keep trying to get these things, and your Father in heaven knows you need them.
MT
6:33
Seek first God’s kingdom and what God wants. Then all your other needs will be met as well.
LK
12:32
“Don’t fear, little flock, because your Father wants to give you the kingdom.
MT
6:34
So don’t worry about tomorrow, because tomorrow will have its own worries. Each day has enough trouble of its own.
Default Mt 6:25-34 Lk 12:22-32
MT
6:25
“So I tell you, don’t worry about the food or drink you need to live, or about the clothes you need for your body. Life is more than food, and the body is more than clothes.
MT
6:26
Look at the birds in the air. They don’t plant or harvest or store food in barns, but your heavenly Father feeds them. And you know that you are worth much more than the birds.
MT
6:27
You cannot add any time to your life by worrying about it.
MT
6:28
“And why do you worry about clothes? Look at how the lilies in the field grow. They don’t work or make clothes for themselves.
MT
6:29

MT
6:30

MT
6:31

MT
6:32

MT
6:33

MT
6:34

Default Mt 6:25-34 Lk 12:22-32
LK
12:22
Jesus said to his followers, “So I tell you, don’t worry about the food you need to live, or about the clothes you need for your body.
LK
12:23
Life is more than food, and the body is more than clothes.
LK
12:24
Look at the birds. They don’t plant or harvest, they don’t have storerooms or barns, but God feeds them. And you are worth much more than birds.
LK
12:25
You cannot add any time to your life by worrying about it.
LK
12:26
If you cannot do even the little things, then why worry about the big things?
LK
12:27
Consider how the lilies grow; they don’t work or make clothes for themselves. But I tell you that even Solomon with his riches was not dressed as beautifully as one of these flowers.
LK
12:28
God clothes the grass in the field, which is alive today but tomorrow is thrown into the fire. So how much more will God clothe you? Don’t have so little faith!
LK
12:29
Don’t always think about what you will eat or what you will drink, and don’t keep worrying.
LK
12:30
All the people in the world are trying to get these things, and your Father knows you need them.
LK
12:31
But seek God’s kingdom, and all your other needs will be met as well.
LK
12:32
“Don’t fear, little flock, because your Father wants to give you the kingdom.

MT
6:20
But store your treasures in heaven where they cannot be destroyed by moths or rust and where thieves cannot break in and steal them.
MT
6:21
Your heart will be where your treasure is.

6:19
“Don’t store treasures for yourselves here on earth where moths and rust will destroy them and thieves can break in and steal them.
MT
6:20

MT
6:21
Your heart will be where your treasure is.

12:33
Sell your possessions and give to the poor. Get for yourselves purses that will not wear out, the treasure in heaven that never runs out, where thieves can’t steal and moths can’t destroy.
LK
12:34
Your heart will be where your treasure is.
Week 36-43 | I Have Come To Separate The Trues And The Falses
Mt 10:34-36 Lk 12:49-53
Default Mt 10:34-36 Lk 12:49-53
LK
12:49
“I came to set fire to the world, and I wish it were already burning!
LK
12:50
I have a baptism(az) to suffer through, and I feel very troubled until it is over.
LK
12:51
Do you think I came to give peace to the earth? No, I tell you, I came to divide it.

10:35

MT
10:36
A person’s enemies will be members of his own family.’ (Micah 7:6)
Default Mt 10:34-36 Lk 12:49-53
MT
10:34
“Don’t think that I came to bring peace to the earth. I did not come to bring peace, but a sword.
MT
10:35
I have come so that ‘a son will be against his father, a daughter will be against her mother, a daughter-in-law will be against her mother-in-law.
MT
10:36
A person’s enemies will be members of his own family.’ (Micah 7:6)

LK
12:49
“I came to set fire to the world, and I wish it were already burning!
LK
12:50
I have a baptism(az) to suffer through, and I feel very troubled until it is over.
LK
12:51
Do you think I came to give peace to the earth? No, I tell you, I came to divide it.
LK
12:52
From now on, a family with five people will be divided, three against two, and two against three.
LK
12:53
They will be divided: father against son and son against father, mother against daughter and daughter against mother, mother-in-law against daughter-in-law and daughter-in-law against mother-in-law.”
Week 36-43 | Following Jesus Requires Engagement
Mt 10:37-39 Lk 14:25-33
Default Mt 10:37-39 Lk 14:25-33
LK
14:25
Large crowds were traveling with Jesus, and he turned and said to them,
LK
14:26
“If anyone comes to me but loves his father, mother, wife, children, brothers, or sisters-or even life-more than me, he cannot be my follower.
LK
14:27
Whoever is not willing to carry his cross and follow me cannot be my follower.
LK
14:28
If you want to build a tower, you first sit down and decide how much it will cost, to see if you have enough money to finish the job.
LK
14:29
If you don’t, you might lay the foundation, but you would not be able to finish. Then all who would see it would make fun of you,
LK
14:30
saying, ‘This person began to build but was not able to finish.’
LK
14:31
“If a king is going to fight another king, first he will sit down and plan. He will decide if he and his ten thousand soldiers can defeat the other king who has twenty thousand soldiers.
LK
14:32
If he can’t, then while the other king is still far away, he will send some people to speak to him and ask for peace.
LK
14:33
In the same way, you must give up everything you have to be my follower.
Default Mt 10:37-39 Lk 14:25-33
MT
10:37
“Those who love their father or mother more than they love me are not worthy to be my followers. Those who love their son or daughter more than they love me are not worthy to be my followers.
MT
10:38
Whoever is not willing to carry the cross and follow me is not worthy of me.
MT
10:39
Those who try to hold on to their lives will give up true life. Those who give up their lives for me will hold on to true life.
Default Mt 10:37-39 Lk 14:25-33
LK
14:25
Large crowds were traveling with Jesus, and he turned and said to them,
LK
14:26
“If anyone comes to me but loves his father, mother, wife, children, brothers, or sisters-or even life-more than me, he cannot be my follower.
LK
14:27
Whoever is not willing to carry his cross and follow me cannot be my follower.
LK
14:28
If you want to build a tower, you first sit down and decide how much it will cost, to see if you have enough money to finish the job.
LK
14:29
If you don’t, you might lay the foundation, but you would not be able to finish. Then all who would see it would make fun of you,
LK
14:30
saying, ‘This person began to build but was not able to finish.’
LK
14:31
“If a king is going to fight another king, first he will sit down and plan. He will decide if he and his ten thousand soldiers can defeat the other king who has twenty thousand soldiers.
LK
14:32
If he can’t, then while the other king is still far away, he will send some people to speak to him and ask for peace.
LK
14:33
In the same way, you must give up everything you have to be my follower.
Week 36-43 | Signs Of Times
Lk 12:54-56
Lk 12:54-56
LK
12:54
Then Jesus said to the people, “When you see clouds coming up in the west, you say, ‘It’s going to rain,’ and it happens.
LK
12:55
When you feel the wind begin to blow from the south, you say, ‘It will be a hot day,’ and it happens.
LK
12:56
Hypocrites! You know how to understand the appearance of the earth and sky. Why don’t you understand what is happening now?
Week 36-43 | Change Your Hearts
Lk 13:1-9
Lk 13:1-9
LK
13:1
At that time some people were there who told Jesus that Pilate(ba) had killed some people from Galilee while they were worshiping. He mixed their blood with the blood of the animals they were sacrificing to God.
LK
13:2
Jesus answered, “Do you think this happened to them because they were more sinful than all others from Galilee?
LK
13:3
No, I tell you. But unless you change your hearts and lives, you will be destroyed as they were!
LK
13:4
What about those eighteen people who died when the tower of Siloam fell on them? Do you think they were more sinful than all the others who live in Jerusalem?
LK
13:5
No, I tell you. But unless you change your hearts and lives, you will all be destroyed too!”
LK
13:6
Jesus told this story: “A man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard. He came looking for some fruit on the tree, but he found none.
LK
13:7
So the man said to his gardener, ‘I have been looking for fruit on this tree for three years, but I never find any. Cut it down. Why should it waste the ground?’
LK
13:8
But the servant answered, ‘Master, let the tree have one more year to produce fruit. Let me dig up the dirt around it and put on some fertilizer.
LK
13:9
If the tree produces fruit next year, good. But if not, you can cut it down.’”
Week 36-43 | Jesus Heals On The Sabbath
Lk 13:10-17
Lk 13:10-17
LK
13:10
Jesus was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath day.
LK
13:11
A woman was there who, for eighteen years, had an evil spirit in her that made her crippled. Her back was always bent; she could not stand up straight.
LK
13:12
When Jesus saw her, he called her over and said, “Woman, you are free from your sickness.”
LK
13:13
Jesus put his hands on her, and immediately she was able to stand up straight and began praising God.
LK
13:14
The synagogue leader was angry because Jesus healed on the Sabbath day. He said to the people, “There are six days when one has to work. So come to be healed on one of those days, and not on the Sabbath day.”
LK
13:15
The Lord answered, “You hypocrites! Doesn’t each of you untie your work animals and lead them to drink water every day-even on the Sabbath day?
LK
13:16
This woman that I healed, a daughter of Abraham, has been held by Satan for eighteen years. Surely it is not wrong for her to be freed from her sickness on a Sabbath day!”
LK
13:17
When Jesus said this, all of those who were criticizing him were ashamed, but the entire crowd rejoiced at all the wonderful things Jesus was doing.
Week 36-43 | On The Way To Jerusalem
Lk 13:22-22
Lk 13:22-22
LK
13:22
Jesus was teaching in every town and village as he traveled toward Jerusalem.
Week 36-43 | The Narrow Path

LK
13:23
Someone said to Jesus, “Lord, will only a few people be saved?” Jesus said,
MT
7:13
“Enter through the narrow gate. The gate is wide and the road is wide that leads to hell, and many people enter through that gate.
MT
7:14
But the gate is small and the road is narrow that leads to true life. Only a few people find that road.

MT
7:13
“Enter through the narrow gate. The gate is wide and the road is wide that leads to hell, and many people enter through that gate.
MT
7:14
But the gate is small and the road is narrow that leads to true life. Only a few people find that road.

13:23
Someone said to Jesus, “Lord, will only a few people be saved?” Jesus said,
LK
13:24
“Try hard to enter through the narrow door, because many people will try to enter there, but they will not be able.
Week 36-43 | Who Obeys God Enters To Heaven
Mt 7:21-23 Lk 13:25-30
Default Mt 7:21-23 Lk 13:25-30
MT
7:21
“Not all those who say ‘You are our Lord’ will enter the kingdom of heaven. The only people who will enter the kingdom of heaven are those who do what my Father in heaven wants.
MT
7:22
On the last day many people will say to me, ‘Lord, Lord, we spoke for you, and through you we forced out demons and did many miracles.’
MT
7:23
Then I will tell them clearly, ‘Get away from me, you who do evil. I never knew you.’
Default Mt 7:21-23 Lk 13:25-30
MT
7:21
“Not all those who say ‘You are our Lord’ will enter the kingdom of heaven. The only people who will enter the kingdom of heaven are those who do what my Father in heaven wants.
MT
7:22
On the last day many people will say to me, ‘Lord, Lord, we spoke for you, and through you we forced out demons and did many miracles.’
MT
7:23
Then I will tell them clearly, ‘Get away from me, you who do evil. I never knew you.’
Default Mt 7:21-23 Lk 13:25-30
LK
13:25
When the owner of the house gets up and closes the door, you can stand outside and knock on the door and say, ‘Sir, open the door for us.’ But he will answer, ‘I don’t know you or where you come from.’
LK
13:26
Then you will say, ‘We ate and drank with you, and you taught in the streets of our town.’
LK
13:27
But he will say to you, ‘I don’t know you or where you come from. Go away from me, all you who do evil!’
LK
13:28
You will cry and grind your teeth with pain when you see Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and all the prophets in God’s kingdom, but you yourselves thrown outside.
LK
13:29
People will come from the east, west, north, and south and will sit down at the table in the kingdom of God.
LK
13:30
There are those who are last now who will be first in the future. And there are those who are first now who will be last in the future.”
Week 36-43 | Jesus Send A Message To Herod
Lk 13:31-33
Lk 13:31-33
LK
13:31
At that time some Pharisees came to Jesus and said, “Go away from here! Herod wants to kill you!”
LK
13:32
Jesus said to them, “Go tell that fox Herod, ‘Today and tomorrow I am forcing demons out and healing people. Then, on the third day, I will reach my goal.’
LK
13:33
Yet I must be on my way today and tomorrow and the next day. Surely it cannot be right for a prophet to be killed anywhere except in Jerusalem.
