Week 43 | Jesus Judges Jerusalem
Mt 23:37-39 Lk 13:34-35
Default Mt 23:37-39 Lk 13:34-35
MT
23:37
“Jerusalem, Jerusalem! You kill the prophets and stone to death those who are sent to you. Many times I wanted to gather your people as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you did not let me.
MT
23:38
Now your house will be left completely empty.
MT
23:39
I tell you, you will not see me again until that time when you will say, ‘God bless the One who comes in the name of the Lord.’”(cg)
Default Mt 23:37-39 Lk 13:34-35
MT
23:37
“Jerusalem, Jerusalem! You kill the prophets and stone to death those who are sent to you. Many times I wanted to gather your people as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you did not let me.
MT
23:38
Now your house will be left completely empty.
MT
23:39
I tell you, you will not see me again until that time when you will say, ‘God bless the One who comes in the name of the Lord.’”(cg)
Default Mt 23:37-39 Lk 13:34-35
LK
13:34
“Jerusalem, Jerusalem! You kill the prophets and stone to death those who are sent to you. Many times I wanted to gather your people as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you would not let me.
LK
13:35
Now your house is left completely empty. I tell you, you will not see me until that time when you will say, ‘God bless the One who comes in the name of the Lord.’”(bb)
Week 43 | Eating With A Chief Pharisee: Healing On Sabbath
Lk 14:1-6
Lk 14:1-6
LK
14:1
On a Sabbath day, when Jesus went to eat at the home of a leading Pharisee, the people were watching Jesus very closely.
LK
14:2
And in front of him was a man with dropsy.(bc)
LK
14:3
Jesus said to the Pharisees and experts on the law, “Is it right or wrong to heal on the Sabbath day?”
LK
14:4
But they would not answer his question. So Jesus took the man, healed him, and sent him away.
LK
14:5
Jesus said to the Pharisees and teachers of the law, “If your child(bd) or ox falls into a well on the Sabbath day, will you not pull him out quickly?”
LK
14:6
And they could not answer him.
Week 43 | Power Or Influence
Lk 14:7-14
Lk 14:7-14
LK
14:7
When Jesus noticed that some of the guests were choosing the best places to sit, he told this story:
LK
14:8
“When someone invites you to a wedding feast, don’t take the most important seat, because someone more important than you may have been invited.
LK
14:9
The host, who invited both of you, will come to you and say, ‘Give this person your seat.’ Then you will be embarrassed and will have to move to the last place.
LK
14:10
So when you are invited, go sit in a seat that is not important. When the host comes to you, he may say, ‘Friend, move up here to a more important place.’ Then all the other guests will respect you.
LK
14:11
All who make themselves great will be made humble, but those who make themselves humble will be made great.”
LK
14:12
Then Jesus said to the man who had invited him, “When you give a lunch or a dinner, don’t invite only your friends, your family, your other relatives, and your rich neighbors. At another time they will invite you to eat with them, and you will be repaid.
LK
14:13
Instead, when you give a feast, invite the poor, the crippled, the lame, and the blind.
LK
14:14
Then you will be blessed, because they have nothing and cannot pay you back. But you will be repaid when the good people rise from the dead.”
Week 43 | At The Feast Of Dedication (Hanukkah)
Jn 10:22-39
Jn 10:22-39
JN
10:22
The time came for the Feast of Dedication at Jerusalem. It was winter,
JN
10:23
and Jesus was walking in the Temple in Solomon’s Porch.
JN
10:24
Some people gathered around him and said, “How long will you make us wonder about you? If you are the Christ, tell us plainly.”
JN
10:25
Jesus answered, “I told you already, but you did not believe. The miracles I do in my Father’s name show who I am.
JN
10:26
But you don’t believe, because you are not my sheep.
JN
10:27
My sheep listen to my voice; I know them, and they follow me.
JN
10:28
I give them eternal life, and they will never die, and no one can steal them out of my hand.
JN
10:29
My Father gave my sheep to me. He is greater than all, and no person can steal my sheep out of my Father’s hand.
JN
10:30
The Father and I are one.”
JN
10:31
Again some of the people picked up stones to kill Jesus.
JN
10:32
But he said to them, “I have done many good works from the Father. Which of these good works are you killing me for?”
JN
10:33
They answered, “We are not killing you because of any good work you did, but because you speak against God. You are only a human, but you say you are the same as God!”
JN
10:34
Jesus answered, “It is written in your law that God said, ‘I said, you are gods.’(ag)
JN
10:35
This Scripture called those people gods who received God’s message, and Scripture is always true.
JN
10:36
So why do you say that I speak against God because I said, ‘I am God’s Son’? I am the one God chose and sent into the world.
JN
10:37
If I don’t do what my Father does, then don’t believe me.
JN
10:38
But if I do what my Father does, even though you don’t believe in me, believe what I do. Then you will know and understand that the Father is in me and I am in the Father.”
JN
10:39
They tried to take Jesus again, but he escaped from them.
Week 43-62 | Ministry In Judea Goes On
– +
Week 43-62 | Arrival To Judea To The Other Side Of The Jordan
Jn 10:40-42
Jn 10:40-42
JN
10:40
Then he went back across the Jordan River to the place where John had first baptized. Jesus stayed there,
JN
10:41
and many people came to him and said, “John never did a miracle, but everything John said about this man is true.”
JN
10:42
And in that place many believed in Jesus.
Week 43-62 | It's Hard For The Rich To Enter God's Kingdom
Mt 19:16-30 Mk 10:17-31 Lk 18:18-30
Default Mt 19:16-30 Mk 10:17-31 Lk 18:18-30
LK
18:18
A certain leader asked Jesus, “Good Teacher, what must I do to have life forever?”
LK
18:19
Jesus said to him, “Why do you call me good? Only God is good.
MK
10:19
You know the commands: ‘You must not murder anyone. You must not be guilty of adultery. You must not steal. You must not tell lies about your neighbor. You must not cheat. Honor your father and mother.’”(ak)
MK
10:20
The man said, “Teacher, I have obeyed all these things since I was a boy.”
MK
10:21
Jesus, looking at the man, loved him and said, “There is one more thing you need to do. Go and sell everything you have, and give the money to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come and follow me.”
MK
10:22
He was very sad to hear Jesus say this, and he left sorrowfully, because he was rich.
MK
10:23
Then Jesus looked at his followers and said, “How hard it will be for the rich to enter the kingdom of God!”
MK
10:24
The followers were amazed at what Jesus said. But he said again, “My children, it is very hard(al) to enter the kingdom of God!
MK
10:25
It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter the kingdom of God.”
MK
10:26
The followers were even more surprised and said to each other, “Then who can be saved?”
MK
10:27
Jesus looked at them and said, “For people this is impossible, but for God all things are possible.”
MK
10:28
Peter said to Jesus, “Look, we have left everything and followed you.”
MK
10:29
Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, all those who have left houses, brothers, sisters, mother, father, children, or farms for me and for the Good News
MK
10:30
will get more than they left. Here in this world they will have a hundred times more homes, brothers, sisters, mothers, children, and fields. And with those things, they will also suffer for their belief. But in this age they will have life forever.
MK
10:31
Many who are first now will be last in the future. And many who are last now will be first in the future.”
Default Mt 19:16-30 Mk 10:17-31 Lk 18:18-30
MT
19:16
A man came to Jesus and asked, “Teacher, what good thing must I do to have life forever?”
MT
19:17
Jesus answered, “Why do you ask me about what is good? Only God is good. But if you want to have life forever, obey the commands.”
MT
19:18
The man asked, “Which commands?” Jesus answered, “‘You must not murder anyone; you must not be guilty of adultery; you must not steal; you must not tell lies about your neighbor;
MT
19:19
honor your father and mother;(bl) and love your neighbor as you love yourself.’”(bm)
MT
19:20
The young man said, “I have obeyed all these things. What else do I need to do?”
MT
19:21
Jesus answered, “If you want to be perfect, then go and sell your possessions and give the money to the poor. If you do this, you will have treasure in heaven. Then come and follow me.”
MT
19:22
But when the young man heard this, he left sorrowfully, because he was rich.
MT
19:23
Then Jesus said to his followers, “I tell you the truth, it will be hard for a rich person to enter the kingdom of heaven.
MT
19:24
Yes, I tell you that it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter the kingdom of God.”
MT
19:25
When Jesus’ followers heard this, they were very surprised and asked, “Then who can be saved?”
MT
19:26
Jesus looked at them and said, “For people this is impossible, but for God all things are possible.”
MT
19:27
Peter said to Jesus, “Look, we have left everything and followed you. So what will we have?”
MT
19:28
Jesus said to them, “I tell you the truth, when the age to come has arrived, the Son of Man will sit on his great throne. All of you who followed me will also sit on twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
MT
19:29
And all those who have left houses, brothers, sisters, father, mother,(bn) children, or farms to follow me will get much more than they left, and they will have life forever.
MT
19:30
Many who are first now will be last in the future. And many who are last now will be first in the future.
Default Mt 19:16-30 Mk 10:17-31 Lk 18:18-30
MK
10:17
As Jesus started to leave, a man ran to him and fell on his knees before Jesus. The man asked, “Good teacher, what must I do to have life forever?”
MK
10:18
Jesus answered, “Why do you call me good? Only God is good.
MK
10:19
You know the commands: ‘You must not murder anyone. You must not be guilty of adultery. You must not steal. You must not tell lies about your neighbor. You must not cheat. Honor your father and mother.’”(ak)
MK
10:20
The man said, “Teacher, I have obeyed all these things since I was a boy.”
MK
10:21
Jesus, looking at the man, loved him and said, “There is one more thing you need to do. Go and sell everything you have, and give the money to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come and follow me.”
MK
10:22
He was very sad to hear Jesus say this, and he left sorrowfully, because he was rich.
MK
10:23
Then Jesus looked at his followers and said, “How hard it will be for the rich to enter the kingdom of God!”
MK
10:24
The followers were amazed at what Jesus said. But he said again, “My children, it is very hard(al) to enter the kingdom of God!
MK
10:25
It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter the kingdom of God.”
MK
10:26
The followers were even more surprised and said to each other, “Then who can be saved?”
MK
10:27
Jesus looked at them and said, “For people this is impossible, but for God all things are possible.”
MK
10:28
Peter said to Jesus, “Look, we have left everything and followed you.”
MK
10:29
Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, all those who have left houses, brothers, sisters, mother, father, children, or farms for me and for the Good News
MK
10:30
will get more than they left. Here in this world they will have a hundred times more homes, brothers, sisters, mothers, children, and fields. And with those things, they will also suffer for their belief. But in this age they will have life forever.
MK
10:31
Many who are first now will be last in the future. And many who are last now will be first in the future.”
Default Mt 19:16-30 Mk 10:17-31 Lk 18:18-30
LK
18:18
A certain leader asked Jesus, “Good Teacher, what must I do to have life forever?”
LK
18:19
Jesus said to him, “Why do you call me good? Only God is good.
LK
18:20
You know the commands: ‘You must not be guilty of adultery. You must not murder anyone. You must not steal. You must not tell lies about your neighbor. Honor your father and mother.’”(bn)
LK
18:21
But the leader said, “I have obeyed all these commands since I was a boy.”
LK
18:22
When Jesus heard this, he said to him, “There is still one more thing you need to do. Sell everything you have and give it to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come and follow me.”
LK
18:23
But when the man heard this, he became very sad, because he was very rich.
LK
18:24
Jesus looked at him and said, “It is very hard for rich people to enter the kingdom of God.
LK
18:25
It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter the kingdom of God.” Who Can Be Saved?
LK
18:26
When the people heard this, they asked, “Then who can be saved?”
LK
18:27
Jesus answered, “The things impossible for people are possible for God.”
LK
18:28
Peter said, “Look, we have left everything and followed you.”
LK
18:29
Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, all those who have left houses, wives, brothers, parents, or children for the kingdom of God
LK
18:30
will get much more in this life. And in the age that is coming, they will have life forever.”
Week 43-62 | Jealous Vineyard Workers
Mt 20:1-16
Mt 20:1-16
MT
20:1
“The kingdom of heaven is like a person who owned some land. One morning, he went out very early to hire some people to work in his vineyard.
MT
20:2
The man agreed to pay the workers one coin(bo) for working that day. Then he sent them into the vineyard to work.
MT
20:3
About nine o’clock the man went to the marketplace and saw some other people standing there, doing nothing.
MT
20:4
So he said to them, ‘If you go and work in my vineyard, I will pay you what your work is worth.’
MT
20:5
So they went to work in the vineyard. The man went out again about twelve o’clock and three o’clock and did the same thing.
MT
20:6
About five o’clock the man went to the marketplace again and saw others standing there. He asked them, ‘Why did you stand here all day doing nothing?’
MT
20:7
They answered, ‘No one gave us a job.’ The man said to them, ‘Then you can go and work in my vineyard.’
MT
20:8
“At the end of the day, the owner of the vineyard said to the boss of all the workers, ‘Call the workers and pay them. Start with the last people I hired and end with those I hired first.’
MT
20:9
“When the workers who were hired at five o’clock came to get their pay, each received one coin.
MT
20:10
When the workers who were hired first came to get their pay, they thought they would be paid more than the others. But each one of them also received one coin.
MT
20:11
When they got their coin, they complained to the man who owned the land.
MT
20:12
They said, ‘Those people were hired last and worked only one hour. But you paid them the same as you paid us who worked hard all day in the hot sun.’
MT
20:13
But the man who owned the vineyard said to one of those workers, ‘Friend, I am being fair to you. You agreed to work for one coin.
MT
20:14
So take your pay and go. I want to give the man who was hired last the same pay that I gave you.
MT
20:15
I can do what I want with my own money. Are you jealous because I am good to those people?’
MT
20:16
“So those who are last now will someday be first, and those who are first now will someday be last.”
Week 43-62 | Be Trusted With A Little
Lk 16:1-12
Lk 16:1-12
LK
16:1
Jesus also said to his followers, “Once there was a rich man who had a manager to take care of his business. This manager was accused of cheating him.
LK
16:2
So he called the manager in and said to him, ‘What is this I hear about you? Give me a report of what you have done with my money, because you can’t be my manager any longer.’
LK
16:3
The manager thought to himself, ‘What will I do since my master is taking my job away from me? I am not strong enough to dig ditches, and I am ashamed to beg.
LK
16:4
I know what I’ll do so that when I lose my job people will welcome me into their homes.’
LK
16:5
“So the manager called in everyone who owed the master any money. He asked the first one, ‘How much do you owe?’
LK
16:6
He answered, ‘Eight hundred gallons of olive oil.’ The manager said to him, ‘Take your bill, sit down quickly, and write four hundred gallons.’
LK
16:7
Then the manager asked another one, ‘How much do you owe?’ He answered, ‘One thousand bushels of wheat.’ Then the manager said to him, ‘Take your bill and write eight hundred bushels.’
LK
16:8
So, the master praised the dishonest manager for being clever. Yes, worldly people are more clever with their own kind than spiritual people are.
LK
16:9
“I tell you, make friends for yourselves using worldly riches so that when those riches are gone, you will be welcomed in those homes that continue forever.
LK
16:10
Whoever can be trusted with a little can also be trusted with a lot, and whoever is dishonest with a little is dishonest with a lot.
LK
16:11
If you cannot be trusted with worldly riches, then who will trust you with true riches?
LK
16:12
And if you cannot be trusted with things that belong to someone else, who will give you things of your own?
Week 43-62 | God Or Worldly Riches
Mt 6:24-24 Lk 16:13-15
Default Mt 6:24-24 Lk 16:13-15
LK
16:13
“No servant can serve two masters. The servant will hate one master and love the other, or will follow one master and refuse to follow the other. You cannot serve both God and worldly riches.”
LK
16:14
The Pharisees, who loved money, were listening to all these things and made fun of Jesus.
LK
16:15
He said to them, “You make yourselves look good in front of people, but God knows what is really in your hearts. What is important to people is hateful in God’s sight.
Default Mt 6:24-24 Lk 16:13-15
MT
6:24
“No one can serve two masters. The person will hate one master and love the other, or will follow one master and refuse to follow the other. You cannot serve both God and worldly riches.
Default Mt 6:24-24 Lk 16:13-15
LK
16:13
“No servant can serve two masters. The servant will hate one master and love the other, or will follow one master and refuse to follow the other. You cannot serve both God and worldly riches.”
LK
16:14
The Pharisees, who loved money, were listening to all these things and made fun of Jesus.
LK
16:15
He said to them, “You make yourselves look good in front of people, but God knows what is really in your hearts. What is important to people is hateful in God’s sight.
Week 43-62 | The Rich Man And The Poor Lazarus
Lk 16:19-31
Lk 16:19-31
LK
16:19
Jesus said, “There was a rich man who always dressed in the finest clothes and lived in luxury every day.
LK
16:20
And a very poor man named Lazarus, whose body was covered with sores, was laid at the rich man’s gate.
LK
16:21
He wanted to eat only the small pieces of food that fell from the rich man’s table. And the dogs would come and lick his sores.
LK
16:22
Later, Lazarus died, and the angels carried him to the arms of Abraham. The rich man died, too, and was buried.
LK
16:23
In the place of the dead, he was in much pain. The rich man saw Abraham far away with Lazarus at his side.
LK
16:24
He called, ‘Father Abraham, have mercy on me! Send Lazarus to dip his finger in water and cool my tongue, because I am suffering in this fire!’
LK
16:25
But Abraham said, ‘Child, remember when you were alive you had the good things in life, but bad things happened to Lazarus. Now he is comforted here, and you are suffering.
LK
16:26
Besides, there is a big pit between you and us, so no one can cross over to you, and no one can leave there and come here.’
LK
16:27
The rich man said, ‘Father, then please send Lazarus to my father’s house.
LK
16:28
I have five brothers, and Lazarus could warn them so that they will not come to this place of pain.’
LK
16:29
But Abraham said, ‘They have the law of Moses and the writings of the prophets; let them learn from them.’
LK
16:30
The rich man said, ‘No, father Abraham! If someone goes to them from the dead, they would believe and change their hearts and lives.’
LK
16:31
But Abraham said to him, ‘If they will not listen to Moses and the prophets, they will not listen to someone who comes back from the dead.’”
Week 43-62 | The Faith Size Of A Mustard Seed
Lk 17:5-6
Lk 17:5-6
LK
17:5
The apostles said to the Lord, “Give us more faith!”
LK
17:6
The Lord said, “If your faith were the size of a mustard seed, you could say to this mulberry tree, ‘Dig yourself up and plant yourself in the sea,’ and it would obey you.
Week 43-62 | Don't Expect Thanks For Doing Your Job
Lk 17:7-10
Lk 17:7-10
LK
17:7
“Suppose one of you has a servant who has been plowing the ground or caring for the sheep. When the servant comes in from working in the field, would you say, ‘Come in and sit down to eat’?
LK
17:8
No, you would say to him, ‘Prepare something for me to eat. Then get yourself ready and serve me. After I finish eating and drinking, you can eat.’
LK
17:9
The servant does not get any special thanks for doing what his master commanded.
LK
17:10
It is the same with you. When you have done everything you are told to do, you should say, ‘We are unworthy servants; we have only done the work we should do.’”
Week 43-62 | God’s Kingdom Is Within You
Lk 17:20-22
Lk 17:20-22
LK
17:20
Some of the Pharisees asked Jesus, “When will the kingdom of God come?” Jesus answered, “God’s kingdom is coming, but not in a way that you will be able to see with your eyes.
LK
17:21
People will not say, ‘Look, here it is!’ or, ‘There it is!’ because God’s kingdom is within(bi) you.”
LK
17:22
Then Jesus said to his followers, “The time will come when you will want very much to see one of the days of the Son of Man. But you will not see it.
Week 43-62 | God Will Answer His People
Lk 18:1-8
Lk 18:1-8
LK
18:1
Then Jesus used this story to teach his followers that they should always pray and never lose hope.
LK
18:2
“In a certain town there was a judge who did not respect God or care about people.
LK
18:3
In that same town there was a widow who kept coming to this judge, saying, ‘Give me my rights against my enemy.’
LK
18:4
For a while the judge refused to help her. But afterwards, he thought to himself, ‘Even though I don’t respect God or care about people,
LK
18:5
I will see that she gets her rights. Otherwise she will continue to bother me until I am worn out.’”
LK
18:6
The Lord said, “Listen to what the unfair judge said.
LK
18:7
God will always give what is right to his people who cry to him night and day, and he will not be slow to answer them.
LK
18:8
I tell you, God will help his people quickly. But when the Son of Man comes again, will he find those on earth who believe in him?”
Week 43-62 | Prayer Of A Pharisee And A Tax Collector
Lk 18:9-14
Lk 18:9-14
LK
18:9
Jesus told this story to some people who thought they were very good and looked down on everyone else:
LK
18:10
“A Pharisee and a tax collector both went to the Temple to pray.
LK
18:11
The Pharisee stood alone and prayed, ‘God, I thank you that I am not like other people who steal, cheat, or take part in adultery, or even like this tax collector.
LK
18:12
I fast(bm) twice a week, and I give one-tenth of everything I get!’
LK
18:13
“The tax collector, standing at a distance, would not even look up to heaven. But he beat on his chest because he was so sad. He said, ‘God, have mercy on me, a sinner.’
LK
18:14
I tell you, when this man went home, he was right with God, but the Pharisee was not. All who make themselves great will be made humble, but all who make themselves humble will be made great.” Who Will Enter God’s Kingdom?
Week 43-62 | About Divorce
Mt 19:3-12 Mk 10:2-12
Default Mt 19:3-12 Mk 10:2-12
MT
19:3
Some Pharisees came to Jesus and tried to trick him. They asked, “Is it right for a man to divorce his wife for any reason he chooses?”
MT
19:4
Jesus answered, “Surely you have read in the Scriptures: When God made the world, ‘he made them male and female.’(bg)
MT
19:5
And God said, ‘So a man will leave his father and mother and be united with his wife, and the two will become one body.’(bh)
MT
19:6
So there are not two, but one. God has joined the two together, so no one should separate them.”
MT
19:7
The Pharisees asked, “Why then did Moses give a command for a man to divorce his wife by giving her divorce papers?”
MT
19:8
Jesus answered, “Moses allowed you to divorce your wives because you refused to accept God’s teaching, but divorce was not allowed in the beginning.
MT
19:9
I tell you that anyone who divorces his wife and marries another woman is guilty of adultery.(bi) The only reason for a man to divorce his wife is if his wife has sexual relations with another man.”
MT
19:10
The followers said to him, “If that is the only reason a man can divorce his wife, it is better not to marry.”
MT
19:11
Jesus answered, “Not everyone can accept this teaching, but God has made some able to accept it.
MT
19:12
There are different reasons why some men cannot marry. Some men were born without the ability to become fathers. Others were made that way later in life by other people. And some men have given up marriage because of the kingdom of heaven. But the person who can marry should accept this teaching about marriage.”(bj)
Default Mt 19:3-12 Mk 10:2-12
MT
19:3
Some Pharisees came to Jesus and tried to trick him. They asked, “Is it right for a man to divorce his wife for any reason he chooses?”
MT
19:4
Jesus answered, “Surely you have read in the Scriptures: When God made the world, ‘he made them male and female.’(bg)
MT
19:5
And God said, ‘So a man will leave his father and mother and be united with his wife, and the two will become one body.’(bh)
MT
19:6
So there are not two, but one. God has joined the two together, so no one should separate them.”
MT
19:7
The Pharisees asked, “Why then did Moses give a command for a man to divorce his wife by giving her divorce papers?”
MT
19:8
Jesus answered, “Moses allowed you to divorce your wives because you refused to accept God’s teaching, but divorce was not allowed in the beginning.
MT
19:9
I tell you that anyone who divorces his wife and marries another woman is guilty of adultery.(bi) The only reason for a man to divorce his wife is if his wife has sexual relations with another man.”
MT
19:10
The followers said to him, “If that is the only reason a man can divorce his wife, it is better not to marry.”
MT
19:11
Jesus answered, “Not everyone can accept this teaching, but God has made some able to accept it.
MT
19:12
There are different reasons why some men cannot marry. Some men were born without the ability to become fathers. Others were made that way later in life by other people. And some men have given up marriage because of the kingdom of heaven. But the person who can marry should accept this teaching about marriage.”(bj)
Default Mt 19:3-12 Mk 10:2-12
MK
10:2
Some Pharisees came to Jesus and tried to trick him. They asked, “Is it right for a man to divorce his wife?”
MK
10:3
Jesus answered, “What did Moses command you to do?”
MK
10:4
They said, “Moses allowed a man to write out divorce papers and send her away.”(ag)
MK
10:5
Jesus said, “Moses wrote that command for you because you were stubborn.
MK
10:6
But when God made the world, ‘he made them male and female.’(ah)
MK
10:7
‘So a man will leave his father and mother and be united with his wife,(ai)
MK
10:8
and the two will become one body.’(aj) So there are not two, but one.
MK
10:9
God has joined the two together, so no one should separate them.”
MK
10:10
Later, in the house, his followers asked Jesus again about the question of divorce.
MK
10:11
He answered, “Anyone who divorces his wife and marries another woman is guilty of adultery against her.
MK
10:12
And the woman who divorces her husband and marries another man is also guilty of adultery.”
Week 43-62 | Kingdom Of God Belongs To People Who Are Like Children
Mt 19:13-15 Mk 10:13-16 Lk 18:15-17
Default Mt 19:13-15 Mk 10:13-16 Lk 18:15-17
MK
10:13
Some people brought their little children to Jesus so he could touch them, but his followers told them to stop.
MK
10:14
When Jesus saw this, he was upset and said to them, “Let the little children come to me. Don’t stop them, because the kingdom of God belongs to people who are like these children.
MK
10:15
I tell you the truth, you must accept the kingdom of God as if you were a little child, or you will never enter it.”
MK
10:16
Then Jesus took the children in his arms, put his hands on them, and blessed them.
Default Mt 19:13-15 Mk 10:13-16 Lk 18:15-17
MT
19:13
Then the people brought their little children to Jesus so he could put his hands on them(bk) and pray for them. His followers told them to stop,
MT
19:14
but Jesus said, “Let the little children come to me. Don’t stop them, because the kingdom of heaven belongs to people who are like these children.”
MT
19:15
After Jesus put his hands on the children, he left there.
Default Mt 19:13-15 Mk 10:13-16 Lk 18:15-17
MK
10:13
Some people brought their little children to Jesus so he could touch them, but his followers told them to stop.
MK
10:14
When Jesus saw this, he was upset and said to them, “Let the little children come to me. Don’t stop them, because the kingdom of God belongs to people who are like these children.
MK
10:15
I tell you the truth, you must accept the kingdom of God as if you were a little child, or you will never enter it.”
MK
10:16
Then Jesus took the children in his arms, put his hands on them, and blessed them.
Default Mt 19:13-15 Mk 10:13-16 Lk 18:15-17
LK
18:15
Some people brought even their babies to Jesus so he could touch them. When the followers saw this, they told them to stop.
LK
18:16
But Jesus called for the children, saying, “Let the little children come to me. Don’t stop them, because the kingdom of God belongs to people who are like these children.
LK
18:17
I tell you the truth, you must accept the kingdom of God as if you were a child, or you will never enter it.”
Week 43-62 | Raises Lazarus
Jn 11:1-44
Jn 11:1-44
JN
11:1
A man named Lazarus was sick. He lived in the town of Bethany, where Mary and her sister Martha lived.
JN
11:2
Mary was the woman who later put perfume on the Lord and wiped his feet with her hair. Mary’s brother was Lazarus, the man who was now sick.
JN
11:3
So Mary and Martha sent someone to tell Jesus, “Lord, the one you love is sick.”
JN
11:4
When Jesus heard this, he said, “This sickness will not end in death. It is for the glory of God, to bring glory to the Son of God.”
JN
11:5
Jesus loved Martha and her sister and Lazarus.
JN
11:6
But when he heard that Lazarus was sick, he stayed where he was for two more days.
JN
11:7
Then Jesus said to his followers, “Let’s go back to Judea.”
JN
11:8
The followers said, “But Teacher, some people there tried to stone you to death only a short time ago. Now you want to go back there?”
JN
11:9
Jesus answered, “Are there not twelve hours in the day? If anyone walks in the daylight, he will not stumble, because he can see by this world’s light.
JN
11:10
But if anyone walks at night, he stumbles because there is no light to help him see.”
JN
11:11
After Jesus said this, he added, “Our friend Lazarus has fallen asleep, but I am going there to wake him.”
JN
11:12
The followers said, “But Lord, if he is only asleep, he will be all right.”
JN
11:13
Jesus meant that Lazarus was dead, but his followers thought he meant Lazarus was really sleeping.
JN
11:14
So then Jesus said plainly, “Lazarus is dead.
JN
11:15
And I am glad for your sakes I was not there so that you may believe. But let’s go to him now.”
JN
11:16
Then Thomas (the one called Didymus) said to the other followers, “Let us also go so that we can die with him.”
JN
11:17
When Jesus arrived, he learned that Lazarus had already been dead and in the tomb for four days.
JN
11:18
Bethany was about two miles from Jerusalem.
JN
11:19
Many of the Jews had come there to comfort Martha and Mary about their brother.
JN
11:20
When Martha heard that Jesus was coming, she went out to meet him, but Mary stayed home.
JN
11:21
Martha said to Jesus, “Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died.
JN
11:22
But I know that even now God will give you anything you ask.”
JN
11:23
Jesus said, “Your brother will rise and live again.”
JN
11:24
Martha answered, “I know that he will rise and live again in the resurrection(ah) on the last day.”
JN
11:25
Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life. Those who believe in me will have life even if they die.
JN
11:26
And everyone who lives and believes in me will never die. Martha, do you believe this?”
JN
11:27
Martha answered, “Yes, Lord. I believe that you are the Christ, the Son of God, the One coming to the world.”
JN
11:28
After Martha said this, she went back and talked to her sister Mary alone. Martha said, “The Teacher is here and he is asking for you.”
JN
11:29
When Mary heard this, she got up quickly and went to Jesus.
JN
11:30
Jesus had not yet come into the town but was still at the place where Martha had met him.
JN
11:31
The Jews were with Mary in the house, comforting her. When they saw her stand and leave quickly, they followed her, thinking she was going to the tomb to cry there.
JN
11:32
But Mary went to the place where Jesus was. When she saw him, she fell at his feet and said, “Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died.”
JN
11:33
When Jesus saw Mary crying and the Jews who came with her also crying, he was upset and was deeply troubled.
JN
11:34
He asked, “Where did you bury him?” “Come and see, Lord,” they said.
JN
11:35
Jesus cried.
JN
11:36
So the Jews said, “See how much he loved him.”
JN
11:37
But some of them said, “If Jesus opened the eyes of the blind man, why couldn’t he keep Lazarus from dying?”
JN
11:38
Again feeling very upset, Jesus came to the tomb. It was a cave with a large stone covering the entrance.
JN
11:39
Jesus said, “Move the stone away.” Martha, the sister of the dead man, said, “But, Lord, it has been four days since he died. There will be a bad smell.”
JN
11:40
Then Jesus said to her, “Didn’t I tell you that if you believed you would see the glory of God?”
JN
11:41
So they moved the stone away from the entrance. Then Jesus looked up and said, “Father, I thank you that you heard me.
JN
11:42
I know that you always hear me, but I said these things because of the people here around me. I want them to believe that you sent me.”
JN
11:43
After Jesus said this, he cried out in a loud voice, “Lazarus, come out!”
JN
11:44
The dead man came out, his hands and feet wrapped with pieces of cloth, and a cloth around his face. Jesus said to them, “Take the cloth off of him and let him go.”
Week 43-62 | Priests Decide To Kill Jesus
Jn 11:45-57
Jn 11:45-57
JN
11:45
Many of the people, who had come to visit Mary and saw what Jesus did, believed in him.
JN
11:46
But some of them went to the Pharisees and told them what Jesus had done.
JN
11:47
Then the leading priests and Pharisees called a meeting of the council. They asked, “What should we do? This man is doing many miracles.
JN
11:48
If we let him continue doing these things, everyone will believe in him. Then the Romans will come and take away our Temple and our nation.”
JN
11:49
One of the men there was Caiaphas, the high priest that year. He said, “You people know nothing!
JN
11:50
You don’t realize that it is better for one man to die for the people than for the whole nation to be destroyed.”
JN
11:51
Caiaphas did not think of this himself. As high priest that year, he was really prophesying that Jesus would die for their nation
JN
11:52
and for God’s scattered children to bring them all together and make them one.
JN
11:53
That day they started planning to kill Jesus.
JN
11:54
So Jesus no longer traveled openly among the people. He left there and went to a place near the desert, to a town called Ephraim and stayed there with his followers.
JN
11:55
It was almost time for the Passover Feast. Many from the country went up to Jerusalem before the Passover to do the special things to make themselves pure.
JN
11:56
The people looked for Jesus and stood in the Temple asking each other, “Is he coming to the Feast? What do you think?”
JN
11:57
But the leading priests and the Pharisees had given orders that if anyone knew where Jesus was, he must tell them. Then they could arrest him.
Week 43-62 | Jesus Talks About His Death In Details
Mt 20:17-19 Mk 10:32-34 Lk 18:31-34
Default Mt 20:17-19 Mk 10:32-34 Lk 18:31-34
LK
18:31
Then Jesus took the twelve apostles aside and said to them, “We are going to Jerusalem. Everything the prophets wrote about the Son of Man will happen.
LK
18:32
He will be turned over to those who are evil. They will laugh at him, insult him, spit on him,
LK
18:33
beat him with whips, and kill him. But on the third day, he will rise to life again.”
LK
18:34
The apostles did not understand this; the meaning was hidden from them, and they did not realize what was said.
Default Mt 20:17-19 Mk 10:32-34 Lk 18:31-34
MT
20:17
While Jesus was going to Jerusalem, he took his twelve followers aside privately and said to them,
MT
20:18
“Look, we are going to Jerusalem. The Son of Man will be turned over to the leading priests and the teachers of the law, and they will say that he must die.
MT
20:19
They will give the Son of Man to the non-Jewish people to laugh at him and beat him with whips and crucify him. But on the third day, he will be raised to life again.”
Default Mt 20:17-19 Mk 10:32-34 Lk 18:31-34
MK
10:32
As Jesus and the people with him were on the road to Jerusalem, he was leading the way. His followers were amazed, but others in the crowd who followed were afraid. Again Jesus took the twelve apostles aside and began to tell them what was about to happen in Jerusalem.
MK
10:33
He said, “Look, we are going to Jerusalem. The Son of Man will be turned over to the leading priests and the teachers of the law. They will say that he must die, and they will turn him over to the non-Jewish people,
MK
10:34
who will laugh at him and spit on him. They will beat him with whips and crucify him. But on the third day, he will rise to life again.”
Default Mt 20:17-19 Mk 10:32-34 Lk 18:31-34
LK
18:31
Then Jesus took the twelve apostles aside and said to them, “We are going to Jerusalem. Everything the prophets wrote about the Son of Man will happen.
LK
18:32
He will be turned over to those who are evil. They will laugh at him, insult him, spit on him,
LK
18:33
beat him with whips, and kill him. But on the third day, he will rise to life again.”
LK
18:34
The apostles did not understand this; the meaning was hidden from them, and they did not realize what was said.
Week 43-62 | The Ambition Of James And John
Mt 20:20-28 Mk 10:35-45
Default Mt 20:20-28 Mk 10:35-45
MK
10:35
Then James and John, sons of Zebedee, came to Jesus and said, “Teacher, we want to ask you to do something for us.”
MK
10:36
Jesus asked, “What do you want me to do for you?”
MK
10:37
They answered, “Let one of us sit at your right side and one of us sit at your left side in your glory in your kingdom.”
MK
10:38
Jesus said, “You don’t understand what you are asking. Can you drink the cup that I must drink? And can you be baptized with the same kind of baptism that I must go through?”(am)
MK
10:39
They answered, “Yes, we can.” Jesus said to them, “You will drink the same cup that I will drink, and you will be baptized with the same baptism that I must go through.
MK
10:40
But I cannot choose who will sit at my right or my left; those places belong to those for whom they have been prepared.”
MK
10:41
When the other ten followers heard this, they began to be angry with James and John.
MK
10:42
Jesus called them together and said, “The other nations have rulers. You know that those rulers love to show their power over the people, and their important leaders love to use all their authority.
MK
10:43
But it should not be that way among you. Whoever wants to become great among you must serve the rest of you like a servant.
MK
10:44
Whoever wants to become the first among you must serve all of you like a slave.
MK
10:45
In the same way, the Son of Man did not come to be served. He came to serve others and to give his life as a ransom for many people.”
Default Mt 20:20-28 Mk 10:35-45
MT
20:20
Then the wife of Zebedee came to Jesus with her sons. She bowed before him and asked him to do something for her.
MT
20:21
Jesus asked, “What do you want?” She said, “Promise that one of my sons will sit at your right side and the other will sit at your left side in your kingdom.”
MT
20:22
But Jesus said, “You don’t understand what you are asking. Can you drink the cup that I am about to drink?”(bp) The sons answered, “Yes, we can.”
MT
20:23
Jesus said to them, “You will drink from my cup. But I cannot choose who will sit at my right or my left; those places belong to those for whom my Father has prepared them.”
MT
20:24
When the other ten followers heard this, they were angry with the two brothers.
MT
20:25
Jesus called all the followers together and said, “You know that the rulers of the non-Jewish people love to show their power over the people. And their important leaders love to use all their authority.
MT
20:26
But it should not be that way among you. Whoever wants to become great among you must serve the rest of you like a servant.
MT
20:27
Whoever wants to become first among you must serve the rest of you like a slave.
MT
20:28
In the same way, the Son of Man did not come to be served. He came to serve others and to give his life as a ransom for many people.”
Default Mt 20:20-28 Mk 10:35-45
MK
10:35
Then James and John, sons of Zebedee, came to Jesus and said, “Teacher, we want to ask you to do something for us.”
MK
10:36
Jesus asked, “What do you want me to do for you?”
MK
10:37
They answered, “Let one of us sit at your right side and one of us sit at your left side in your glory in your kingdom.”
MK
10:38
Jesus said, “You don’t understand what you are asking. Can you drink the cup that I must drink? And can you be baptized with the same kind of baptism that I must go through?”(am)
MK
10:39
They answered, “Yes, we can.” Jesus said to them, “You will drink the same cup that I will drink, and you will be baptized with the same baptism that I must go through.
MK
10:40
But I cannot choose who will sit at my right or my left; those places belong to those for whom they have been prepared.”
MK
10:41
When the other ten followers heard this, they began to be angry with James and John.
MK
10:42
Jesus called them together and said, “The other nations have rulers. You know that those rulers love to show their power over the people, and their important leaders love to use all their authority.
MK
10:43
But it should not be that way among you. Whoever wants to become great among you must serve the rest of you like a servant.
MK
10:44
Whoever wants to become the first among you must serve all of you like a slave.
MK
10:45
In the same way, the Son of Man did not come to be served. He came to serve others and to give his life as a ransom for many people.”
Week 43-62 | Blind Men Of Jericho (Bartimaeus)
Mt 20:29-34 Mk 10:46-52 Lk 18:35-43
Default Mt 20:29-34 Mk 10:46-52 Lk 18:35-43
MK
10:46
Then they came to the town of Jericho. As Jesus was leaving there with his followers and a great many people, a blind beggar named Bartimaeus son of Timaeus was sitting by the road.
MT
20:30
Two blind men sitting by the road heard that Jesus was going by, so they shouted, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!”
MT
20:31
The people warned the blind men to be quiet, but they shouted even more, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!”
MT
20:32
Jesus stopped and said to the blind men, “What do you want me to do for you?”
MT
20:33
They answered, “Lord, we want to see.”
MT
20:34
Jesus felt sorry for the blind men and touched their eyes, and at once they could see. Then they followed Jesus.
Default Mt 20:29-34 Mk 10:46-52 Lk 18:35-43
MT
20:29
When Jesus and his followers were leaving Jericho, a great many people followed him.
MT
20:30
Two blind men sitting by the road heard that Jesus was going by, so they shouted, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!”
MT
20:31
The people warned the blind men to be quiet, but they shouted even more, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!”
MT
20:32
Jesus stopped and said to the blind men, “What do you want me to do for you?”
MT
20:33
They answered, “Lord, we want to see.”
MT
20:34
Jesus felt sorry for the blind men and touched their eyes, and at once they could see. Then they followed Jesus.
Default Mt 20:29-34 Mk 10:46-52 Lk 18:35-43
MK
10:46
Then they came to the town of Jericho. As Jesus was leaving there with his followers and a great many people, a blind beggar named Bartimaeus son of Timaeus was sitting by the road.
MK
10:47
When he heard that Jesus from Nazareth was walking by, he began to shout, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
MK
10:48
Many people warned the blind man to be quiet, but he shouted even more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
MK
10:49
Jesus stopped and said, “Tell the man to come here.” So they called the blind man, saying, “Cheer up! Get to your feet. Jesus is calling you.”
MK
10:50
The blind man jumped up, left his coat there, and went to Jesus.
MK
10:51
Jesus asked him, “What do you want me to do for you?” The blind man answered, “Teacher, I want to see.”
MK
10:52
Jesus said, “Go, you are healed because you believed.” At once the man could see, and he followed Jesus on the road.
Default Mt 20:29-34 Mk 10:46-52 Lk 18:35-43
LK
18:35
As Jesus came near the city of Jericho, a blind man was sitting beside the road, begging.
LK
18:36
When he heard the people coming down the road, he asked, “What is happening?”
LK
18:37
They told him, “Jesus, from Nazareth, is going by.”
LK
18:38
The blind man cried out, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
LK
18:39
The people leading the group warned the blind man to be quiet. But the blind man shouted even more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
LK
18:40
Jesus stopped and ordered the blind man to be brought to him. When he came near, Jesus asked him,
LK
18:41
“What do you want me to do for you?” He said, “Lord, I want to see.”
LK
18:42
Jesus said to him, “Then see. You are healed because you believed.”
LK
18:43
At once the man was able to see, and he followed Jesus, thanking God. All the people who saw this praised God.
Week 43-62 | Zacchaeus A Chief Tax Collector Changes His Heart
Lk 19:1-10
Default Lk 19:1-10
LK
19:2
A man was there named Zacchaeus, who was a very important tax collector, and he was wealthy.
LK
19:3
He wanted to see who Jesus was, but he was not able because he was too short to see above the crowd.
LK
19:4
He ran ahead to a place where Jesus would come, and he climbed a sycamore tree so he could see him.
LK
19:5
When Jesus came to that place, he looked up and said to him, “Zacchaeus, hurry and come down! I must stay at your house today.”
LK
19:6
Zacchaeus came down quickly and welcomed him gladly.
LK
19:7
All the people saw this and began to complain, “Jesus is staying with a sinner!”
LK
19:8
But Zacchaeus stood and said to the Lord, “I will give half of my possessions to the poor. And if I have cheated anyone, I will pay back four times more.”
LK
19:9
Jesus said to him, “Salvation has come to this house today, because this man also belongs to the family of Abraham.
LK
19:10
The Son of Man came to find lost people and save them.”
Default Lk 19:1-10
LK
19:1
Jesus was going through the city of Jericho.
LK
19:2
A man was there named Zacchaeus, who was a very important tax collector, and he was wealthy.
LK
19:3
He wanted to see who Jesus was, but he was not able because he was too short to see above the crowd.
LK
19:4
He ran ahead to a place where Jesus would come, and he climbed a sycamore tree so he could see him.
LK
19:5
When Jesus came to that place, he looked up and said to him, “Zacchaeus, hurry and come down! I must stay at your house today.”
LK
19:6
Zacchaeus came down quickly and welcomed him gladly.
LK
19:7
All the people saw this and began to complain, “Jesus is staying with a sinner!”
LK
19:8
But Zacchaeus stood and said to the Lord, “I will give half of my possessions to the poor. And if I have cheated anyone, I will pay back four times more.”
LK
19:9
Jesus said to him, “Salvation has come to this house today, because this man also belongs to the family of Abraham.
LK
19:10
The Son of Man came to find lost people and save them.”
Week 43-62 | Talents
Mt 25:14-30 Lk 19:11-28
Default Mt 25:14-30 Lk 19:11-28
LK
19:11
As the people were listening to this, Jesus told them a story because he was near Jerusalem and they thought God’s kingdom would appear immediately.
LK
19:12
He said: “A very important man went to a country far away to be made a king and then to return home.
LK
19:13
So he called ten of his servants and gave a coin(bo) to each servant. He said, ‘Do business with this money until I get back.’
LK
19:14
But the people in the kingdom hated the man. So they sent a group to follow him and say, ‘We don’t want this man to be our king.’
LK
19:15
“But the man became king. When he returned home, he said, ‘Call those servants who have my money so I can know how much they earned with it.’
LK
19:16
“The first servant came and said, ‘Sir, I earned ten coins with the one you gave me.’
LK
19:17
The king said to the servant, ‘Excellent! You are a good servant. Since I can trust you with small things, I will let you rule over ten of my cities.’
LK
19:18
“The second servant said, ‘Sir, I earned five coins with your one.’
LK
19:19
The king said to this servant, ‘You can rule over five cities.’
LK
19:20
“Then another servant came in and said to the king, ‘Sir, here is your coin which I wrapped in a piece of cloth and hid.
LK
19:21
I was afraid of you, because you are a hard man. You even take money that you didn’t earn and gather food that you didn’t plant.’
LK
19:22
Then the king said to the servant, ‘I will condemn you by your own words, you evil servant. You knew that I am a hard man, taking money that I didn’t earn and gathering food that I didn’t plant.
LK
19:23
Why then didn’t you put my money in the bank? Then when I came back, my money would have earned some interest.’
LK
19:24
“The king said to the men who were standing by, ‘Take the coin away from this servant and give it to the servant who earned ten coins.’
LK
19:25
They said, ‘But sir, that servant already has ten coins.’
LK
19:26
The king said, ‘Those who have will be given more, but those who do not have anything will have everything taken away from them.
LK
19:27
Now where are my enemies who didn’t want me to be king? Bring them here and kill them before me.’”
LK
19:28
After Jesus said this, he went on toward Jerusalem.
Default Mt 25:14-30 Lk 19:11-28
MT
25:14
“The kingdom of heaven is like a man who was going to another place for a visit. Before he left, he called for his servants and told them to take care of his things while he was gone.
MT
25:15
He gave one servant five bags of gold, another servant two bags of gold, and a third servant one bag of gold, to each one as much as he could handle. Then he left.
MT
25:16
The servant who got five bags went quickly to invest the money and earned five more bags.
MT
25:17
In the same way, the servant who had two bags invested them and earned two more.
MT
25:18
But the servant who got one bag went out and dug a hole in the ground and hid the master’s money.
MT
25:19
“After a long time the master came home and asked the servants what they did with his money.
MT
25:20
The servant who was given five bags of gold brought five more bags to the master and said, ‘Master, you trusted me to care for five bags of gold, so I used your five bags to earn five more.’
MT
25:21
The master answered, ‘You did well. You are a good and loyal servant. Because you were loyal with small things, I will let you care for much greater things. Come and share my joy with me.’
MT
25:22
“Then the servant who had been given two bags of gold came to the master and said, ‘Master, you gave me two bags of gold to care for, so I used your two bags to earn two more.’
MT
25:23
The master answered, ‘You did well. You are a good and loyal servant. Because you were loyal with small things, I will let you care for much greater things. Come and share my joy with me.’
MT
25:24
“Then the servant who had been given one bag of gold came to the master and said, ‘Master, I knew that you were a hard man. You harvest things you did not plant. You gather crops where you did not sow any seed.
MT
25:25
So I was afraid and went and hid your money in the ground. Here is your bag of gold.’
MT
25:26
The master answered, ‘You are a wicked and lazy servant! You say you knew that I harvest things I did not plant and that I gather crops where I did not sow any seed.
MT
25:27
So you should have put my gold in the bank. Then, when I came home, I would have received my gold back with interest.’
MT
25:28
“So the master told his other servants, ‘Take the bag of gold from that servant and give it to the servant who has ten bags of gold.
MT
25:29
Those who have much will get more, and they will have much more than they need. But those who do not have much will have everything taken away from them.’
MT
25:30
Then the master said, ‘Throw that useless servant outside, into the darkness where people will cry and grind their teeth with pain.’
Default Mt 25:14-30 Lk 19:11-28
LK
19:11
As the people were listening to this, Jesus told them a story because he was near Jerusalem and they thought God’s kingdom would appear immediately.
LK
19:12
He said: “A very important man went to a country far away to be made a king and then to return home.
LK
19:13
So he called ten of his servants and gave a coin(bo) to each servant. He said, ‘Do business with this money until I get back.’
LK
19:14
But the people in the kingdom hated the man. So they sent a group to follow him and say, ‘We don’t want this man to be our king.’
LK
19:15
“But the man became king. When he returned home, he said, ‘Call those servants who have my money so I can know how much they earned with it.’
LK
19:16
“The first servant came and said, ‘Sir, I earned ten coins with the one you gave me.’
LK
19:17
The king said to the servant, ‘Excellent! You are a good servant. Since I can trust you with small things, I will let you rule over ten of my cities.’
LK
19:18
“The second servant said, ‘Sir, I earned five coins with your one.’
LK
19:19
The king said to this servant, ‘You can rule over five cities.’
LK
19:20
“Then another servant came in and said to the king, ‘Sir, here is your coin which I wrapped in a piece of cloth and hid.
LK
19:21
I was afraid of you, because you are a hard man. You even take money that you didn’t earn and gather food that you didn’t plant.’
LK
19:22
Then the king said to the servant, ‘I will condemn you by your own words, you evil servant. You knew that I am a hard man, taking money that I didn’t earn and gathering food that I didn’t plant.
LK
19:23
Why then didn’t you put my money in the bank? Then when I came back, my money would have earned some interest.’
LK
19:24
“The king said to the men who were standing by, ‘Take the coin away from this servant and give it to the servant who earned ten coins.’
LK
19:25
They said, ‘But sir, that servant already has ten coins.’
LK
19:26
The king said, ‘Those who have will be given more, but those who do not have anything will have everything taken away from them.
LK
19:27
Now where are my enemies who didn’t want me to be king? Bring them here and kill them before me.’”
LK
19:28
After Jesus said this, he went on toward Jerusalem.
Week 62 | The Week Before The Second Passover In Jerusalem
– +
Week 62 | Anointing By Mary
Mt 26:6-13 Mk 14:3-9 Lk 7:36-50 Jn 12:1-9
Default Mt 26:6-13 Mk 14:3-9 Lk 7:36-50 Jn 12:1-9
JN
12:1
Six days before the Passover Feast, Jesus went to Bethany, where Lazarus lived. (Lazarus is the man Jesus raised from the dead.)
JN
12:2
There they had a dinner for Jesus. Martha served the food, and Lazarus was one of the people eating with Jesus.
JN
12:3
Mary brought in a pint of very expensive perfume made from pure nard. She poured the perfume on Jesus’ feet, and then she wiped his feet with her hair. And the sweet smell from the perfume filled the whole house.
JN
12:4
Judas Iscariot, one of Jesus’ followers who would later turn against him, was there. Judas said,
JN
12:5
“This perfume was worth an entire year’s wages. Why wasn’t it sold and the money given to the poor?”
JN
12:6
But Judas did not really care about the poor; he said this because he was a thief. He was the one who kept the money box, and he often stole from it.
JN
12:7
Jesus answered, “Leave her alone. It was right for her to save this perfume for today, the day for me to be prepared for burial.
JN
12:8
You will always have the poor with you, but you will not always have me.”
JN
12:9
A large crowd of people heard that Jesus was in Bethany. So they went there to see not only Jesus but Lazarus, whom Jesus raised from the dead.
Default Mt 26:6-13 Mk 14:3-9 Lk 7:36-50 Jn 12:1-9
MT
26:6
Jesus was in Bethany at the house of Simon, who had a skin disease.
MT
26:7
While Jesus was there, a woman approached him with an alabaster jar filled with expensive perfume. She poured this perfume on Jesus’ head while he was eating.
MT
26:8
His followers were upset when they saw the woman do this. They asked, “Why waste that perfume?
MT
26:9
It could have been sold for a great deal of money and the money given to the poor.”
MT
26:10
Knowing what had happened, Jesus said, “Why are you troubling this woman? She did an excellent thing for me.
MT
26:11
You will always have the poor with you, but you will not always have me.
MT
26:12
This woman poured perfume on my body to prepare me for burial.
MT
26:13
I tell you the truth, wherever the Good News is preached in all the world, what this woman has done will be told, and people will remember her.”
Default Mt 26:6-13 Mk 14:3-9 Lk 7:36-50 Jn 12:1-9
MK
14:3
Jesus was in Bethany at the house of Simon, who had a skin disease. While Jesus was eating there, a woman approached him with an alabaster jar filled with very expensive perfume, made of pure nard. She opened the jar and poured the perfume on Jesus’ head.
MK
14:4
Some who were there became upset and said to each other, “Why waste that perfume?
MK
14:5
It was worth a full year’s work. It could have been sold and the money given to the poor.” And they got very angry with the woman.
MK
14:6
Jesus said, “Leave her alone. Why are you troubling her? She did an excellent thing for me.
MK
14:7
You will always have the poor with you, and you can help them anytime you want. But you will not always have me.
MK
14:8
This woman did the only thing she could do for me; she poured perfume on my body to prepare me for burial.
MK
14:9
I tell you the truth, wherever the Good News is preached in all the world, what this woman has done will be told, and people will remember her.”
Default Mt 26:6-13 Mk 14:3-9 Lk 7:36-50 Jn 12:1-9
LK
7:36
One of the Pharisees asked Jesus to eat with him, so Jesus went into the Pharisee’s house and sat at the table.
LK
7:37
A sinful woman in the town learned that Jesus was eating at the Pharisee’s house. So she brought an alabaster jar of perfume
LK
7:38
and stood behind Jesus at his feet, crying. She began to wash his feet with her tears, and she dried them with her hair, kissing them many times and rubbing them with the perfume.
LK
7:39
When the Pharisee who asked Jesus to come to his house saw this, he thought to himself, “If Jesus were a prophet, he would know that the woman touching him is a sinner!”
LK
7:40
Jesus said to the Pharisee, “Simon, I have something to say to you.” Simon said, “Teacher, tell me.”
LK
7:41
Jesus said, “Two people owed money to the same banker. One owed five hundred coins(x) and the other owed fifty.
LK
7:42
They had no money to pay what they owed, but the banker told both of them they did not have to pay him. Which person will love the banker more?”
LK
7:43
Simon, the Pharisee, answered, “I think it would be the one who owed him the most money.” Jesus said to Simon, “You are right.”
LK
7:44
Then Jesus turned toward the woman and said to Simon, “Do you see this woman? When I came into your house, you gave me no water for my feet, but she washed my feet with her tears and dried them with her hair.
LK
7:45
You gave me no kiss of greeting, but she has been kissing my feet since I came in.
LK
7:46
You did not put oil on my head, but she poured perfume on my feet.
LK
7:47
I tell you that her many sins are forgiven, so she showed great love. But the person who is forgiven only a little will love only a little.”
LK
7:48
Then Jesus said to her, “Your sins are forgiven.”
LK
7:49
The people sitting at the table began to say among themselves, “Who is this who even forgives sins?”
LK
7:50
Jesus said to the woman, “Because you believed, you are saved from your sins. Go in peace.”
Default Mt 26:6-13 Mk 14:3-9 Lk 7:36-50 Jn 12:1-9
JN
12:1
Six days before the Passover Feast, Jesus went to Bethany, where Lazarus lived. (Lazarus is the man Jesus raised from the dead.)
JN
12:2
There they had a dinner for Jesus. Martha served the food, and Lazarus was one of the people eating with Jesus.
JN
12:3
Mary brought in a pint of very expensive perfume made from pure nard. She poured the perfume on Jesus’ feet, and then she wiped his feet with her hair. And the sweet smell from the perfume filled the whole house.
JN
12:4
Judas Iscariot, one of Jesus’ followers who would later turn against him, was there. Judas said,
JN
12:5
“This perfume was worth an entire year’s wages. Why wasn’t it sold and the money given to the poor?”
JN
12:6
But Judas did not really care about the poor; he said this because he was a thief. He was the one who kept the money box, and he often stole from it.
JN
12:7
Jesus answered, “Leave her alone. It was right for her to save this perfume for today, the day for me to be prepared for burial.
JN
12:8
You will always have the poor with you, but you will not always have me.”
JN
12:9
A large crowd of people heard that Jesus was in Bethany. So they went there to see not only Jesus but Lazarus, whom Jesus raised from the dead.
Week 62 | Priests Plan To Kill Jesus And Lazarus
Mt 26:1-5 Mk 14:1-2 Lk 22:1-2 Jn 12:10-11
Default Mt 26:1-5 Mk 14:1-2 Lk 22:1-2 Jn 12:10-11
JN
12:10
So the leading priests made plans to kill Lazarus, too.
JN
12:11
Because of Lazarus many of the Jews were leaving them and believing in Jesus.
LK
22:2
The leading priests and teachers of the law were trying to find a way to kill Jesus, because they were afraid of the people.
Default Mt 26:1-5 Mk 14:1-2 Lk 22:1-2 Jn 12:10-11
MT
26:1
After Jesus finished saying all these things, he told his followers,
MT
26:2
“You know that the day after tomorrow is the day of the Passover Feast. On that day the Son of Man will be given to his enemies to be crucified.”
MT
26:3
Then the leading priests and the elders had a meeting at the palace of the high priest, named Caiaphas.
MT
26:4
At the meeting, they planned to set a trap to arrest Jesus and kill him.
MT
26:5
But they said, “We must not do it during the feast, because the people might cause a riot.”
Default Mt 26:1-5 Mk 14:1-2 Lk 22:1-2 Jn 12:10-11

14:1
It was now only two days before the Passover and the Feast of Unleavened Bread. The leading priests and teachers of the law were trying to find a trick to arrest Jesus and kill him.
MK
14:2
But they said, “We must not do it during the feast, because the people might cause a riot.”
Default Mt 26:1-5 Mk 14:1-2 Lk 22:1-2 Jn 12:10-11
LK
22:1
It was almost time for the Feast of Unleavened Bread, called the Passover Feast.
LK
22:2
The leading priests and teachers of the law were trying to find a way to kill Jesus, because they were afraid of the people.

Week 62 | Judas Comes To An Agreement With The Priests
Mt 26:14-16 Mk 14:10-11 Lk 22:3-6
Default Mt 26:14-16 Mk 14:10-11 Lk 22:3-6
LK
22:3
Satan entered Judas Iscariot, one of Jesus’ twelve apostles.
LK
22:4
Judas went to the leading priests and some of the soldiers who guarded the Temple and talked to them about a way to hand Jesus over to them.
LK
22:5
They were pleased and agreed to give Judas money.
LK
22:6
He agreed and watched for the best time to hand Jesus over to them when he was away from the crowd.
Default Mt 26:14-16 Mk 14:10-11 Lk 22:3-6
MT
26:14
Then one of the twelve apostles, Judas Iscariot, went to talk to the leading priests.
MT
26:15
He said, “What will you pay me for giving Jesus to you?” And they gave him thirty silver coins.
MT
26:16
After that, Judas watched for the best time to turn Jesus in.
Default Mt 26:14-16 Mk 14:10-11 Lk 22:3-6
MK
14:10
One of the twelve apostles, Judas Iscariot, went to talk to the leading priests to offer to hand Jesus over to them.
MK
14:11
These priests were pleased about this and promised to pay Judas money. So he watched for the best time to turn Jesus in.
Default Mt 26:14-16 Mk 14:10-11 Lk 22:3-6
