LK
21:6
“As for these things you are looking at, the time will come when not one stone will be left on another. Every stone will be thrown down.”
Week 62 | False Prophets, Wars, Sicknesses, Lack Of Food
Mt 24:3-8 Mk 13:3-8 Lk 21:7-11
Default Mt 24:3-8 Mk 13:3-8 Lk 21:7-11
LK
21:7
They asked Jesus, “Teacher, when will these things happen? What will be the sign that they are about to take place?”
LK
21:8
Jesus said, “Be careful so you are not fooled. Many people will come in my name, saying, ‘I am the One’ and, ‘The time has come!’ But don’t follow them.
LK
21:9
When you hear about wars and riots, don’t be afraid, because these things must happen first, but the end will come later.”
LK
21:10
Then he said to them, “Nations will fight against other nations, and kingdoms against other kingdoms.
LK
21:11
In various places there will be great earthquakes, sicknesses, and a lack of food. Fearful events and great signs will come from heaven.
Default Mt 24:3-8 Mk 13:3-8 Lk 21:7-11
MT
24:3
Later, as Jesus was sitting on the Mount of Olives, his followers came to be alone with him. They said, “Tell us, when will these things happen? And what will be the sign that it is time for you to come again and for this age to end?”
MT
24:4
Jesus answered, “Be careful that no one fools you.
MT
24:5
Many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am the Christ,’ and they will fool many people.
MT
24:6
You will hear about wars and stories of wars that are coming, but don’t be afraid. These things must happen before the end comes.
MT
24:7
Nations will fight against other nations; kingdoms will fight against other kingdoms. There will be times when there is no food for people to eat, and there will be earthquakes in different places.
MT
24:8
These things are like the first pains when something new is about to be born.
Default Mt 24:3-8 Mk 13:3-8 Lk 21:7-11
MK
13:3
Later, as Jesus was sitting on the Mount of Olives, opposite the Temple, he was alone with Peter, James, John, and Andrew. They asked Jesus,
MK
13:4
“Tell us, when will these things happen? And what will be the sign that they are going to happen?”
MK
13:5
Jesus began to answer them, “Be careful that no one fools you.
MK
13:6
Many people will come in my name, saying, ‘I am the One,’ and they will fool many people.
MK
13:7
When you hear about wars and stories of wars that are coming, don’t be afraid. These things must happen before the end comes.
MK
13:8
Nations will fight against other nations, and kingdoms against other kingdoms. There will be earthquakes in different places, and there will be times when there is no food for people to eat. These things are like the first pains when something new is about to be born.
Default Mt 24:3-8 Mk 13:3-8 Lk 21:7-11
LK
21:7
They asked Jesus, “Teacher, when will these things happen? What will be the sign that they are about to take place?”
LK
21:8
Jesus said, “Be careful so you are not fooled. Many people will come in my name, saying, ‘I am the One’ and, ‘The time has come!’ But don’t follow them.
LK
21:9
When you hear about wars and riots, don’t be afraid, because these things must happen first, but the end will come later.”
LK
21:10
Then he said to them, “Nations will fight against other nations, and kingdoms against other kingdoms.
LK
21:11
In various places there will be great earthquakes, sicknesses, and a lack of food. Fearful events and great signs will come from heaven.
Week 62 | Persecution
Mt 10:17-18 Mk 13:9-10 Lk 21:12-13
Default Mt 10:17-18 Mk 13:9-10 Lk 21:12-13
MK
13:9
“You must be careful. People will arrest you and take you to court and beat you in their synagogues. You will be forced to stand before kings and governors, to tell them about me. This will happen to you because you follow me.
MK
13:10
But before these things happen, the Good News must be told to all people.
Default Mt 10:17-18 Mk 13:9-10 Lk 21:12-13
MT
10:17
Be careful of people, because they will arrest you and take you to court and whip you in their synagogues.
MT
10:18
Because of me you will be taken to stand before governors and kings, and you will tell them and the non-Jewish people about me.
Default Mt 10:17-18 Mk 13:9-10 Lk 21:12-13
MK
13:9
“You must be careful. People will arrest you and take you to court and beat you in their synagogues. You will be forced to stand before kings and governors, to tell them about me. This will happen to you because you follow me.
MK
13:10
But before these things happen, the Good News must be told to all people.
Default Mt 10:17-18 Mk 13:9-10 Lk 21:12-13
LK
21:12
“But before all these things happen, people will arrest you and treat you cruelly. They will judge you in their synagogues and put you in jail and force you to stand before kings and governors, because you follow me.
LK
21:13
But this will give you an opportunity to tell about me.
Week 62 | Torture, Executions
Mt 24:9-14 Jn 16:1-4
Default Mt 24:9-14 Jn 16:1-4
JN
16:1
“I have told you these things to keep you from giving up.
JN
16:2
People will put you out of their synagogues. Yes, the time is coming when those who kill you will think they are offering service to God.
JN
16:3
They will do this because they have not known the Father and they have not known me.
MT
24:10
At that time, many will lose their faith, and they will turn against each other and hate each other.
MT
24:11
Many false prophets will come and cause many people to believe lies.
MT
24:12
There will be more and more evil in the world, so most people will stop showing their love for each other.
MT
24:13
But those people who keep their faith until the end will be saved.
MT
24:14
The Good News about God’s kingdom will be preached in all the world, to every nation. Then the end will come.
Default Mt 24:9-14 Jn 16:1-4
MT
24:9
“Then people will arrest you, hand you over to be hurt, and kill you. They will hate you because you believe in me.
MT
24:10
At that time, many will lose their faith, and they will turn against each other and hate each other.
MT
24:11
Many false prophets will come and cause many people to believe lies.
MT
24:12
There will be more and more evil in the world, so most people will stop showing their love for each other.
MT
24:13
But those people who keep their faith until the end will be saved.
MT
24:14
The Good News about God’s kingdom will be preached in all the world, to every nation. Then the end will come.
Default Mt 24:9-14 Jn 16:1-4
JN
16:1
“I have told you these things to keep you from giving up.
JN
16:2
People will put you out of their synagogues. Yes, the time is coming when those who kill you will think they are offering service to God.
JN
16:3
They will do this because they have not known the Father and they have not known me.
JN
16:4
I have told you these things now so that when the time comes you will remember that I warned you. The Work of the Holy Spirit “I did not tell you these things at the beginning, because I was with you then.
Week 62 | Don't Worry ABout What To Say Then
Mt 10:19-20 Mk 13:11-11 Lk 12:11-12
Default Mt 10:19-20 Mk 13:11-11 Lk 12:11-12
LK
12:11
“When you are brought into the synagogues before the leaders and other powerful people, don’t worry about how to defend yourself or what to say.
LK
12:12
At that time the Holy Spirit will teach you what you must say.”
Default Mt 10:19-20 Mk 13:11-11 Lk 12:11-12
MT
10:19
When you are arrested, don’t worry about what to say or how to say it. At that time you will be given the things to say.
MT
10:20
It will not really be you speaking but the Spirit of your Father speaking through you.
Default Mt 10:19-20 Mk 13:11-11 Lk 12:11-12
MK
13:11
When you are arrested and judged, don’t worry ahead of time about what you should say. Say whatever is given you to say at that time, because it will not really be you speaking; it will be the Holy Spirit.
Default Mt 10:19-20 Mk 13:11-11 Lk 12:11-12
LK
12:11
“When you are brought into the synagogues before the leaders and other powerful people, don’t worry about how to defend yourself or what to say.
LK
12:12
At that time the Holy Spirit will teach you what you must say.”
Week 62 | The Holy Spirit Will Speak Through You
Lk 21:14-15
Lk 21:14-15
LK
21:14
Make up your minds not to worry ahead of time about what you will say.
LK
21:15
I will give you the wisdom to say things that none of your enemies will be able to stand against or prove wrong.
Week 62 | Relatives, Friends Will Give Each Other To Be Killed
Mt 10:21-22 Mk 13:12-13 Lk 21:16-19
Default Mt 10:21-22 Mk 13:12-13 Lk 21:16-19
MT
10:21
“Brothers will give their own brothers to be killed, and fathers will give their own children to be killed. Children will fight against their own parents and have them put to death.
MT
10:22
All people will hate you because you follow me, but those people who keep their faith until the end will be saved.
Default Mt 10:21-22 Mk 13:12-13 Lk 21:16-19
MT
10:21
“Brothers will give their own brothers to be killed, and fathers will give their own children to be killed. Children will fight against their own parents and have them put to death.
MT
10:22
All people will hate you because you follow me, but those people who keep their faith until the end will be saved.
Default Mt 10:21-22 Mk 13:12-13 Lk 21:16-19
MK
13:12
“Brothers will give their own brothers to be killed, and fathers will give their own children to be killed. Children will fight against their own parents and cause them to be put to death.
MK
13:13
All people will hate you because you follow me, but those people who keep their faith until the end will be saved.
Default Mt 10:21-22 Mk 13:12-13 Lk 21:16-19
LK
21:16
Even your parents, brothers, relatives, and friends will turn against you, and they will kill some of you.
LK
21:17
All people will hate you because you follow me.
LK
21:18
But none of these things can really harm you.
LK
21:19
By continuing to have faith you will save your lives.
Week 62 | Run Away To The Mountains
Mt 24:15-16 Mk 13:14-14 Lk 21:20-22
Default Mt 24:15-16 Mk 13:14-14 Lk 21:20-22
MT
24:15
“Daniel the prophet spoke about ‘a blasphemous object that brings destruction.’(ch) You will see this standing in the holy place.” (You who read this should understand what it means.)
LK
21:21
At that time, the people in Judea should run away to the mountains. The people in Jerusalem must get out, and those who are near the city should not go in.
LK
21:22
These are the days of punishment to bring about all that is written in the Scriptures.
Default Mt 24:15-16 Mk 13:14-14 Lk 21:20-22
MT
24:15
“Daniel the prophet spoke about ‘a blasphemous object that brings destruction.’(ch) You will see this standing in the holy place.” (You who read this should understand what it means.)
MT
24:16
“At that time, the people in Judea should run away to the mountains.
Default Mt 24:15-16 Mk 13:14-14 Lk 21:20-22
MK
13:14
“You will see ‘a blasphemous object that brings destruction’(ax) standing where it should not be.” (You who read this should understand what it means.) “At that time, the people in Judea should run away to the mountains.
Default Mt 24:15-16 Mk 13:14-14 Lk 21:20-22
LK
21:20
“When you see armies all around Jerusalem, you will know it will soon be destroyed.
LK
21:21
At that time, the people in Judea should run away to the mountains. The people in Jerusalem must get out, and those who are near the city should not go in.
LK
21:22
These are the days of punishment to bring about all that is written in the Scriptures.
Week 62 | Leave Immediately
Mt 24:17-18 Mk 13:15-16 Lk 17:31-33
Default Mt 24:17-18 Mk 13:15-16 Lk 17:31-33
LK
17:31
“On that day, a person who is on the roof and whose belongings are in the house should not go inside to get them. A person who is in the field should not go back home.
LK
17:32
Remember Lot’s wife.(bk)
LK
17:33
Those who try to keep their lives will lose them. But those who give up their lives will save them.
Default Mt 24:17-18 Mk 13:15-16 Lk 17:31-33
MT
24:17
If people are on the roofs(ci) of their houses, they must not go down to get anything out of their houses.
MT
24:18
If people are in the fields, they must not go back to get their coats.
Default Mt 24:17-18 Mk 13:15-16 Lk 17:31-33
MK
13:15
If people are on the roofs(ay) of their houses, they must not go down or go inside to get anything out of their houses.
MK
13:16
If people are in the fields, they must not go back to get their coats.
Default Mt 24:17-18 Mk 13:15-16 Lk 17:31-33
LK
17:31
“On that day, a person who is on the roof and whose belongings are in the house should not go inside to get them. A person who is in the field should not go back home.
LK
17:32
Remember Lot’s wife.(bk)
LK
17:33
Those who try to keep their lives will lose them. But those who give up their lives will save them.
Week 62 | There Will Be More Trouble Than Ever
Mt 24:19-22 Mk 13:17-20 Lk 21:23-24
Default Mt 24:19-22 Mk 13:17-20 Lk 21:23-24
MT
24:19
At that time, how terrible it will be for women who are pregnant or have nursing babies!
MT
24:20
Pray that it will not be winter or a Sabbath day when these things happen and you have to run away,
MT
24:21
because at that time there will be much trouble. There will be more trouble than there has ever been since the beginning of the world until now, and nothing as bad will ever happen again.
LK
21:24
They will be killed by the sword and taken as prisoners to all nations. Jerusalem will be crushed by non-Jewish people until their time is over.
MT
24:22
God has decided to make that terrible time short. Otherwise, no one would go on living. But God will make that time short to help the people he has chosen.
Default Mt 24:19-22 Mk 13:17-20 Lk 21:23-24
MT
24:19
At that time, how terrible it will be for women who are pregnant or have nursing babies!
MT
24:20
Pray that it will not be winter or a Sabbath day when these things happen and you have to run away,
MT
24:21
because at that time there will be much trouble. There will be more trouble than there has ever been since the beginning of the world until now, and nothing as bad will ever happen again.
MT
24:22
God has decided to make that terrible time short. Otherwise, no one would go on living. But God will make that time short to help the people he has chosen.
Default Mt 24:19-22 Mk 13:17-20 Lk 21:23-24
MK
13:17
At that time, how terrible it will be for women who are pregnant or have nursing babies!
MK
13:18
Pray that these things will not happen in winter,
MK
13:19
because those days will be full of trouble. There will be more trouble than there has ever been since the beginning, when God made the world, until now, and nothing as bad will ever happen again.
MK
13:20
God has decided to make that terrible time short. Otherwise, no one would go on living. But God will make that time short to help the people he has chosen.
Default Mt 24:19-22 Mk 13:17-20 Lk 21:23-24
LK
21:23
How terrible it will be for women who are pregnant or have nursing babies! Great trouble will come upon this land, and God will be angry with these people.
LK
21:24
They will be killed by the sword and taken as prisoners to all nations. Jerusalem will be crushed by non-Jewish people until their time is over.
Week 62 | Self-Appointed Christs, False Prophets
Mt 24:23-27 Mk 13:21-23 Lk 17:23-25
Default Mt 24:23-27 Mk 13:21-23 Lk 17:23-25
MT
24:23
At that time, someone might say to you, ‘Look, there is the Christ!’ Or another person might say, ‘There he is!’ But don’t believe them.
MT
24:24
False Christs and false prophets will come and perform great wonders and miracles. They will try to fool even the people God has chosen, if that is possible.
MT
24:25
Now I have warned you about this before it happens.
MT
24:26
“If people tell you, ‘The Christ is in the desert,’ don’t go there. If they say, ‘The Christ is in the inner room,’ don’t believe it.
MT
24:27
When the Son of Man comes, he will be seen by everyone, like lightning flashing from the east to the west.
Default Mt 24:23-27 Mk 13:21-23 Lk 17:23-25
MT
24:23
At that time, someone might say to you, ‘Look, there is the Christ!’ Or another person might say, ‘There he is!’ But don’t believe them.
MT
24:24
False Christs and false prophets will come and perform great wonders and miracles. They will try to fool even the people God has chosen, if that is possible.
MT
24:25
Now I have warned you about this before it happens.
MT
24:26
“If people tell you, ‘The Christ is in the desert,’ don’t go there. If they say, ‘The Christ is in the inner room,’ don’t believe it.
MT
24:27
When the Son of Man comes, he will be seen by everyone, like lightning flashing from the east to the west.
Default Mt 24:23-27 Mk 13:21-23 Lk 17:23-25
MK
13:21
At that time, someone might say to you, ‘Look, there is the Christ!’ Or another person might say, ‘There he is!’ But don’t believe them.
MK
13:22
False Christs and false prophets will come and perform great wonders and miracles. They will try to fool even the people God has chosen, if that is possible.
MK
13:23
So be careful. I have warned you about all this before it happens.
Default Mt 24:23-27 Mk 13:21-23 Lk 17:23-25
LK
17:23
People will say to you, ‘Look, there he is!’ or, ‘Look, here he is!’ Stay where you are; don’t go away and search.
LK
17:24
“When the Son of Man comes again, he will shine like lightning, which flashes across the sky and lights it up from one side to the other.
LK
17:25
But first he must suffer many things and be rejected by the people of this time.
Week 62 | As Right Before The Great Flood
Mt 24:37-39 Lk 17:26-30
Default Mt 24:37-39 Lk 17:26-30
LK
17:26
When the Son of Man comes again, it will be as it was when Noah lived.
LK
17:27
People were eating, drinking, marrying, and giving their children to be married until the day Noah entered the boat. Then the flood came and killed them all.
LK
17:28
It will be the same as during the time of Lot. People were eating, drinking, buying, selling, planting, and building.
LK
17:29
But the day Lot left Sodom,(bj) fire and sulfur rained down from the sky and killed them all.
LK
17:30
This is how it will be when the Son of Man comes again.
Default Mt 24:37-39 Lk 17:26-30
MT
24:37
When the Son of Man comes, it will be like what happened during Noah’s time.
MT
24:38
In those days before the flood, people were eating and drinking, marrying and giving their children to be married, until the day Noah entered the boat.
MT
24:39
They knew nothing about what was happening until the flood came and destroyed them. It will be the same when the Son of Man comes.
Default Mt 24:37-39 Lk 17:26-30
LK
17:26
When the Son of Man comes again, it will be as it was when Noah lived.
LK
17:27
People were eating, drinking, marrying, and giving their children to be married until the day Noah entered the boat. Then the flood came and killed them all.
LK
17:28
It will be the same as during the time of Lot. People were eating, drinking, buying, selling, planting, and building.
LK
17:29
But the day Lot left Sodom,(bj) fire and sulfur rained down from the sky and killed them all.
LK
17:30
This is how it will be when the Son of Man comes again.
Week 62 | Then Jesus Comes Again
Mt 24:29-31 Mk 13:24-27 Lk 21:25-28
Default Mt 24:29-31 Mk 13:24-27 Lk 21:25-28
MT
24:29
“Soon after the trouble of those days, ‘the sun will grow dark, and the moon will not give its light. The stars will fall from the sky. And the powers of the heavens will be shaken.’ (Isaiah 13:10); 34:4
MT
24:30
“At that time, the sign of the Son of Man will appear in the sky. Then all the peoples of the world will cry. They will see the Son of Man coming on clouds in the sky with great power and glory.
MT
24:31
He will use a loud trumpet to send his angels all around the earth, and they will gather his chosen people from every part of the world.
LK
21:28
When these things begin to happen, look up and hold your heads high, because the time when God will free you is near!”
Default Mt 24:29-31 Mk 13:24-27 Lk 21:25-28
MT
24:29
“Soon after the trouble of those days, ‘the sun will grow dark, and the moon will not give its light. The stars will fall from the sky. And the powers of the heavens will be shaken.’ (Isaiah 13:10); 34:4
MT
24:30
“At that time, the sign of the Son of Man will appear in the sky. Then all the peoples of the world will cry. They will see the Son of Man coming on clouds in the sky with great power and glory.
MT
24:31
He will use a loud trumpet to send his angels all around the earth, and they will gather his chosen people from every part of the world.
Default Mt 24:29-31 Mk 13:24-27 Lk 21:25-28
MK
13:24
“During the days after this trouble comes, ‘the sun will grow dark, and the moon will not give its light.
MK
13:25
The stars will fall from the sky. And the powers of the heavens will be shaken.’ (Isaiah 13:10); 34:4
MK
13:26
“Then people will see the Son of Man coming in clouds with great power and glory.
MK
13:27
Then he will send his angels all around the earth to gather his chosen people from every part of the earth and from every part of heaven.
Default Mt 24:29-31 Mk 13:24-27 Lk 21:25-28
LK
21:25
“There will be signs in the sun, moon, and stars. On earth, nations will be afraid and confused because of the roar and fury of the sea.
LK
21:26
People will be so afraid they will faint, wondering what is happening to the world, because the powers of the heavens will be shaken.
LK
21:27
Then people will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.
LK
21:28
When these things begin to happen, look up and hold your heads high, because the time when God will free you is near!”
Week 62 | One Will Be Taken And The Other Will Be Left
Mt 24:40-41 Lk 17:34-36
Default Mt 24:40-41 Lk 17:34-36
LK
17:34
I tell you, on that night two people will be sleeping in one bed; one will be taken and the other will be left.
LK
17:35
There will be two women grinding grain together; one will be taken, and the other will be left. [
LK
17:36
Two people will be in the field. One will be taken, and the other will be left.]”(bl)
Default Mt 24:40-41 Lk 17:34-36
MT
24:40
Two men will be in the field. One will be taken, and the other will be left.
MT
24:41
Two women will be grinding grain with a mill.(ck) One will be taken, and the other will be left.

LK
17:34
I tell you, on that night two people will be sleeping in one bed; one will be taken and the other will be left.
LK
17:35

LK
17:36
Two people will be in the field. One will be taken, and the other will be left.]”(bl)
Week 62 | Vultures
Mt 24:28-28 Lk 17:37-37
Default Mt 24:28-28 Lk 17:37-37
LK
17:37
The followers asked Jesus, “Where will this be, Lord?” Jesus answered, “Where there is a dead body, there the vultures will gather.”
Default Mt 24:28-28 Lk 17:37-37
MT
24:28
Wherever the dead body is, there the vultures will gather.
Default Mt 24:28-28 Lk 17:37-37
LK
17:37
The followers asked Jesus, “Where will this be, Lord?” Jesus answered, “Where there is a dead body, there the vultures will gather.”
Week 62 | The Signs Of Jesus' Coming
Mt 24:32-36 Mk 13:28-32 Lk 21:29-33
Default Mt 24:32-36 Mk 13:28-32 Lk 21:29-33
MT
24:32
“Learn a lesson from the fig tree: When its branches become green and soft and new leaves appear, you know summer is near.
MT
24:33
In the same way, when you see all these things happening, you will know that the time is near, ready to come.
MT
24:34
I tell you the truth, all these things will happen while the people of this time are still living.
MT
24:35
Earth and sky will be destroyed, but the words I have said will never be destroyed. When Will Jesus Come Again?
MT
24:36
“No one knows when that day or time will be, not the angels in heaven, not even the Son.(cj) Only the Father knows.
Default Mt 24:32-36 Mk 13:28-32 Lk 21:29-33
MT
24:32
“Learn a lesson from the fig tree: When its branches become green and soft and new leaves appear, you know summer is near.
MT
24:33
In the same way, when you see all these things happening, you will know that the time is near, ready to come.
MT
24:34
I tell you the truth, all these things will happen while the people of this time are still living.
MT
24:35
Earth and sky will be destroyed, but the words I have said will never be destroyed. When Will Jesus Come Again?
MT
24:36
“No one knows when that day or time will be, not the angels in heaven, not even the Son.(cj) Only the Father knows.

MK
13:28
“Learn a lesson from the fig tree: When its branches become green and soft and new leaves appear, you know summer is near.
MK
13:29
In the same way, when you see these things happening, you will know that the time is near, ready to come.
MK
13:30
I tell you the truth, all these things will happen while the people of this time are still living.
MK
13:31
Earth and sky will be destroyed, but the words I have said will never be destroyed.
MK
13:32
“No one knows when that day or time will be, not the angels in heaven, not even the Son. Only the Father knows.
Default Mt 24:32-36 Mk 13:28-32 Lk 21:29-33
LK
21:29
Then Jesus told this story: “Look at the fig tree and all the other trees.
LK
21:30
When their leaves appear, you know that summer is near.
LK
21:31
In the same way, when you see these things happening, you will know that God’s kingdom is near.
LK
21:32
“I tell you the truth, all these things will happen while the people of this time are still living.
LK
21:33
Earth and sky will be destroyed, but the words I have spoken will never be destroyed.
Week 62 | Always Be Ready
Mt 24:42-44 Mk 13:33-33 Lk 12:39-40
Default Mt 24:42-44 Mk 13:33-33 Lk 12:39-40
LK
12:39
“Remember this: If the owner of the house knew what time a thief was coming, he would not allow the thief to enter his house.
LK
12:40
So you also must be ready, because the Son of Man will come at a time when you don’t expect him!” Who Is the Trusted Servant?
Default Mt 24:42-44 Mk 13:33-33 Lk 12:39-40
MT
24:42
“So always be ready, because you don’t know the day your Lord will come.
MT
24:43
Remember this: If the owner of the house knew what time of night a thief was coming, the owner would watch and not let the thief break in.
MT
24:44
So you also must be ready, because the Son of Man will come at a time you don’t expect him.
Default Mt 24:42-44 Mk 13:33-33 Lk 12:39-40
MK
13:33
Be careful! Always be ready,(az) because you don’t know when that time will be.
Default Mt 24:42-44 Mk 13:33-33 Lk 12:39-40
LK
12:39
“Remember this: If the owner of the house knew what time a thief was coming, he would not allow the thief to enter his house.
LK
12:40
So you also must be ready, because the Son of Man will come at a time when you don’t expect him!” Who Is the Trusted Servant?
Week 62 | The Reliable And The Disloyal Servant
Mt 24:45-51 Mk 13:34-37 Lk 12:41-48
Default Mt 24:45-51 Mk 13:34-37 Lk 12:41-48
MT
24:45
“Who is the wise and loyal servant that the master trusts to give the other servants their food at the right time?
MT
24:46
When the master comes and finds the servant doing his work, the servant will be blessed.
MT
24:47
I tell you the truth, the master will choose that servant to take care of everything he owns.
LK
12:45
But suppose the servant thinks to himself, ‘My master will not come back soon,’ and he begins to beat the other servants, men and women, and to eat and drink and get drunk.
LK
12:46
The master will come when that servant is not ready and is not expecting him. Then the master will cut him in pieces and send him away to be with the others who don’t obey.
LK
12:47
“The servant who knows what his master wants but is not ready, or who does not do what the master wants, will be beaten with many blows!
LK
12:48
But the servant who does not know what his master wants and does things that should be punished will be beaten with few blows. From everyone who has been given much, much will be demanded. And from the one trusted with much, much more will be expected.
MK
13:37
I tell you this, and I say this to everyone: ‘Be ready!’”
Default Mt 24:45-51 Mk 13:34-37 Lk 12:41-48
MT
24:45
“Who is the wise and loyal servant that the master trusts to give the other servants their food at the right time?
MT
24:46
When the master comes and finds the servant doing his work, the servant will be blessed.
MT
24:47
I tell you the truth, the master will choose that servant to take care of everything he owns.
MT
24:48
But suppose that evil servant thinks to himself, ‘My master will not come back soon,’
MT
24:49
and he begins to beat the other servants and eat and get drunk with others like him?
MT
24:50
The master will come when that servant is not ready and is not expecting him.
MT
24:51
Then the master will cut him in pieces and send him away to be with the hypocrites, where people will cry and grind their teeth with pain.
Default Mt 24:45-51 Mk 13:34-37 Lk 12:41-48
MK
13:34
It is like a man who goes on a trip. He leaves his house and lets his servants take care of it, giving each one a special job to do. The man tells the servant guarding the door always to be watchful.
MK
13:35
So always be ready, because you don’t know when the owner of the house will come back. It might be in the evening, or at midnight, or in the morning while it is still dark, or when the sun rises.
MK
13:36
Always be ready. Otherwise he might come back suddenly and find you sleeping.
MK
13:37
I tell you this, and I say this to everyone: ‘Be ready!’”
Default Mt 24:45-51 Mk 13:34-37 Lk 12:41-48
LK
12:41
Peter said, “Lord, did you tell this story to us or to all people?”
LK
12:42
The Lord said, “Who is the wise and trusted servant that the master trusts to give the other servants their food at the right time?
LK
12:43
When the master comes and finds the servant doing his work, the servant will be blessed.
LK
12:44
I tell you the truth, the master will choose that servant to take care of everything he owns.
LK
12:45
But suppose the servant thinks to himself, ‘My master will not come back soon,’ and he begins to beat the other servants, men and women, and to eat and drink and get drunk.
LK
12:46
The master will come when that servant is not ready and is not expecting him. Then the master will cut him in pieces and send him away to be with the others who don’t obey.
LK
12:47
“The servant who knows what his master wants but is not ready, or who does not do what the master wants, will be beaten with many blows!
LK
12:48
But the servant who does not know what his master wants and does things that should be punished will be beaten with few blows. From everyone who has been given much, much will be demanded. And from the one trusted with much, much more will be expected.
Week 62 | The Ten Virgins
Mt 25:1-13 Lk 12:35-38
Default Mt 25:1-13 Lk 12:35-38
MT
25:1
“At that time the kingdom of heaven will be like ten bridesmaids who took their lamps and went to wait for the bridegroom.
MT
25:2
Five of them were foolish and five were wise.
MT
25:3
The five foolish bridesmaids took their lamps, but they did not take more oil for the lamps to burn.
MT
25:4
The wise bridesmaids took their lamps and more oil in jars.
MT
25:5
Because the bridegroom was late, they became sleepy and went to sleep.
MT
25:6
“At midnight someone cried out, ‘The bridegroom is coming! Come and meet him!’
MT
25:7
Then all the bridesmaids woke up and got their lamps ready.
MT
25:8
But the foolish ones said to the wise, ‘Give us some of your oil, because our lamps are going out.’
MT
25:9
The wise bridesmaids answered, ‘No, the oil we have might not be enough for all of us. Go to the people who sell oil and buy some for yourselves.’
MT
25:10
“So while the five foolish bridesmaids went to buy oil, the bridegroom came. The bridesmaids who were ready went in with the bridegroom to the wedding feast. Then the door was closed and locked.
MT
25:11
“Later the others came back and said, ‘Sir, sir, open the door to let us in.’
MT
25:12
But the bridegroom answered, ‘I tell you the truth, I don’t want to know you.’
MT
25:13
“So always be ready, because you don’t know the day or the hour the Son of Man will come.
Default Mt 25:1-13 Lk 12:35-38
MT
25:1
“At that time the kingdom of heaven will be like ten bridesmaids who took their lamps and went to wait for the bridegroom.
MT
25:2
Five of them were foolish and five were wise.
MT
25:3
The five foolish bridesmaids took their lamps, but they did not take more oil for the lamps to burn.
MT
25:4
The wise bridesmaids took their lamps and more oil in jars.
MT
25:5
Because the bridegroom was late, they became sleepy and went to sleep.
MT
25:6
“At midnight someone cried out, ‘The bridegroom is coming! Come and meet him!’
MT
25:7
Then all the bridesmaids woke up and got their lamps ready.
MT
25:8
But the foolish ones said to the wise, ‘Give us some of your oil, because our lamps are going out.’
MT
25:9
The wise bridesmaids answered, ‘No, the oil we have might not be enough for all of us. Go to the people who sell oil and buy some for yourselves.’
MT
25:10
“So while the five foolish bridesmaids went to buy oil, the bridegroom came. The bridesmaids who were ready went in with the bridegroom to the wedding feast. Then the door was closed and locked.
MT
25:11
“Later the others came back and said, ‘Sir, sir, open the door to let us in.’
MT
25:12
But the bridegroom answered, ‘I tell you the truth, I don’t want to know you.’
MT
25:13
“So always be ready, because you don’t know the day or the hour the Son of Man will come.
Default Mt 25:1-13 Lk 12:35-38
LK
12:35
“Be dressed, ready for service, and have your lamps shining.
LK
12:36
Be like servants who are waiting for their master to come home from a wedding party. When he comes and knocks, the servants immediately open the door for him.
LK
12:37
They will be blessed when their master comes home, because he sees that they were watching for him. I tell you the truth, the master will dress himself to serve and tell the servants to sit at the table, and he will serve them.
LK
12:38
Those servants will be blessed when he comes in and finds them still waiting, even if it is midnight or later.
Week 62 | The Sheep And The Goats
Mt 25:31-46
Mt 25:31-46
MT
25:31
“The Son of Man will come again in his great glory, with all his angels. He will be King and sit on his great throne.
MT
25:32
All the nations of the world will be gathered before him, and he will separate them into two groups as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.
MT
25:33
The Son of Man will put the sheep on his right and the goats on his left.
MT
25:34
“Then the King will say to the people on his right, ‘Come, my Father has given you his blessing. Receive the kingdom God has prepared for you since the world was made.
MT
25:35
I was hungry, and you gave me food. I was thirsty, and you gave me something to drink. I was alone and away from home, and you invited me into your house.
MT
25:36
I was without clothes, and you gave me something to wear. I was sick, and you cared for me. I was in prison, and you visited me.’
MT
25:37
“Then the good people will answer, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry and give you food, or thirsty and give you something to drink?
MT
25:38
When did we see you alone and away from home and invite you into our house? When did we see you without clothes and give you something to wear?
MT
25:39
When did we see you sick or in prison and care for you?’
MT
25:40
“Then the King will answer, ‘I tell you the truth, anything you did for even the least of my people here, you also did for me.’
MT
25:41
“Then the King will say to those on his left, ‘Go away from me. You will be punished. Go into the fire that burns forever that was prepared for the devil and his angels.
MT
25:42
I was hungry, and you gave me nothing to eat. I was thirsty, and you gave me nothing to drink.
MT
25:43
I was alone and away from home, and you did not invite me into your house. I was without clothes, and you gave me nothing to wear. I was sick and in prison, and you did not care for me.’
MT
25:44
“Then those people will answer, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry or thirsty or alone and away from home or without clothes or sick or in prison? When did we see these things and not help you?’
MT
25:45
“Then the King will answer, ‘I tell you the truth, anything you refused to do for even the least of my people here, you refused to do for me.’
MT
25:46
“These people will go off to be punished forever, but the good people will go to live forever.”
Week 63 | The Day Before Passover Eve

Week 63 | Preparation For The Last Supper
Mt 26:17-20 Mk 14:12-17 Lk 22:7-13
Default Mt 26:17-20 Mk 14:12-17 Lk 22:7-13
LK
22:7
The Day of Unleavened Bread came when the Passover lambs had to be sacrificed.
LK
22:8
Jesus said to Peter and John, “Go and prepare the Passover meal for us to eat.”
LK
22:9
They asked, “Where do you want us to prepare it?”
LK
22:10
Jesus said to them, “After you go into the city, a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him into the house that he enters,
LK
22:11
and tell the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher says: “Where is the guest room in which I may eat the Passover meal with my followers?”’
LK
22:12
Then he will show you a large, furnished room upstairs. Prepare the Passover meal there.”
LK
22:13
So Peter and John left and found everything as Jesus had said. And they prepared the Passover meal.
Default Mt 26:17-20 Mk 14:12-17 Lk 22:7-13
MT
26:17
On the first day of the Feast of Unleavened Bread, the followers came to Jesus. They said, “Where do you want us to prepare for you to eat the Passover meal?”
MT
26:18
Jesus answered, “Go into the city to a certain man and tell him, ‘The Teacher says: “The chosen time is near. I will have the Passover with my followers at your house.”’”
MT
26:19
The followers did what Jesus told them to do, and they prepared the Passover meal.
MT
26:20
In the evening Jesus was sitting at the table with his twelve followers.
Default Mt 26:17-20 Mk 14:12-17 Lk 22:7-13
MK
14:12
It was now the first day of the Feast of Unleavened Bread when the Passover lamb was sacrificed. Jesus’ followers said to him, “Where do you want us to go and prepare for you to eat the Passover meal?”
MK
14:13
Jesus sent two of his followers and said to them, “Go into the city and a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him.
MK
14:14
When he goes into a house, tell the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher says: “Where is my guest room in which I can eat the Passover meal with my followers?”’
MK
14:15
The owner will show you a large room upstairs that is furnished and ready. Prepare the food for us there.”
MK
14:16
So the followers left and went into the city. Everything happened as Jesus had said, so they prepared the Passover meal.
MK
14:17
In the evening, Jesus went to that house with the twelve.
Default Mt 26:17-20 Mk 14:12-17 Lk 22:7-13
LK
22:7
The Day of Unleavened Bread came when the Passover lambs had to be sacrificed.
LK
22:8
Jesus said to Peter and John, “Go and prepare the Passover meal for us to eat.”
LK
22:9
They asked, “Where do you want us to prepare it?”
LK
22:10
Jesus said to them, “After you go into the city, a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him into the house that he enters,
LK
22:11
and tell the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher says: “Where is the guest room in which I may eat the Passover meal with my followers?”’
LK
22:12
Then he will show you a large, furnished room upstairs. Prepare the Passover meal there.”
LK
22:13

Week 63 | The New Agreement
Mt 26:26-29 Mk 14:22-25 Lk 22:14-20
Default Mt 26:26-29 Mk 14:22-25 Lk 22:14-20
LK
22:14
When the time came, Jesus and the apostles were sitting at the table.
LK
22:15
He said to them, “I wanted very much to eat this Passover meal with you before I suffer.
LK
22:16
I will not eat another Passover meal until it is given its true meaning in the kingdom of God.”
LK
22:19
Then Jesus took some bread, gave thanks, broke it, and gave it to the apostles, saying, “This is my body,(b) which I am giving for you. Do this to remember me.”
MT
26:27
Then Jesus took a cup and thanked God for it and gave it to the followers. He said, “Every one of you drink this.
MT
26:28
This is my blood which is the new(cl) agreement that God makes with his people. This blood is poured out for many to forgive their sins.
LK
22:18
I will not drink again from the fruit of the vine(a) until God’s kingdom comes.”
Default Mt 26:26-29 Mk 14:22-25 Lk 22:14-20
MT
26:26
While they were eating, Jesus took some bread and thanked God for it and broke it. Then he gave it to his followers and said, “Take this bread and eat it; this is my body.”
MT
26:27
Then Jesus took a cup and thanked God for it and gave it to the followers. He said, “Every one of you drink this.
MT
26:28
This is my blood which is the new(cl) agreement that God makes with his people. This blood is poured out for many to forgive their sins.
MT
26:29
I tell you this: I will not drink of this fruit of the vine(cm) again until that day when I drink it new with you in my Father’s kingdom.”
Default Mt 26:26-29 Mk 14:22-25 Lk 22:14-20
MK
14:22
While they were eating, Jesus took some bread and thanked God for it and broke it. Then he gave it to his followers and said, “Take it; this is my body.”
MK
14:23
Then Jesus took a cup and thanked God for it and gave it to the followers, and they all drank from the cup.
MK
14:24
Then Jesus said, “This is my blood which is the new(ba) agreement that God makes with his people. This blood is poured out for many.
MK
14:25
I tell you the truth, I will not drink of this fruit of the vine(bb) again until that day when I drink it new in the kingdom of God.”
Default Mt 26:26-29 Mk 14:22-25 Lk 22:14-20
LK
22:14
When the time came, Jesus and the apostles were sitting at the table.
LK
22:15
He said to them, “I wanted very much to eat this Passover meal with you before I suffer.
LK
22:16
I will not eat another Passover meal until it is given its true meaning in the kingdom of God.”
LK
22:17
Then Jesus took a cup, gave thanks, and said, “Take this cup and share it among yourselves.
LK
22:18
I will not drink again from the fruit of the vine(a) until God’s kingdom comes.”
LK
22:19
Then Jesus took some bread, gave thanks, broke it, and gave it to the apostles, saying, “This is my body,(b) which I am giving for you. Do this to remember me.”
LK
22:20
In the same way, after supper, Jesus took the cup and said, “This cup is the new agreement that God makes with his people. This new agreement begins with my blood which is poured out for you. Who Will Turn Against Jesus?
Week 63 | The Leader Should Be Like The Servant
Lk 22:24-30
Lk 22:24-30
LK
22:24
The apostles also began to argue about which one of them was the most important.
LK
22:25
But Jesus said to them, “The kings of the non-Jewish people rule over them, and those who have authority over others like to be called ‘friends of the people.’
LK
22:26
But you must not be like that. Instead, the greatest among you should be like the youngest, and the leader should be like the servant.
LK
22:27
Who is more important: the one sitting at the table or the one serving? You think the one at the table is more important, but I am like a servant among you.
LK
22:28
“You have stayed with me through my struggles.
LK
22:29
Just as my Father has given me a kingdom, I also give you a kingdom
LK
22:30
so you may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom. And you will sit on thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel. Don’t Lose Your Faith!
Week 63 | Jesus Washes His Followers’ Feet
Jn 13:1-15
Jn 13:1-15
JN
13:1
It was almost time for the Passover Feast. Jesus knew that it was time for him to leave this world and go back to the Father. He had always loved those who were his own in the world, and he loved them all the way to the end.
JN
13:2
Jesus and his followers were at the evening meal. The devil had already persuaded Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon, to turn against Jesus.
JN
13:3
Jesus knew that the Father had given him power over everything and that he had come from God and was going back to God.
JN
13:4
So during the meal Jesus stood up and took off his outer clothing. Taking a towel, he wrapped it around his waist.
JN
13:5
Then he poured water into a bowl and began to wash the followers’ feet, drying them with the towel that was wrapped around him.
JN
13:6
Jesus came to Simon Peter, who said to him, “Lord, are you going to wash my feet?”
JN
13:7
Jesus answered, “You don’t understand now what I am doing, but you will understand later.”
JN
13:8
Peter said, “No, you will never wash my feet.” Jesus answered, “If I don’t wash your feet, you are not one of my people.”
JN
13:9
Simon Peter answered, “Lord, then wash not only my feet, but wash my hands and my head, too!”
JN
13:10
Jesus said, “After a person has had a bath, his whole body is clean. He needs only to wash his feet. And you men are clean, but not all of you.”
JN
13:11
Jesus knew who would turn against him, and that is why he said, “Not all of you are clean.”
JN
13:12
When he had finished washing their feet, he put on his clothes and sat down again. He asked, “Do you understand what I have just done for you?
JN
13:13
You call me ‘Teacher’ and ‘Lord,’ and you are right, because that is what I am.
JN
13:14
If I, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also should wash each other’s feet.
JN
13:15
I did this as an example so that you should do as I have done for you.
Week 63 | A Servant Is Not Greater Than His Master
Mt 10:24-25 Lk 6:40-40 Jn 13:16-17
Default Mt 10:24-25 Lk 6:40-40 Jn 13:16-17
JN
13:16
I tell you the truth, a servant is not greater than his master. A messenger is not greater than the one who sent him.
JN
13:17
If you know these things, you will be blessed if you do them.
Default Mt 10:24-25 Lk 6:40-40 Jn 13:16-17
MT
10:24
“A student is not better than his teacher, and a servant is not better than his master.
MT
10:25
A student should be satisfied to become like his teacher; a servant should be satisfied to become like his master. If the head of the family is called Beelzebul, then the other members of the family will be called worse names!
Default Mt 10:24-25 Lk 6:40-40 Jn 13:16-17
LK
6:40
A student is not better than the teacher, but the student who has been fully trained will be like the teacher.
Default Mt 10:24-25 Lk 6:40-40 Jn 13:16-17
JN
13:16
I tell you the truth, a servant is not greater than his master. A messenger is not greater than the one who sent him.
JN
13:17
If you know these things, you will be blessed if you do them.
Week 63 | Whoever Accepts Jesus, Accepts The One
Mt 10:40-42 Mk 9:41-41 Lk 10:16-16 Jn 13:20-20
Default Mt 10:40-42 Mk 9:41-41 Lk 10:16-16 Jn 13:20-20
LK
10:16
“Whoever listens to you listens to me, and whoever refuses to accept you refuses to accept me. And whoever refuses to accept me refuses to accept the One who sent me.”

MT
10:40
Whoever accepts you also accepts me, and whoever accepts me also accepts the One who sent me.
MT
10:41
Whoever meets a prophet and accepts him will receive the reward of a prophet. And whoever accepts a good person because that person is good will receive the reward of a good person.
MT
10:42
Those who give one of these little ones a cup of cold water because they are my followers will truly get their reward.”
Default Mt 10:40-42 Mk 9:41-41 Lk 10:16-16 Jn 13:20-20

9:41
I tell you the truth, whoever gives you a drink of water because you belong to the Christ will truly get his reward.

10:16
“Whoever listens to you listens to me, and whoever refuses to accept you refuses to accept me. And whoever refuses to accept me refuses to accept the One who sent me.”

JN
13:20
I tell you the truth, whoever accepts anyone I send also accepts me. And whoever accepts me also accepts the One who sent me.”
Week 63 | One Of You Will Turn Against Me

JN
13:19

Week 63 | Judas - The Literal And Symbolic Yeast - Is Leaving
Mt 26:21-25 Mk 14:18-21 Lk 22:21-23 Jn 13:21-30
Default Mt 26:21-25 Mk 14:18-21 Lk 22:21-23 Jn 13:21-30
JN
13:21
After Jesus said this, he was very troubled. He said openly, “I tell you the truth, one of you will turn against me.”
JN
13:22
The followers all looked at each other, because they did not know whom Jesus was talking about.
JN
13:23
One of the followers sitting(ak) next to Jesus was the follower Jesus loved.
JN
13:24
Simon Peter motioned to him to ask Jesus whom he was talking about.
JN
13:25
That follower leaned closer to Jesus and asked, “Lord, who is it?”
JN
13:26
Jesus answered, “I will dip this bread into the dish. The man I give it to is the man who will turn against me.” So Jesus took a piece of bread, dipped it, and gave it to Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon.
JN
13:27
As soon as Judas took the bread, Satan entered him. Jesus said to him, “The thing that you will do-do it quickly.”
JN
13:28
No one at the table understood why Jesus said this to Judas.
JN
13:29
Since he was the one who kept the money box, some of the followers thought Jesus was telling him to buy what was needed for the feast or to give something to the poor.
JN
13:30
Judas took the bread Jesus gave him and immediately went out. It was night.
Default Mt 26:21-25 Mk 14:18-21 Lk 22:21-23 Jn 13:21-30
MT
26:21
As they were eating, Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, one of you will turn against me.”
MT
26:22
This made the followers very sad. Each one began to say to Jesus, “Surely, Lord, I am not the one who will turn against you, am I?”
MT
26:23
Jesus answered, “The man who has dipped his hand with me into the bowl is the one who will turn against me.
MT
26:24
The Son of Man will die, just as the Scriptures say. But how terrible it will be for the person who hands the Son of Man over to be killed. It would be better for him if he had never been born.”
MT
26:25
Then Judas, who would give Jesus to his enemies, said to Jesus, “Teacher, surely I am not the one, am I?” Jesus answered, “Yes, it is you.”
Default Mt 26:21-25 Mk 14:18-21 Lk 22:21-23 Jn 13:21-30
MK
14:18
While they were all eating, Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, one of you will turn against me - one of you eating with me now.”
MK
14:19
The followers were very sad to hear this. Each one began to say to Jesus, “I am not the one, am I?”
MK
14:20
Jesus answered, “It is one of the twelve-the one who dips his bread into the bowl with me.
MK
14:21
The Son of Man will die, just as the Scriptures say. But how terrible it will be for the person who hands the Son of Man over to be killed. It would be better for him if he had never been born.”
Default Mt 26:21-25 Mk 14:18-21 Lk 22:21-23 Jn 13:21-30
LK
22:21

LK
22:22
What God has planned for the Son of Man will happen, but how terrible it will be for that one who turns against the Son of Man.”
LK
22:23
Then the apostles asked each other which one of them would do that.
Default Mt 26:21-25 Mk 14:18-21 Lk 22:21-23 Jn 13:21-30
JN
13:21
After Jesus said this, he was very troubled. He said openly, “I tell you the truth, one of you will turn against me.”
JN
13:22
The followers all looked at each other, because they did not know whom Jesus was talking about.
JN
13:23
One of the followers sitting(ak) next to Jesus was the follower Jesus loved.
JN

JN
13:25

JN

JN
13:27

JN
13:28

13:30

Week 63 | Love Each Other
Jn 13:31-35
Jn 13:31-35
JN
13:31
When Judas was gone, Jesus said, “Now the Son of Man receives his glory, and God receives glory through him.
JN
13:32
If God receives glory through him,(al) then God will give glory to the Son through himself. And God will give him glory quickly.”
JN
13:33
Jesus said, “My children, I will be with you only a little longer. You will look for me, and what I told the Jews, I tell you now: Where I am going you cannot come.
JN
13:34
“I give you a new command: Love each other. You must love each other as I have loved you.
JN
13:35
All people will know that you are my followers if you love each other.”

Week 63 | You Will All Stumble In Your Faith
Mt 26:31-35 Mk 14:27-31 Lk 22:31-34 Jn 13:36-38
Default Mt 26:31-35 Mk 14:27-31 Lk 22:31-34 Jn 13:36-38
MT
26:31
Jesus told his followers, “Tonight you will all stumble in your faith on account of me, because it is written in the Scriptures: ‘I will kill the shepherd, and the sheep will scatter.’ (Zechariah 13:7)
MT
26:32
But after I rise from the dead, I will go ahead of you into Galilee.”
LK
22:31
“Simon, Simon, Satan has asked to test all of you as a farmer sifts his wheat.
LK
22:32
I have prayed that you will not lose your faith! Help your brothers be stronger when you come back to me.”
LK
22:33
But Peter said to Jesus, “Lord, I am ready to go with you to prison and even to die with you!”
LK
22:34
But Jesus said, “Peter, before the rooster crows this day, you will say three times that you don’t know me.”
MK
14:31
But Peter insisted, “I will never say that I don’t know you! I will even die with you!” And all the other followers said the same thing.
Default Mt 26:31-35 Mk 14:27-31 Lk 22:31-34 Jn 13:36-38
MT
26:31
Jesus told his followers, “Tonight you will all stumble in your faith on account of me, because it is written in the Scriptures: ‘I will kill the shepherd, and the sheep will scatter.’ (Zechariah 13:7)
MT
26:32
But after I rise from the dead, I will go ahead of you into Galilee.”
MT
26:33
Peter said, “Everyone else may stumble in their faith because of you, but I will not.”
MT
26:34
Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, tonight before the rooster crows you will say three times that you don’t know me.”
MT
26:35
But Peter said, “I will never say that I don’t know you! I will even die with you!” And all the other followers said the same thing.
Default Mt 26:31-35 Mk 14:27-31 Lk 22:31-34 Jn 13:36-38
MK
14:27
Then Jesus told the followers, “You will all stumble in your faith, because it is written in the Scriptures: ‘I will kill the shepherd, and the sheep will scatter.’ (Zechariah 13:7)
MK
14:28
But after I rise from the dead, I will go ahead of you into Galilee.”
MK
14:29
Peter said, “Everyone else may stumble in their faith, but I will not.”
MK
14:30
Jesus answered, “I tell you the truth, tonight before the rooster crows twice you will say three times you don’t know me.”
MK
14:31
But Peter insisted, “I will never say that I don’t know you! I will even die with you!” And all the other followers said the same thing.
Default Mt 26:31-35 Mk 14:27-31 Lk 22:31-34 Jn 13:36-38
LK
22:31
“Simon, Simon, Satan has asked to test all of you as a farmer sifts his wheat.
LK
22:32
I have prayed that you will not lose your faith! Help your brothers be stronger when you come back to me.”
LK
22:33
But Peter said to Jesus, “Lord, I am ready to go with you to prison and even to die with you!”
LK
22:34
But Jesus said, “Peter, before the rooster crows this day, you will say three times that you don’t know me.”
Default Mt 26:31-35 Mk 14:27-31 Lk 22:31-34 Jn 13:36-38
JN
13:36
Simon Peter asked Jesus, “Lord, where are you going?” Jesus answered, “Where I am going you cannot follow now, but you will follow later.”
JN
13:37
Peter asked, “Lord, why can’t I follow you now? I am ready to die for you!”
JN
13:38
Jesus answered, “Are you ready to die for me? I tell you the truth, before the rooster crows, you will say three times that you don’t know me.”
Week 63 | Now Carry Money And Sword With You
Lk 22:35-38
Lk 22:35-38
LK
22:35
Then Jesus said to the apostles, “When I sent you out without a purse, a bag, or sandals, did you need anything?” They said, “No.”
LK
22:36
He said to them, “But now if you have a purse or a bag, carry that with you. If you don’t have a sword, sell your coat and buy one.
LK
22:37
The Scripture says, ‘He was treated like a criminal,’(c) and I tell you this scripture must have its full meaning. It was written about me, and it is happening now.”
LK
22:38
His followers said, “Look, Lord, here are two swords.” He said to them, “That is enough.”
Week 63 | Ask Me For Anything In My Name
Jn 14:1-14
Jn 14:1-14
JN
14:1
Jesus said, “Don’t let your hearts be troubled. Trust in God, and trust in me.
JN
14:2
There are many rooms in my Father’s house; I would not tell you this if it were not true. I am going there to prepare a place for you.
JN
14:3
After I go and prepare a place for you, I will come back and take you to be with me so that you may be where I am.
JN
14:4
You know the way to the place where I am going.”(am)
JN
14:5
Thomas said to Jesus, “Lord, we don’t know where you are going. So how can we know the way?”
JN
14:6
Jesus answered, “I am the way, and the truth, and the life. The only way to the Father is through me.
JN
14:7
If you really knew me, you would know my Father, too. But now you do know him, and you have seen him.”
JN
14:8
Philip said to him, “Lord, show us the Father. That is all we need.”
JN
14:9
Jesus answered, “I have been with you a long time now. Do you still not know me, Philip? Whoever has seen me has seen the Father. So why do you say, ‘Show us the Father’?
JN
14:10
Don’t you believe that I am in the Father and the Father is in me? The words I say to you don’t come from me, but the Father lives in me and does his own work.
JN
14:11
Believe me when I say that I am in the Father and the Father is in me. Or believe because of the miracles I have done.
JN
14:12
I tell you the truth, whoever believes in me will do the same things that I do. Those who believe will do even greater things than these, because I am going to the Father.
JN
14:13
And if you ask for anything in my name, I will do it for you so that the Father’s glory will be shown through the Son.
JN
14:14
If you ask me for anything in my name, I will do it.
Week 63 | Jesus Promises The Holy Spirit
Jn 14:15-31
Jn 14:15-31
JN
14:15
“If you love me, you will obey my commands.
JN
14:16
I will ask the Father, and he will give you another Helper(an) to be with you forever-
JN
14:17
the Spirit of truth. The world cannot accept him, because it does not see him or know him. But you know him, because he lives with you and he will be in you.
JN
14:18
“I will not leave you all alone like orphans; I will come back to you.
JN
14:19
In a little while the world will not see me anymore, but you will see me. Because I live, you will live, too.
JN
14:20
On that day you will know that I am in my Father, and that you are in me and I am in you.
JN
14:21
Those who know my commands and obey them are the ones who love me, and my Father will love those who love me. I will love them and will show myself to them.”
JN
14:22
Then Judas (not Judas Iscariot) said, “But, Lord, why do you plan to show yourself to us and not to the rest of the world?”
JN
14:23
Jesus answered, “If people love me, they will obey my teaching. My Father will love them, and we will come to them and make our home with them.
JN
14:24
Those who do not love me do not obey my teaching. This teaching that you hear is not really mine; it is from my Father, who sent me.
JN
14:25
“I have told you all these things while I am with you.
JN
14:26
But the Helper will teach you everything and will cause you to remember all that I told you. This Helper is the Holy Spirit whom the Father will send in my name.
JN
14:27
“I leave you peace; my peace I give you. I do not give it to you as the world does. So don’t let your hearts be troubled or afraid.
JN
14:28
You heard me say to you, ‘I am going, but I am coming back to you.’ If you loved me, you should be happy that I am going back to the Father, because he is greater than I am.
JN
14:29
I have told you this now, before it happens, so that when it happens, you will believe.
JN
14:30
I will not talk with you much longer, because the ruler of this world is coming. He has no power over me,
JN
14:31
but the world must know that I love the Father, so I do exactly what the Father told me to do. “Come now, let us go.
Week 63 | Jesus Is Like A Vine
Jn 15:1-17
Jn 15:1-17
JN
15:1
“I am the true vine; my Father is the gardener.
JN
15:2
He cuts off every branch of mine that does not produce fruit. And he trims and cleans every branch that produces fruit so that it will produce even more fruit.
JN
15:3
You are already clean because of the words I have spoken to you.
JN
15:4
Remain in me, and I will remain in you. A branch cannot produce fruit alone but must remain in the vine. In the same way, you cannot produce fruit alone but must remain in me.
JN
15:5
“I am the vine, and you are the branches. If any remain in me and I remain in them, they produce much fruit. But without me they can do nothing.
JN
15:6
If any do not remain in me, they are like a branch that is thrown away and then dies. People pick up dead branches, throw them into the fire, and burn them.
JN
15:7
If you remain in me and follow my teachings, you can ask anything you want, and it will be given to you.
JN
15:8
You should produce much fruit and show that you are my followers, which brings glory to my Father.
JN
15:9
I loved you as the Father loved me. Now remain in my love.
JN
15:10
I have obeyed my Father’s commands, and I remain in his love. In the same way, if you obey my commands, you will remain in my love.
JN
15:11
I have told you these things so that you can have the same joy I have and so that your joy will be the fullest possible joy.
JN
15:12
“This is my command: Love each other as I have loved you.
JN
15:13
The greatest love a person can show is to die for his friends.
JN
15:14
You are my friends if you do what I command you.
JN
15:15
I no longer call you servants, because a servant does not know what his master is doing. But I call you friends, because I have made known to you everything I heard from my Father.
JN
15:16
You did not choose me; I chose you. And I gave you this work: to go and produce fruit, fruit that will last. Then the Father will give you anything you ask for in my name.
JN
15:17
This is my command: Love each other.
Week 63 | The Followers And The World
Jn 15:18-25
Jn 15:18-25
JN
15:18
“If the world hates you, remember that it hated me first.
JN
15:19
If you belonged to the world, it would love you as it loves its own. But I have chosen you out of the world, so you don’t belong to it. That is why the world hates you.
JN
15:20
Remember what I told you: A servant is not greater than his master. If people did wrong to me, they will do wrong to you, too. And if they obeyed my teaching, they will obey yours, too.
JN
15:21
They will do all this to you on account of me, because they do not know the One who sent me.
JN
15:22
If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not be guilty of sin, but now they have no excuse for their sin.
JN
15:23
Whoever hates me also hates my Father.
JN
15:24
I did works among them that no one else has ever done. If I had not done these works, they would not be guilty of sin. But now they have seen what I have done, and yet they have hated both me and my Father.
JN
15:25
But this happened so that what is written in their law would be true: ‘They hated me for no reason.’(ao)
Week 63 | Tell People About Me
Jn 15:26-27
Jn 15:26-27
JN
15:26
“I will send you the Helper(ap) from the Father; he is the Spirit of truth who comes from the Father. When he comes, he will tell about me,
JN
15:27
and you also must tell people about me, because you have been with me from the beginning.
Week 63 | The Work Of The Holy Spirit
Jn 16:5-15
Jn 16:5-15
JN
16:5
Now I am going back to the One who sent me. But none of you asks me, ‘Where are you going?’
JN
16:6
Your hearts are filled with sadness because I have told you these things.
JN
16:7
But I tell you the truth, it is better for you that I go away. When I go away, I will send the Helper(aq) to you. If I do not go away, the Helper will not come.
JN
16:8
When the Helper comes, he will prove to the people of the world the truth about sin, about being right with God, and about judgment.
JN
16:9
He will prove to them that sin is not believing in me.
JN
16:10
He will prove to them that being right with God comes from my going to the Father and not being seen anymore.
JN
16:11
And the Helper will prove to them that judgment happened when the ruler of this world was judged.
JN
16:12
“I have many more things to say to you, but they are too much for you now.
JN
16:13
But when the Spirit of truth comes, he will lead you into all truth. He will not speak his own words, but he will speak only what he hears, and he will tell you what is to come.
JN
16:14
The Spirit of truth will bring glory to me, because he will take what I have to say and tell it to you.
JN
16:15
All that the Father has is mine. That is why I said that the Spirit will take what I have to say and tell it to you.
Week 63 | Sadness Will Become Happiness
Jn 16:16-24
Jn 16:16-24
JN
16:16
“After a little while you will not see me, and then after a little while you will see me again.”
JN
16:17
Some of the followers said to each other, “What does Jesus mean when he says, ‘After a little while you will not see me, and then after a little while you will see me again’? And what does he mean when he says, ‘Because I am going to the Father’?”
JN
16:18
They also asked, “What does he mean by ‘a little while’? We don’t understand what he is saying.”
JN
16:19
Jesus saw that the followers wanted to ask him about this, so he said to them, “Are you asking each other what I meant when I said, ‘After a little while you will not see me, and then after a little while you will see me again’?
JN
16:20
I tell you the truth, you will cry and be sad, but the world will be happy. You will be sad, but your sadness will become joy.
JN
16:21
When a woman gives birth to a baby, she has pain, because her time has come. But when her baby is born, she forgets the pain, because she is so happy that a child has been born into the world.
JN
16:22
It is the same with you. Now you are sad, but I will see you again and you will be happy, and no one will take away your joy.
JN
16:23
In that day you will not ask me for anything. I tell you the truth, my Father will give you anything you ask for in my name.
JN
16:24
Until now you have not asked for anything in my name. Ask and you will receive, so that your joy will be the fullest possible joy.
Week 63 | Be Brave: I Have Defeated The World
Jn 16:25-33
Jn 16:25-33
JN
16:25
“I have told you these things indirectly in stories. But the time will come when I will not use stories like that to tell you things; I will speak to you in plain words about the Father.
JN
16:26
In that day you will ask the Father for things in my name. I mean, I will not need to ask the Father for you.
JN
16:27
The Father himself loves you. He loves you because you loved me and believed that I came from God.
JN
16:28
I came from the Father into the world. Now I am leaving the world and going back to the Father.”
JN
16:29
Then the followers of Jesus said, “You are speaking clearly to us now and are not using stories that are hard to understand.
JN
16:30
We can see now that you know all things. You can answer a person’s question even before it is asked. This makes us believe you came from God.”
JN
16:31
Jesus answered, “So now you believe?
JN
16:32
Listen to me; a time is coming when you will be scattered, each to your own home. That time is now here. You will leave me alone, but I am never really alone, because the Father is with me.
JN
16:33
“I told you these things so that you can have peace in me. In this world you will have trouble, but be brave! I have defeated the world.”
Week 63 | Jesus Prays For His Followers
Jn 17:1-26
Jn 17:1-26
JN
17:1
After Jesus said these things, he looked toward heaven and prayed, “Father, the time has come. Give glory to your Son so that the Son can give glory to you.
JN
17:2
You gave the Son power over all people so that the Son could give eternal life to all those you gave him.
JN
17:3
And this is eternal life: that people know you, the only true God, and that they know Jesus Christ, the One you sent.
JN
17:4
Having finished the work you gave me to do, I brought you glory on earth.
JN
17:5
And now, Father, give me glory with you; give me the glory I had with you before the world was made.
JN
17:6
“I showed what you are like to those you gave me from the world. They belonged to you, and you gave them to me, and they have obeyed your teaching.
JN
17:7
Now they know that everything you gave me comes from you.
JN
17:8
I gave them the teachings you gave me, and they accepted them. They knew that I truly came from you, and they believed that you sent me.
JN
17:9
I am praying for them. I am not praying for people in the world but for those you gave me, because they are yours.
JN
17:10
All I have is yours, and all you have is mine. And my glory is shown through them.
JN
17:11
I am coming to you; I will not stay in the world any longer. But they are still in the world. Holy Father, keep them safe by the power of your name, the name you gave me, so that they will be one, just as you and I are one.
JN
17:12
While I was with them, I kept them safe by the power of your name, the name you gave me. I protected them, and only one of them, the one worthy of destruction, was lost so that the Scripture would come true.
JN
17:13
“I am coming to you now. But I pray these things while I am still in the world so that these followers can have all of my joy in them.
JN
17:14
I have given them your teaching. And the world has hated them, because they don’t belong to the world, just as I don’t belong to the world.
JN
17:15
I am not asking you to take them out of the world but to keep them safe from the Evil One.
JN
17:16
They don’t belong to the world, just as I don’t belong to the world.
JN
17:17
Make them ready for your service through your truth; your teaching is truth.
JN
17:18
I have sent them into the world, just as you sent me into the world.
JN
17:19
For their sake, I am making myself ready to serve so that they can be ready for their service of the truth.
JN
17:20
“I pray for these followers, but I am also praying for all those who will believe in me because of their teaching.
JN
17:21
Father, I pray that they can be one. As you are in me and I am in you, I pray that they can also be one in us. Then the world will believe that you sent me.
JN
17:22
I have given these people the glory that you gave me so that they can be one, just as you and I are one.
JN
17:23
I will be in them and you will be in me so that they will be completely one. Then the world will know that you sent me and that you loved them just as much as you loved me.
JN
17:24
“Father, I want these people that you gave me to be with me where I am. I want them to see my glory, which you gave me because you loved me before the world was made.
JN
17:25
Father, you are the One who is good. The world does not know you, but I know you, and these people know you sent me.
JN
17:26
I showed them what you are like, and I will show them again. Then they will have the same love that you have for me, and I will live in them.”
Week 63 | Jesus Is Arrested And Executed On The Day Of Passover Eve
– +
Week 63 | Gethsemane: Father, Do What You Want
Mt 26:36-46 Mk 14:32-42 Lk 22:40-46 Jn 18:1-1
Default Mt 26:36-46 Mk 14:32-42 Lk 22:40-46 Jn 18:1-1
MT
26:36
Then Jesus went with his followers to a place called Gethsemane. He said to them, “Sit here while I go over there and pray.”
MT
26:37
He took Peter and the two sons of Zebedee with him, and he began to be very sad and troubled.
MT
26:38
He said to them, “My heart is full of sorrow, to the point of death. Stay here and watch with me.”
MT
26:39
After walking a little farther away from them, Jesus fell to the ground and prayed, “My Father, if it is possible, do not give me this cup(cn) of suffering. But do what you want, not what I want.”
MT
26:40
Then Jesus went back to his followers and found them asleep. He said to Peter, “You men could not stay awake with me for one hour?
MT
26:41
Stay awake and pray for strength against temptation. The spirit wants to do what is right, but the body is weak.”
MT
26:42
Then Jesus went away a second time and prayed, “My Father, if it is not possible for this painful thing to be taken from me, and if I must do it, I pray that what you want will be done.”
MT
26:43
Then he went back to his followers, and again he found them asleep, because their eyes were heavy.
MT
26:44
So Jesus left them and went away and prayed a third time, saying the same thing.
MT
26:45
Then Jesus went back to his followers and said, “Are you still sleeping and resting? The time has come for the Son of Man to be handed over to sinful people.
MT
26:46
Get up, we must go. Look, here comes the man who has turned against me.”

Then Jesus went with his followers to a place called Gethsemane. He said to them, “Sit here while I go over there and pray.”
MT
26:37
He took Peter and the two sons of Zebedee with him, and he began to be very sad and troubled.
MT
26:38
He said to them, “My heart is full of sorrow, to the point of death. Stay here and watch with me.”
MT
26:39
After walking a little farther away from them, Jesus fell to the ground and prayed, “My Father, if it is possible, do not give me this cup(cn) of suffering. But do what you want, not what I want.”
MT
26:40
Then Jesus went back to his followers and found them asleep. He said to Peter, “You men could not stay awake with me for one hour?
MT
26:41
Stay awake and pray for strength against temptation. The spirit wants to do what is right, but the body is weak.”
MT
26:42
Then Jesus went away a second time and prayed, “My Father, if it is not possible for this painful thing to be taken from me, and if I must do it, I pray that what you want will be done.”
MT
26:43

MT
26:44
So Jesus left them and went away and prayed a third time, saying the same thing.
MT
26:45

MT
26:46
