Default Mt 26:36-46 Mk 14:32-42 Lk 22:40-46 Jn 18:1-1
MK
14:32
Jesus and his followers went to a place called Gethsemane. He said to them, “Sit here while I pray.”
MK
14:33
Jesus took Peter, James, and John with him, and he began to be very sad and troubled.
MK
14:34
He said to them, “My heart is full of sorrow, to the point of death. Stay here and watch.”
MK
14:35
After walking a little farther away from them, Jesus fell to the ground and prayed that, if possible, he would not have this time of suffering.
MK
14:36
He prayed, “Abba,(bc) Father! You can do all things. Take away this cup(bd) of suffering. But do what you want, not what I want.”
MK
14:37
Then Jesus went back to his followers and found them asleep. He said to Peter, “Simon, are you sleeping? Couldn’t you stay awake with me for one hour?
MK
14:38
Stay awake and pray for strength against temptation. The spirit wants to do what is right, but the body is weak.”
MK
14:39
Again Jesus went away and prayed the same thing.
MK
14:40
Then he went back to his followers, and again he found them asleep, because their eyes were very heavy. And they did not know what to say to him.
MK
14:41
After Jesus prayed a third time, he went back to his followers and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and resting? That’s enough. The time has come for the Son of Man to be handed over to sinful people.
MK
14:42
Get up, we must go. Look, here comes the man who has turned against me.”
Default Mt 26:36-46 Mk 14:32-42 Lk 22:40-46 Jn 18:1-1
LK
22:40
When he reached the place, he said to them, “Pray for strength against temptation.”
LK
22:41
Then Jesus went about a stone’s throw away from them. He kneeled down and prayed,
LK
22:42
“Father, if you are willing, take away this cup(d) of suffering. But do what you want, not what I want.”
LK
22:43
Then an angel from heaven appeared to him to strengthen him.
LK
22:44
Being full of pain, Jesus prayed even harder. His sweat was like drops of blood falling to the ground.
LK
22:45
When he finished praying, he went to his followers and found them asleep because of their sadness.
LK
22:46
Jesus said to them, “Why are you sleeping? Get up and pray for strength against temptation.”
Default Mt 26:36-46 Mk 14:32-42 Lk 22:40-46 Jn 18:1-1
JN
18:1
When Jesus finished praying, he went with his followers across the Kidron Valley. On the other side there was a garden, and Jesus and his followers went into it.
Week 63 | Gethsemane: Jesus Is Arrested
Mt 26:47-56 Mk 14:43-52 Lk 22:47-53 Jn 18:2-12
Default Mt 26:47-56 Mk 14:43-52 Lk 22:47-53 Jn 18:2-12
LK
22:47
While Jesus was speaking, a crowd came up, and Judas, one of the twelve apostles, was leading them. He came close to Jesus so he could kiss him.
LK
22:48
But Jesus said to him, “Judas, are you using the kiss to give the Son of Man to his enemies?”
LK
22:49
When those who were standing around him saw what was happening, they said, “Lord, should we strike them with our swords?”
LK
22:50
And one of them struck the servant of the high priest and cut off his right ear.
LK
22:51
Jesus said, “Stop! No more of this.” Then he touched the servant’s ear and healed him.
MT
26:52
Jesus said to the man, “Put your sword back in its place. All who use swords will be killed with swords.
MT
26:53
Surely you know I could ask my Father, and he would give me more than twelve armies of angels.
MT
26:54
But it must happen this way to bring about what the Scriptures say.”
JN
18:4
Knowing everything that would happen to him, Jesus went out and asked, “Who is it you are looking for?”
JN
18:5
They answered, “Jesus from Nazareth.”
JN
18:6
“I am he,” Jesus said. (Judas, the one who turned against Jesus, was standing there with them.) When Jesus said, “I am he,” they moved back and fell to the ground.
JN
18:7
Jesus asked them again, “Who is it you are looking for?” They said, “Jesus of Nazareth.”
MK
14:48
Then Jesus said, “You came to get me with swords and clubs as if I were a criminal.
MK
14:49
Every day I was with you teaching in the Temple, and you did not arrest me there. But all these things have happened to make the Scriptures come true.”
JN
18:8
“I told you that I am he,” Jesus said. “So if you are looking for me, let the others go.”
MK
14:50
Then all of Jesus’ followers left him and ran away.
JN
18:9
This happened so that the words Jesus said before would come true: “I have not lost any of the ones you gave me.”
JN
18:12
Then the soldiers with their commander and the guards arrested Jesus. They tied him
Default Mt 26:47-56 Mk 14:43-52 Lk 22:47-53 Jn 18:2-12
MT
26:47
While Jesus was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve apostles, came up. With him were many people carrying swords and clubs who had been sent from the leading priests and the Jewish elders of the people.
MT
26:48
Judas had planned to give them a signal, saying, “The man I kiss is Jesus. Arrest him.”
MT
26:49
At once Judas went to Jesus and said, “Greetings, Teacher!” and kissed him.
MT
26:50
Jesus answered, “Friend, do what you came to do.” Then the people came and grabbed Jesus and arrested him.
MT
26:51
When that happened, one of Jesus’ followers reached for his sword and pulled it out. He struck the servant of the high priest and cut off his ear.
MT
26:52
Jesus said to the man, “Put your sword back in its place. All who use swords will be killed with swords.
MT
26:53
Surely you know I could ask my Father, and he would give me more than twelve armies of angels.
MT
26:54
But it must happen this way to bring about what the Scriptures say.”
MT
26:55
Then Jesus said to the crowd, “You came to get me with swords and clubs as if I were a criminal. Every day I sat in the Temple teaching, and you did not arrest me there.
MT
26:56
But all these things have happened so that it will come about as the prophets wrote.” Then all of Jesus’ followers left him and ran away.
Default Mt 26:47-56 Mk 14:43-52 Lk 22:47-53 Jn 18:2-12
MK
14:43
At once, while Jesus was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve apostles, came up. With him were many people carrying swords and clubs who had been sent from the leading priests, the teachers of the law, and the Jewish elders.
MK
14:44
Judas had planned a signal for them, saying, “The man I kiss is Jesus. Arrest him and guard him while you lead him away.”
MK
14:45
So Judas went straight to Jesus and said, “Teacher!” and kissed him.
MK
14:46
Then the people grabbed Jesus and arrested him.
MK
14:47
One of his followers standing nearby pulled out his sword and struck the servant of the high priest and cut off his ear.
MK
14:48
Then Jesus said, “You came to get me with swords and clubs as if I were a criminal.
MK
14:49
Every day I was with you teaching in the Temple, and you did not arrest me there. But all these things have happened to make the Scriptures come true.”
MK
14:50
Then all of Jesus’ followers left him and ran away.
MK
14:51
A young man, wearing only a linen cloth, was following Jesus, and the people also grabbed him.
MK
14:52
But the cloth he was wearing came off, and he ran away naked.
Default Mt 26:47-56 Mk 14:43-52 Lk 22:47-53 Jn 18:2-12
LK
22:47
While Jesus was speaking, a crowd came up, and Judas, one of the twelve apostles, was leading them. He came close to Jesus so he could kiss him.
LK
22:48
But Jesus said to him, “Judas, are you using the kiss to give the Son of Man to his enemies?”
LK
22:49
When those who were standing around him saw what was happening, they said, “Lord, should we strike them with our swords?”
LK
22:50
And one of them struck the servant of the high priest and cut off his right ear.
LK
22:51
Jesus said, “Stop! No more of this.” Then he touched the servant’s ear and healed him.
LK
22:52
Those who came to arrest Jesus were the leading priests, the soldiers who guarded the Temple, and the elders. Jesus said to them, “You came out here with swords and clubs as though I were a criminal.
LK
22:53
I was with you every day in the Temple, and you didn’t arrest me there. But this is your time-the time when darkness rules.”
Default Mt 26:47-56 Mk 14:43-52 Lk 22:47-53 Jn 18:2-12
JN
18:2
Judas knew where this place was, because Jesus met there often with his followers. Judas was the one who turned against Jesus.
JN
18:3
So Judas came there with a group of soldiers and some guards from the leading priests and the Pharisees. They were carrying torches, lanterns, and weapons.
JN
18:4
Knowing everything that would happen to him, Jesus went out and asked, “Who is it you are looking for?”
JN
18:5
They answered, “Jesus from Nazareth.”
JN
18:6
“I am he,” Jesus said. (Judas, the one who turned against Jesus, was standing there with them.) When Jesus said, “I am he,” they moved back and fell to the ground.
JN
18:7
Jesus asked them again, “Who is it you are looking for?” They said, “Jesus of Nazareth.”
JN
18:8
“I told you that I am he,” Jesus said. “So if you are looking for me, let the others go.”
JN
18:9
This happened so that the words Jesus said before would come true: “I have not lost any of the ones you gave me.”
JN
18:10
Simon Peter, who had a sword, pulled it out and struck the servant of the high priest, cutting off his right ear. (The servant’s name was Malchus.)
JN
18:11
Jesus said to Peter, “Put your sword back. Shouldn’t I drink the cup(ar) the Father gave me?”
JN
18:12
Then the soldiers with their commander and the guards arrested Jesus. They tied him
Week 63 | Hearing Before Annas
Jn 18:13-24
Jn 18:13-24
JN
18:13
and led him first to Annas, the father-in-law of Caiaphas, the high priest that year.
JN
18:14
Caiaphas was the one who told the Jews that it would be better if one man died for all the people.
JN
18:15
Simon Peter and another one of Jesus’ followers went along after Jesus. This follower knew the high priest, so he went with Jesus into the high priest’s courtyard.
JN
18:16
But Peter waited outside near the door. The follower who knew the high priest came back outside, spoke to the girl at the door, and brought Peter inside.
JN
18:17
The girl at the door said to Peter, “Aren’t you also one of that man’s followers?” Peter answered, “No, I am not!”
JN
18:18
It was cold, so the servants and guards had built a fire and were standing around it, warming themselves. Peter also was standing with them, warming himself.
JN
18:19
The high priest asked Jesus questions about his followers and his teaching.
JN
18:20
Jesus answered, “I have spoken openly to everyone. I have always taught in synagogues and in the Temple, where all the Jews come together. I never said anything in secret.
JN
18:21
So why do you question me? Ask the people who heard my teaching. They know what I said.”
JN
18:22
When Jesus said this, one of the guards standing there hit him. The guard said, “Is that the way you answer the high priest?”
JN
18:23
Jesus answered him, “If I said something wrong, then show what it was. But if what I said is true, why do you hit me?”
JN
18:24
Then Annas sent Jesus, who was still tied, to Caiaphas the high priest.
Week 63 | Jesus is Led To Caiaphas

MK
14:53
The people who arrested Jesus led him to the house of the high priest, where all the leading priests, the elders, and the teachers of the law were gathered.
MK
14:54
Peter followed far behind and entered the courtyard of the high priest’s house. There he sat with the guards, warming himself by the fire.

Those people who arrested Jesus led him to the house of Caiaphas, the high priest, where the teachers of the law and the elders were gathered.
MT
26:58
Peter followed far behind to the courtyard of the high priest’s house, and he sat down with the guards to see what would happen to Jesus.

MK
14:54

LK

Week 63 | Trial Before The Leaders At Caiaphas
Mt 26:59-68 Mk 14:55-65 Lk 22:63-71
Default Mt 26:59-68 Mk 14:55-65 Lk 22:63-71
MT
26:59
The leading priests and the whole Jewish council tried to find something false against Jesus so they could kill him.
MT
26:60
Many people came and told lies about him, but the council could find no real reason to kill him. Then two people came and said,
MT
26:61
“This man said, ‘I can destroy the Temple of God and build it again in three days.’”
MT
26:62
Then the high priest stood up and said to Jesus, “Aren’t you going to answer? Don’t you have something to say about their charges against you?”
MT
26:63
But Jesus said nothing. Again the high priest said to Jesus, “I command you by the power of the living God: Tell us if you are the Christ, the Son of God.”
MT
26:64
Jesus answered, “Those are your words. But I tell you, in the future you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of God, the Powerful One, and coming on clouds in the sky.”
MT
26:65
When the high priest heard this, he tore his clothes and said, “This man has said things that are against God! We don’t need any more witnesses; you all heard him say these things against God.
MT
26:66
What do you think?” The people answered, “He should die.”
MT
26:67
Then the people there spat in Jesus’ face and beat him with their fists. Others slapped him.
LK
22:64
They blindfolded him and said, “Prove that you are a prophet, and tell us who hit you.”
Default Mt 26:59-68 Mk 14:55-65 Lk 22:63-71
MT
26:59
The leading priests and the whole Jewish council tried to find something false against Jesus so they could kill him.
MT
26:60
Many people came and told lies about him, but the council could find no real reason to kill him. Then two people came and said,
MT
26:61
“This man said, ‘I can destroy the Temple of God and build it again in three days.’”
MT
26:62
Then the high priest stood up and said to Jesus, “Aren’t you going to answer? Don’t you have something to say about their charges against you?”
MT
26:63
But Jesus said nothing. Again the high priest said to Jesus, “I command you by the power of the living God: Tell us if you are the Christ, the Son of God.”
MT
26:64
Jesus answered, “Those are your words. But I tell you, in the future you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of God, the Powerful One, and coming on clouds in the sky.”
MT
26:65
When the high priest heard this, he tore his clothes and said, “This man has said things that are against God! We don’t need any more witnesses; you all heard him say these things against God.
MT
26:66
What do you think?” The people answered, “He should die.”
MT
26:67
Then the people there spat in Jesus’ face and beat him with their fists. Others slapped him.
MT
26:68
They said, “Prove to us that you are a prophet, you Christ! Tell us who hit you!”
Default Mt 26:59-68 Mk 14:55-65 Lk 22:63-71
MK
14:55
The leading priests and the whole Jewish council tried to find something that Jesus had done wrong so they could kill him. But the council could find no proof of anything.
MK
14:56
Many people came and told false things about him, but all said different things-none of them agreed.
MK
14:57
Then some people stood up and lied about Jesus, saying,
MK
14:58
“We heard this man say, ‘I will destroy this Temple that people made. And three days later, I will build another Temple not made by people.’”
MK
14:59
But even the things these people said did not agree.
MK
14:60
Then the high priest stood before them and asked Jesus, “Aren’t you going to answer? Don’t you have something to say about their charges against you?”
MK
14:61
But Jesus said nothing; he did not answer. The high priest asked Jesus another question: “Are you the Christ, the Son of the blessed God?”
MK
14:62
Jesus answered, “I am. And in the future you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of God, the Powerful One, and coming on clouds in the sky.”
MK
14:63
When the high priest heard this, he tore his clothes and said, “We don’t need any more witnesses!
MK
14:64
You all heard him say these things against God. What do you think?” They all said that Jesus was guilty and should die.
MK
14:65
Some of the people there began to spit at Jesus. They blindfolded him and beat him with their fists and said, “Prove you are a prophet!” Then the guards led Jesus away and beat him.
Default Mt 26:59-68 Mk 14:55-65 Lk 22:63-71
LK
22:63
The men who were guarding Jesus began making fun of him and beating him.
LK
22:64
They blindfolded him and said, “Prove that you are a prophet, and tell us who hit you.”
LK
22:65
They said many cruel things to Jesus.
LK
22:66
When day came, the council of the elders of the people, both the leading priests and the teachers of the law, came together and led Jesus to their highest court.
LK
22:67
They said, “If you are the Christ, tell us.” Jesus said to them, “If I tell you, you will not believe me.
LK
22:68
And if I ask you, you will not answer.
LK
22:69
But from now on, the Son of Man will sit at the right hand of the powerful God.”
LK
22:70
They all said, “Then are you the Son of God?” Jesus said to them, “You say that I am.”
LK
22:71
They said, “Why do we need witnesses now? We ourselves heard him say this.”
Week 63 | Peter Says He Doesn’t Know Jesus
Mt 26:69-75 Mk 14:66-72 Lk 22:56-62 Jn 18:25-27
Default Mt 26:69-75 Mk 14:66-72 Lk 22:56-62 Jn 18:25-27
MT
26:69
At that time, as Peter was sitting in the courtyard, a servant girl came to him and said, “You also were with Jesus of Galilee.”
MT
26:70
But Peter said to all the people there that he was never with Jesus. He said, “I don’t know what you are talking about.”
MT
26:71
When he left the courtyard and was at the gate, another girl saw him. She said to the people there, “This man was with Jesus of Nazareth.”
MT
26:72
Again, Peter said he was never with him, saying, “I swear I don’t know this man Jesus!”
MT
26:73
A short time later, some people standing there went to Peter and said, “Surely you are one of those who followed Jesus. The way you talk shows it.”
MT
26:74
Then Peter began to place a curse on himself and swear, “I don’t know the man.” At once, a rooster crowed.
MT
26:75
And Peter remembered what Jesus had told him: “Before the rooster crows, you will say three times that you don’t know me.” Then Peter went outside and cried painfully.
Default Mt 26:69-75 Mk 14:66-72 Lk 22:56-62 Jn 18:25-27
MT
26:69
At that time, as Peter was sitting in the courtyard, a servant girl came to him and said, “You also were with Jesus of Galilee.”
MT
26:70
But Peter said to all the people there that he was never with Jesus. He said, “I don’t know what you are talking about.”
MT
26:71
When he left the courtyard and was at the gate, another girl saw him. She said to the people there, “This man was with Jesus of Nazareth.”
MT
26:72
Again, Peter said he was never with him, saying, “I swear I don’t know this man Jesus!”
MT
26:73
A short time later, some people standing there went to Peter and said, “Surely you are one of those who followed Jesus. The way you talk shows it.”
MT
26:74
Then Peter began to place a curse on himself and swear, “I don’t know the man.” At once, a rooster crowed.
MT
26:75
And Peter remembered what Jesus had told him: “Before the rooster crows, you will say three times that you don’t know me.” Then Peter went outside and cried painfully.
Default Mt 26:69-75 Mk 14:66-72 Lk 22:56-62 Jn 18:25-27
MK
14:66
While Peter was in the courtyard, a servant girl of the high priest came there.
MK
14:67
She saw Peter warming himself at the fire and looked closely at him. Then she said, “You also were with Jesus, that man from Nazareth.”
MK
14:68
But Peter said that he was never with Jesus. He said, “I don’t know or understand what you are talking about.” Then Peter left and went toward the entrance of the courtyard. And the rooster crowed.(be)
MK
14:69
The servant girl saw Peter there, and again she said to the people who were standing nearby, “This man is one of those who followed Jesus.”
MK
14:70
Again Peter said that it was not true. A short time later, some people were standing near Peter saying, “Surely you are one of those who followed Jesus, because you are from Galilee, too.”
MK
14:71
Then Peter began to place a curse on himself and swear, “I don’t know this man you’re talking about!”
MK
14:72
At once, the rooster crowed the second time. Then Peter remembered what Jesus had told him: “Before the rooster crows twice, you will say three times that you don’t know me.” Then Peter lost control of himself and began to cry.
Default Mt 26:69-75 Mk 14:66-72 Lk 22:56-62 Jn 18:25-27
LK
22:56
A servant girl saw Peter sitting there in the firelight, and looking closely at him, she said, “This man was also with him.”
LK
22:57
But Peter said this was not true; he said, “Woman, I don’t know him.”
LK
22:58
A short time later, another person saw Peter and said, “You are also one of them.” But Peter said, “Man, I am not!”
LK
22:59
About an hour later, another man insisted, “Certainly this man was with him, because he is from Galilee, too.”
LK
22:60
But Peter said, “Man, I don’t know what you are talking about!” At once, while Peter was still speaking, a rooster crowed.
LK
22:61
Then the Lord turned and looked straight at Peter. And Peter remembered what the Lord had said: “Before the rooster crows this day, you will say three times that you don’t know me.”
LK
22:62
Then Peter went outside and cried painfully.
Default Mt 26:69-75 Mk 14:66-72 Lk 22:56-62 Jn 18:25-27
JN
18:25
As Simon Peter was standing and warming himself, they said to him, “Aren’t you one of that man’s followers?” Peter said it was not true; he said, “No, I am not.”
JN
18:26
One of the servants of the high priest was there. This servant was a relative of the man whose ear Peter had cut off. The servant said, “Didn’t I see you with him in the garden?”
JN
18:27
Again Peter said it wasn’t true. At once a rooster crowed.
Week 63 | Judas' Confession And Suicide
Mt 27:3-10
Mt 27:3-10
MT
27:3
Judas, the one who had given Jesus to his enemies, saw that they had decided to kill Jesus. Then he was very sorry for what he had done. So he took the thirty silver coins back to the priests and the leaders,
MT
27:4
saying, “I sinned; I handed over to you an innocent man.” The leaders answered, “What is that to us? That’s your problem, not ours.”
MT
27:5
So Judas threw the money into the Temple. Then he went off and hanged himself.
MT
27:6
The leading priests picked up the silver coins in the Temple and said, “Our law does not allow us to keep this money with the Temple money, because it has paid for a man’s death.”
MT
27:7
So they decided to use the coins to buy Potter’s Field as a place to bury strangers who died in Jerusalem.
MT
27:8
That is why that field is still called the Field of Blood.
MT
27:9
So what Jeremiah the prophet had said came true: “They took thirty silver coins. That is how little the Israelites thought he was worth.
MT
27:10
They used those thirty silver coins to buy the potter’s field, as the Lord commanded me.”(co)
Week 63 | Jesus Is Turned Over To Pilates

18:28
Early in the morning they led Jesus from Caiaphas’s house to the Roman governor’s palace. They would not go inside the palace, because they did not want to make themselves unclean;(as) they wanted to eat the Passover meal.

27:1
Early the next morning, all the leading priests and elders of the people decided that Jesus should die.
MT
27:2
They tied him, led him away, and turned him over to Pilate, the governor.

Very early in the morning, the leading priests, the elders, the teachers of the law, and all the Jewish council decided what to do with Jesus. They tied him, led him away, and turned him over to Pilate, the governor.

23:1

Week 63 | Pilate Questions Jesus
Mt 27:11-14 Mk 15:2-5 Lk 23:2-5 Jn 18:29-38
Default Mt 27:11-14 Mk 15:2-5 Lk 23:2-5 Jn 18:29-38
JN
18:29
So Pilate went outside to them and asked, “What charges do you bring against this man?”
JN
18:30
They answered, “If he were not a criminal, we wouldn’t have brought him to you.”
MT
27:12
When the leading priests and the elders accused Jesus, he said nothing.
MT
27:13
So Pilate said to Jesus, “Don’t you hear them accusing you of all these things?”
MK
15:3
The leading priests accused Jesus of many things.
MK
15:4
So Pilate asked Jesus another question, “You can see that they are accusing you of many things. Aren’t you going to answer?”
MK
15:5
But Jesus still said nothing, so Pilate was very surprised.
JN
18:31
Pilate said to them, “Take him yourselves and judge him by your own law.” “But we are not allowed to put anyone to death,” the Jews answered.
JN
18:32
(This happened so that what Jesus said about how he would die would come true.)
JN
18:33
Then Pilate went back inside the palace and called Jesus to him and asked, “Are you the king of the Jews?”
JN
18:34
Jesus said, “Is that your own question, or did others tell you about me?”
JN
18:35
Pilate answered, “I am not one of you. It was your own people and their leading priests who handed you over to me. What have you done wrong?”
JN
18:36
Jesus answered, “My kingdom does not belong to this world. If it belonged to this world, my servants would have fought to keep me from being given over to the Jewish leaders. But my kingdom is from another place.”
JN
18:37
Pilate said, “So you are a king!” Jesus answered, “You are the one saying I am a king. This is why I was born and came into the world: to tell people the truth. And everyone who belongs to the truth listens to me.”
JN
18:38
Pilate said, “What is truth?” After he said this, he went out to the crowd again and said to them, “I find nothing against this man.
LK
23:5
They were insisting, saying, “But Jesus makes trouble with the people, teaching all around Judea. He began in Galilee, and now he is here.”
Default Mt 27:11-14 Mk 15:2-5 Lk 23:2-5 Jn 18:29-38
MT
27:11
Jesus stood before Pilate the governor, and Pilate asked him, “Are you the king of the Jews?” Jesus answered, “Those are your words.”
MT
27:12
When the leading priests and the elders accused Jesus, he said nothing.
MT
27:13
So Pilate said to Jesus, “Don’t you hear them accusing you of all these things?”
MT
27:14
But Jesus said nothing in answer to Pilate, and Pilate was very surprised at this.
Default Mt 27:11-14 Mk 15:2-5 Lk 23:2-5 Jn 18:29-38
MK
15:2
Pilate asked Jesus, “Are you the king of the Jews?” Jesus answered, “Those are your words.”
MK
15:3
The leading priests accused Jesus of many things.
MK
15:4

MK
15:5
But Jesus still said nothing, so Pilate was very surprised.
Default Mt 27:11-14 Mk 15:2-5 Lk 23:2-5 Jn 18:29-38
LK
23:2
They began to accuse Jesus, saying, “We caught this man telling things that mislead our people. He says that we should not pay taxes to Caesar, and he calls himself the Christ, a king.”
LK
23:3
Pilate asked Jesus, “Are you the king of the Jews?” Jesus answered, “Those are your words.”
LK
23:4
Pilate said to the leading priests and the people, “I find nothing against this man.”
LK
23:5

18:30

JN
18:31
Pilate said to them, “Take him yourselves and judge him by your own law.” “But we are not allowed to put anyone to death,” the Jews answered.
JN
18:32
(This happened so that what Jesus said about how he would die would come true.)
JN
18:33
Then Pilate went back inside the palace and called Jesus to him and asked, “Are you the king of the Jews?”
JN
18:34
Jesus said, “Is that your own question, or did others tell you about me?”
JN
18:35
Pilate answered, “I am not one of you. It was your own people and their leading priests who handed you over to me. What have you done wrong?”
JN
18:36
Jesus answered, “My kingdom does not belong to this world. If it belonged to this world, my servants would have fought to keep me from being given over to the Jewish leaders. But my kingdom is from another place.”
JN
18:37
Pilate said, “So you are a king!” Jesus answered, “You are the one saying I am a king. This is why I was born and came into the world: to tell people the truth. And everyone who belongs to the truth listens to me.”
JN
18:38
Pilate said, “What is truth?” After he said this, he went out to the crowd again and said to them, “I find nothing against this man.
Week 63 | Pilate Sends Jesus to Herod
Lk 23:6-12
Lk 23:6-12
LK
23:6
Pilate heard this and asked if Jesus was from Galilee.
LK
23:7
Since Jesus was under Herod’s authority, Pilate sent Jesus to Herod, who was in Jerusalem at that time.
LK
23:8
When Herod saw Jesus, he was very glad, because he had heard about Jesus and had wanted to meet him for a long time. He was hoping to see Jesus work a miracle.
LK
23:9
Herod asked Jesus many questions, but Jesus said nothing.
LK
23:10
The leading priests and teachers of the law were standing there, strongly accusing Jesus.
LK
23:11
After Herod and his soldiers had made fun of Jesus, they dressed him in a kingly robe and sent him back to Pilate.
LK
23:12
In the past, Pilate and Herod had always been enemies, but on that day they became friends.
Week 63 | Pilate Declares: Jesus Is Not Guilty
Lk 23:13-16
Lk 23:13-16
LK
23:13
Pilate called the people together with the leading priests and the rulers.
LK
23:14
He said to them, “You brought this man to me, saying he makes trouble among the people. But I have questioned him before you all, and I have not found him guilty of what you say.
LK
23:15
Also, Herod found nothing wrong with him; he sent him back to us. Look, he has done nothing for which he should die.
LK
23:16
So, after I punish him, I will let him go free.”
Week 63 | Jesus Or Barabbas
Mt 27:15-23 Mk 15:6-14 Lk 23:17-22 Jn 18:39-40
Default Mt 27:15-23 Mk 15:6-14 Lk 23:17-22 Jn 18:39-40
MK
15:6
Every year at the time of the Passover the governor would free one prisoner whom the people chose.
MK
15:7
At that time, there was a man named Barabbas in prison who was a rebel and had committed murder during a riot.
MT
27:17
When the people gathered at Pilate’s house, Pilate said, “Whom do you want me to set free: Barabbas(c) or Jesus who is called the Christ?”
MT
27:18
Pilate knew that they turned Jesus in to him because they were jealous.
MT
27:19
While Pilate was sitting there on the judge’s seat, his wife sent this message to him: “Don’t do anything to that man, because he is innocent. Today I had a dream about him, and it troubled me very much.”
MT
27:20
But the leading priests and elders convinced the crowd to ask for Barabbas to be freed and for Jesus to be killed.
LK
23:18
But the people shouted together, “Take this man away! Let Barabbas go free!”
LK
23:20
Pilate wanted to let Jesus go free and told this to the crowd.
LK
23:21
But they shouted again, “Crucify him! Crucify him!”
LK
23:22
A third time Pilate said to them, “Why? What wrong has he done? I can find no reason to kill him. So I will have him punished and set him free.”
Default Mt 27:15-23 Mk 15:6-14 Lk 23:17-22 Jn 18:39-40
MT
27:15
Every year at the time of Passover the governor would free one prisoner whom the people chose.
MT
27:16
At that time there was a man in prison, named Barabbas,(b) who was known to be very bad.
MT
27:17
When the people gathered at Pilate’s house, Pilate said, “Whom do you want me to set free: Barabbas(c) or Jesus who is called the Christ?”
MT
27:18
Pilate knew that they turned Jesus in to him because they were jealous.
MT
27:19
While Pilate was sitting there on the judge’s seat, his wife sent this message to him: “Don’t do anything to that man, because he is innocent. Today I had a dream about him, and it troubled me very much.”
MT
27:20
But the leading priests and elders convinced the crowd to ask for Barabbas to be freed and for Jesus to be killed.
MT
27:21
Pilate said, “I have Barabbas and Jesus. Which do you want me to set free for you?” The people answered, “Barabbas.”
MT
27:22
Pilate asked, “So what should I do with Jesus, the one called the Christ?” They all answered, “Crucify him!”
MT
27:23
Pilate asked, “Why? What wrong has he done?” But they shouted louder, “Crucify him!”
Default Mt 27:15-23 Mk 15:6-14 Lk 23:17-22 Jn 18:39-40
MK
15:6
Every year at the time of the Passover the governor would free one prisoner whom the people chose.
MK
15:7
At that time, there was a man named Barabbas in prison who was a rebel and had committed murder during a riot.
MK
15:8
The crowd came to Pilate and began to ask him to free a prisoner as he always did.
MK
15:9
So Pilate asked them, “Do you want me to free the king of the Jews?”
MK
15:10
Pilate knew that the leading priests had turned Jesus in to him because they were jealous.
MK
15:11
But the leading priests had persuaded the people to ask Pilate to free Barabbas, not Jesus.
MK
15:12
Then Pilate asked the crowd again, “So what should I do with this man you call the king of the Jews?”
MK
15:13
They shouted, “Crucify him!”
MK
15:14
Pilate asked, “Why? What wrong has he done?” But they shouted even louder, “Crucify him!”
Default Mt 27:15-23 Mk 15:6-14 Lk 23:17-22 Jn 18:39-40
LK
23:17
[Every year at the Passover Feast, Pilate had to release one prisoner to the people.](f)
LK
23:18
But the people shouted together, “Take this man away! Let Barabbas go free!”
LK
23:19
(Barabbas was a man who was in prison for his part in a riot in the city and for murder.)
LK
23:20
Pilate wanted to let Jesus go free and told this to the crowd.
LK
23:21
But they shouted again, “Crucify him! Crucify him!”
LK
23:22
A third time Pilate said to them, “Why? What wrong has he done? I can find no reason to kill him. So I will have him punished and set him free.”
Default Mt 27:15-23 Mk 15:6-14 Lk 23:17-22 Jn 18:39-40
JN
18:39
But it is your custom that I free one prisoner to you at Passover time. Do you want me to free the ‘king of the Jews’?”
JN
18:40
They shouted back, “No, not him! Let Barabbas go free!” (Barabbas was a robber.)
Week 63 | Pilate Whips Jesus, The Soldiers Shame Him
Mt 27:27-30 Mk 15:16-19 Jn 19:1-3
Default Mt 27:27-30 Mk 15:16-19 Jn 19:1-3
MT
27:27
The governor’s soldiers took Jesus into the governor’s palace, and they all gathered around him.
MT
27:28
They took off his clothes and put a red robe on him.
MT
27:29
Using thorny branches, they made a crown, put it on his head, and put a stick in his right hand. Then the soldiers bowed before Jesus and made fun of him, saying, “Hail, King of the Jews!”
MT
27:30
They spat on Jesus. Then they took his stick and began to beat him on the head.
Default Mt 27:27-30 Mk 15:16-19 Jn 19:1-3
MT
27:27
The governor’s soldiers took Jesus into the governor’s palace, and they all gathered around him.
MT
27:28
They took off his clothes and put a red robe on him.
MT
27:29
Using thorny branches, they made a crown, put it on his head, and put a stick in his right hand. Then the soldiers bowed before Jesus and made fun of him, saying, “Hail, King of the Jews!”
MT
27:30
They spat on Jesus. Then they took his stick and began to beat him on the head.
Default Mt 27:27-30 Mk 15:16-19 Jn 19:1-3
MK
15:16
The soldiers took Jesus into the governor’s palace (called the Praetorium) and called all the other soldiers together.
MK
15:17
They put a purple robe on Jesus and used thorny branches to make a crown for his head.
MK
15:18
They began to call out to him, “Hail, King of the Jews!”
MK
15:19
The soldiers beat Jesus on the head many times with a stick. They spit on him and made fun of him by bowing on their knees and worshiping him.
Default Mt 27:27-30 Mk 15:16-19 Jn 19:1-3
JN
19:1
Then Pilate ordered that Jesus be taken away and whipped.
JN
19:2
The soldiers made a crown from some thorny branches and put it on Jesus’ head and put a purple robe around him.
JN
19:3
Then they came to him many times and said, “Hail, King of the Jews!” and hit him in the face.
Week 63 | Pilate Argues For Jesus Against The People
Jn 19:4-15
Default Jn 19:4-15
JN
19:4
Again Pilate came out and said to them, “Look, I am bringing Jesus out to you. I want you to know that I find nothing against him.”
JN
19:5
So Jesus came out, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe. Pilate said to them, “Here is the man!”
JN
19:6
When the leading priests and the guards saw Jesus, they shouted, “Crucify him! Crucify him!” But Pilate answered, “Crucify him yourselves, because I find nothing against him.”
JN
19:7
The leaders answered, “We have a law that says he should die, because he said he is the Son of God.”
JN
19:8
When Pilate heard this, he was even more afraid.
JN
19:9
He went back inside the palace and asked Jesus, “Where do you come from?” But Jesus did not answer him.
JN
19:10
Pilate said, “You refuse to speak to me? Don’t you know I have power to set you free and power to have you crucified?”
JN
19:11
Jesus answered, “The only power you have over me is the power given to you by God. The man who turned me in to you is guilty of a greater sin.”
JN
19:12
After this, Pilate tried to let Jesus go. But some in the crowd cried out, “Anyone who makes himself king is against Caesar. If you let this man go, you are no friend of Caesar.”
JN
19:13
When Pilate heard what they were saying, he brought Jesus out and sat down on the judge’s seat at the place called The Stone Pavement. (In the Hebrew language(at) the name is Gabbatha.)
JN
19:14
It was about noon on Preparation Day of Passover week. Pilate said to the crowd, “Here is your king!”
JN
19:15
They shouted, “Take him away! Take him away! Crucify him!” Pilate asked them, “Do you want me to crucify your king?” The leading priests answered, “The only king we have is Caesar.”
Default Jn 19:4-15
JN
19:4
Again Pilate came out and said to them, “Look, I am bringing Jesus out to you. I want you to know that I find nothing against him.”
JN
19:5
So Jesus came out, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe. Pilate said to them, “Here is the man!”
JN
19:6
When the leading priests and the guards saw Jesus, they shouted, “Crucify him! Crucify him!” But Pilate answered, “Crucify him yourselves, because I find nothing against him.”
JN
19:7
The leaders answered, “We have a law that says he should die, because he said he is the Son of God.”
JN
19:8
When Pilate heard this, he was even more afraid.
JN
19:9
He went back inside the palace and asked Jesus, “Where do you come from?” But Jesus did not answer him.
JN
19:10
Pilate said, “You refuse to speak to me? Don’t you know I have power to set you free and power to have you crucified?”
JN
19:11
Jesus answered, “The only power you have over me is the power given to you by God. The man who turned me in to you is guilty of a greater sin.”
JN
19:12
After this, Pilate tried to let Jesus go. But some in the crowd cried out, “Anyone who makes himself king is against Caesar. If you let this man go, you are no friend of Caesar.”
JN
19:13
When Pilate heard what they were saying, he brought Jesus out and sat down on the judge’s seat at the place called The Stone Pavement. (In the Hebrew language(at) the name is Gabbatha.)
JN
19:14
It was about noon on Preparation Day of Passover week. Pilate said to the crowd, “Here is your king!”
JN
19:15
They shouted, “Take him away! Take him away! Crucify him!” Pilate asked them, “Do you want me to crucify your king?” The leading priests answered, “The only king we have is Caesar.”
Week 63 | Pilate Washing His Hands
Mt 27:24-26 Mk 15:15-15 Lk 23:23-25 Jn 19:16-16
Default Mt 27:24-26 Mk 15:15-15 Lk 23:23-25 Jn 19:16-16
MT
27:24
When Pilate saw that he could do nothing about this and that a riot was starting, he took some water and washed his hands(d) in front of the crowd. Then he said, “I am not guilty of this man’s death. You are the ones who are causing it!”
MT
27:25
All the people answered, “We and our children will be responsible for his death.”
JN
19:16
So Pilate handed Jesus over to them to be crucified. Jesus Is Crucified The soldiers took charge of Jesus.

27:24

MT
27:25
All the people answered, “We and our children will be responsible for his death.”
MT
27:26

23:25

Week 63 | The Way To Golgota
Mt 27:32-34 Mk 15:21-23 Lk 23:26-32 Jn 19:17-17
Default Mt 27:32-34 Mk 15:21-23 Lk 23:26-32 Jn 19:17-17
MT
27:32
As the soldiers were going out of the city with Jesus, they forced a man from Cyrene, named Simon, to carry the cross for Jesus.
LK
23:27
A large crowd of people was following Jesus, including some women who were sad and crying for him.
LK
23:28
But Jesus turned and said to them, “Women of Jerusalem, don’t cry for me. Cry for yourselves and for your children.
LK
23:29
The time is coming when people will say, ‘Blessed are the women who cannot have children and who have no babies to nurse.’
LK
23:30
Then people will say to the mountains, ‘Fall on us!’ And they will say to the hills, ‘Cover us!’
LK
23:31
If they act like this now when life is good, what will happen when bad times come?”(g)
LK
23:32
There were also two criminals led out with Jesus to be put to death.
MK
15:22
They led Jesus to the place called Golgotha, which means the Place of the Skull.
MK
15:23
The soldiers tried to give Jesus wine mixed with myrrh to drink, but he refused.
Default Mt 27:32-34 Mk 15:21-23 Lk 23:26-32 Jn 19:17-17
MT
27:32
As the soldiers were going out of the city with Jesus, they forced a man from Cyrene, named Simon, to carry the cross for Jesus.
MT
27:33
They all came to the place called Golgotha, which means the Place of the Skull.
MT
27:34
The soldiers gave Jesus wine mixed with gall(e) to drink. He tasted the wine but refused to drink it.
Default Mt 27:32-34 Mk 15:21-23 Lk 23:26-32 Jn 19:17-17
MK
15:21
A man named Simon from Cyrene, the father of Alexander and Rufus, was coming from the fields to the city. The soldiers forced Simon to carry the cross for Jesus.
MK
15:22
They led Jesus to the place called Golgotha, which means the Place of the Skull.
MK
15:23
The soldiers tried to give Jesus wine mixed with myrrh to drink, but he refused.
Default Mt 27:32-34 Mk 15:21-23 Lk 23:26-32 Jn 19:17-17
LK
23:26
As they led Jesus away, Simon, a man from Cyrene, was coming in from the fields. They forced him to carry Jesus’ cross and to walk behind him.
LK
23:27
A large crowd of people was following Jesus, including some women who were sad and crying for him.
LK
23:28
But Jesus turned and said to them, “Women of Jerusalem, don’t cry for me. Cry for yourselves and for your children.
LK
23:29
The time is coming when people will say, ‘Blessed are the women who cannot have children and who have no babies to nurse.’
LK
23:30
Then people will say to the mountains, ‘Fall on us!’ And they will say to the hills, ‘Cover us!’
LK
23:31
If they act like this now when life is good, what will happen when bad times come?”(g)
LK
23:32
There were also two criminals led out with Jesus to be put to death.
Default Mt 27:32-34 Mk 15:21-23 Lk 23:26-32 Jn 19:17-17
JN
19:17
Carrying his own cross, Jesus went out to a place called The Place of the Skull, which in the Hebrew language(au) is called Golgotha.
Week 63 | The Crucifixion
Mt 27:35-37 Mk 15:24-26 Lk 23:33-34 Jn 19:18-27
Default Mt 27:35-37 Mk 15:24-26 Lk 23:33-34 Jn 19:18-27
LK
23:33
When they came to a place called the Skull, the soldiers crucified Jesus and the criminals - one on his right and the other on his left.
MK
15:25
It was nine o’clock in the morning when they crucified Jesus.
JN
19:19
Pilate wrote a sign and put it on the cross. It read: jesus of nazareth, the king of the jews.
JN
19:20
The sign was written in Hebrew, in Latin, and in Greek. Many of the people read the sign, because the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city.
JN
19:21
The leading priests said to Pilate, “Don’t write, ‘The King of the Jews.’ But write, ‘This man said, “I am the King of the Jews.”’”
JN
19:22
Pilate answered, “What I have written, I have written.”
LK
23:34
Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, because they don’t know what they are doing.”(h) The soldiers threw lots to decide who would get his clothes.
JN
19:23
After the soldiers crucified Jesus, they took his clothes and divided them into four parts, with each soldier getting one part. They also took his long shirt, which was all one piece of cloth, woven from top to bottom.
JN
19:24
So the soldiers said to each other, “We should not tear this into parts. Let’s throw lots to see who will get it.” This happened so that this Scripture would come true: “They divided my clothes among them, and they threw lots for my clothing.” (Psalm 22:18) So the soldiers did this.
JN
19:25
Standing near his cross were Jesus’ mother, his mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.
JN
19:26
When Jesus saw his mother and the follower he loved standing nearby, he said to his mother, “Dear woman, here is your son.”
JN
19:27
Then he said to the follower, “Here is your mother.” From that time on, the follower took her to live in his home.
Default Mt 27:35-37 Mk 15:24-26 Lk 23:33-34 Jn 19:18-27
MT
27:35
When the soldiers had crucified him, they threw lots to decide who would get his clothes.(f)
MT
27:36
The soldiers sat there and continued watching him.
MT
27:37
They put a sign above Jesus’ head with a charge against him. It said: this is jesus, the king of the jews.
Default Mt 27:35-37 Mk 15:24-26 Lk 23:33-34 Jn 19:18-27
MK
15:24
The soldiers crucified Jesus and divided his clothes among themselves, throwing lots to decide what each soldier would get.
MK
15:25
It was nine o’clock in the morning when they crucified Jesus.
MK
15:26
There was a sign with this charge against Jesus written on it: the king of the jews.
Default Mt 27:35-37 Mk 15:24-26 Lk 23:33-34 Jn 19:18-27
LK
23:33
When they came to a place called the Skull, the soldiers crucified Jesus and the criminals - one on his right and the other on his left.
LK
23:34
Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, because they don’t know what they are doing.”(h) The soldiers threw lots to decide who would get his clothes.
Default Mt 27:35-37 Mk 15:24-26 Lk 23:33-34 Jn 19:18-27
JN
19:18
There they crucified Jesus. They also crucified two other men, one on each side, with Jesus in the middle.
JN
19:19
Pilate wrote a sign and put it on the cross. It read: jesus of nazareth, the king of the jews.
JN
19:20
The sign was written in Hebrew, in Latin, and in Greek. Many of the people read the sign, because the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city.
JN
19:21
The leading priests said to Pilate, “Don’t write, ‘The King of the Jews.’ But write, ‘This man said, “I am the King of the Jews.”’”
JN
19:22
Pilate answered, “What I have written, I have written.”
JN
19:23
After the soldiers crucified Jesus, they took his clothes and divided them into four parts, with each soldier getting one part. They also took his long shirt, which was all one piece of cloth, woven from top to bottom.
JN
19:24
So the soldiers said to each other, “We should not tear this into parts. Let’s throw lots to see who will get it.” This happened so that this Scripture would come true: “They divided my clothes among them, and they threw lots for my clothing.” (Psalm 22:18) So the soldiers did this.
JN
19:25
Standing near his cross were Jesus’ mother, his mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.
JN
19:26
When Jesus saw his mother and the follower he loved standing nearby, he said to his mother, “Dear woman, here is your son.”
JN
19:27
Then he said to the follower, “Here is your mother.” From that time on, the follower took her to live in his home.
Week 63 | Jesus Is Insulted On The Cross
Mt 27:38-44 Mk 15:27-32 Lk 23:35-43
Default Mt 27:38-44 Mk 15:27-32 Lk 23:35-43
MT
27:38
Two robbers were crucified beside Jesus, one on the right and the other on the left.
MT
27:39
People walked by and insulted Jesus and shook their heads,
MT
27:40
saying, “You said you could destroy the Temple and build it again in three days. So save yourself! Come down from that cross if you are really the Son of God!”
MT
27:41
The leading priests, the teachers of the law, and the Jewish elders were also making fun of Jesus.
MT
27:42
They said, “He saved others, but he can’t save himself! He says he is the king of Israel! If he is the king, let him come down now from the cross. Then we will believe in him.
MT
27:43
He trusts in God, so let God save him now, if God really wants him. He himself said, ‘I am the Son of God.’”
LK
23:39
One of the criminals on a cross began to shout insults at Jesus: “Aren’t you the Christ? Then save yourself and us.”
LK
23:40
But the other criminal stopped him and said, “You should fear God! You are getting the same punishment he is.
LK
23:41
We are punished justly, getting what we deserve for what we did. But this man has done nothing wrong.”
LK
23:42
Then he said, “Jesus, remember me when you come into your kingdom.”
LK
23:43
Jesus said to him, “I tell you the truth, today you will be with me in paradise.”(i)
Default Mt 27:38-44 Mk 15:27-32 Lk 23:35-43
MT
27:38
Two robbers were crucified beside Jesus, one on the right and the other on the left.
MT
27:39
People walked by and insulted Jesus and shook their heads,
MT
27:40
saying, “You said you could destroy the Temple and build it again in three days. So save yourself! Come down from that cross if you are really the Son of God!”
MT
27:41
The leading priests, the teachers of the law, and the Jewish elders were also making fun of Jesus.
MT
27:42
They said, “He saved others, but he can’t save himself! He says he is the king of Israel! If he is the king, let him come down now from the cross. Then we will believe in him.
MT
27:43
He trusts in God, so let God save him now, if God really wants him. He himself said, ‘I am the Son of God.’”
MT
27:44
And in the same way, the robbers who were being crucified beside Jesus also insulted him.
Default Mt 27:38-44 Mk 15:27-32 Lk 23:35-43
MK
15:27
They also put two robbers on crosses beside Jesus, one on the right, and the other on the left.
MK
15:28
[And the Scripture came true that says, “They put him with criminals.”](bf)
MK
15:29
People walked by and insulted Jesus and shook their heads, saying, “You said you could destroy the Temple and build it again in three days.
MK
15:30
So save yourself! Come down from that cross!”
MK
15:31
The leading priests and the teachers of the law were also making fun of Jesus. They said to each other, “He saved other people, but he can’t save himself.
MK
15:32
If he is really the Christ, the king of Israel, let him come down now from the cross. When we see this, we will believe in him.” The robbers who were being crucified beside Jesus also insulted him.
Default Mt 27:38-44 Mk 15:27-32 Lk 23:35-43
LK
23:35
The people stood there watching. And the leaders made fun of Jesus, saying, “He saved others. Let him save himself if he is God’s Chosen One, the Christ.”
LK
23:36
The soldiers also made fun of him, coming to Jesus and offering him some vinegar.
LK
23:37
They said, “If you are the king of the Jews, save yourself!”
LK
23:38
At the top of the cross these words were written: this is the king of the jews.
LK
23:39
One of the criminals on a cross began to shout insults at Jesus: “Aren’t you the Christ? Then save yourself and us.”
LK
23:40
But the other criminal stopped him and said, “You should fear God! You are getting the same punishment he is.
LK
23:41
We are punished justly, getting what we deserve for what we did. But this man has done nothing wrong.”
LK
23:42
Then he said, “Jesus, remember me when you come into your kingdom.”
LK
23:43
Jesus said to him, “I tell you the truth, today you will be with me in paradise.”(i)
Week 63 | Jesus Dies
Mt 27:45-51 Mk 15:33-38 Lk 23:44-46 Jn 19:28-37
Default Mt 27:45-51 Mk 15:33-38 Lk 23:44-46 Jn 19:28-37
MT
27:45
At noon the whole country became dark, and the darkness lasted for three hours.
MT
27:46
About three o’clock Jesus cried out in a loud voice, “Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani?” This means, “My God, my God, why have you abandoned me?”
JN
19:28
After this, Jesus knew that everything had been done. So that the Scripture would come true, he said, “I am thirsty.”(av)
MT
27:47
Some of the people standing there who heard this said, “He is calling Elijah.”
JN
19:29
There was a jar full of vinegar there, so the soldiers soaked a sponge in it, put the sponge on a branch of a hyssop plant, and lifted it to Jesus’ mouth.
MT
27:49
But the others said, “Don’t bother him. We want to see if Elijah will come to save him.”
LK
23:46
Jesus cried out in a loud voice, “Father, I give you my life.” After Jesus said this, he died.
MT
27:51
Then the curtain in the Temple(g) was torn into two pieces, from the top to the bottom. Also, the earth shook and rocks broke apart.
JN
19:31
This day was Preparation Day, and the next day was a special Sabbath day. Since the religious leaders did not want the bodies to stay on the cross on the Sabbath day, they asked Pilate to order that the legs of the men be broken(aw) and the bodies be taken away.
JN
19:32
So the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first man on the cross beside Jesus. Then they broke the legs of the man on the other cross beside Jesus.
JN
19:33
But when the soldiers came to Jesus and saw that he was already dead, they did not break his legs.
JN
19:34
But one of the soldiers stuck his spear into Jesus’ side, and at once blood and water came out.
JN
19:35
(The one who saw this happen is the one who told us this, and whatever he says is true. And he knows that he tells the truth, and he tells it so that you might believe.)
JN
19:36
These things happened to make the Scripture come true: “Not one of his bones will be broken.”(ax)
JN
19:37
And another Scripture says, “They will look at the one they stabbed.”(ay)
Default Mt 27:45-51 Mk 15:33-38 Lk 23:44-46 Jn 19:28-37
MT
27:45
At noon the whole country became dark, and the darkness lasted for three hours.
MT
27:46
About three o’clock Jesus cried out in a loud voice, “Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani?” This means, “My God, my God, why have you abandoned me?”
MT
27:47
Some of the people standing there who heard this said, “He is calling Elijah.”
MT
27:48
Quickly one of them ran and got a sponge and filled it with vinegar and tied it to a stick and gave it to Jesus to drink.
MT
27:49
But the others said, “Don’t bother him. We want to see if Elijah will come to save him.”
MT
27:50
But Jesus cried out again in a loud voice and died.
MT
27:51
Then the curtain in the Temple(g) was torn into two pieces, from the top to the bottom. Also, the earth shook and rocks broke apart.
Default Mt 27:45-51 Mk 15:33-38 Lk 23:44-46 Jn 19:28-37
MK
15:33
At noon the whole country became dark, and the darkness lasted for three hours.
MK
15:34
At three o’clock Jesus cried in a loud voice, “Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani.” This means, “My God, my God, why have you abandoned me?”
MK
15:35
When some of the people standing there heard this, they said, “Listen! He is calling Elijah.”
MK
15:36
Someone there ran and got a sponge, filled it with vinegar, tied it to a stick, and gave it to Jesus to drink. He said, “We want to see if Elijah will come to take him down from the cross.”
MK
15:37
Then Jesus cried in a loud voice and died.
MK
15:38
The curtain in the Temple(bg) was torn into two pieces, from the top to the bottom.
Default Mt 27:45-51 Mk 15:33-38 Lk 23:44-46 Jn 19:28-37
LK
23:44
It was about noon, and the whole land became dark until three o’clock in the afternoon,
LK
23:45
because the sun did not shine. The curtain in the Temple(j) was torn in two.
LK
23:46
Jesus cried out in a loud voice, “Father, I give you my life.” After Jesus said this, he died.
Default Mt 27:45-51 Mk 15:33-38 Lk 23:44-46 Jn 19:28-37
JN
19:28
After this, Jesus knew that everything had been done. So that the Scripture would come true, he said, “I am thirsty.”(av)
JN
19:29
There was a jar full of vinegar there, so the soldiers soaked a sponge in it, put the sponge on a branch of a hyssop plant, and lifted it to Jesus’ mouth.
JN
19:30
When Jesus tasted the vinegar, he said, “It is finished.” Then he bowed his head and died.
JN
19:31
This day was Preparation Day, and the next day was a special Sabbath day. Since the religious leaders did not want the bodies to stay on the cross on the Sabbath day, they asked Pilate to order that the legs of the men be broken(aw) and the bodies be taken away.
JN
19:32
So the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first man on the cross beside Jesus. Then they broke the legs of the man on the other cross beside Jesus.
JN
19:33
But when the soldiers came to Jesus and saw that he was already dead, they did not break his legs.
JN
19:34
But one of the soldiers stuck his spear into Jesus’ side, and at once blood and water came out.
JN
19:35
(The one who saw this happen is the one who told us this, and whatever he says is true. And he knows that he tells the truth, and he tells it so that you might believe.)
JN
19:36
These things happened to make the Scripture come true: “Not one of his bones will be broken.”(ax)
JN
19:37
And another Scripture says, “They will look at the one they stabbed.”(ay)

LK

27:56

MK
15:39

MK
15:40
Some women were standing at a distance from the cross, watching; among them were Mary Magdalene, Salome, and Mary the mother of James and Joseph. (James was her youngest son.)
MK
15:41
These women had followed Jesus in Galilee and helped him. Many other women were also there who had come with Jesus to Jerusalem.

23:47

LK
23:48
When all the people who had gathered there to watch saw what happened, they returned home, beating their chests because they were so sad.
LK
23:49
But those who were close friends of Jesus, including the women who had followed him from Galilee, stood at a distance and watched.
Week 63 | Joseph Asks Pilate For Jesus' Body

Default Mt 27:57-58 Mk 15:42-45 Lk 23:50-52 Jn 19:38-38
LK
23:50
There was a good and religious man named Joseph who was a member of the council.
LK
23:51

MK
15:42
This was Preparation Day. (That means the day before the Sabbath day.) That evening,
LK
23:52
Joseph went to Pilate to ask for the body of Jesus.
MK
15:44

MK
15:45
The officer told Pilate that he was dead, so Pilate told Joseph he could have the body.

27:58

MK
15:42
This was Preparation Day. (That means the day before the Sabbath day.) That evening,
MK
15:43
Joseph from Arimathea was brave enough to go to Pilate and ask for Jesus’ body. Joseph, an important member of the Jewish council, was one of the people who was waiting for the kingdom of God to come.
MK
15:44
Pilate was amazed that Jesus would have already died, so he called the army officer who had guarded Jesus and asked him if Jesus had already died.
MK
15:45
The officer told Pilate that he was dead, so Pilate told Joseph he could have the body.

19:38

JN
19:41

JN
19:42

LK

MT
27:61

Week 63 | Joseph Comes Back With Nicodemus And Spices And Properly Buries The Body | The Women Don't See This Proper Burial
Jn 19:39-40
Jn 19:39-40
JN

JN
19:40

Week 63-70+ | God Rises Jesus Back To Life

Week 63 | High Sabbath, Violated By Leaders Going To Pilate For Guard
Mt 27:62-65
Mt 27:62-65
MT
27:62
The next day, the day after Preparation Day, the leading priests and the Pharisees went to Pilate.
MT
27:63
They said, “Sir, we remember that while that liar was still alive he said, ‘After three days I will rise from the dead.’
MT
27:64
So give the order for the tomb to be guarded closely till the third day. Otherwise, his followers might come and steal the body and tell people that he has risen from the dead. That lie would be even worse than the first one.”
MT
27:65
Pilate said, “Take some soldiers and go guard the tomb the best way you know.”
Week 63 | Roman Seal And Guard At The Tomb
Mt 27:66-66
Mt 27:66-66
MT
27:66

Week 63 | Jesus Is Raised To Life
Mt 28:2-4
Mt 28:2-4
MT
28:2
At that time there was a strong earthquake. An angel of the Lord came down from heaven, went to the tomb, and rolled the stone away from the entrance. Then he sat on the stone.
MT
28:3
He was shining as bright as lightning, and his clothes were white as snow.
MT
28:4
The soldiers guarding the tomb shook with fear because of the angel, and they became like dead men.

27:53

24:5

24:6

Week 63 | Jesus Appears To Maria Magdalene
Mk 16:9-9 Jn 20:14-17
Default Mk 16:9-9 Jn 20:14-17
JN
20:14
When Mary said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there, but she did not know it was Jesus.
JN
20:16
Jesus said to her, “Mary.”
JN
20:17
Mary turned toward Jesus and said in the Hebrew language,(az) “Rabboni.” (This means “Teacher.”) Jesus said to her, “Don’t hold on to me, because I have not yet gone up to the Father. But go to my brothers and tell them, ‘I am going back to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.’”
Default Mk 16:9-9 Jn 20:14-17
MK
16:9
After Jesus rose from the dead early on the first day of the week, he showed himself first to Mary Magdalene. One time in the past, he had forced seven demons out of her.
Default Mk 16:9-9 Jn 20:14-17
JN
20:14
When Mary said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there, but she did not know it was Jesus.
JN
20:15
Jesus asked her, “Woman, why are you crying? Whom are you looking for?” Thinking he was the gardener, she said to him, “Did you take him away, sir? Tell me where you put him, and I will get him.”
JN
20:16
Jesus said to her, “Mary.”
JN
20:17
Mary turned toward Jesus and said in the Hebrew language,(az) “Rabboni.” (This means “Teacher.”) Jesus said to her, “Don’t hold on to me, because I have not yet gone up to the Father. But go to my brothers and tell them, ‘I am going back to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.’”

Mt 28:9-10
Mt 28:9-10
MT
28:9

MT
28:10
Then Jesus said to them, “Don’t be afraid. Go and tell my followers to go on to Galilee, and they will see me there.”
Week 63 | The Leaders Bribe The Guards
Mt 28:11-15
Mt 28:11-15
MT
28:11
While the women went to tell Jesus’ followers, some of the soldiers who had been guarding the tomb went into the city to tell the leading priests everything that had happened.
MT
28:12
Then the priests met with the elders and made a plan. They paid the soldiers a large amount of money
MT
28:13
and said to them, “Tell the people that Jesus’ followers came during the night and stole the body while you were asleep.
MT
28:14
If the governor hears about this, we will satisfy him and save you from trouble.”
MT
28:15
So the soldiers kept the money and did as they were told. And that story is still spread among the people even today.
Week 63 | Women Let Followers Know, But They Don't Believe
Mk 16:10-11 Lk 24:10-11 Jn 20:18-18
Default Mk 16:10-11 Lk 24:10-11 Jn 20:18-18
LK
24:10
It was Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and some other women who told the apostles everything that had happened at the tomb.
LK
24:11
But they did not believe the women, because it sounded like nonsense.
Default Mk 16:10-11 Lk 24:10-11 Jn 20:18-18
MK
16:10
After Mary saw Jesus, she went and told his followers, who were very sad and were crying.
MK
16:11
But Mary told them that Jesus was alive. She said that she had seen him, but the followers did not believe her.
Default Mk 16:10-11 Lk 24:10-11 Jn 20:18-18
LK
24:10
It was Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and some other women who told the apostles everything that had happened at the tomb.
LK
24:11
But they did not believe the women, because it sounded like nonsense.
Default Mk 16:10-11 Lk 24:10-11 Jn 20:18-18
JN
20:18
Mary Magdalene went and said to the followers, “I saw the Lord!” And she told them what Jesus had said to her.
Week 63 | Jesus Joins To Two Of His Followers On Their Way To Emmaus
Mk 16:12-13 Lk 24:13-35
Default Mk 16:12-13 Lk 24:13-35
LK
24:13
That same day two of Jesus’ followers were going to a town named Emmaus, about seven miles from Jerusalem.
LK
24:14
They were talking about everything that had happened.
LK
24:15
While they were talking and discussing, Jesus himself came near and began walking with them,
LK
24:16
but they were kept from recognizing him.
LK
24:17
Then he said, “What are these things you are talking about while you walk?” The two followers stopped, looking very sad.
LK
24:18
The one named Cleopas answered, “Are you the only visitor in Jerusalem who does not know what just happened there?”
LK
24:19
Jesus said to them, “What are you talking about?” They said, “About Jesus of Nazareth. He was a prophet who said and did many powerful things before God and all the people.
LK
24:20
Our leaders and the leading priests handed him over to be sentenced to death, and they crucified him.
LK
24:21
But we were hoping that he would free Israel. Besides this, it is now the third day since this happened.
LK
24:22
And today some women among us amazed us. Early this morning they went to the tomb,
LK
24:23
but they did not find his body there. They came and told us that they had seen a vision of angels who said that Jesus was alive!
LK
24:24
So some of our group went to the tomb, too. They found it just as the women said, but they did not see Jesus.”
LK
24:25
Then Jesus said to them, “You are foolish and slow to believe everything the prophets said.
LK
24:26
They said that the Christ must suffer these things before he enters his glory.”
LK
24:27
Then starting with what Moses and all the prophets had said about him, Jesus began to explain everything that had been written about himself in the Scriptures.
LK
24:28
They came near the town of Emmaus, and Jesus acted as if he were going farther.
LK
24:29
But they begged him, “Stay with us, because it is late; it is almost night.” So he went in to stay with them.
LK
24:30
When Jesus was at the table with them, he took some bread, gave thanks, divided it, and gave it to them.
LK
24:31
And then, they were allowed to recognize Jesus. But when they saw who he was, he disappeared.
LK
24:32
They said to each other, “It felt like a fire burning in us when Jesus talked to us on the road and explained the Scriptures to us.”
LK
24:33
So the two followers got up at once and went back to Jerusalem. There they found the eleven apostles and others gathered.
LK
24:34
They were saying, “The Lord really has risen from the dead! He showed himself to Simon.”
LK
24:35
Then the two followers told what had happened on the road and how they recognized Jesus when he divided the bread.
Default Mk 16:12-13 Lk 24:13-35
MK
16:12
Later, Jesus showed himself to two of his followers while they were walking in the country, but he did not look the same as before.
MK
16:13
These followers went back to the others and told them what had happened, but again, the followers did not believe them.

Week 63 | Jesus Appears In The Last Supper's Room
Mk 16:14-14 Lk 24:36-49 Jn 20:19-23
Default Mk 16:14-14 Lk 24:36-49 Jn 20:19-23
LK
24:36
While the two followers were telling this, Jesus himself stood right in the middle of them and said, “Peace be with you.”
LK
24:37
They were fearful and terrified and thought they were seeing a ghost.
LK
24:38
But Jesus said, “Why are you troubled? Why do you doubt what you see?
LK
24:39
Look at my hands and my feet. It is I myself! Touch me and see, because a ghost does not have a living body as you see I have.”
LK
24:40
After Jesus said this, he showed them his hands and feet.
LK
24:41
While they still could not believe it because they were amazed and happy, Jesus said to them, “Do you have any food here?”
LK
24:42
They gave him a piece of broiled fish.
LK
24:43
While the followers watched, Jesus took the fish and ate it.
LK
24:44
He said to them, “Remember when I was with you before? I said that everything written about me must happen-everything in the law of Moses, the books of the prophets, and the Psalms.”
LK
24:45
Then Jesus opened their minds so they could understand the Scriptures.
LK
24:46
He said to them, “It is written that the Christ would suffer and rise from the dead on the third day
LK
24:47
and that a change of hearts and lives and forgiveness of sins would be preached in his name to all nations, starting at Jerusalem.
LK
24:48
You are witnesses of these things.
LK
24:49
I will send you what my Father has promised, but you must stay in Jerusalem until you have received that power from heaven.”
Default Mk 16:14-14 Lk 24:36-49 Jn 20:19-23
MK
16:14
Later Jesus showed himself to the eleven apostles while they were eating, and he criticized them because they had no faith. They were stubborn and refused to believe those who had seen him after he had risen from the dead.
Default Mk 16:14-14 Lk 24:36-49 Jn 20:19-23

24:36

LK
24:37

LK
24:38
But Jesus said, “Why are you troubled? Why do you doubt what you see?
LK
24:39

LK
24:40
After Jesus said this, he showed them his hands and feet.
LK
24:41
While they still could not believe it because they were amazed and happy, Jesus said to them, “Do you have any food here?”
LK
24:42

LK
24:43
While the followers watched, Jesus took the fish and ate it.
LK
24:44
He said to them, “Remember when I was with you before? I said that everything written about me must happen-everything in the law of Moses, the books of the prophets, and the Psalms.”
LK

24:46

LK

LK
24:48
You are witnesses of these things.
LK
24:49

Default Mk 16:14-14 Lk 24:36-49 Jn 20:19-23
JN
20:19
When it was evening on the first day of the week, Jesus’ followers were together. The doors were locked, because they were afraid of the elders. Then Jesus came and stood right in the middle of them and said, “Peace be with you.”
JN
20:20
After he said this, he showed them his hands and his side. His followers were thrilled when they saw the Lord.
JN
20:21
Then Jesus said again, “Peace be with you. As the Father sent me, I now send you.”
JN
20:22
After he said this, he breathed on them and said, “Receive the Holy Spirit.
JN
20:23
If you forgive anyone his sins, they are forgiven. If you don’t forgive them, they are not forgiven.”
Week 64 | Jesus Appears Again In The Presence Of Thomas
Jn 20:24-29
Jn 20:24-29
JN
20:24
Thomas (called Didymus), who was one of the twelve, was not with them when Jesus came.
JN
20:25
The other followers kept telling Thomas, “We saw the Lord.” But Thomas said, “I will not believe it until I see the nail marks in his hands and put my finger where the nails were and put my hand into his side.”
JN
20:26
A week later the followers were in the house again, and Thomas was with them. The doors were locked, but Jesus came in and stood right in the middle of them. He said, “Peace be with you.”
JN
20:27
Then he said to Thomas, “Put your finger here, and look at my hands. Put your hand here in my side. Stop being an unbeliever and believe.”
JN
20:28
Thomas said to him, “My Lord and my God!”
JN
20:29
Then Jesus told him, “You believe because you see me. Those who believe without seeing me will be truly blessed.”
Week 64-70 | The Ascension
Mk 16:19-19 Act 25:6-11
Default Mk 16:19-19 Act 25:6-11
Act
25:6
When the apostles were all together, they asked Jesus, “Lord, are you now going to give the kingdom back to Israel?”
Act
25:7
Jesus said to them, “The Father is the only One who has the authority to decide dates and times. These things are not for you to know.
Act
25:8
But when the Holy Spirit comes to you, you will receive power. You will be my witnesses-in Jerusalem, in all of Judea, in Samaria, and in every part of the world.”
Act
25:9
After he said this, as they were watching, he was lifted up, and a cloud hid him from their sight.
Act
25:10
As he was going, they were looking into the sky. Suddenly, two men wearing white clothes stood beside them.
Act
25:11
They said, “Men of Galilee, why are you standing here looking into the sky? Jesus, whom you saw taken up from you into heaven, will come back in the same way you saw him go.”
Default Mk 16:19-19 Act 25:6-11
MK
16:19
After the Lord Jesus said these things to his followers, he was carried up into heaven, and he sat at the right side of God.
Default Mk 16:19-19 Act 25:6-11
Act
25:6
When the apostles were all together, they asked Jesus, “Lord, are you now going to give the kingdom back to Israel?”
Act
25:7
Jesus said to them, “The Father is the only One who has the authority to decide dates and times. These things are not for you to know.
Act
25:8
But when the Holy Spirit comes to you, you will receive power. You will be my witnesses-in Jerusalem, in all of Judea, in Samaria, and in every part of the world.”
Act
25:9
After he said this, as they were watching, he was lifted up, and a cloud hid him from their sight.
Act
25:10
As he was going, they were looking into the sky. Suddenly, two men wearing white clothes stood beside them.
Act
25:11
They said, “Men of Galilee, why are you standing here looking into the sky? Jesus, whom you saw taken up from you into heaven, will come back in the same way you saw him go.”
Week 64-70 | The Followers Wait For The Holy Spirit By Praying Together
Act 25:12-14
Act 25:12-14
Act
25:12
Then they went back to Jerusalem from the Mount of Olives. (This mountain is about half a mile from Jerusalem.)
Act
25:13
When they entered the city, they went to the upstairs room where they were staying. Peter, John, James, Andrew, Philip, Thomas, Bartholomew, Matthew, James son of Alphaeus, Simon (known as the Zealot), and Judas son of James were there.
Act
25:14
They all continued praying together with some women, including Mary the mother of Jesus, and Jesus’ brothers.
Week 70 | The Holy Spirit Baptise The Followers
Act 26:1-4
Act 26:1-4
Act
26:1
When the day of Pentecost came, they were all together in one place.
Act
26:2
Suddenly a noise like a strong, blowing wind came from heaven and filled the whole house where they were sitting.
Act
26:3
They saw something like flames of fire that were separated and stood over each person there.
Act
26:4
They were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and they began to speak different languages(a) by the power the Holy Spirit was giving them.
Jesus Encourages Peter
Jn 21:1-14
Jn 21:1-14
JN
21:1
Later, Jesus showed himself to his followers again-this time at Lake Galilee.(ba) This is how he showed himself:
JN
21:2
Some of the followers were together: Simon Peter, Thomas (called Didymus), Nathanael from Cana in Galilee, the two sons of Zebedee, and two other followers.
JN
21:3
Simon Peter said, “I am going out to fish.” The others said, “We will go with you.” So they went out and got into the boat. They fished that night but caught nothing.
JN
21:4
Early the next morning Jesus stood on the shore, but the followers did not know it was Jesus.
JN
21:5
Then he said to them, “Friends, did you catch any fish?” They answered, “No.”
JN
21:6
He said, “Throw your net on the right side of the boat, and you will find some.” So they did, and they caught so many fish they could not pull the net back into the boat.
JN
21:7
The follower whom Jesus loved said to Peter, “It is the Lord!” When Peter heard him say this, he wrapped his coat around himself. (Peter had taken his clothes off.) Then he jumped into the water.
JN
21:8
The other followers went to shore in the boat, dragging the net full of fish. They were not very far from shore, only about a hundred yards.
JN
21:9
When the followers stepped out of the boat and onto the shore, they saw a fire of hot coals. There were fish on the fire, and there was bread.
JN
21:10
Then Jesus said, “Bring some of the fish you just caught.”
JN
21:11
Simon Peter went into the boat and pulled the net to the shore. It was full of big fish, one hundred fifty-three in all, but even though there were so many, the net did not tear.
JN
21:12
Jesus said to them, “Come and eat.” None of the followers dared ask him, “Who are you?” because they knew it was the Lord.
JN
21:13
Jesus came and took the bread and gave it to them, along with the fish.
JN
21:14
This was now the third time Jesus showed himself to his followers after he was raised from the dead.
Jesus Triple Checks If Peter Regained His Faith
Jn 21:15-24
Jn 21:15-24
JN
21:15
When they finished eating, Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon son of John, do you love me more than these?” He answered, “Yes, Lord, you know that I love you.” Jesus said, “Feed my lambs.”
JN
21:16
Again Jesus said, “Simon son of John, do you love me?” He answered, “Yes, Lord, you know that I love you.” Jesus said, “Take care of my sheep.”
JN
21:17
A third time he said, “Simon son of John, do you love me?” Peter was hurt because Jesus asked him the third time, “Do you love me?” Peter said, “Lord, you know everything; you know that I love you!” He said to him, “Feed my sheep.
JN
21:18
I tell you the truth, when you were younger, you tied your own belt and went where you wanted. But when you are old, you will put out your hands and someone else will tie you and take you where you don’t want to go.”
JN
21:19
(Jesus said this to show how Peter would die to give glory to God.) Then Jesus said to Peter, “Follow me!”
JN
21:20
Peter turned and saw that the follower Jesus loved was walking behind them. (This was the follower who had leaned against Jesus at the supper and had said, “Lord, who will turn against you?”)
JN
21:21
When Peter saw him behind them, he asked Jesus, “Lord, what about him?”
JN
21:22
Jesus answered, “If I want him to live until I come back, that is not your business. You follow me.”
JN
21:23
So a story spread among the followers that this one would not die. But Jesus did not say he would not die. He only said, “If I want him to live until I come back, that is not your business.”
JN
21:24
That follower is the one who is telling these things and who has now written them down. We know that what he says is true.
Jesus Sends Out The Apostles To Everyone In The World
Mt 28:16-20 Mk 16:15-18
Default Mt 28:16-20 Mk 16:15-18
MT
28:16
The eleven followers went to Galilee to the mountain where Jesus had told them to go.
MT
28:17
On the mountain they saw Jesus and worshiped him, but some of them did not believe it was really Jesus.
MT
28:18
Then Jesus came to them and said, “All power in heaven and on earth is given to me.
MT
28:19
So go and make followers of all people in the world. Baptize them in the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit.
MK
16:16
Anyone who believes and is baptized will be saved, but anyone who does not believe will be punished.
MK
16:17
And those who believe will be able to do these things as proof: They will use my name to force out demons. They will speak in new languages.(bi)
MK
16:18
They will pick up snakes and drink poison without being hurt. They will touch the sick, and the sick will be healed.”
MT
28:20
Teach them to obey everything that I have taught you, and I will be with you always, even until the end of this age.”
Default Mt 28:16-20 Mk 16:15-18
MT
28:16
The eleven followers went to Galilee to the mountain where Jesus had told them to go.
MT
28:17
On the mountain they saw Jesus and worshiped him, but some of them did not believe it was really Jesus.
MT
28:18
Then Jesus came to them and said, “All power in heaven and on earth is given to me.
MT
28:19
So go and make followers of all people in the world. Baptize them in the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit.
MT
28:20
Teach them to obey everything that I have taught you, and I will be with you always, even until the end of this age.”
Default Mt 28:16-20 Mk 16:15-18
MK
16:15
Jesus said to his followers, “Go everywhere in the world, and tell the Good News to everyone.
MK
16:16
Anyone who believes and is baptized will be saved, but anyone who does not believe will be punished.
MK
16:17
And those who believe will be able to do these things as proof: They will use my name to force out demons. They will speak in new languages.(bi)
MK
16:18
They will pick up snakes and drink poison without being hurt. They will touch the sick, and the sick will be healed.”
The Apostles Tell The Good News To Eeveryone In The World
Mk 16:20-20
Mk 16:20-20
MK
16:20
The followers went everywhere in the world and told the Good News to people, and the Lord helped them. The Lord proved that the Good News they told was true by giving them power to work miracles.
